TESO326: the player's guildmaster in the Mages Guild
TESO593: ruins in the south of Cyrodiil
TESO370: the male master of the necromancers

plots: necromancers have been creating black soul gems for the King of Worms
Arch-Mage Traven believes that the Black Soul Gem may be instrumental in saving the Mages Guild

quest.title: Ambush
quest.objective: retrieve a unique Black Soul Gem from the necromancers, and return immediately to Arch-Mage Traven
tasks: Go to Silorn.
oversee a contingent of Battlemages in their fight with the necromancers
retrieve a unique Black Soul Gem from the necromancers, and return immediately to Arch-Mage Traven
quest.description:
Time is against us, and our enemies grow stronger. There is much to do, and little time in which to do it. Your next task is essential.
Word has been sent that the Necromancers have been quite busy, creating black soul gems for their master. In particular, a unique Black Soul Gem has been crafted in the south of Cyrodiil, in the ruins of Silorn.
This gem needs to be confiscated and brought here, before it can be delivered to the King of Worms and used against us. I have need of it. I believe the Black Soul Gem  may be instrumental in saving our guild. I will explain once you have returned with it. Until then, discussion is useless.
A contingent of Battlemages has been sent to the site. I would like you to oversee their actions on my behalf. The only thing that matters is that gem. Do you understand? Once you have it safely in your possession, return here immediately.
Know that you have my complete confidence. I would not entrust this job to you if I did not feel you were prepared for it. Now, go.

TESO56: the prince of madness, one of the Daedric Princes
TESO58: the capital city of Sheogorath's realm
TESO60: Sheogorath's Chamberlain who knows a lot

plots: Sheogorath gives the player summon Haskill spell for their previous services
the Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia show the player what New Sheoth truly is
once the player understands what Sheogorath's Realm is, the player might understand why it's important to keep it intact

quest.title: Understanding Madness
quest.objective: meet the Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia, and join their courts
tasks: Go to Sheogorath's Palace.
seek out the Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia
meet the Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia, and join their courts
quest.description:
I'm Sheogorath, Prince of Madness. And other things. I'm not talking about them. As you should know by now.
You've run a maze like a good little rat, but no cheese for you yet. Well, maybe a little. I've granted you a new spell - the ability to summon Haskill, my Chamberlain, to aid you in your travels. He knows a lot. More than he knows.
Now we're going to give you a taste of where you have found yourself. You're going to learn. Two halves, two rulers, two places within my palace. Meet and greet. Do what they will, so you know what they're about.
The Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia. Seek them out, and let them show you what New Sheoth is. You might be surprised. Once you understand what My Realm is, you might understand why it's important to keep it intact. And maybe you'll make some friends along the way. That's always nice!

TESO388: the tormentor of men, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: the player has summoned Molag Bal
Melus Petilius has sworn an oath to never to raise a weapon against another man again: Molag Bal wants Melus Petilius to break his oath
Molag Bal will save the player's life when Melus Petilius kills the player

quest.title: Molag Bal's Dark Bidding
quest.objective: goad Melus Petilius into killing you with the Cursed Mace
tasks: find Melus Petilius
goad Melus Petilius into killing you with the Cursed Mace
quest.description:
Another mortal come to do my bidding. I, Molag Bal, only wish suffering and death. You will bring me both. I want to see a man brought to the edge. And pushed.
Near Brindle Home you will find Melus Petilius. A good man. An honorable man. He disgusts me. He has sworn an oath: never to raise a weapon against another man again. I want him to break that oath, and damn himself forever.
You will let him kill you with this: the Cursed Mace. As you are doing this for me, I'll save your miserable life. Probably. Get out of my sight.

TESS214: a hall where bodies are interred and cared for, in Whiterun
TESS16: the god of burials and funeral rites

plots: Alessandra did not want to become a Priest of Arkay like her father
Alessandra gives the player her ceremonial dagger

quest.title: Pilgrimage
quest.objective: help Alessandra make peace with her dead father
tasks: Go to Hall of the Dead.
bring Alessandra's ceremonial dagger to Andurs so it can be interred with Alessandra's father's remains
help Alessandra make peace with her dead father
quest.description:
I am Alessandra, a priest of Arkay.
My father was a Priest of Arkay, as well. All my life was spent around the dead, being forced to learn the proper burial rituals and prayers. I never had any friends; who'd want to spend time with 'the little weird girl who hangs around dead people?' So I grew up with a miserable trade. This is all I know how to do... prepare and inter the deceased.
I'd like to make the journey to the Hall of the Dead in Whiterun and give my ceremonial dagger to Andurs, the caretaker. I believe once it's interred with my father's remains I'll be at peace with his memory.
A Priest of Arkay is entrusted with a ceremonial dagger once they've completed their training. It's usually given by the head priest who sanctified the ritual. In my case, the head priest happened to be my father. The thing is, I never wanted to follow in his footsteps... In some ways I still don't.
I'm entrusting you with the dagger. Bring it to Andurs and he'll take care of the rest.

BG2245: a member of the Amnian Cowled Wizards
BG212: Valygar Corthala's house in the Docks District of Athkatla, or Umar Hills
BG2247: Valygar Corthala's house in the Docks District of Athkatla, or Umar Hills
Valygar Corthala's house in the Docks District of Athkatla, or Umar Hills
BG2248: last son of a wealthy family and a true brute
Valygar Corthala's house in the Docks District of Athkatla, or Umar Hills

plots: magic is hated in Amn
Valygar Corthala has murdered two Cowled Wizards: he is currently in hiding
Valygar Corthala's friends and servants will not speak to Cowled Wizards

quest.title: The Hunt for Valygar Corthala
quest.objective: deliver Valygar Corthala to the Cowled Wizards dead or alive
tasks: Go to .
track down Valygar Corthala
deliver Valygar Corthala to the Cowled Wizards dead or alive
quest.description:
I am Tolgerias, a proud member of the Amnian Cowled Wizards.
This matter must be handled with discretion and expediency. There is something that has been plaguing us for more than a week now and has become quite alarming.
You know of the prevailing attitude against magic here in Amn, yes? Well, amongst some it is even worse than that... a burning, palpable hatred. One particular man here in Athkatla has murdered two of our number in cold blood. He is currently in hiding, and we need you to track the fellow down. We have been unable to do so, much to our frustration. Cowled Wizards cannot be assaulted without repercussions or it will lead to... serious problems.
He is Valygar Corthala, last son of a wealthy family and a true brute. Ask around and you may discover if he is hiding within the city or someplace else. He has a home here in the Docks District, or he may have fled to the Umar Hills. His friends and servants will not speak to us, but they may to you.
We do not ask that you commit any murder. We wish Valygar be delivered to us, that is all. He will likely resist, so if you must kill him, so be it. But if you do kill him, I simply must have his body. Valygar must be delivered to us whether he is dead or alive. You understand, yes?

TESO266: a seedy tavern in Anvil, located outside the city walls near the waterfront

plots: Gogan was robbed by the all-female gang: Maelona's family heirloom was among the things that the gang took from him
the city guard have not done much about the all-female gang: the men they rob are too embarrassed to report the gang

quest.title: The Siren's Deception
quest.objective: get Maelona's family heirloom back from an all-female gang of thieves that prey on the married men of Anvil
tasks: Go to Flowing Bowl.
find leads about the all-female gang
get Maelona's family heirloom back from an all-female gang of thieves that prey on the married men of Anvil
quest.description:
I'm Maelona. How would you like to get my husband, Gogan, out of hot water?
Believe me, he'll need all the help he can get to worm his way out of this one. To think he'd fall for the gang's scheme... agh! I could kill him! I'm sorry... I'm rambling and got you confused. Let me explain.
The women in the gang use their wiles to lure men out to some remote location and rob them blind. It's been going on for some time now. The city guard hasn't done very much about it, because frankly, the men who are robbed are so embarrassed, they don't want to report it. Take for example that good-for-nothing husband of mine, Gogan. He cared more about their charms than my own.
When Gogan was, uh... with the women, they took something quite valuable from him. No... it's not what you're thinking. He was carrying a precious family heirloom with him when he was lured out to their lair. It was a small ring given to him on our wedding day. The ring belonged to my mother, and has been in the family for generations. I'm willing to give you all the money I have to get it back. 100 gold. Can you help us?
All I can tell you is that the best place to start is at The Flowing Bowl. It's a tavern located outside the city walls near the waterfront. The Flowing Bowl attracts the worst Anvil has to offer. Always be on your guard.

TESO35: a stolen painting depicting Count Valga

plots: someone stole a painting from Countess Arriana Valga's bedchamber: do not accuse the wrong person
Countess Arriana Valga gives the player some keys that allow the player access to many of the restricted areas in Castle Chorrol

quest.title: Canvas the Castle
quest.objective: recover a painting, and bring the culprit to justice
tasks: gather clues about the identity of the culprit
recover a painting, and bring the culprit to justice
quest.description:
I am Countess Arriana Valga of Chorrol. I wish I had time to chat, but I'm afraid I am in the middle of an investigation.
You seem the trusting type. Perhaps you can assist me? It seems someone has taken away an heirloom that is quite dear to me. I want you to help me recover a stolen painting. The painting was of my lost love, the Count Valga, and it has been stolen from my bedchamber. If you find the painting, and bring the culprit to justice, you shall be justly rewarded.
I suggest you begin to gather clues. And I warn you: do not accuse the wrong person, or I shall be quite cross with you. Here are some keys. They should allow you access to many of the restricted areas in Castle Chorrol.

BG2135: the second floor in Delosar's Inn
BG2137: the second floor in Delosar's Inn
the second floor in Delosar's Inn
BG2138: a big man with big friends

plots: Dennis refuses to pay his debts to Vittario
Dennis promised to pay Vittario's bar tab in exchange for some lessons on the gong

quest.title: Help Vittorio Collect His Debt
quest.objective: protect Vittario from Dennis while Vittario collects Dennis' debt
tasks: follow Vittario to Dennis
protect Vittario from Dennis while Vittario collects Dennis' debt
quest.description:
I, Vittario, be in some need of assistance, me pal. There be a fellow within Delosar's Inn there... Dennis. He owes me a good deal of coin, an' refuses to pay!
He promised to pay off me bar tab, he did, in exchange for some lessons on the gong. Well, I teached him, I did... an' now he refuses to pay me tab!
Ehhh, well I be kicked out of Delosar's for not having my tab paid. Dennis be a big fellow... with big friends. I need some muscle behind me if I'm t' go within.
Come... follow me inside o' Delosar's, and let's have a little talk wi' Dennis, aye? I do believe he is on the second floor.
I be a poor, poor man, me pal... I have almost nothing to offer ye. I beg ye to help a destitute teacher find some justice!

BG1268: a man residing in Citadel Adbar
BG1271: a legendary hero who went mad after his family was killed
BG1272: a dagger that belonged to Hurgan Stoneblade's grandpa

plots: Hurgan Stoneblade's grandpa was killed by a demon
Durlag intended to send "Soultaker" to Hurgan Stoneblade's mother
Durlag did not send "Soultaker": his family was replaced with doppelgangers and he was driven mad after killing the doppelgangers

quest.title: Recovering "Soultaker"
quest.objective: bring the "Soultaker" to Hurgan Stoneblade
tasks: find the "Soultaker"
bring the "Soultaker" to Hurgan Stoneblade
quest.description:
I am Hurgan Stoneblade, presently residing in Citadel Adbar. Have I got the adventure that'll make ye yearn for glory!
Ye have heard of Durlag's Tower, mayhaps? Me granda' was a good friend of Durlag's. Me granda' was slain by an evil demon but Durlag survived. Durlag kept "Soultaker" that had been me granda's. He was going to send it to me mother, but he was betrayed. A sad tale, that.
After Durlag built the tower his family was replaced by doppelgangers. Durlag killed them all but was driven mad by the act. He entrapped his tower heavily and forgot about me granda's dagger.
If ye be interested, I wish to hire ye to retrieve me granda's dagger, "Soultaker," me birthright.
An enchanted hammer I can offer ye for yer services.

MC136: an ocean monument: a dangerous underwater temple made out of turquoise stone blocks, located far south of Fishing Hamlet
MC137: an ocean monument: a dangerous underwater temple made out of turquoise stone blocks, located far south of Fishing Hamlet
an ocean monument: a dangerous underwater temple made out of turquoise stone blocks, located far south of Fishing Hamlet
MC138: [Enemy] one-eyed, large, pale, evil pufferfish that can shoot laser, and make the player fatigued when the player is near them
an ocean monument: a dangerous underwater temple made out of turquoise stone blocks, located far south of Fishing Hamlet

plots: Heide wants serenity
the player is an enemy of Heide

quest.title: The One That Got Away
quest.objective: recover Heide's fishing rod
tasks: Go to .
find the Elder Guardian that swallowed Heide's fishing rod, and kill it
recover Heide's fishing rod
quest.description:
I just escaped with my life from a friggin' Elder Guardian, and now I run into you, my least favorite person in the whole world.
The damn Elder Guardian swallowed the hook, line, and sinker of my fishing rod while I was out in the sea fishing on my boat. It must have eaten the whole fishing rod after it slipped from my grip into the sea.
I shouldn't have gone fish so close to the ocean monument far south of this village. I just couldn't see the turquoise stones that make up the monument before it was too late. Who even built those dangerous underwater temples anyway?
I have a proposition for you: recover my fishing rod from the Elder Guardian, and I'll set you up with enough cooked salmon to last your lifetime. We might even become friends. First, you have to find the Elder Guardian, and kill it.
Elder Guardians are one-eyed, large, pale, evil pufferfish. They can shoot laser, and make you fatigued when you get close to them.

TESS45: a librarian who can translate the writings of Shalidor
TESS413: a immensely powerful male mage in the first era

plots: Shalidor holed himself up in Labyrinthian, and devoted all of his time to research and study

quest.title: Shalidor's Insights
quest.objective: bring the writings of Shalidor to Urag gro-Shub
tasks: Go to Skyrim.
discover the writings of Shalidor
bring the writings of Shalidor to Urag gro-Shub
quest.description:
Have you ever heard of Shalidor? Immensely powerful mage, back in the First Era. Had an understanding of magic few have ever matched. He holed himself up in Labyrinthian, and devoted all of his time to research and study. Wrote more than you would imagine possible.
Since then, his writings have been scattered all over Skyrim, but are little use to anyone who can't translate them. I'm one of the few who can. I'm always trying to find more of Shalidor's writings.
I've heard whispers of more of his work having turned up. If you can track it down, it may prove useful to all of us.

MC54: the dimension at the end of all
MC110: a dragon the rules over The End

plots: wants knowledge
the player is an infamous person
the player can enter The End from a stronghold

quest.title: The Ruler of The End
quest.objective: find out whether the Ender Dragon exists
tasks: find a stronghold
find out whether the Ender Dragon exists
quest.description:
There is a place at the end of all, far away from this village. A perfect place for a person of a more.. dark disposition.
This place is called The End. It is said that you can enter it from a stronghold. The End is is said to be ruled over by a beast called the Ender Dragon: I'd like you check out whether the Ender Dragon truly exists.
Oh, I did not mention the best part yet: there are wonderful treasures in The End.

TESS107: an island that is covered with ancient ruins

plots: the passage to Vahlok's Tomb must have been opened by an earthquake that accompanied one of the Red Mountain's eruptions

quest.title: Lost Legacy
quest.objective: protect Tharstan while he researches an old tomb
tasks: Go to .
meet Tharstan
protect Tharstan while he researches an old tomb
quest.description:
Yes, I think you're just the adventurous sort I need. I have a job offer for you.
As a scholar of history, I've always found Solstheim to be most intriguing. I've made many forays into the ancient ruins that cover the island. I've come to know those ruins so well, I could draw you a map from memory. That's why I noticed the new passage the moment I laid eyes on it.
it leads to an old tomb, I think. It must have been opened by an earthquake that accompanied one of the Red Mountain's eruptions. I'd love to have a closer look, but those old ruins can be dangerous and I'm no adventurer. I'll pay you to watch my back down there.
I'll be heading back there soon. If you're interested, meet me at the ruins and we'll see what we can find. Now I'm off to pack for the expedition!

TESO97: a shrine to Saint Kaladas, below the Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin
TESO99: a shrine to Saint Kaladas, below the Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin
a shrine to Saint Kaladas, below the Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin
TESO100: the god of work and commerce, one of the Nine
a shrine to Saint Kaladas, below the Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin
TESO101: a shrine to Saint Kaladas, below the Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin

plots: the player has passed the gauntlet unlike others in three hundred years: the player can redeem the souls of the ghost knights and restore their order
Sir Ralvas placed his own will and lust for fame over the will of the Nine
Sir Ralvas failed the challenge of Zenithar: the inscription for the challenge says to "walk in the faith"
the player must pray at the shrine of Saint Kaladas to receive a vision: the player will see the Mace of Zenithar, separated from them by a great chasm
Sir Ralvas fell from the platform each time he tried to cross the chasm

quest.title: The Path of the Righteous
quest.objective: retrieve the Mace of Zenithar for yourself
tasks: complete the challenge of Zenithar
retrieve the Mace of Zenithar for yourself
quest.description:
You have my, Sir Ralvas', tribute, sir knight. In three hundred years, none have passed the gauntlet. In three hundred years, we have never known hope. But for the first time, it seems that someone may succeed where we have failed. I see in you the chance to redeem our souls and restore the order. And now, I must ask you to press forward where I could not. I must ask you to face the challenge of Zenithar.
I was arrogant and foolhardy. I sought personal glory. I placed my own will and my own lust for fame over the will of the Nine. In facing the challenge of Zenithar, I failed. I tried dozens -- no, hundreds of times to reach the Mace. I fell each time. And each time I awoke in the chapel, I leaped again. I tried to enlist the help of the other knights, but none would come to my aid. The inscription says to "walk in the faith" but even now, I do not know what this means.
Below the Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin there is a shrine to the great craftsman, Saint Kaladas. Those seeking the Mace must pray before the shrine. When you bow, you will receive a vision -- or perhaps not. It is unclear. The priests saw that my body never moved, but it felt so real. You will see the Mace of Zenithar, separated from you by a great chasm. The chasm represents your doubt. Your faith must be your guide across it.
This is what I know. As I said, my faith was weak. I did not understand the test and I fell from the platform each time I tried to cross. I have told you all that I know. All that is left is for you to prove yourself more worthy than I. If you seek the Mace, travel to Leyawiin's chapel, kneel at the shrine in the undercroft, and let your faith in the Nine be the salvation of us all.

TESS144: a queen who ruled over Windhelm in the Second Era, had a legendary sword

plots: the player asked Oengul War-Anvil whether he is the castle blacksmith
Oengul War-Anvil is working an a sword: the Jarl of Windhelm wants it to look like High Queen Freydis' sword

quest.title: The Queen's Sword
quest.objective: retrieve High Queen Freydis' sword for Oengul War-Anvil
tasks: Go to Cronvangr Cave.
find High Queen Freydis' sword
retrieve High Queen Freydis' sword for Oengul War-Anvil
quest.description:
Of course I am the castle blacksmith. What do I look like, a tavern wench? Ah, don't let my words cut you too deep. I've just been working the forge too hard. Trying to set this sword right.
Jarl wants it to look like an ancient blade. High Queen Freydis ruled over Windhelm in the Second Era, and her sword was legendary. Getting the real sword would be even better than making a copy, but no one wants to risk getting it from its resting place, Cronvangr Cave.
If you find that sword, traveler, I'd be grateful.

plots: Will wants comfort
the player is an enemy of Will

quest.title: Spooky Shenanigans
quest.objective: give a carved pumpkin to Will
tasks: obtain a carved pumpkin
give a carved pumpkin to Will
quest.description:
Try to catch me, you big meanie! I bet you can't even carve pumpkins!
You wanna try to obtain a carved pumpkin and give it to me? I surely will not do any kind of pranks with it... like sneaking up on grownups... pinky swear.
Perhaps I'd even share my ten cookies with you. That should teach to to be nicer!

plots: the player has trespassed gnolls' territory with the player's party
the gnolls' demand 50 gold from the player, but the player doesn't have any money

quest.title: Ludrug's Band
quest.objective: win the duel against Ludrug
tasks: choose your champion to fight against Ludrug
win the duel against Ludrug
quest.description:
Stop! You have trespassed on our territory. You shall not be allowed to leave until you have paid tribute. We demand 50 gold in tribute!
No money? That is too bad for you. We let you go only if you win fight. Your best champion versus our best champion. Our best champion is Ludrug. Ludrug is me. Are you ready for fight? No matter, we fight now!
If you lose, you must die! If you win, we must let you pass! Tread carefully, we will be watching you.

BG2224: a merchant and a worried father

plots: Therndle Daglefodd cannot work without knowing his sons fate

quest.title: A Son Missing
quest.objective: find out what happened to Bedlen Daglefodd
tasks: look for Bedlen Daglefodd
find out what happened to Bedlen Daglefodd
quest.description:
I'm Therndle Daglefodd, a merchant.
My child, Bedlen Daglefodd, has been missing for a tunnel's worth of digging. I simply cannot work without knowing his fate.
Could you have a look for him?

TESO423: a master trainer in light armor

plots: the player told J'bari that they want light armor training from him

quest.title: Light Armor Training
quest.objective: give an unenchanted Elven cuirass to J'bari
tasks: get an unenchanted Elven cuirass
give an unenchanted Elven cuirass to J'bari
quest.description:
If you want training from me, you're going to have to get something for me first.
I need a new Elven cuirass. Nothing fancy, nothing enchanted. Just a decent piece of armor. You get that for me, and I'll train you. That's the deal.

BG2119: a pirate town on an island

plots: Ginia grew up in Brynnlaw, which used to be a pleasant town
pirates lead by Desharik invaded Brynnlaw
pirates drove people from their homes: Ginia's father tried to take their home back from the pirates but was executed
Desharik gave Ginia and Ason to Chremy for their father's actions
Calahan could take Ginia and Ason away from Brynnlaw, but Ginia and Ason can't pay him

quest.title: Ginia's Tale
quest.objective: talk to Calahan near the docks about taking Ginia and Ason
tasks: Go to .
kill Chremy
talk to Calahan near the docks about taking Ginia and Ason
quest.description:
I should begin with my name... Ginia. I grew up here in Brynnlaw.
Things have not always been like this. Brynnlaw was once a pleasant town, though my memories may be influenced by happier times in my own life.
Then the pirates arrived, led by the despot Desharik. Desharik had lost a war with another pirate king. Forced to this island, his ships invaded the town. They took our homes. Desharik killed our mayor and dumped his body into the sea. We were forced out into the streets.
My father could take no more injustice. He tried to get back into our house and was executed for breaking the law of the pirates. Once they've stolen something, the owner has no claim on it.
Desharik said that we would have to pay for our father's "crime." He gave us to Chremy, his lieutenant, as a reward for service. He put me to work as a courtesan for the drunken pirates. It's horrible, traveler! He says that he'll kill my brother Ason if I don't do it.
There is no escape for Ason and me. There is a smuggler who will take us, but we cannot afford to pay him. There is nowhere to run on this island.
Chremy can be found near the inn. The smuggler's name is Calahan. I hope that Calahan will take us with him when you kill Chremy. He will be near the docks. Please be careful!

TESO440: an Akaviri artifact, an amulet that protects its wearer from poisons of any type, looks like a snake coiled around and encircling itself: the eyes of the snake are precious gems

plots: the player has seen Akaviri relics displayed by Countess Narina Carvain
Countess Narina Carvain gives the player a translation of an Akaviri messenger's translated diary, a rough map and a unique key that may help the player in the ruins in Pale Pass

quest.title: Lifting the Vale
quest.objective: bring the Draconian Madstone to Countess Narina Carvain
tasks: Go to .
find the Draconian Madstone
bring the Draconian Madstone to Countess Narina Carvain
quest.description:
Allow me to formally introduce myself. I'm Countess Narina Carvain. I assume you've noticed all of the Akaviri relics I'm displaying.
Well, it's safe to say I'm a collector of sorts. I've invested a great deal of time and money acquiring these bits of ancient history. In fact, I'd be so bold as to proclaim my collection the most complete in all Cyrodiil; perhaps even beyond. Except for one thing.
A particular relic has eluded me for many years. Possessing this piece of Akaviri antiquity would make my collection complete. I'm of course referring to The Draconian Madstone. The stone is a fine bit of Akaviri craftsmanship. Worn like an amulet, this talisman is said to protect the wearer from poisons of any type. The talisman appears as a snake coiled around and encircling itself. The eyes of the snake are supposed to be precious gems or some such. Through my sources, I've learned that the last reported location of the Draconian Madstone was the ruins at Pale Pass.
If you retrieve the Draconian Madstone for me, I'll be happy to compensate you by rewarding you with another Akaviri artifact. Are you in the game?
Let me tell you how you're going to find the talisman. I've come into the possession of a diary written by an Akaviri messenger. I suspect that the text within can lead you to the ruins. Here's a translation of the passages we could still read. It was quite damaged. I've also included a rough map that was drawn in the diary as well. I'm also providing you with a unique key that was supposedly found with the diary. I'm assuming it will prove useful when you arrive at the site.

plots: the player is a friend of the Zeraphi

quest.title: The Crab Trap
quest.objective: stop the Ezrohir from getting scrap metal from the crabs
tasks: Go to Dead Shoals.
prevent the Crab King from finishing his negotiations with the Ezrohir
stop the Ezrohir from getting scrap metal from the crabs
quest.description:
Your timing is perfect, my friend! Below us, in the Dead Shoals, the Crab King is negotiating with a representative of the Ezrohir, to provide the Ezrohir with a huge cache of scrap metal they have salvaged. The Ezrohir will use that scrap to forge more arms to bring against us! They must be stopped!
I beg you: Go down into the Dead Shoals and prevent the Crab King from concluding his negotiations with the Ezrohir! I realize this is not much in the way of a reward, but this potion is all I can offer.

TESS287: a member of the Companions, and a werewolf
TESS95: a dead male member of the Companions
TESS200: a dead male member of the Companions who wanted to cure his lycanthropy

plots: the player is the Harbinger of the Companions
Skjor and Kodlak talked about totems of Hircine: simple-looking objects that could channel the powers of the werewolf in new directions

quest.title: Totem of Hircine
quest.objective: find a totem of Hircine with Aela the Huntress
tasks: go with Aela the Huntress

Want to come along and help me find this totem of Hircine?

plots: both Lilith and Lord Skarmaen asked to see the player before

quest.title: The Dueling Families of Trademeet
quest.objective: bring the Mantle of Waukeen to Lord Skarmaen
tasks: Go to .

bring the Mantle of Waukeen to Lord Skarmaen
quest.description:
Hello once again!
It is pleasing to see that you did not respond to the call of that harlot, Lilith Lurraxol. The woman is too deluded to see the truth, as I said. A commoner that has risen above her station. Our two houses have been feuding for generations. The Lurraxols seem to be possessed of the notion that their family founded this town... what an absurd thought!
Why they would even presume to suppose such a thing, I have no idea. It is sad, however, that the Alibakkars have never had the evidence to prove our claim to them... though it galls me that we would need it. All that has recently changed. An old tome belonging to my family states that there is proof — that proof can be found right here in Trademeet. In the graveyard is a tomb that has been long abandoned... but which also houses the founder of the town. My ancestor. With him lies a large circlet called the Mantle of Waukeen.
Possessing that circlet would be all the proof I need, so I wish to acquire it. I would do so myself, but there happens to be a good reason the tomb is abandoned. It is... haunted, so they say. The exact nature of its danger I do not know... but you are a hero who surely could face its perils and return safely with the mantle, yes? In return, I shall pay you 1,000 gold. I shall give you the key, then, which will allow you into the tomb... the key itself having been in my family for some time as well. More proof, yes? Go, then, and return with the mantle.

quest.title: The Ultimate Heist
quest.objective: steal one of the Elder Scrolls from the Imperial Palace
tasks: Go to Imperial Sewers.
Go to Imperial Palace.

steal one of the Elder Scrolls from the Imperial Palace
quest.description:
This is the big one. This is the heist that will be written about and talked about for decades to come. We are going to steal one of the Elder Scrolls from the Imperial Palace. Are you ready for this challenge?
There is no buyer. This is for glory, not for money. Our names will become legend. I also have a personal need for this particular scroll. As for your compensation, I ask you to trust me. If my plan works, you will get a reward worth far more than mere money.
I have worked for eleven years planning this heist. Savilla's Stone provided the last bit of information I needed. The Elder Scrolls are kept in the Imperial Palace behind a door that cannot be breached. Savilla's Stone has revealed a path around this door. You will have to travel the Old Way. Once used as an escape route for Imperial Emperors, it has been forgotten for centuries.
The Old Way can be found in the Imperial Sewers. Here is the key for the gate to that section of the sewers. My scrying with Savilla's Stone has provided clues, but not the details. I know the tools you will need there, but not the obstacles themselves. The Boots of Springheel Jak will allow you to leap to an unreachable place. They will also protect you from a long fall. The Arrow of Extrication is the only way to unlock the final door. Take them both.
Once you are inside the Palace itself, you need to find the reading room. The blind priests will deliver a scroll to you there. I arranged for the notable Celia Camoran to want to read a particular Elder Scroll. Don't ask how. However, she will be... unavoidably detained. You will take her place. Do not speak to the priests. They are blindfolded and will not realize it isn't her unless you speak. As the guildmaster, I am waiving bloodprice for anyone you kill during this heist. However, I can't stop the Watch from putting a price on your head.
I have written it all down for you in this book. I've chosen you because you are the best. Good luck.

quest.description:
Daynas Valen's Notes
by Daynas Valen

How to summarize a lifetime of research? So little of what I have learned matters now - the petty politics of ancient times, the age-long campaign to wipe out all mention of the Gauldur name.
In the opening days of the First Era, the Archmage Gauldur was revered throughout the north. Wisdom, wealth, honor, and power were his, and even the legendary heros' heirs sought his counsel.
Smothered by his shadow, Gauldur's three sons grew cruel and resentful. They lusted after their father's power and prestige, and eventually Jyrik, the eldest, discovered its source: a mysterious amulet, from which he never parted. Together, they conspired to murder their father in his sleep and divide his amulet between them. And so it was done.
Consumed by their newfound power, the brothers laid waste to the surrounding villages. So great was the carnage that the High King himself intervened, sending a company of battlemages led by the Archmage Geirmund to subdue the brothers. And after a devastating battle, the three fled the field.
Mikrul, the youngest, was run to ground in Folgunthur, the ancient barrows at the foot of Solitude. Geirmund pursued Jyrik to the shattered crypts of Saarthal, half-buried even then. And at last, Sigdis was cornered in the southernmost reaches of land and later entombed in Geirmund's Hall.

It's the playground for the wicked and depraved, a ship where prostitutes ply their trade. All I want you to do is find him and take his spellbook. I have enough magical skill to reverse the curse if I had the formula for his spell.

plots: the Black Hand has sanctioned the Rose of Sithis against Adamus Phillida

quest.title: Permanent Retirement

quest.description:
I have another assassination contract for you.
Do you recall the name Adamus Phillida? The Imperial Legion pest? It's time he joined Death in the Void. Think you're up to the task?
Adamus Phillida has spent his entire career investigating the Dark Brotherhood, interrupting our contracts, killing our family members! We tried to eliminate Phillida, of course, but failed on three separate occasions. He's a powerful man, and was surrounded by powerful associates. Now the Legion's pig's years of service have come to an end. He has retired. Phillida must not be allowed such a victory! His destiny is... darker. Phillida now resides in Leyawiin, in the City Watch barracks, an honored guest of the soldiers there. He is, in fact, more vulnerable than ever.
The Black Hand has sanctioned the Rose of Sithis. It is a magic arrow specifically enchanted to kill its target. In this case, Phillida. As long as the arrow hits Phillida, he will die. But it cannot pierce armor! Shoot while Phillida is armored, and the Rose will be wasted. Travel to Leyawiin. Track Phillida. Learn his schedule. Observe when he removes that blasted Legion armor! And then, let fly the Rose of Sithis! Kill Phillida in any way, Rose or not, and the contract is complete. But to receive a bonus, you must go beyond murder. You must send a message! Once Phillida is dead, take the very finger from his corpse, the one that bears an Imperial Legion signet ring! Deposit this finger in the desk of Phillida's successor, in his office in the Prison Barracks, in the Imperial City! Do this, and the bonus is yours.

quest.description:
Hail knight! I am Pelinal Whitestrake, whose Relics you seek with a worthy heart!
Your prayers have woken me from my endless dream. Or perhaps you have entered my dream, and I still sleep. I think others have sometimes spoken to me, others like you, but my memory is doubtful. Perhaps the others came after you. Your need must be great for the gods to allow us to speak. Has Umaril the Accursed found a way back? The foulest of a foul race. A thousand curses upon his unholy name!
I thought I'd won. But I should have known. The Slavemasters are a cunning breed. Umaril found a way to cheat death, as I could not. If you would seek for my Relics, I know little that can help you. All that has passed since my death is like mist that my mind cannot take hold of. My friends built a shrine upon the site of my death, Vanua, where the Ayleid Elves tormented me in a final act of revenge. I can show you where it once stood. Perhaps it is there still.
Fare thee well, sir knight. May the gods grant you to destroy Umaril utterly, as I failed to do.

TESS541: a man who has been abandoned by his master
TESS542: a forbidden wing of the Blue Palace
TESS543: the large palace of the local ruler

plots: Dervenin's master says that Dervenin is interrupting his vacation
without Dervenin's master's guidance, Dervenin's homeland is falling apart
Dervenin's master went into the Pelagius Wing to talk with an old friend
Dervenin gives the player a hip bone: the player can't enter Pelagius Wing without it

quest.title: The Mind of Madness
quest.objective: gain access to the Pelagius Wing, and find Dervenin's master
tasks: Go to Blue Palace.
talk to Una or Erdi about entering the Pelagius Wing
gain access to the Pelagius Wing, and find Dervenin's master
quest.description:
My master has abandoned me! Abandoned his people. And nothing I say can change his mind. Now he refuses to even see me. He says I interrupt his vacation! It's been so many years... Won't you please help?
Without his guidance, our homeland is falling apart. North wages war against the south! We need his return. Oh, but... I'm sure he'll repay you when he comes to his senses! His favor is a powerful, powerful thing. And so very worth any... inconveniences.
Last I saw him, he was visiting a friend in the Blue Palace. But no one as mundane as the local ruler. No, no... such people are below him. No, he went into the forbidden wing of the palace, to speak with an old friend. Said it had been ages since they had last had tea. Oh and you'll need the hip bone... it's very important. No entering Pelagius Wing without that.
The doors to the Pelagius Wing are locked. But I hear the maids, Una and Erdi, know how to enter it for cleaning. Surely they can help for such an important matter?

TESS821: the player's male superior in the Thieves Guild
TESS824: the female first mate of the Red Wave

plots: Delvin sent the player to Erikur
Captain Volf neglected to honor a trade agreement between him and Erikur

quest.title: The Dainty Sload
quest.objective: frame Captain Volf by planting some contraband
tasks: Go to Dainty Sload.
get some Balmora Blue from Sabine Nyette
plant the Balmora Blue in Captain Volf's footlocker
frame Captain Volf by planting some contraband
quest.description:
It's about time you got here. I'm not accustomed to dealing with people who are unreliable. That's why I asked Delvin to send me his best.
Nothing raises my ire more than having an agreement broken. It's bad for business and it wastes time. Captain Volf of the Dainty Sload has decided to test my patience on this matter by neglecting to honor a trade agreement we had established.
I need you to help me show him the error of his ways by sneaking on board the Sload and planting some contraband. You'll need to get your hands on some Balmora Blue from Sabine Nyette down by the docks. She's the first mate on another ship, the Red Wave.
Once you get your hands on it, I want you to plant it in Captain Volf's footlocker. I'll take care of the rest. Captain Volf is ashore right now and I want the authorities waiting for him when he gets back.
Now get going... I don't want to see your face until the job's done.

TESS431: the home of Bashnag's dangerous coven

plots: the player saved Selveni Nethri from a spiders' web
Selveni Nethri was a member of Bashnag's coven, but they chased her out and left her for dead

quest.title: The Savior of Selveni Nethri
quest.objective: help Selveni Nethri escape from Southfringe Sanctum
tasks: escort Selveni Nethri outside
help Selveni Nethri escape from Southfringe Sanctum
quest.description:
Thanks for getting me out of that. Bashnag's coven chased me out and left me for dead down here. Nobody lasts too long with the spiders.
Please, will you help me get out of here? If the coast is clear, I'll make a break for it. We - well 'they', Bashnag's circle of mages, live here. They made it pretty clear that I'm no longer welcome. These are no dainty college mages. Bashnag has the skill of a magister and the mind of a warlord.
This is a dangerous bunch. They're good company if you want to study necromancy in peace, though.

TESS168: the player's guildleader in the Dark Brotherhood
TESS409: a ritual to employ the services of the Dark Brotherhood

plots: Muiri has performed the Black Sacrament
do whatever Muiri wishes, be professional, represent the Dark Brotherhood well, and get the job done

quest.title: Mourning Never Comes
quest.objective: assassinate an ex-lover for Muiri
tasks: Go to The Hag's Cure.
speak with Muiri, set up the contract with her, and fulfill it
assassinate an ex-lover for Muiri
quest.description:
Ah, there you are. We've got some business to discuss.
You must go to the city of Markarth, and speak with the apothecary's assistant. You'll probably find her in the shop, The Hag's Cure. The girl's been running her mouth, wants an ex-lover killed. She's apparently performed the Black Sacrament. Her name is Muiri. I need you to talk to her, set up the contract, and carry it out.
Just do whatever the contact wishes. Be professional, represent us well, and get the job done. Since it's your first contract, I'll let you keep whatever Muiri pays. She'll be generous, I'm sure. They always are.

TESS514: a Forsworn man, and a prisoner who tried to have the player killed in the past
TESS517: a man who has been in Cidhna Mine the longest beside Madanach

plots: the player has been imprisoned in Cidhna Mine without any reason

quest.title: No One Escapes Cidhna Mine
quest.objective: discover how widespread the injustice of Markarth is
tasks: talk to Braig: tell him that Madanach sent you, and ask him why he is in Cidhna Mine
discover how widespread the injustice of Markarth is
quest.description:
Well, well. Look at you. The authorities of Markarth have turned you into an animal. A wild beast caged up and left to go mad.
So, my fellow beast, what do you want? Answers about the Forsworn? Revenge for trying to have you killed? You're one of us now, you see? A slave. The boot of the false, unjust law stepping on your throat. Maybe if you understood that, I could help you.
There's a man named Braig inside these mines. Besides me, he's been here the longest. Tell him I sent you. Ask him why he's here. I want you to know how widespread the injustice of Markarth is. Then, we might discuss about an early pardon.

plots: the player is a noble: Bolumir would like to be the chaplain of the player's keep
Bolumir does not promise to stay long at the player's keep

quest.title: The Priest of Tempus
quest.objective: deal with Bolumir
tasks: decide whether to accept Bolumir's offer or not
deal with Bolumir
quest.description:
My name be Bolumir, priest of Tempus, the god of battles!
Hahr... it has been some time since I have rested my feet in any place, to tell the truth. I've been wandering for many a year now. The traveling does wear on me, to tell the truth. I've come to ask if you've a chapel that a priest of Tempus might set himself up in... bring the good Word to the folk of the area.
What do you say, eh? If my manner does not strike you as offensive, I would be glad to be chaplain of your wee keep here. I can help your people here much while I stay. But I do not promise to stay for long. Either you accept me or you don't, my liege... that is your choice, and I'll not begrudge it you.

plots: Flydian was sent by the High Merchant
druids are suspected of the animal attacks

quest.title: Animal trouble in Trademeet
quest.objective: investigate why forest animals are attacking Trademeet
tasks: Go to Trademeet.
go talk with the High Merchant
investigate why forest animals are attacking Trademeet
quest.description:
I am Flydian, a messenger sent by the High Merchant of Trademeet to find someone to help our town.
Trademeet is under attack by forest animals. The High Merchant thinks druids may be responsible, but we haven't the manpower to find them and stop it.
The High Merchant will have more information for you.

plots: the player is Sheogorath's newest and only noble in the realm
a messenger told Sheogorath that Order has attacked Brellach and routed his soldiers

quest.title: The Helpless Army
quest.objective: free Brellach from Order
tasks: talk to the messenger
free Brellach from Order
quest.description:
There's a perfect job for you, my newest and only Noble in the realm!
A messenger told me that Order has attacked my army's stronghold at Brellach and routed my soldiers! If Order has truly entered my army's stronghold, things have taken a disturbing turn. It means Order has tried subterfuge... not its strong suit. Amazing! Perhaps things aren't going as poorly as I'd imagined.
You'll want to get all the details from the messenger. Unless you already have. You haven't, have you?

plots: Una wants knowledge
Una thinks that Suspicious Man works for Illagers

quest.title: A Shadow of Treachery
quest.objective: investigate Suspicious Man's actions
tasks: find Suspicious Man's journal, and bring it to Una
investigate Suspicious Man's actions
quest.description:
I need the help of an outsider. I think one of the villagers here works for Illagers in secret! They could be planning an attack on Desert Refuge!
Would you please investigate this matter for me? Try to obtain Suspicious Man's journal. It should shed light on his actions.
I'me even willing to reward you with 48 emeralds. What are a few gems to peace of mind?

BG2128: a little girl, and Lissa's daughter

plots: Jaella just lies in bed staring at the wall

quest.title: Lissa's Daughter Needs Healing
quest.objective: heal Jaella
tasks: find out what Gerhardt knows about Jaella's condition
heal Jaella
quest.description:
My name is Lissa. Something's wrong with my daughter.
Her name is Jaella. She's hurt, traveler. I don't know what's wrong with her. She just lies in bed staring at the wall. Won't even eat.
Please heal her. She's just a little girl. Please, you must go and find out exactly what Gerhardt knows about Jaella's condition. You'll find him in the basement.

MC16: a woman tired of regular food

plots: Bella wants comfort
the player can craft golden apples by combining an apple with gold ingots

quest.title: Fine Dining
quest.objective: bring 5 golden apples to Bella
tasks: obtain 5 golden apples
bring 5 golden apples to Bella
quest.description:
I'm sick and tired of eating the same boring, mundane food every day. I want to taste something a bit more refined. Something like golden apples.
Could you help a lady in distress? Bring me 5 golden apples to sample from, and I'll procure you a diamond block. That should leave a sweet taste in your mouth, as well.
Golden apples can be found in various dangerous corners of the world. If you don't fancy exploring, you can craft golden apples by combining an apple with gold ingots.

plots: guards do not let anyone in the circus tent

quest.title: Find Giran's Mother Within the Circus Tent
quest.objective: investigate the circus tent
tasks: find Giran's mother
investigate the circus tent
quest.description:
sniff* My momma's still inside. They says she can't come out. My momma went into the tent to see a circus show. But somethin' happened, and now nobody comes out. There's guards who won't let nobody in anymore, too. But my momma's in there!
I want my momma! Please find her, please!

plots: the player entered the room where Melka has been imprisoned

quest.title: The Affairs of Hagravens
quest.objective: help Melka reclaim her tower by killing Petra
tasks: let Melka out of the cage
help Melka reclaim her tower by killing Petra
quest.description:
Who enters? Will nobody save poor Melka?
You, meat! Come, come. Don't leave poor Melka to die. Pretty, pretty flesh. Let me out!
Petra! Evil Petra put me in a cage, stole my tower. Hate her, chew her bones! Let me out, kind, kind meat.
Ah, I have a pretty staff. Help me find Petra, wring her neck, pluck her eyes. Take my prize staff, I just want my tower back!

plots: Joseph wears a greenstone wedding ring on his left hand
Joseph went missing in the mines
men have disappeared in the mines before

quest.title: Joseph's Wife
quest.objective: investigate Joseph's fate for his wife
tasks: find Joseph
investigate Joseph's fate for his wife
quest.description:
My husband is missing in the mines. All I know about the mines are that men keep on disappearing in their hellish depths.
My husband is one of the miners, but he hasn't been home for weeks. His name is Joseph, and he wears his wedding ring on his left hand. It's a greenstone ring.
Please, find him and tell me how he is doing!

TESS153: a young, beautiful woman, and Ranmir's lost love
TESS154: a male drunk who used to be happy with Isabelle Rolaine

plots: Ranmir is sure that Isabelle Rolaine ran away with Vex

quest.title: Drowned Sorrows
quest.objective: find Isabelle Rolaine
tasks: Go to Riften.
talk to Vex about Isabelle Rolaine
find Isabelle Rolaine
quest.description:
I'm Dagur, an innkeeper.
I wondered if I could ask a favor of you. It's about Ranmir. Don't get me wrong, I don't have a problem with him being in my inn all the time. He mostly keeps to himself, and so far he's been able to pay. I just hate to see what's happened to him. He hasn't always been like this, you know. Drunk, I mean.
He was a different person. Happy, outgoing... Like anyone who's in love. See, Ranmir was involved with a pretty young woman named Isabelle Rolaine. The two of them were very happy together, I thought. One day, she just disappeared. Ranmir was convinced she'd run off with someone else, leaving him behind. He turned to drinking, and what's left of him is what you see here every day.
I hoped that maybe if she could be found, if he had some sort of explanation, that maybe he could put himself back together. I'm in no position to go searching for her, but perhaps you could. Ranmir seemed convinced that Isabelle'd run off to Riften with someone named Vex. That's all I remember.

TESO56: the prince of madness, one of the Daedric Princes
TESO164: the prince of order, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: Sheogorath is gone: Jyggalag will win, if the throne of Madness remains empty
the Staff of Sheogorath faded with Sheogorath
Haskill gives the player a crystal that opens the sealed door at Knifepoint Hollow: the library is a thing of Order, and it will still serve that end

quest.title: Symbols of Office
quest.objective: remake the Staff of Sheogorath and fill the throne of Madness after Sheogorath's passing
tasks: Go to Knifepoint Hollow.
find the being who can help you to remake the Staff of Sheogorath
remake the Staff of Sheogorath and fill the throne of Madness after Sheogorath's passing
quest.description:
Sheogorath is gone, but hope is not lost. We have a rare opportunity here, but I hesitate to do what must be done. If the Throne of Madness remains empty when Jyggalag storms the palace, he will prevail. But there is a chance that the throne may not be empty. The only way to protect the Realm from Jyggalag is to place you in the Throne of Madness.
Unfortunately, when Sheogorath faded, the power of the Staff of Sheogorath faded with him. It must now be remade. The Staff is the symbol of power in this Realm. He who rightfully holds the Staff may hold the throne of the Shivering Isles. However, the secrets of its construction are lost.
That which is lost can be found again. There is one being in the Shivering Isles who may be able to assist you in the construction of a new Staff. The ruins of Knifepoint Hollow once served as a great library. There, you will find a door. Behind that door, you will find the answer you seek.
Take this crystal. It contains the power to open the sealed door. Inside, you will find the final remnants of the library. Be mindful of what you find there. The library is a thing of Order, and it will still serve that end.

plots: Commander Vale believes that the Alchemist might attack the Wellspring Temple: the Alchemist wants to reach the Guardian of Water

quest.title: Protect the Guardian!
quest.objective: protect the Guardian of Water
tasks: Go to Wellspring Temple.
scout the Wellspring Temple
protect the Guardian of Water
quest.description:
Commander Vale believes that the Alchemist might attack the Wellspring Temple, in an attempt to reach the Guardian of Water ... for what nefarious purpose I am afraid to speculate. There has been no word from either Vale, or the Guardian.
Scout the Wellspring Temple, and determine if the Guardian of Water is in any danger.

TESS155: the player's superior in the Thieves Guild
TESS412: a woman who pissed off the wrong person

plots: the Thieves Guild gets rid of people without killing them, unlike the Dark Brotherhood

quest.title: The Shill Job
quest.objective: frame Carlotta Valentia to get her out of the way
tasks: place an item as evidence inside Carlotta Valentia's home
frame Carlotta Valentia to get her out of the way
quest.description:
When a client needs us to eliminate another, we don't operate like the Dark Brotherhood. We find alternate means to get them out of the way.
We send you to plant some phony evidence in the mark's house, and then tip off the town guard... the rest takes care of itself. Sound like you can handle it?
Go place an item as evidence inside Carlotta Valentia's home. She must have ticked-off our client badly. The client's impatient and keeps asking if the job's done. Can you get him off my back?

plots: the rings of blood magic increase the abilities of the player's vampiric powers: Molag Bal supposedly gave the rings to vampires

quest.title: Rings of Blood Magic
quest.objective: retrieve a set of ancient rings of blood magic for yourself
tasks: Go to Swindler's Den.
Go to Cragwallow Slope.
retrieve the Ring of the Erudite
retrieve the Ring of the Beast
retrieve a set of ancient rings of blood magic for yourself
quest.description:
I've discovered the whereabouts of a set of ancient rings of Blood Magic: the Ring of the Erudite in Swindler's Den and the Ring of the Beast in Cragwallow Slope. They belong among our kind, not gathering mold in some vagabond's treasure pile.
The rings increase the abilities of your vampiric powers. Some say Molag Bal himself gave these rings to ancient powerful vampire lords. Some say that is just a myth.
You'll be able to keep the rings. I wouldn't be telling you where to find them if I desired them for myself.

TESS925: an ancient Blades sanctuary, hidden deep in the crags of the Reach
TESS227: a person who can stop Alduin and avert the end of the world

plots: the player is the Dragonborn

quest.title: Alduin's Wall
quest.objective: locate Alduin's Wall in Sky Haven Temple
tasks: Go to Karthspire.
find the entrance to Sky Haven Temple with Esbern
locate Alduin's Wall in Sky Haven Temple
quest.description:
Only a Dragonborn can stop Alduin and avert the end of the world!
But... I don't yet know how you can stop him. But Alduin's Wall does. I hope. It's in Sky Haven Temple, an ancient Blades sanctuary, hidden deep in the crags of the Reach.
Ah, yes. The entrance to Sky Haven Temple seems to be near what's now known as the Karthspire. We'll have to see what we find when we arrive there.
We should be careful. There's no telling what traps and wards the ancient Blades may have set.

TL2137: the player's old friend, who promised the player a a greater reward if the player came to visit him in Ossean Wastes
TL2138: Lord Taldimut's armory that houses some of the finest weapons
TL2139: a hidden portal to the Celestial Armory

plots: Ezrohir have the Celestial Armory under siege

quest.title: The Key to Victory
quest.objective: help Lord Taldimut gather up weapons and armor from the Celestial Armory without Ezrohir noticing
tasks: Go to Celestial Armory.
use the Golden Gear to get inside the Celestial Armory, and activate the Armory Portal
help Lord Taldimut gather up weapons and armor from the Celestial Armory without Ezrohir noticing
quest.description:
It's good to see you again, my friend! I know that I promised you a greater reward, should you come to visit... but that was before I returned to the Ossean Wastes and found the Celestial Armory under siege by Ezrohir.
What if I give you your choice of artifacts from the Armory? The Celestial Armory houses some of the finest weapons in the world! You have but to use the Golden Gear to get inside, then activate the Armory Portal, which will allow us to gather up the weapons and armor safely... with the Ezrohir none the wiser!

TESS307: the shaman of the Skaal, and Frea's father

plots: something has taken control of most of the people of Solstheim, including the Skaal: it makes them work on horrible creations that corrupt the stones
Storn says that Miraak has returned to Solstheim, but that is impossible

quest.title: The Temple of Miraak
quest.objective: uncover what lies beneath the Temple of Miraak
tasks: Go to Temple of Miraak.
find a way into the Temple of Miraak with Frea
uncover what lies beneath the Temple of Miraak
quest.description:
I am Frea of the Skaal. I am here to either save my people, or avenge them.
Something has taken control of most of the people of Solstheim. It makes them forget themselves, and work on these horrible creations that corrupt the Stones, the very land itself. My father Storn, our shaman, says Miraak has returned to Solstheim, but that is impossible.
If you want to know what lies beneath the Temple of Miraak, then let us go together. First, we need to find a way into the Temple of Miraak.

BG114: the leader of the Thieves' Guild
BG117: a house inhabited by Shandalar's daughters

plots: Shandalar lives inside a Halruaan skyship
Shandalar knows how to produce Halruaan skyships: Shandalar plans to sell the knowledge of building Halruaan skyships to Grand Duchess Liia Jannath
Halruaans do not want others to obtain their skyships
spellbook, statuette, and artifact fragment are the ingredients needed to keep the skyships aloft: Shandalar's daughters have them

quest.title: Alatos and the Thieves' Guild
quest.objective: steal spellbook, statuette, and artifact fragment, and bring them to Alatos Thuibuld
tasks: Go to Oberan's Estate.
go to Oberan's Estate
steal spellbook, statuette, and artifact fragment, and bring them to Alatos Thuibuld
quest.description:
I am Alatos Thuibuld, though I thank you not to mention that too often.
A local wizard by the name of Shandalar makes his home in a moored Halruaan skyship. It would appear that he has the knowledge to reproduce these flying marvels and is currently organizing the sale of the recipe to Grand Duchess Liia Jannath. He has drawn up a set of rituals and has procured an artifact fragment and an ancient statuette vital to the spell that keeps the ships aloft. These he has divided amongst his daughters until the deal is to proceed. I have been contacted by a representative of the Halruaans, and they have no wish to see scores of flying ships manufactured in every port. You are to infiltrate the place of exchange that is known as Oberan's Estate, steal the ingredients, and return here with them. Simple enough.
You would be well paid. Enough gold to give you a backache and, if I am well pleased, mayhaps a magical weapon or two. Perhaps a little more, perhaps a little less. It entirely depends upon your performance.

TESO16: a female noble ruling over Chorrol

plots: the last tenant of Arborwatch has cleaned the place of furniture
Seed-Neeus should have furniture for sale

quest.title: Buying a house in Chorrol
quest.objective: purchase Arborwatch
tasks: give 20,000 gold to Countess Valga
purchase Arborwatch
quest.description:
It is a pleasure to meet you. I am Countess Valga of Chorrol.
Are you looking for a house to buy? There is a positively gorgeous home for sale right on the main plaza. You'll be hard pressed to find a nicer home for sale in Chorrol.
The house is called Arborwatch, and it costs 20,000 gold to buy the house from me. It would be a pleasure to have you become a citizen of Chorrol.
The last tenant of Arborwatch has cleaned the place of furniture. I'd recommend stopping by Northern Goods and Trade. The owner, Seed-Neeus, should have everything you need.

BG1178: a priestess who can help Sam

plots: Lena and Sam have been wandering in the wilderness
Sam will join the player

quest.title: Sam and Lena
quest.objective: save Sam from dying
tasks: Go to Temple of Wisdom.
take Sam to Gellana Mirrorshade
save Sam from dying
quest.description:
Please wait a moment, kind traveler! You've got to help me!
My name is Lena. You must forgive me for my appearance, but I've been wandering the wilderness for more than a week now.
My friend is badly hurt, and he might die if he doesn't get assistance soon. His name is Sam. If you were to take him to Gellana Mirrorshade at the Temple of Wisdom, she'd help him.
Please, can you do this?

BG1263: northeast of the village, in the woods
BG1264: northeast of the village, in the woods
northeast of the village, in the woods
BG1265: northeast of the village, in the woods

plots: Maralee's husband took Peladan hunting: werewolves attacked Peladan and his father
Peladan went missing, but Maralee's husband was killed
Peladan and Maralee's husband have dark hair

quest.title: Maralee's Child
quest.objective: return Peladan to Maralee
tasks: find Peladan
return Peladan to Maralee
quest.description:
Hello, good people. I am Maralee. Two moons ago my husband took my son out hunting with him. They were attacked by those horrible wolf-creatures. They... they killed my husband and took my baby.
Others say that they took the baby away to eat him, but I know he's still alive. He's a beautiful little boy with dark hair like his father. He is three moons old and his name is Peladan.
They took him from my husband northeast of the village, in the woods.

TESO126: the player's superior at the Fighters Guild

plots: Azzan only has one more contract for the player

quest.title: The Stone of St. Alessia
quest.objective: return the stolen Stone of St. Alessia to the Bruma Chapel
tasks: Go to Bruma.
talk to Cirroc
return the stolen Stone of St. Alessia to the Bruma Chapel
quest.description:
I've only got one more thing on my plate for you, but it's an important one. The Stone of St. Alessia has been stolen from the Bruma Chapel.
I don't know if you're religious, but a lot of folks are, and the Stone is important. Talk to Cirroc in Bruma. He'll fill you in on the details.

TESS227: the only person who can defeat dragons for good

plots: the player is Dragonborn

quest.title: Dragon Hunting
quest.objective: kill a dragon with the Blades
tasks: ask Esbern to send the Blades to the dragon
kill a dragon with the Blades
quest.description:
The Blades of the old hunted down many dragons in their day, and they have records of where the beasts lived.
Only you can truly defeat these monsters, Dragonborn, but you do not have to do so alone. The Blades can help you.
Just ask whenever you're ready to take on a dragon. We will send the Blades to help you fulfill your destiny. The dragon's soul should make you stronger.

plots: Lee wants comfort
cyan dye is made by combining green dye and blue dye

quest.title: Showing Your True Colors
quest.objective: bring 16 cyan dye to Lee
tasks: obtain 16 cyan dye
bring 16 cyan dye to Lee
quest.description:
I want to make my leather works more... dashing and colorful.
Bring me 16 cyan dye, and I'll reward you with 32 emeralds. You can make cyan dye by combining green dye with blue dye, I think. I'd obtain the dye myself, but the smell of my tanning chemicals attracts all sorts of unsavory creatures to me out there.

plots: there is an open grave in Falkreath graveyard: Vighar broke free from the grave
Dengeir of Stuhn's family is entrusted with keeping Vighar buried: somebody stole the wardstone that kept Vighar in the grave

quest.title: Dark Ancestor
quest.objective: destroy Vighar
tasks: Go to Bloodlet Throne.
find Vighar
destroy Vighar
quest.description:
You may have seen the open grave in our graveyard. Most of the townsfolk think it's the work of a corpse thief. The truth is less pleasant. It is...was, the grave of Vighar, my own ancestor, dead for centuries now.
Vighar is a vampire. My family is entrusted with keeping him buried, but recently someone stole the wardstone that sealed him in the grave, and Vighar escaped. It's too late for the wardstone. Vighar must be destroyed. If this gets out, my family will suffer great shame.
See that Vighar is destroyed. He will have fled to gather others of his kind at Bloodlet Throne.

TESO527: the player's guildleader in the Mages Guild
TESO528: the king of worms, the leader of the necromancers

plots: with Traven's gem in the player's possession, the player will be impervious to Mannimarco's attempt to enthrall them
Traven will die after giving the quest to the player

quest.title: Confront the King
quest.objective: defeat Mannimarco once and for all
tasks: get Traven's gem after speaking with Traven, and seek out Mannimarco
defeat Mannimarco once and for all
quest.description:
Hear me, and hear me well. Mannimarco will have what he seeks, but it will be his undoing at your hands.
With this gem in your possession, you will be impervious to his attempt to enthrall you. When he fails, that is when you shall strike. When we are done speaking, you will take this gem, you will then seek out Mannimarco, and destroy him. Get to him anyway you can. It is your only hope for defeating him. I have full confidence in you, and so I leave the guild in your care.
When I am gone, you will be recognized as Arch-Mage and leader of the Guild. Lead your fellow mages, and lead them well. The future rests on your shoulders.
Farewell, my friend.

TESS657: the god of hunting and monsters
TESS658: a ring that is supposed to control a werewolf's transformations, a relic of Hircine

plots: Sinding killed a little girl, because he lost control of his transformations
Hircine cursed the Ring of Hircine when Sinding obtained it: it transforms him at the worst of times
Sinding will escape from the prison after giving the quest

quest.title: Ill Met by Moonlight
quest.objective: take the Ring of Hircine back to Hircine
tasks: Go to .
hunt down the beast to draw out Hircine
take the Ring of Hircine back to Hircine
quest.description:
Come to gawk at the monster?
A little girl is dead because of me. Believe me, it wasn't anything I ever intended to do. I just... lost control. I tried to tell them, but none of them believe me.
It's all on account of this blasted ring. This is the Ring of Hircine. I was told it could let me control my transformations. Perhaps it used to. But I'll never know. Hircine didn't care for my taking it, and threw a curse on it. I put it on... and the changes just came to me. I could never guess when. It would be at the worst times. Like... with the little girl.
I don't suppose there's a point in keeping the secret if I'm going to die in here anyway. I'm sure you've heard of men who shift to beasts under the influence of the moons. I am one of them. A werewolf. It's my secret, and my shame. That's why I wanted the ring... it was said to give men like me control. Now I may look like a man, but I still feel the animal inside of me, as strong as ever.
You would take the ring back to Hircine? Oh my. You would do this for me? Here, take it. I don't want anything to do with this wretched thing anymore. Seek out the beast. He wanders these woods. Bring him down and... well, the Lord of the Hunt should smile on you and appear before you.
I wish you luck, but should leave here while I still have my skin. Should our paths cross again, I will remember your kindness. Farewell.

plots: the player and Jauffre won't like Martin's plan to obtain a Great Sigil Stone
Great Sigil Stones are the anchors of Great Gates: the Mythic Dawn opened a Great Gate at Kvatch, and they want to open another one here to destroy Bruma

the only way to recover the Amulet of Kings is to allow the Mythic Dawn to proceed with their plan to attack Bruma

quest.title: Defense of Bruma
quest.objective: have the Countess meet Martin in the Chapel of Talos for a council of war
tasks: Go to Bruma.
explain Martin's plan to the Countess
have the Countess meet Martin in the Chapel of Talos for a council of war
quest.description:
We need a Great Sigil Stone. You're not going to like it. Jauffre doesn't like it. The Countess of Bruma certainly isn't going to like it. Great Sigil Stones are the anchors of Great Gates. The kind of gate the Mythic Dawn opened at Kvatch. The kind of Gate the Mythic Dawn wants to open here to destroy Bruma.
The risk is great, I know. I was at Kvatch. I saw the terrible power of the Daedric siege engine. But we have no choice. The only way to recover the Amulet of Kings is to allow the Mythic Dawn to proceed with their plan to attack Bruma.
Please, my friend. I explain myself to you so you understand me. And so you can explain to the Countess. I'm afraid she may take a bit more convincing than you.
Have the Countess of Bruma meet me in the Chapel of Talos for a council of war. That seems a fitting place to make such desperate plans.

TESS18: a priest who has dedicated his whole life to reading and deciphering Elder Scrolls
TESS9: mysterious scrolls used in divining prophecies

plots: Lord Harkon is giving a speech to the player and their fellow vampires: the player and the other vampires will dominate over the sun itself, and forge a realm of eternal darkness

quest.title: Prophet of the Night
quest.objective: locate a Moth Priest for Lord Harkon

quest.description:
Scions of the night! Hear my words! The prophesied time is at last upon us. Soon we will claim dominion over the sun itself, and forge a new realm of eternal darkness.
Now that I have reclaimed one of my Elder Scrolls, we must find a Moth Priest to read it. I have spread false rumors about the discovery of an Elder Scroll in Skyrim to lure a Moth Priest here. Now it is time to see if those efforts have borne fruit.
Go forth, and search the land for rumors of a Moth Priest within our borders. Look to the cities. Speak to innkeepers, carriage drivers, anyone who would meet a traveler.
Go now, and carry out this task. This is my command!

quest.description:
It appears you have found my body. Very good. This is where my memories are stored … including the locations of multiple caches of treasure. I could share these with you, if you would help me reacquire the rest of my components.
We should begin with my Cognition Linkage. Without that, I won't be able to do much more than repeat this message. My sensors tell me it is somewhere nearby. Find it and reinstall it, and I will direct you to one of those treasure troves.

They caused considerable damage to the cities, and devastated the land, until the Zeraphi sultan had had enough. He banished them both: one to the desert, and one to... another place; a dark realm.

tasks: Go to .

remove pollution from the various points of focus for magic energies with specially enchanted gloves, and return the gloves to Drevis Neloren afterwards
quest.description:
There may be a matter in which your... skills... could be useful. The various points of focus for magic energies around the College have become polluted, and need cleansing.
As you may be aware, the College has gone to great lengths to purify and enhance the natural energies of the world. This both enhances our connection to the realm of magic, and eliminates possible interference from outside sources. These energies, on occasion, become... polluted. Effort must be made to see that they are kept pure, clean.
These specially enchanted gloves will allow you to delve directly into the focal points for these energies. Go to each focal point and remove whatever impurities you may find there. Return the gloves to me when you have finished. Please exercise caution. This is not a procedure without possible... consequences.

plots: Francois Motierre is waiting for the player inside his house: the player should not kill him
Francois Motierre's debtors have sent an enforcer to kill him
Vicente Valtieri gives the player a knife: the blade has been coated with Languorwine, and there's only enough Languorwine for slicing Francois Motierre

quest.title: The Assassinated Man
quest.objective: help Francois Motierre fake his death to escape his debts
tasks: Go to Chorrol.
break into Francois Motierre's house
help Francois Motierre fake his death to escape his debts
quest.description:
I, Vicente Valtieri, have a special contract that needs fulfillment. In truth. I don't wish to offer it to any other guild member. I've come to rely on your abilities.
We're usually called upon to take a life, but not this time. This contract requires us to stage the assassination of a marked man.
You must go to the city of Chorrol and break into the house of Francois Motierre. Inside you will find Motierre waiting for you. Do not kill him! You see, Francois Motierre is a marked man. He owes a considerable sum to the wrong kind of people. So, they have sent an enforcer to kill him. This is an unusual contract, Motierre had to make a special arrangement with us before it was approved. I trust in your professionalism.
Here, take this knife. The blade has been coated with a rare poison called Languorwine. One drop in a normal human bloodstream will mimic the effects of death immediately. I will provide you with a vial of antidote, which will be used to revive Francois Motierre after you successfully stage his death. You should also know that there's only enough Languorwine on the blade for this one contract. After Motierre is sliced, the knife will be useless.
As payment, I'll be pleased to award you this amulet, Cruelty's Heart.

plots: the player has not met Janus Hassildor before: the player and Janus Hassildor are both looking for a cure for vampirism
over 50 years ago Rona and Janus Hassildor were turned into vampires: Janus Hassildor embraced the vampirism, Rona did not

quest.title: Vampire Cure
quest.objective: report to Janus Hassildor's steward after finding a cure for vampirism
tasks: Go to .
find the witch of Glenmoril
report to Janus Hassildor's steward after finding a cure for vampirism
quest.description:
I'm sorry. We've not met. I'm Janus Hassildor, Count of Skingrad. I understand you're looking for a cure for vampirism. This is fortunate, as I also seek the cure.
I wish to tell you a story so that you might understand why I would trust you with my secrets. More than 50 years ago, my wife Rona and I were both turned into vampires. While I came to embrace the changes in myself, she did not. She hated what she had become, and refused to feed to keep herself healthy. She eventually slipped into a coma from which she has not awoken. My trusted servants have cared for her all this time, but I wish for her to at last find peace. The cure is for her. I have researched what I can, but acquiring the cure is beyond my grasp. I cannot risk drawing too much attention to myself. So I would ask that you took up the search on my behalf. If you are successful, I will reward you in whatever small way I can. Will you aid me?
What little I have discovered points to the witches of Glenmoril. In the past, they have been capable of creating a cure. I have searched for these witches throughout Cyrodiil, but no covens still exist within its borders. There may be one left. I have unconfirmed reports of a woman seen near the Corbolo river, who fits the description of these witches. Seek her out, and learn whether she can help. She lives somewhere along the river, east of the Imperial City and south of Cheydinhal. If you are successful in finding a cure, report to my steward. You have my thanks.

plots: the player has advanced quickly in their conjuration studies

quest.title: Your Will Be Done
quest.objective: learn powerful, new conjuration spells
tasks: summon an unbound Dremora, prove that you are in control, and order the Dremora bring you a sigil stone from an Oblivion gate

quest.description:
How quickly you've advanced. Most impressive. There are spells yet to be learned, powerful spells that can more closely and more permanently bind creatures to your will. These spells are difficult, even for one as skilled as I. To even begin to inscribe them, I need something very special. A sigil stone from an Oblivion gate.
I do not have one in my possession. Nor do you, I'm sure. So we require a Dremora to retrieve one for us. You will summon one, and order it to bring a sigil stone to you. I will then inscribe the spells for you.
But there are risks. There are always risks. You must summon and command an unbound Dremora. Summoning an Unbound Dremora is not like other Conjuration spells. It will not simply do your bidding. You must first prove you are in control.
I will teach you the spell to summon the Dremora, but know that it will only work in a place properly prepared for the event. Here is the spell you need. Go to the top of the Hall of Attainment; I have prepared a place for you there.
