Before we get down to business, I've got something I need you to do.
Well, as you know, the Guild's growing and things are looking up around here. The only thing we're lacking is a reliable way to transport our merchandise across the land.
I'm not sure if you've noticed, but there are several caravans that travel across the realm. They're shrewd traders and don't mind getting their hands dirty.
I've bartered with their leader, Ri'saad, on more than one occasion. I want you to bring him something. You see, the caravans are notorious for transporting illegal substances.
Present Ri'saad with this satchel of Moon Sugar, and I bet my last coin he'll make a deal.

Hail, good friend! I am most pleased to see you here! Your timing could not be better, as I, Coran, am in most dire need!
I was traveling Forest of Tethir with my beloved Safana... and now she is kidnapped! It is dreadful! Two days ago, we were beset by giant wolves... wolfweres, I fear. They tried to take us both, but I was able to escape. Safana, however, was not so fortunate. I tracked them to an encampment east of here, but even a great warrior such as myself cannot beat them alone.
We must save her and strike a blow against the foul werebeasts! Together, we shall be unstoppable!

quest.description:
I've got a good feeling about you. And I don't often get good feelings about anything. A warrior knows to trust her gut... I'm not going to go through the normal process with you. I've got a little test lined up. Pass that, and we'll talk about you joining the Legion.
The ancients built many of the fortresses that dot the landscape of Skyrim. Sadly, most have fallen into disrepair. And nearly all have been overrun with bandits or other vagabonds. Fort Hraggstad is one of the few that remains mostly intact. We're going to install a garrison there, but first, you're going to clean out the bandits that have moved in.
Then, it's time for you to officially join the Legion.

plots: the note is addressed toward the player: the player is the Silence of the Dark Brotherhood

quest.title: A Matter of Honor
quest.objective: assassinate Alval Uvani
tasks: locate Alval Uvani with a schedule included in this dead drop
assassinate Alval Uvani
quest.description:
Dead Drop Orders #5
by Lucien Lachance

If you're reading this note, Shaleez is dead. You've done the world a great service, Silencer. It's time to continue the good work.
Your next target is a traveling Dark Elf merchant by the name of Alval Uvani, who is currently renting a house in the city of Leyawiin. Uvani is a well-respected tradesman back in his native Morrowind, but his business often takes him very far from home. Therein lies the problem. Alval Uvani's wife has become disillusioned with her husband's repeated, extended absences and wishes to dissolve their marriage, and has sought the Dark Brotherhood's assistance. Lucky for us Cyrodiil is a bit beyond the reach of Morrowind's Morag Tong.
Alval Uvani is currently traveling around Cyrodiil, and is never in one place for more than a couple of days. In this dead drop you will also find a schedule detailing the Dark Elf's whereabouts; use it to locate him and plan your elimination. Be aware, however, that because he is forced to travel alone to the farthest reaches of the Empire, Uvani has learned to defend himself. He is a master of the Destruction school of Magicka, and is no stranger to killing.
When Alval Uvani lies rotting, journey to the Market District of the Imperial City. There you will find a shop called Stonewall Shields. Your dead drop is located behind that building, in a hollowed-out tree stump. As usual, you will find your reward for the previous contract, as well as information on your next.
Ah yes, I must mention one last detail. Apparently Alval Uvani suffers from a rare Dark Elf condition, a serious allergy to honey. If you could somehow get Uvani to drink the honey-based mead, perhaps by replacing his food, he would suffer from complete paralyzation. This would certainly make the Dark Elf a bit easier to deal with.

quest.title: A Misguided Murder

quest.description:
Now I ask for a more specific task that will disrupt the Shadow Thieves further.
The task is... unseemly.
It calls for the murder of a man. Not a truly innocent man, but hardly a villain of epic scope. You must kill, blaming the murder on the Shadow Thieves. He is head of a merchant house, and his link to Shadow Thieves is blatant. If he were to die and certain gear were at the scene, it would implicate the guild we oppose.
Take this cloak and dagger, and go kill Senior Armagaran Vulova. When he is dead, put the cloak and dagger in the fountain in his house. He will die easily, though there may be guards. His small house is in the Government District, between the jail and the government building.
Go.

plots: the player killed the skin dancers that attacked Raissa
the skin dancers turned Raissa into a skin dancer: they peeled her skin from her bones and one of them put Raissa's skin on like a coat

a spell of restoration can cure Raissa

quest.title: Heal Raissa's Skin Dancer Condition
quest.objective: cure Raissa
tasks: Go to Waukeenar Temple.
talk to the temple superior about a restoration spell
cure Raissa
quest.description:
Y-you... you killed those monsters? It was so... horrible! They turned me, Raissa, into one of them: a skin dancer. Peeled my skin from m-my bones and... and now I've put it back! They turned me into one of them. He took my skin like it was some kind of coat and put it on. He told me that now I was a skin dancer too.
I... I cannot go anywhere like this! I can feel that magic, that evil, growing inside of me! Please, my noble savior... help me! Wh-when he was... taking my skin, the skin walker said the only way to stop the process was a spell of restoration. B-but he laughed, saying I would never receive it.
If... if you could find that spell, could you not cast it upon me? Maybe... maybe the temple superior at the Waukeenar Temple would have something!
I have no coin. I know such magic is very expensive... but if you could find it in your heart to save me, I would be eternally grateful!

quest.description:
The task I ask will be treacherous, but you seem capable. Serve well, and you will be rewarded. Display any treachery, and it will be seen. Now to the task.
A cult of the eyeless has emerged: He of the Unsleeping Eyes must know of this cult. The blindness they promote is abhorrent to Helm. We ask you to investigate and identify the cult.
The Vigilant One informs us that the cult is underground and close, but we cannot see past the sewers. You must infiltrate it, as friend or conqueror. You must suffer the filth of the sewers to find the filth of the cult. They are not hiding amidst the pipes, so there must be a passage leading further away.
Our resources are thin at the moment, but an ally of Helm and servant of Torm is awaiting you in the sewers now. Seek Keldorn to serve with you. Faith guide you both.

I am Officer Vai of the Flaming Fist and, to be honest, I could use your help.
The bandit raids have been getting worse. I used to think that they were just your usual brigands out to make a quick buck in troubled times, but not anymore. They're working for someone... Damn it, this is a fine mess, isn't it?
I'll pay 50 gold pieces for every bandit scalp you can bring me — and spread the news. I want this whole region cleared, and I want to know what in the Nine Hells is going on here.

quest.description:
I am Khellor Ahmson, a mere guard.
I saw what happened, and I share your helplessness. Any complaints about Officer Roenall must first go THROUGH him, so you can imagine how many get through.
This did not come from me, for if my indiscretion against Roenall were to get out, I should be thrown from the military. There is one way you can get to him.
Roenall is quite corrupt and more than willing to exercise his power. You are not monitored as we, so you can do something that I or another guard cannot.
Look to the docks and a man named Barg. Examine him and what he does, and you are sure to see what I mean. You might also wish to pry into Roenall's personal records. They may reveal something of his fondness for gems. I did not tell you this... and I certainly did not say his records are in his home northwest of the main government building in the Government District.
Think on what I've said, and bring anything you learn to Corgeig Axehand in the Government District main building. He is Roenall's commander.

Since you've dealt with these Gates before, I'd like you to help the Countess's guard close this gate. Once they've seen how it's done, they should be able to handle any new gates on their own.
Captain Burd is waiting for you outside the Bruma city gate. He'll show you the Oblivion Gate. Although I doubt it will be hard to find.

There might still be hope. If we can find a way to free the Guardian from Ezrohir's control, we can thwart the Alchemist's plans.

Thank you for coming.
You may recognize that statue over there on the table. The very one that you recently sold -- for less than its true worth.
As you may know, I am somewhat of an enthusiast for Ayleid antiquities. In my own modest way, I have amassed a rather considerable collection.
I have recently become interested in obtaining the complete set of these ancient statues. I believe that ten still exist within the various ancient Ayleid Ruins. No mere shopkeeper knows their true worth.
If you bring them to me when you find them, I will pay you double for each one.

tasks: assassinate Havilstein Hoar-Blood
receive Silencer's next contract after killing Havilstein Hoar-Blood
quest.description:
Dead Drop Orders #6
by Lucien Lachance

Alval Uvani is dead, just like all the others. You continue to impress me, Silencer, and I am only too eager to indulge your homicidal instincts.
Your next target is a savage Nord barbarian, living alone and exposed at a small campsite on the summit of Gnoll Mountain. This barbarian, Havilstein Hoar-Blood by name, savagely butchered the chieftain of a mead hall on the island of Solstheim. The chieftain's sister has forgone the Nord custom of extracting the monetary retribution of wergild, and instead wants Hoar-Blood to pay with his life. You, dear Silencer, will help put her family at peace.
You are to go to Gnoll Mountain, locate Havilstein Hoar-Blood, and send his soul to the great beyond.
When Hoar-Blood has been executed, journey to the ancient ruin of Nornal. In the flooded section of that ruin you will find a chest, submerged in the water. As you may have guessed, the chest contains your reward for killing Havilstein Hoar-Blood, 500 gold, and your next contract.

quest.description:
Ah... another mortal come to beg Sanguine to add a bit of spice to an otherwise drab existence. I would have you perform a service for me.
The Castle Leyawiin is a dull, dreary place. The mistress is an especially somber soul, and tomorrow she will hold another excruciating dinner party. I want you to liven it up. Use this spell on the Countess and her guests. I think it will make the party much more interesting. You should probably try to be inconspicuous. Or they might kill you. Oh, and the party is by invitation only. You'll have to find a way in.
Have fun!

You may call me Lady Hannah. Ragefast! Oh, he makes me seethe! He's a mage on a power trip and what does he do?
He acquires his own personal nymph and enslaves her in his quarters! Seek him out and look into this matter immediately! His house is in the northwest part of town.
I wish you luck and all the passion of my fury in your task.

TESO496: a long-dead thief, giving quest via "Crumpled Note"
TESO498: a valley in the Jeralls with some ruins

plots: "Crumpled Note" is addressed to an old friend of G.S.
G.S. recounts how he stole a magical ring from a wizard and escaped from the owner of the ring until he ended up into Pale Pass

quest.title: The Forgotten Chests of Pale Pass
quest.objective: find the magical ring that G.S. hid inside some old barrels
tasks: Go to Pale Pass.
use a key to open a chest to find another key for an another chest until you find the ring
find the magical ring that G.S. hid inside some old barrels
quest.description:
Crumpled Note
by G.S.

I guess you found the message I told you about, old friend. We've traveled together for so long, and you're the only one I trust with the ring and my story.
I knew climbing into the window of that wizard's house was a mistake, but the bounty on the ring was just too enticing to pass up. They said it was worth thousands of drakes... enough to keep me comfortable for a while as I lay low. They also said the owner of the ring was out of town at some meeting of wizards or some such.
They were wrong on both counts. You'd think I'd be used to this by now, dealing with the unpredictable in our line of work. But after trying to fence the ring all over the realm, no one would touch it. Worse still, the wizard was pursuing me the entire time. I had to call in many favors to stay one step ahead of him.
I decided to strike north and make for the neighboring land. As I was crossing the Jeralls, he finally caught up to me. Two fireballs later, I found myself tumbling down a steep snowy slope into a valley. Don't know where I am, but there are ruins of some old fort here. Luckily, that fetcher didn't follow me down; I assume he gave me up for dead.
I think I'm going to stash the ring in this valley, cross the border north, and return later when I feel it's safe. I've used some old chests I found in the ruins to make sure nobody stumbles across the ring by mistake; you know, the old key to a key thing like we used to do. If I don't make it back here, and you're reading this message, then the ring is all yours, my friend. Use it well and remember me.
G.S.

TESS129: a ring that boosts an alchemist's talents

quest.description:
I'm Frida, the oldest woman in Dawnstar.
I picked up the herb trade from my husband. We used to go out in the wilds and collect ingredients together. He used to call me his "pretty Juniper." It's quite romantic, if you're an alchemist. Frost took the old fool a few seasons back, while he was looking for the Ring of Pure Mixtures.
I found the ring's resting place, Shrouded Grove, after he died, but I'm far too old to go exploring some cave, now. I'd be happy to give you some alchemy training in exchange for the ring, if you bring it to me.

River's End is a large village, yet we lack a watchhouse! We don't have a place to store away all troublemakers! They are free to roam along the law-abiding people...
Hero, you are an honorable person. Could you build us a watchhouse? You should gather up some construction materials first. Complete the watchhouse, and we'll give you an enchanted axe. May it help you bury your enemies!

TESO273: the childhood home of Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane, where no human has lived for years
TESO19: somewhere south of Chorrol, but southwest of Fort Carmala

plots: the player reunited Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane
ogres attacked Weatherleah when Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane were little children: Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane's parents fled from Weatherleah
Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane's father carried Guilbert Jemane to safety and later returned to Weatherleah believing Reynald Jemane and the boys' mother had perished

quest.title: Legacy Lost
quest.objective: help Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane recover Weatherleah
tasks: find Weatherleah, and see if it is still inhabited by ogres
help Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane recover Weatherleah
quest.description:
I can't thank you enough for helping to reunite me with Reynald. I never would have guessed he was still alive. We have much to discuss, but if you have time, I'd beg you stay a moment longer and hear about our home, Weatherleah.
Weatherleah was our family's home for generations. Our parents fled it when ogres attacked; they became separated. My father carried me to safety. He later returned and believed Reynald and my mother had perished. Since ogres are cannibals, he didn't expect to find their bodies. Thankfully, however, it seems that my mother managed to carry Reynald to safety. While my mother didn't survive, Reynald did, and for that I'm grateful.
But we both want more - we want our home back. We're not fighters; you appear to have more skill than either of us. Would you go to Weatherleah, and see if it's still inhabited by ogres?
Now, we're not quite sure where the estate is located. We'll offer up what we know, however. We believe it's somewhere south of Chorrol, but southwest of Fort Carmala. It may be difficult to find. Since no one's lived there for many years, it may be quite overgrown by now.
If you find Weatherleah, let us know. We'll be waiting anxiously.

find the final resting place of the assassin of old
go on an adventure
quest.description:
Come to Olava for a reading, did you? Hmph. Yes. Yes, I surely can give you a reading.
It's not something I do lightly, mind you, and it's not as specific as you might want. But yes. I will do this for you. Please, relax. Free your mind. Yes, that's it...
A potential for adventure, and wealth. It is a ruin, ripe for the plunder. Deepwood Redoubt. Far to the northwest... Through there is... Hag's End. The last resting place of an assassin of old. A dark brother, who bequeaths his ancient earthly possessions... to you.
No... no, that is all. Now... now please. I find myself very weary all of sudden.

plots: On the second floor of Baenlin's house is a secreted door leading to a crawlspace containing the fastenings of a mounted head that hangs over Baenlin's favorite chair: if the player loosens the fastenings any night between 8:00 pm and 11:00 pm, the head will fall on Baenlin

quest.description:
We need you to stage an... accident. Kill the target in the manner specified, and you'll receive a considerable bonus. The target is a Wood Elf named Baenlin. You will find him at his home in Bruma.
Enter secretly and avoid his manservant, Gromm. On the second floor is a secreted door leading to a crawlspace. Inside are the fastenings of a mounted head that hangs over Baenlin's favorite chair. Loosen the fastenings any night between 8:00 pm and 11:00 pm, and the head will surely fall on Baenlin as he relaxes in his chair, as is custom. If Baenlin is killed in any other manner, or if the manservant Gromm is killed, you will forfeit the bonus.
Now go, and may Death be with you.

quest.description:
It is I, the spirit of the grove, child.
Child of nature, you are again needed. Balance is threatened, and Chaos is at the periphery. Will you serve the grove?
The grove is young in terms of nature and ancient in the years of man. Centuries ago, Marek of Halruaa established a protectorate of nature in these woods. Now, as Marek knew would someday happen, his descendants have returned and old enemies marshal their forces. A child called Loren has recently arrived in Trademeet. This child is the inheritor of Marek's spirit, but does not yet have the knowledge to use his power. Surely he shall be slain by the forces of chaos if you do not rescue him. Even now he is alone and in danger, his parents slain by an evil that haunts him. You must find the child Loren in Trademeet and fight Marek's old enemies to save the child's life.
The spirit that once was Marek has gone forth to aid the child... but the spirit is not the power that the man once was and cannot hope to hold out for long. Aid him lest all be lost.

My Liege. I'm glad to see you. We have a developing situation that requires your attention.
An Obelisk of Order has activated in the Palace courtyard. My guards are engaging the Knights as we speak. We will defend the Palace to the end of our strength, and will cast ourselves in the path of cursed Jyggalag himself should he come here.

TESS253: a temple hosting the root of the nightmare problem, a short walk away from Dawnstar

quest.description:
The entire town is being plagued by horrible nightmares. They're in serious danger but I'm afraid there's little I can do about it.
These dreams are manifestations created by Vaermina. She has an awful hunger for our memories. In return, she leaves behind nightmares, not unlike a cough marks a serious illness. I must end her terrible influence over these people before the damage becomes permanent.
I need to return to the source of the problem, to Nightcaller Temple. Perhaps you'd be willing to assist me in that regard? I've already said too much. If anyone overhears what we're saying, it could start a panic. I would simply ask that you trust me and help me end Dawnstar's nightmares.
Nightcaller Temple is only a short walk from Dawnstar. Come, we must hurry.

quest.description:
I'd like to bake my delicious honey cakes for the whole village! Then they'd certainly know that I have traveled all over the world! I even used to be a wandering trader.
I need a lot of honey for the cakes. You are quite a wanderer yourself. Perhaps you could help me procure 10 honey blocks. You can get honey from bees; you just have to find them first.
Do this for me, and I'll give you a special reward: a Shulker Box. These things were worth their weight in emeralds every time someone murdered my pack llamas: they made hauling my stock much easier.

TESS358: Shor's shield-thane, and the guardian of the Whalebone Bridge

quest.title: Sovngarde
quest.objective: go over the Whalebone Bridge to the Hall of Valor

go over the Whalebone Bridge to the Hall of Valor
quest.description:
I am Tsun, shield-thane to Shor. The Whalebone Bridge he bade me guard and winnow all those souls whose heroic end sent them here, to Shor's lofty hall where welcome, well earned, awaits those I judge fit to join that fellowship of honor.
You pursue Alduin, the World Eater. A fateful errand. No few have chafed to face the Worm since first he set his soul-snare here at Sovngarde's threshold. But Shor restrained our wrathful onslaught - perhaps, deep counseled, your doom he foresaw.
Living or dead, by decree of Shor, none may pass this perilous bridge 'till I judge them worthy by the warrior's test.

quest.description:
I am most certainly not going to sing your praises, you nasty cretin.
On the contrary, it would be music to my ears if you helped me reach my musical ambitions. No one in this village seems to care for music, or any of the arts for that matter. For starters, obtain 24 note blocks. It has to be exactly 24, because there are that many different notes to play. It's possible to craft note blocks from wooden planks and redstone dust.
Bring the 24 note blocks to me. I'll let you have an old music disc of mine.

Go and slay one of the beasts. It should let them know that Dawnstar is not to be trifled with. I'm counting on you.

TESS15: a Nord werewolf, and a fellow member of the Companions

cure Farkas' lycanthropy

There is always work. My mind is someplace else, though.

Aela said we would need a Hagraven's head. I already have one of them, but she said it was a special kind. And that you knew where to get more.
Let's go find one!

TESO228: a male thief, and Arnora Auria's ex-boyfriend

plots: Jorundr and Arnora Auria have had a rocky relationship: Jorundr and Arnora Auria committed petty crimes all over Cyrodiil
Jorundr started to take risks and began robbing more dangerous targets
Arnora Auria got afraid of Jorundr

Jorundr and Arnora Auria's last score was a tax shipment being delivered to the Imperial City: Jorundr killed a guard and he was captured by the Bruma guard two days later at Jorundr and Arnora Auria's makeshift campsite
Jorundr had moved the stolen gold away from the campsite

quest.title: Two Sides of the Coin
quest.objective: find out where Jorundr and Arnora Auria's stolen gold is hidden
tasks: Go to Bruma Castle Dungeons.
speak to Jorundr
find out where Jorundr and Arnora Auria's stolen gold is hidden
quest.description:
Here's the deal. Jorundr and I have had a rocky relationship at best.
Against my will, I've been dragged all over Cyrodiil helping him commit petty crimes. I wouldn't say we're thieves. I mean, we've stolen things... sure. But we've never stolen that much at one time. Just enough to keep us going. That is, until last year.
Jorundr started to take risks and began robbing more dangerous targets. Not just lone merchants, mind you. I'm talking about the bigger scores. Like estates and tax shipments. I begged him to stop, as I knew that his capers would one day lead to violence. He just threatened to... hurt me if I got in his way. I think the gold changed him. I really do. He wasn't the man I met seven years ago. The few times I tried to say something, he'd strike me or push me away. I began to become frightened of him.
Our last score was a tax shipment being delivered to the Imperial City. We robbed it, and in the midst of the chaos, Jorundr killed a guard. I was mortified. We snatched up the gold and holed up in the mountains. He said if I breathed a word of the murder to anyone, he'd kill me. I was terrified of him at this point. Two days later, the Bruma City Guard traced us to our makeshift campsite. I was off gathering food, but Jorundr was captured. Served him right. When I went back to the site later, the gold was gone! He'd moved it! What I need you to do is go to the Bruma Castle Dungeons and speak to him for me. Convince him to tell you where the gold is and then we split it.

plots: Marek has poisoned the player: the player has 10 days to live
Lothander wants to help the player get an antidote to the poison
Lothander was forced to work for the Iron Throne with a geas

quest.title: Marek and Lothander
quest.objective: get an antidote before you die of Marek's poison
tasks: talk to Haspur who can possibly reverse Lothander's geas
get an antidote before you die of Marek's poison
quest.description:
I am Lothander.
I do not wish you harm. My partner, Marek, has poisoned you. While you slept, he slipped a slow-acting magical poison into your food. You have about ten days to live. Common priest spells won't help you. Only one thing can, and that's the antidote. I can help you find it, if you help me first.
My problem is this: I don't work for the Iron Throne because I wish to but rather because I have been forced. I have been enspelled with a geas. If I do not obey everything that Marek orders of me the spell will take effect and I shall waste away. I need a way to rid myself of the spell. I know of a diviner at the market square who may have the answers I seek, but I don't have the money to pay him. Will you help me?

TESS163: not in the Bulwark, one of the abandoned houses on the outskirts of Raven Rock
TESS166: not in the Bulwark, one of the abandoned houses on the outskirts of Raven Rock
not in the Bulwark, one of the abandoned houses on the outskirts of Raven Rock
TESS167: a powerful and addicting alcohol drink

plots: Modyn Veleth's men have been stashing bottles of Emberbrand Wine: it distracts them from their tasks

quest.title: Recipe for Distraction
quest.objective: tell Modyn Veleth the location of a hidden stash of Emberbrand Wine
tasks: Go to .
locate the hidden stash of Emberbrand Wine
tell Modyn Veleth the location of a hidden stash of Emberbrand Wine
quest.description:
Modyn Veleth, Captain of the Redoran Guard at your service. Looking for something to lend a hand with? We have problems aplenty in Raven Rock.
Commanding the Redoran Guard can be a difficult task. Even the most experienced warriors can fall prey to petty distractions. They usually didn't amount to much, but they make my job that much harder. Some of my own men have become quite accustomed to a spirit they called 'Emberbrand Wine.' Despise the stuff myself. It's powerful and tremendously addicting... I've seen men fail to finish even a single flask.
If I knew where they were stashing the bottles, I'd put an end to it myself. Could you track down the stash? That would be helpful. I just don't have time to do it myself right now.
They're too smart to have left it in the Bulwark. I'd search one of the abandoned houses on the outskirts of town.

TESO454: an old warrior turned farmer, and a worried father
TESO455: Valus Odiil, Rallus and Antus' farm, not far from Chorrol

plots: Rallus may know more about the creatures that attacked the Odiil Farm

quest.title: The Killing Field
quest.objective: reclaim the Odiil Farm from the creatures of the Great Forest with Rallus and Antus
tasks: Go to Weynon Priory.
meet up with Rallus and Antus
reclaim the Odiil Farm from the creatures of the Great Forest with Rallus and Antus
quest.description:
My sons! Have you seen my sons Rallus and Antus? They're going to fight off the creatures at our farm, but I fear for their safety.
For the last few days, we've suffered attacks from these creatures at our farm not far from Chorrol. They're coming from someplace in the Great Forest. I don't know where, but Rallus may know more by now. My boys will take up the fight even if the guards won't. Doesn't matter if it's outside the town walls - it still affects us all. They expect me to go with them, but... I fear in my old age, I'm not the warrior I once was. Would you... would you go in my place?
I'm supposed to meet them at Weynon Priory. You'd best get whatever supplies you need now, so you can get there in time.
I... I need a drink to calm my nerves. Please, excuse me.

TESO324: the lord of natural order, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: the player has found Peryite's shrine that is filled with Peryite's paralyzed followers: Peryite's worshipers cast a spell in the hopes of summoning Peryite and got trapped between worlds
Peryite will transport the player to the plane of Oblivion in which his worshipers are trapped: when the player has collected the worshipers' souls, Peryite will return the player here

quest.title: Peryite's Foolish Followers
quest.objective: rescue the souls of Peryite's worshipers from Oblivion
tasks: Go to Realm of Peryite.
enter the plane of Oblivion where Peryite's worshipers' souls are trapped
rescue the souls of Peryite's worshipers from Oblivion
quest.description:
This one moves! A welcome change. So, mortal, you have found my shrine, and you have seen my followers. They are an embarrassment to me, Peryite.
The fools cast a spell in the hopes of summoning me to them. It was prideful and foolish, and it has had its consequences. My followers are trapped between worlds; their bodies here on this plane, their souls in Oblivion. I would have you reunite the bodies and the souls.
I will transport you to the plane of Oblivion in which they are trapped. Find their souls. When all are collected, I will return you here.
You shall have Spell Breaker, with my blessing. May it bring you order.

plots: the player is not an Orc or blood-kin to the Orcs: the player is not welcome at the Orc stronghold by the code of Malacath

quest.title: The Forgemaster's Fingers
quest.objective: bring the Forgemaster's Fingers, an enchanted pair on gauntlets, to the chief of the Orcs
tasks: Go to Stony Creek Cave.
find the Forgemaster's Fingers
bring the Forgemaster's Fingers, an enchanted pair on gauntlets, to the chief of the Orcs
quest.description:
Halt, outlander. By the Code of Malacath, this stronghold belongs to the Orcs. Your kind are unwelcome. You're not an Orc, or Blood-Kin, so stay out. We only help our own.
Hmm... there is a way to become Blood-Kin, if you truly insist on entering our stronghold. We've heard whispers of an enchanted pair of gauntlets, hidden and protected by dangerous men, beasts, or worse.
They are called the Forgemaster's Fingers. Find them at Stony Creek Cave. Bring them to our chief, and he will decide if you're worthy to be Blood-Kin to the Orcs.

You must get our acorns back from Ilyich, the clan leader of Irenicus's duergar slaves. He is somewhere within this dungeon. Please take the acorns to the Fairy Queen who lives in the south end of the Windspear Hills.

Earana and I have an unpleasant history. She does not care for Guild regulations, and errantly believes I am mis-using my powers. I have seen that she is in town. Though she has not approached me, I know she wants something.
I would like you to find out what it is. Determine what Earana's after, and how we may be rid of her. I do not want her here, spreading her lies.

Mara is the Goddess of Love. The temple spreads her gifts by tending to the sick, the poor, and the lost. We also perform wedding ceremonies for all the loving couples.
You wish to be married to your future spouse? It's good to see love blossoming, even during these difficult times. Your wedding will be held tomorrow, from dawn until dusk, in the Temple of Mara.

TESS155: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

quest.description:
The Thalmor ambassador, Elenwen, regularly throws parties where the rich and connected cozy up to the Thalmor.
I can get you into one of those parties. Once you're inside the Embassy, you get away and find Elenwen's secret files. I have a contact inside the Embassy. He's not up for this kind of high-risk mission, but he can help you. His name's Malborn. Wood elf, plenty of reason to hate the Thalmor. You can trust him.
I'll get word for him to meet you in Solitude, at the Winking Skeever -- you know it? While you're doing that, I'll work on getting you an invitation to Elenwen's little party.
Meet me at the Solitude stables after you've arranged things with Malborn.

Find my son, and close shut the jaws of Oblivion.

I'm not the sharpest shepherd around. You seem like a clever person: perhaps you know how to find these colorful sheep. Sheep love grass; they tend to stay in grassy areas.
Let me have some colorful, beautiful sheep. I want to test breeding a flock of sheep in all colors of the rainbow. I'll let you have a pile of regular ole white wool.

TESS697: an ancient ghost of a soldier
TESS700: Ghost of Old Hroldan's long-dead brother-in-arms

quest.description:
You don't remember me, Hjalti? Two campaigns we served together. You saved my life time and time again. You promised me, Hjalti. You promised that when we sacked Hroldan, you would make me your sworn brother.
And I've waited. Even after the enemies' arrows dug into my chest and their hammers crushed my bones. I've waited.
Give me your sword, Hjalti. That we may become brothers as you promised.

BG2245: a man, and one of the masters of the Athkatla order of the Cowled Wizards

plots: Tolgerias seeks to employ the player in a matter of some urgency: Madeen has been given little knowledge of the matter

quest.description:
Greetings. I am Madeen. I represent one of the masters of the Athkatla order of the Cowled Wizards. He seeks to employ you in a matter of some urgency.
The matter is most sensitive... I have been given little knowledge of it. Tolgerias, the one whom I speak for, is eager to meet with you and discuss these matters.
Master Tolgerias can be found in the government building behind me... you may go within. Do not tarry overlong, my friend.

TESS875: the man with the the strongest arms in all of Skyrim

plots: rules for the fistfight: no weapons, no tricks, no magic

win the wager against Hofgrir Horse-Crusher
quest.description:
Bah, I'm not afraid of anything out here. Walls are just a weakling's hiding spot. Now me, I'm no weakling. In fact, I bet I've got the strongest arms in all of Skyrim.
You bet against me? Oh! Sounds like I've got a challenger. Tell you what. How about a friendly wager, just between us. I bet you my entire purse of septims I can beat you in a fistfight. You match the bet and we fight until one of us gives in.
All right, remember... this is a clean fight. No weapons, no tricks. And none of those fancy magic spells, either. Here we go!

TESS168: the player's guildmaster in the Dark Brotherhood

in the southwest reaches of the realm, in the pine forest

I would like to officially extend to you an invitation to join my Family: the Dark Brotherhood.
In the southwest reaches of the realm, in the Pine Forest, you'll find the entrance to our Sanctuary. It's just beneath the road, hidden from view. When questioned by the Black Door, answer with the correct passphrase: "Silence, my brother." Then you're in. And your new life begins.
I'll see you at home.

TESO416: the queen of lies, one of the Daedric Princes

don't get caught or killed while starting the feud

kill the leaders of the two families and plant evidence to implicate the other family as the killer
Start a feud between two prominent families
quest.description:
I'm Mephala. Call me 'Webspinner'. Pluck but a single thread, and the weave unravels.
In Bleaker's Way, two families, Nord and Dunmer, live in perfect harmony. But beneath the surface lurks the secret seed of strife. Kill the leaders of the two families. Plant evidence to implicate the other family as the killer. And don't get caught. Be cunning. Don't spoil my scheme. And don't die... that would spoil everything. Ha-ha-ha-hah!
And there'll be a little needle to help you stitch your own tangled tapestries: the Ebony Blade.

MC187: a woman who wants to dye her hair

quest.title: Turning Heads
quest.objective: give red dye to Cara

find red dye
give red dye to Cara
quest.description:
The guys in this village rarely take note of me. I want to dye my hair red to make myself more attractive.
Wandering traders often have red dye. Could you find some and give it to me? I'd give you 12 emeralds for the red dye.

plots: Saffir doesn't like that Amren has been spending so much time looking for his father's old sword

quest.objective: retrieve Amren's father's sword for Amren
tasks: Go to Halted Stream Camp.
find Amren's father's sword
retrieve Amren's father's sword for Amren
quest.description:
I'm Amren, the husband of Saffir.
My Saffir doesn't like that I've been spending so much time looking for my father's old sword. He fed his entire family with the gold he made using that weapon. I'm not about to let it gather dust in some thief's trophy room.
I tracked it to a group of bandits nearby. The place is called Halted Stream Camp. But I'm no fool. I'd need the Whiterun guards or maybe hire some mercenaries to get it. I don't know why I'm saying this, but if you find it out in your travels, I'd be grateful to you.

BG294: the merry leader of the Bregan D'aerthe

plots: the player entered the pocket plane via a rope

give the gems that contain the souls of Jarlaxle's men to Jarlaxle
quest.description:
I am Jarlaxle, leader of the Bregan D'aerthe, at your service.
This is a pocket plane, headquarters of the Bregan D'aerthe, my mercenary band. I hoped the rope would bring you here, and I see that it has. Welcome!
There is a lich who has numerous gems that contain the souls of my men, and I want them back. Whether you kill the lich or not is up to you. Killing him would allow you to loot the tower, I suppose, but however you get those gems is of no concern to me.
Once you gather up the gems, I will use the rope to pull you back into the headquarters here. Easy enough, yes?
You shall receive a bit of gold, my friend, for your trouble.

plots: Jesse wants comfort
the player is a friend of Jesse

help the villagers of Desert Refuge obtain a permanent source of water
quest.description:
Hail friend! It's good to see you. I'd offer you something to drink, but I'm running low on refreshments, and quite thirsty myself. We are in a desert, after all. There's not much water around...
Now that I think of it... You could actually help the whole Desert Refuge by obtaining us a permanent source of water! Build us a well, please. Ahh, I can already taste the fresh water on my lips...
I could give you this bucket of lava in exchange for a well. Just don't do anything mischievous with it, or burn yourself!

TL2157: a crypt crawling with the Sturmbeorn in the Path of the Honored Dead

plots: the player has helped Estherians before

find the Scroll of Anom-Irek in a vault
retrieve the Scroll of Anom-Irek, and return to Miamin
quest.description:
You must be the human the other Estherians are speaking of. I am glad to have met you. I have been sent on a quest to recover the Scroll of Anom-Irek, stored in a vault in the Corrupted Crypt, here. The scroll should allow us to heal the Estherians who have been corrupted by evil spirits. Unfortunately, the Sturmbeorn have already entered the crypt, and I have been unable to get past them.
Can I ask you to attempt to retrieve the scroll? I will wait here in the Path of the Honored Dead for your return. Should you succeed, I will see what I can do to provide you with some equipment more fitting a hero of your stature.

TESS526: Valdr's dead hunter friend, a woman
TESS527: Valdr's dead hunter friend, a man

tasks: Go to Moss Mother Cavern.
kill 3 Spriggans with Valdr
help Valdr avenge his fallen friends
quest.description:
Name's Valdr. I hunt out of Falkreath.
We tracked a bear to this den, Moss Mother Cavern. Good coin for those pelts. We had the big sow cornered when they showed up. Three of them, out of nowhere. Spriggans.
Niels went down before we even knew to run. Ari died just inside. I never even thought the things were real. But now what? I can't just walk away. Not with my friends' bodies in there, being torn apart by those beasts.
You would help me clear out the Spriggans? You'd do that for a stranger? I don't know what to say. Lead on, I suppose.

TESS451: a great mage who knows many things
TESS452: a young girl, and Falion's ward

plots: the player is a vampire

return to Falion with a filled black soul gem, and he will perform a vampirism cure ritual
quest.description:
I know many things. I have studied things beyond the reach of most humans, traveled the other planes, seen things one should not see.
I have met gods and long-dead races of people and everything in between and I know enough to see a vampire where others would see a man. I met several of your kind during my studies of life-extending magics. I even considered becoming a vampire myself. In the end, vampirism would endanger my ward Agni which would defeat the intended purpose.
It is possible to cure vampirism. I know of a ritual but I've never performed it. It requires a filled black soul gem. You will need to kill someone. When you have a gem and have filled it return to me and I will perform the ritual. I will bring life to your dead body, vampire.

TESS386: a Skaal woman born in Skyrim

plots: Bera left the Skaal village to return to Skyrim with her love: Morwen's father, a sailor from Skyrim

tasks: Go to Falkreath.

quest.description:
My mother, Bera, was Skaal, but she left the village and I was born in Skyrim. A trade ship from Skyrim struck ice off the coast near the village, and the Skaal took in the surviving sailors. My mother fell in love with one of the sailors - my father - and eventually returned with him to Skyrim.
I came across a few of my mother's old things not long ago. Among them was a necklace that my father gave to her when they were married. I believe she would want it placed upon her tombstone in Falkreath, as a symbol of her undying love and the great sacrifice she made for it.
If you find yourself in Falkreath, please give this amulet to the priest Runil and tell him that I sent you. He will understand. I don't have much to give in reward, but return to me when the task is done and I'll do what I can. Thank you, Skaal-friend.

Damn, that reminds me, I have a delivery to make to her steward, Falk Firebeard. He ordered a special bottle of Stros M'Kai Rum.

I'm afraid there's a problem. A serious one. I've discovered who the Greybeards' leader really is.
He's a dragon. Not just any dragon, but the right hand of Alduin, responsible for many atrocities during the ancient Dragon War. It's true that his crimes are long in the past, but justice does not count the passage of years.
Justice demands that he, Paarthurnax, dies for his crimes. Until he is dead, I'm afraid my oath as a Blade prevents me from offering you aid and comfort.

quest.description:
I have a buyer with a very odd taste in literature, looking for some particular books.
I'm told they're the ravings of a madman, a wizard named Arondil, and his peculiar cravings. It's said to be in four volumes and very hard to come by. My client is offering quite a reward for them, which I'd split with you.
Recently, a woman was found... naked and shivering along the road to Dawnstar. The only information the guard could get from her were tales of strange experiments and Arondil scribbling in his journals.
He used to have a home in Dawnstar until they burned it down. The people say he was doing unspeakable experiments on reanimation... rituals only a necromancer would perform. After he made for Yngvild, he was never heard from again.
In his later years, Arondil moved into some ice caves known as Yngvild. He preferred the solitude in which to perform his, um... experiments.

I'm the Fighters Guild Champion, Modryn Oreyn, as you should know. What do you want? I suppose you've come looking for duties?
I want you to contact Maglir. He's one of your Fighters Guild brothers, but he's defaulted on a contract. We can't allow that. Makes us all look bad. He didn't finish out a contract in Skingrad. Suppose I shouldn't be surprised. He's raw, like you. Go and find out what's wrong with him.

TESO109: a collector of arcane artifacts, who carries a Daedric Staff

plots: Rosentia Gallenus bought a cheap Daedric Staff: four scamps appeared after Rosentia Gallenus spoke the runic word carved on the Daedric Staff while holding it

quest.title: Whom Gods Annoy
quest.objective: make the scamps go away from Rosentia Gallenus' home
tasks: Go to Darkfathom Cave.
dispose of the Daedric Staff
make the scamps go away from Rosentia Gallenus' home
quest.description:
These stupid scamps are driving me crazy! I'm at my wit's end! I, Rosentia Gallenus, beg you to help me!
The beastly little creatures are nasty, smelly, noisy and wrecking my beautiful house! I must be rid of them! I can't let people know I have scamps in here, or they'll think I've taken to Daedra worship. Try explaining that to the town guard.
I had a feeling buying that Daedric Staff would be trouble. Now I'm paying for it with more than just some gold. A few weeks ago, a spellsword was passing through Leyawiin and heard that I like to buy curiosities. He wanted to sell the staff you see me carrying. I eagerly bought it, knowing the value of Daedric relics. In fact, I was a bit suspicious when he sold it so cheap. His loss, my gain I figured. After examining it for a bit I noticed a small word carved on it in runes. Using a book from my library, I translated it. The word was nonsense. However, when I spoke it and held the staff, four scamps suddenly appeared! I thought I was done for! Strangely, they all just stood there. It didn't take long before I realized they were following me! I couldn't be seen in town with scamps following, so I decided to discard the staff. I can't explain it, but somehow I can't compel myself to actually let it go. This staff is obviously cursed! Now I'm stuck with it.
Oh please, I beg you! Take this staff to Darkfathom Cave and get rid of it and the scamps forever! I can't fight, and who knows what's guarding the shrine? Plus, do you know how dirty caves are? It'll ruin anything I wear!
Do this for me, and I'll reward you with another one of my curios I picked up a few years ago... a valuable ring. Ring of Eidolon's Edge.

You scared me! Although I suppose that even someone as infamous as you isn't quite as spooky as Whispering Pines.
That taiga forest is not safe! Many villagers have gone missing there; never to be seen ever again. There must be something that could be done to make the forest safer for us villagers...
Perhaps you could go and build some iron golems in Whispering Pines? That would make the forest much safer! You'd even receive a worthy gift for doing this feat.

quest.description:
I am Raelis Shai, the leader of this merry troupe.
The vagaries of fortune blow an ill wind over us. One of our members is absent due to circumstances we cannot control.
You must hear our story. One of our actors, Haer'Dalis, has been kidnapped by a wizard native to this city... he has made no effort to negotiate with us. The wizard's greed may have called to him at the sight of Haer'Dalis's beloved gem... something our sparrow would not gladly surrender. So this wizard has stolen both away, and there is nothing we can do. I would ask that you return our sparrow and his gem to us both, by whatever means possible.
The wizard's name is Mekrath, I believe... I know that his lair can be accessed through the city's sewers, though where exactly it lies is a mystery.
We are but a destitute troupe of players, child, and can afford little. Mekrath may have treasure of his own... Wrest it from his grasp if you wish to do so.

quest.description:
Dead Drop Orders #4
by Lucien Lachance

J'Ghasta is dead! Well done! I was right about you, Silencer. You are a useful tool indeed. Let's see if you can continue to impress me.
You must journey now to the Flooded Mine. There you will find Shaleez, an Argonian hunter who was banished from her village near the Black Marsh/Morrowind border for the brutal murder of a Dark Elven family. Relatives of the murdered family members have located Shaleez, and demand retribution. And, since the assignment is a bit far for Morrowind's Morag Tong to handle, the Dark Brotherhood has been commissioned to perform the elimination.
Be warned, Silencer! Shaleez is a skilled and deadly hunter, and will fight like the desperate fugitive she is.
After Shaleez has been eliminated, your reward and another contract will be waiting at the dead drop located in a coffin, just outside the ruins of Fort Redman.

The gleam in your eye! It belies your greed, your passion. I've found this blade, child! It is hidden most insidiously. A cruel jest has been played upon us all. My friend here knows this!
The One has left clues for you. Have you not found the clues? Where the topside filth drains, there are the clues. Return to me ere you follow the One's path, for there is much that you must learn.

quest.description:
I am Berrun Ghastkill, mayor of Nashkel.
I need someone to descend into the mines southeast of town and find what has caused our miners to go missing and our ore to become tainted. It won't solve everything, but it's the first step to easing the effects of the iron shortage.
The town can give you a reward of 900 gold pieces. We are a small community and that is all we can afford.
Please, go now and do what you can.

quest.description:
Cicero concerns me. Ever since he arrived, his behavior's been... Well, erratic would be an understatement. I do believe he is truly mad. But it's worse than that.
Cicero's taken to locking himself in the Night Mother's chamber, and talking. To someone. In hushed, but frantic tones. Who is he speaking with? What are they planning? I fear treachery. As the Night Mother's Keeper, he believes he's entitled to the rule of this Sanctuary. Cicero will cite our independence as the need to revert to the Old Ways. He'll claim we're undisciplined, unruly. Heretical, even. Ironically, the Night Mother could prove to be just as much a victim. The queen in a fool's twisted game of chess.
I need you to steal into that chamber, and eavesdrop on their meeting. It'll be no use clinging to the shadows. They'll see you for sure. No, you need a hiding place. Somewhere they'd never think to look. Like inside the Night Mother's coffin.

quest.description:
You are a friend of us villagers, and have helped many of us. Now I'd like you to do something a bit... less conventional.
Illagers have been bothering us for ages: we villagers are not fighters; we can't hold our own against those bloodthirsty brigands. I want you to sow distrust among their ranks: make them fight amongst themselves.
I already have a plan for you to follow. There are two Illager captains, Tony and Tom, who do not exactly see eye to eye. You should go to the Illager camp to the northeast, and pinch Tony's axe without being seen. Then, move on to the Illager outpost to the north of here, kill Tom, and plant Tony's axe on Tom's body. Tony is known to be quick to anger: Tom's men will go after him, for they will assume that Tony killed their leader.
Do this grueling task, and I'll have something highly valuable for you.

It's my favorite bear, Littleman... The bad man who came into our house... he—he hurt me, and he took Littleman with everything else... *sob* I can never go to sleep without Littleman! The bad man has it at that inn in the slums. The Copper something. *sniff* He's in one of those bedrooms in the back! I think his name is "Llynis"...
I've... I've gone to him... *sob*... I've tried to tell him that I just want my bear, please, but he just gets too frightened of me. *sob* Oh, please get it from him!

plots: the player saved Aldeth Sashenstar on his hunting trip

quest.title: Investigating the Merchants' League Estate
quest.objective: investigate Irlentree and Zorl Miyar, and report back to Aldeth Sashenstar
tasks: go with Aldeth Sashenstar, let him introduce you as his old friend and quarter you in the guest chambers
investigate Irlentree and Zorl Miyar, and report back to Aldeth Sashenstar
quest.description:
It is so pleasant to see your face once again. Don't you recognize me? It is I, Aldeth Sashenstar. I am so glad to have met you, especially at a time like this. I need to speak with you privately.
I'm sorry for all of this hiding and skulking, but there are dire events afoot. You know that I am one of the principal shareholders of the Merchants' League. Well, I share ownership of the company with two others: Irlentree and Zorl Miyar, two very distinguished gentlemen. When I returned from my hunting trip — thanks to you, I might add — I found that my two partners had undergone some profound changes, nothing physical or overt, but something far more sinister.
It's as if my partners had become wholly different people while I was gone. They almost take an active interest in squandering our company's resources on frivolous and stupid ideas. If they continue on this course, the company will be in shambles in but a few weeks. I know you have already helped me once, but I ask for your assistance again. I have no other recourse.
Come into the Merchants' League Estate with me. I will explain that you are an old friend of mine and will quarter you in the guest chambers. From there, please investigate my partners, perhaps using magic or any of the other skills you possess. Learn as much as you can during your visit and then report back to me after you're done. It should only take a couple of days.

plots: the player is the hero of Trademeet
the player spoke to Skarmaen before
the Alibakkars and the Lurraxols have been feuding for generations

quest.title: The Battle of Families
quest.objective: bring the Mantle of Waukeen to Lady Lilith
tasks: Go to .
find the Mantle of Waukeen
bring the Mantle of Waukeen to Lady Lilith
quest.description:
Ah! It is the hero of Trademeet, come to see me at last. I trust that all is well? That pig, Skarmaen Alibakkar, did not speak too harshly about me, I trust? No matter. He is a stubborn, deluded fool. Our families have been at odds for generations, you see. The Alibakkars refuse to acknowledge the fact that we are the only true noble family in Trademeet, having founded it. Why they would think themselves higher than they are is beyond my ken. What is unfortunate, however, is that my family has never had actual, physical proof of the truth of our claim.
That has changed, however. A tome has recently been uncovered... an old tome belonging to my family... that states there is proof right here in Trademeet under our noses. In the graveyard, here in town, lies the crypt of the founder... my ancestor. With him lies the Mantle of Waukeen. A pretty name for an old gold circlet. That circlet, however, would prove my claim once and for all and shut those Alibakkars up. I would get it myself, but the tomb is haunted, you see. Here is the key to the tomb... the fact that we possess it is yet more proof of our legitimacy. Use it to enter and obtain the mantle, and then return to me when you are done.
You are a hero who might enter that tomb and retrieve the circlet for me, if you are willing. In return, I will pay you 1,000 gold. What do you say, my hero?

TESO208: the ghost of the nobleman who ruled over Vitharn

quest.title: Ghosts of Vitharn

tasks: Go to Vitharn.
correct the mistakes of the four people who failed to protect the gate lever
break the cycle of torment for the ghosts of Vitharn
quest.description:
I am Count Cirion, and you have violated the inner sanctum of Vitharn Keep.
However, my people and I are in need. Maybe you can help us. Centuries ago, Vitharn was overrun by Fanatics. We were soft and failed to defend ourselves. I was the weakest of all. Now, the shades of my people are cursed by Sheogorath to repeat the final moments of their failures, over and over again. You must help us break the cycle of torment.
Help my people overcome their weakness and defend Vitharn from the Fanatics. Walk among them. There were four who failed to protect the gate lever. Find out what they did wrong and help them correct it. You can put away your sword in these halls. Unlike the defending spirits, within these walls, none will war with you. Not even the Fanatics.
My people long to be laid to rest. Please help them.

plots: Aldeth Sashenstar has been holed up in a cabin for several days
the savages threatened Aldeth Sashenstar and his friends to stop hunting

quest.title: Aldeth and the Group of Savages
quest.objective: protect Aldeth Sashenstar and his friends from a group of savages
tasks: prepare for the savages' attack on Aldeth Sashenstar's cottage
protect Aldeth Sashenstar and his friends from a group of savages
quest.description:
I am Aldeth Sashenstar. You must understand that at the moment, I'm under a terrible amount of stress.
You see, my dear friend, there is a group of uncouth savages that has declared their intention of killing my friends and me. I've been holed up in this cabin for several days and have lacked the wherewithal to try to make an escape.
My friends and I come here every year to do some sport hunting. This year however, a group of woodland savages threatened us with bodily harm if we did not stop our hunting trip. Being civilized men, we realized that it's well within our rights to hunt where we damn well please. After a few more days of hunting, the crass woodmen lost all pretense of humanity and murdered Elban, one of my oldest friends.
I'm sure that they plan to attack our cottage here, so we had best be prepared.

assassinate Valen Dreth in the Imperial Prison
quest.description:
Back for more? It just so happens I have another contract available, one that requires an expert in infiltration.
Ever broken out of jail? How do you feel about breaking into one? The Imperial Prison, to be exact. We need a prisoner... silenced. Can you do it?
Your target is a Dark Elf named Valen Dreth. He thinks he's safe in prison. He is tragically mistaken. A prisoner recently escaped from the prison, using a set of secret tunnels connecting to the Imperial City's sewer system. It's a perfect way inside. Just outside of the Imperial Prison is a grating that leads to the sewers. It has recently been tightly locked, but I will provide a key. It should be easy enough to locate Dreth in his small cell. Besides, I think you know the way, hmmm. He he he he he.
Valen Dreth has been imprisoned for many years. His tongue is sharp, but his body is limp and frail. He will prove an easy, pleasurable kill. You will receive a bonus if you fulfill the contract without killing any of the prison guards. Now go, and may the Night Mother go with you.

It took so long. So very long. But now that you're here, you can accept my contract. My mother, she... she died. I... I'm all alone now. So they sent me to that terrible orphanage in Riften. Honorhall. The headmistress is an evil, cruel woman. They call her Grelod the Kind. But she's not kind. She's terrible. To all of us. So I ran away, and came home. And performed the Black Sacrament.
And you can kill Grelod the Kind! I have a family heirloom you can have. Supposed to be sort of valuable. I hope that's all right.

TESS89: a ghostly guardian whose powers are fading

plots: Valdar has been holding Hevnoraak in his tomb

quest.objective: help Valdar defeat Hevnoraak before he awakens
tasks: Go to .
collect the three vessels needed to vanquish Hevnoraak, and bring them to Valdar
help Valdar defeat Hevnoraak before he awakens
quest.description:
Leave, stranger. Evil stirs in this place. I fear for the security of the very land if it should break free.
We stand at the tomb of Hevnoraak, who has been dead for many generations. I fear, however, that his return may be at hand. I have been holding him here. While he regains strength, however, I am fading. By now I can barely contain his power, much less defeat him if he awakens. But with the help of a living champion I may be able to succeed.
Three vessels in the tomb below hold the power to vanquish Hevnoraak. Before anything else, we need those. Bring them to me - but be careful, mortal. They are guarded by Hevnoraak's minions. They will stop at nothing to see their master return.

BG1250: along the west coast of Balduran's Isle

BG1251: along the west coast of Balduran's Isle

quest.title: Evalt's Missing Brother
quest.objective: find Evan
tasks: Go to .
find the Blue Lady
find Evan
quest.description:
I am Evalt, I fish for clan in these savage waters. Listen, outsider, may I ask you for help?
There is a witch on this isle. My brother called her the Blue Lady and those of us who ply these waters have all heard her singing at one time or another. My brother, Evan, heard her more than most. I think that he went to find her. I think that he is under her spell. I must go and find him. This witch might kill him. He is strong but he is under her spell. I fear that she will kill him before he realizes what is happening. Can you find my brother?
I don't know exactly where the Blue Lady is. I have the sense to avoid her, unlike Evan. But I have only heard her singing along the west coast of the island.

quest.description:
The Key! You have the Skeleton Key! I never thought I'd see it again.
You've done the Guild a great deed. And although they may not show it, I'm certain they appreciate your sacrifices. My only regret is that you had to undertake this task alone.
Nothing would bring me more pride than to return the Key, but I'm afraid it's impossible. From the moment I arrived here, I've felt myself... well... dying.
I'm afraid you have return the Key alone. I'm weakening, and I can feel myself slipping away. The years without restoration of my power have taken their toll. Whatever damage has been caused can only be corrected by following the Pilgrim's Path to the Ebonmere and replacing the Key.
The only possible help I've come across are the remains of some poor fellow who was trying to follow in your footsteps. Perhaps his journal can help?

It is time for decisive action. I have one more duty for you to perform. It is clear to me what must be done. The Hist Tree must be destroyed. This tree is the source of our problems. It is an abomination of nature, and it must be destroyed. As long as the Blackwood Company has access to the sap, we are all in danger. I fear they no longer know what they do.
You must find a way to destroy the Hist, though I can imagine Ri'Zakar will have it well guarded. He's a warrior, a battle-hardened mercenary who's spent time all over Tamriel. He'll keep his prize tree locked away. You'll need to find his key.
Expect an unfriendly welcome at their hall. Finish it.

I met one of the caravan leaders, Ma'dran. He said he'd help get me started if I could bring him a mammoth's tusk. Easier said than done.
If you find one, I could teach you a thing or two about trading. Help you get a fair bargain in the future.

quest.description:
My desire to speak with you was born from the result of our battle. I merely wish to respectfully ask a favor of you.
For countless years I've roamed the Soul Cairn, in unintended service to the Ideal Masters. Before this, I roamed the skies above Tamriel. I desire to return there.
I fear that my time here has taken its toll upon me. I share a bond with this dreaded place. If I ventured far from the Soul Cairn, my strength would begin to wane until I was no more.
I will place my name with you and grant you the right to call my name from Tamriel. Do me this simple honor and I will fight at your side as your Grah-Zeymahzin, your Ally, and teach you my Thu'um.
Simply speak my name to the heavens when you feel the time is right.

quest.description:
Greetings, traveler. I am Azura, known as the Queen of Dawn and Dusk.
I have seen your name, traveler, and heard it whispered in twilight. I ask a service, which holds promise of fame and reward.
Many years ago, five followers of mine slew the vampire Dratik and its kin, but all were infected by the foul creature. Knowing their fate, they sealed themselves up in the vampire's lair. Their suffering weighs heavily on me. Five bright candles shall burn forever in memory of their sacrifice.
Travel to the Gutted Mine. The door will open to you. Bring the peace of death to my followers, and you shall earn my gratitude. For your service, you shall have my Star, that your deeds might be entered in the Book of Fate.

Since you helped us in our time of need, we have been searching for a way to return the favor.
It seems you've met with some unexpected trouble from Cacklespit the witch. I've done a little research, and if you'd like to find her, I think I can help!
From the lore I've been able to piece together, there is a secret way to her hidden realm. The spirit, Fade, can open the way - but he may ask for something in return. You'll have to journey to the Sundered Battlefield in the north. Search for the shrines that mark Fade's resting place. I hope this helps you on your way! I'll keep researching in hopes of finding more information to help you.

quest.description:
Chosen of Talos! Over here! I, Acolyte Vilon, have words for you about your duties within the church!
As a favored of Talos, you will hear questions from the mewling dogs that seek the guidance of the Storm Lord. These weaklings seek guidance, and you are to give it. These worms are barely worthy of stepping upon the floor of the house of the Storm Lord! Nevertheless, you will hear them!
We all take our turn guiding the foolish. I shall send a few your way, and if you do well, perhaps you will not need to speak to any more. We shall see.
For now, guide them in the way of Talos. You must do what is best for the church, and that is all. Anything less and you will have your honors stripped.
Clear?

quest.description:
Ployer! That... that fat excuse for a slaver, he's cursed me! Damn him! If the curse was tailored to me, it might resist removal by normal means. I doubt Ployer would have done this if the solution were simple.
I have a few options. Ployer mentioned that he lived in squalor, suggesting he may be in the poor section of the city. Not likely to find him quick though. The mages with him wore odd colors that might be traceable. Ask at the government building, as all magic is regulated in Athkatla. If they will talk... He also mentioned Belgrade, a merchant that helped expose Ployer. He frequents the Copper Coronet, and the bartender Bernard might know his whereabouts.
My very bones ache today. It is as though I age on the inside. Ohh, this cannot go on for long. We must remove this curse!

You want to help with my research? Are you willing to be an experimental subject?
Oh, it's nothing too dangerous. The experiment should provide an additional spectral tether from your own lifespark to the divine realm. You would experience it as a sort of... increased vigor. You would fight longer, feel stronger, that sort of thing. At least I think it will. Probably. Almost certainly. Of course, you never can tell.
Now stand still... it's my first time casting this spell, and I don't need any additional distractions.

quest.title: A Counter-attack
quest.objective: find the rival guild's hideout, and destroy the rival guild

find the rival guild's hideout, and destroy the rival guild
quest.description:
You were not the only one who was busy last night.
The leader of this rival guild, Bodhi by name, made a daring attack upon us. She can only be a vampire, and I suspect many of her servants are as well. The time has come to strike back to protect our people and the city she has invaded.
Go to the Graveyard District and find their hideout. There is a network of tombs beneath the graves where another spy tracked one of Bodhi's servants. There you shall find a set of blue doors just north of a spider den. The doors are too heavy for any mortal to open, but the vampires likely pass with ease. I shall send a mage to meet you there and arrange for the doors to be opened. Here, you shall need these stakes if you are to truly finish these creatures.
Be on your guard. This Bodhi is the most intelligent and brutal foe I have ever had. If we are lax in our vigilance, we will be at the disadvantage. When you have destroyed their evil, return to me and I will fulfill our bargain.

Actually, there is a teeny tiny issue related to the books: a band of Illagers stole a shipment of books and hauled them to their outpost. Would you kindly find and recover the shipment for me? You'll receive 10 blocks of emerald for your services.

TESO1: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood

plots: the player is an assassin of the Dark Brotherhood: Lucien Lachance has not spoken to the player in a while

quest.title: The Purification
quest.objective: perform the ancient rite known as Purification by killing everyone at the Cheydinhal Sanctuary, and return to Lucien Lachance
tasks: Go to Cheydinhal Sanctuary.
assassinate Ocheeva, Vicente Valtieri, Antoinetta Marie, Gogron gro-Bolmog, Telaendril, M'raaj-Dar and Teinaava
perform the ancient rite known as Purification by killing everyone at the Cheydinhal Sanctuary, and return to Lucien Lachance
quest.description:
I have been waiting for you, assassin. We have not spoken in some time, but I am well aware of your accomplishments within the Dark Brotherhood. That is why I have sent for you. I'm afraid there is a... situation.
The time has come to test both your skill and your loyalty to Sithis. The Black Hand has learned that the Dark Brotherhood has been infiltrated. By whom, and for what purpose, we do not yet know. What we do know is that there is some link between the traitor and the Cheydinhal Sanctuary. The traitor has tainted that place beyond repair. It was learned that the traitor has been active for quite some time, since before you joined the Brotherhood. That absolves you of any suspicion.
The Black Hand has chosen you to perform the ancient rite known as Purification. Everyone inside the Sanctuary must die! You must break one of the Tenets you have sworn to uphold. I know this is an unexpected turn of events, but drastic measures must be taken. Ocheeva, Vicente Valtieri, Antoinetta Marie, Gogron gro-Bolmog, Telaendril, M'raaj-Dar and Teinaava. All of these family members must die! From this point forward, you are no longer bound by the Five Tenets! Sithis will forgive any murder, any theft, so long as you serve the Black Hand!
When the rite of Purification has been completed, return to me here at Fort Farragut, and we will discuss your future. Now, take these special gifts. They will help you greatly. One is a poisoned apple. The other, a unique scroll of summoning. Good luck... assassin.

If you obtain a spectral arrow in your travels, I'd be happy to have it for research. I will even give you some special arrows I've made: Arrows of Weakness. Shoot an enemy with one, and you'll find them much weaker... and easier to kill.

BG2261: a young man, and a faithful soldier

plots: someone opened a secret gate into Saradush: the enemy came through a small sewer outlet that was protected by both a locked iron grate and several powerful magical wards

quest.title: Justice for Mateo
quest.objective: discover the real traitor
tasks: talk to Mateo
discover the real traitor
quest.description:
My name is Captain Samand, and I'm a very busy man right now.
A few days ago, someone opened a secret gate into the town — Saradush could easily have been overrun. We just discovered the traitor was a young man named Mateo. There's no doubt in my mind that *someone* betrayed us. The enemy came through a small sewer outlet that was protected by both a locked iron grate and several powerful magical wards. There is no way to open that entrance from the outside. But Mateo is a faithful soldier, not the type of man to betray Saradush.
An alarm was raised, and my soldiers arrived only a few moments after the gate was opened. We found three soldiers in the area: Mateo, Ardic Santele, and the merchant Kiser Jhaeri. We didn't get a chance to complete our investigations. Ardic, the son of the Countess Santele, disappeared. He was our primary witness. Our attention was focused on the vile Kiser Jhaeri, but we had no proof. Then the countess told us that Ardic, her son, had implicated Mateo before he disappeared.
If you wish to investigate further, I will not stand in your way. Speak to Mateo in his cell. The jailer will let you see him.

TESO426: an exiled mage, giving quest via "Weathered Journal"
TESO429: a male necromancer, Vangaril's friend who become a lich

plots: Erandur's necromantic studies got Erandur and Vangaril expelled from the Guild of Mages

quest.title: Lich of Lost Boy Caverns
quest.objective: follow the story of Vangaril trying to save Erandur from lichdom
tasks: explore the Lost Boy Caverns for more clues about the fate of Vangaril and Erandur
follow the story of Vangaril trying to save Erandur from lichdom
quest.description:
Weathered Journal
by Vangaril

Long have I sought to purge the evils haunting Erandur. Even when his necromantic studies resulted in our mutual expulsion from the Guild of Mages, I persisted in guiding him towards good with a gentle hand. Alas, in our exile, my old friend has mired himself in the foul practice, and in shocking discovery I learned he had become a miserly disciple of the Worm King, a cunning wraith. A Lich.
Frail memory strengthened by dogmatic resolve, the Archmages turned me away when I came to them with my discovery. My pleas for a detachment of battlemages ignored, only my long-past expulsion remembered. And thus, the grave duty falls only to me. I must bear the burden of purging the Lich that was once a friend.
I wander now into the foreboding maw of these catacombs known as the Lost Boy Caverns, far from the climes of common elves and men. With pure spirit and rites of cleansing, I hope to strike down the fearsome Lich and set free the soul of Erandur, but I leave this testament behind, lest I may never return from these depths; as a warning to those who may follow my path.
Faithful, even in Exile,
Vangaril

TESO159: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild

I think I saw an Illager scout keeping an eye on our village from the shadows of nearby trees. Pineville is not safe! The Illagers of the Dark Hall are going to kill us all!
Traveler, could you please help me calm my nerves? It is said that there is a woodland mansion called the Dark Hall deep in the thickets of Darkwood. It is supposed to be a safe haven for Illagers, those bloodthirsty outcasts who resorted to banditry!
I would like you to scout out Darkwood. Be cautious. Darkwood is a dark, dense forest with thick leaf canopies that block sunlight: perfect for ambushes. Find out if the Dark Hall truly exists. I'll pay you a block of emerald! Those are not that easy to come by!

TESS503: a stressful man, and the most recognized scholar on the Dwemer in all of Tamriel

quest.description:
You idiot. Do you even know who I am? The most recognized scholar on the Dwemer in all of Tamriel, and you people keep bothering me!
I... I'm sorry I... I got too excited. I'm in the middle of some very... stressful work, and I shouldn't have yelled. How can I help you?
You want to access my Dwemer museum? It's a private place where I can catalog my research. Occasionally, the nobles will come in and have questions, but that's thankfully rare.
I'll let you in if you agree to something for me. There's a giant spider in Nchuand-Zel, my excavation site. My workers call her 'Nimhe', the Poisoned One. If you deal with Nimhe, I'll let you into both the excavation site and my Dwemer Museum. What do you say?

TESS519: a man the player recruited for Neloth, and thus became untouchable

plots: Drovas Relvi owes Mogrul 1,000 septims: Mogrul thinks that the player should pay Drovas Relvi's debt

quest.title: A New Debt
quest.objective: help Drovas Relvi with his debt to Mogrul

help Drovas Relvi with his debt to Mogrul
quest.description:
It seems you've inherited a problem. Drovas Relvi owes me 1,000 septims. At least he did until you set him up with that powerful wizard. Now he's untouchable. The way I figure it, it's your fault he can't pay me. So I guess I'm going to have to collect it from you.
And if you don't pay me? Nothing for now. But watch your back. I'll be sending collectors to find you. They won't ask so nicely. One way or the other, I'll get my money.
When you are tired of looking over your shoulder, you'll pay me.

plots: the player saved Lord Taldimut and his Zeraphi envoy from goblins

tasks: find the 3 crests for Lord Taldimut
help Lord Taldimut narrow down the location of the Golden Gear
quest.description:
My friend, thank you for coming to our aid. I am Lord Taldimut, the leader of this Zeraphi envoy, sent to procure the Estherians' aid in our upcoming war with the Ezrohir. Grand Regent Eldrayn gave us leave to search the Frosted Hills for the Golden Gear, and we had narrowed our search to these chilly hills before we were assaulted by these goblins.
Now we are too injured to continue our search. Can you aid us? The exact location of the Golden Gear is long forgotten, but the Estherians created a map from three crests. If you can find those, I can interpret the map and find the Gear! Search the Frosted Hills for the crests. Bring them to me, and I will reward you, on behalf of the Zeraphi people.

TESS16: the god of life and death

plots: Tova is not handling the death of her and Torbjorn Shatter-Shield's daughter well

quest.objective: bring Torbjorn Shatter-Shield an amulet of Arkay

bring Torbjorn Shatter-Shield an amulet of Arkay
quest.description:
Please forgive my mood. I'm still coming to terms with my daughter's death. Our little girl died recently. I've been shouldering my days with strong mead, but nothing gives my Tova peace.
I've been looking for an Amulet of Arkay to remind my wife that our child is with the gods now, but I can't find one. Would you be willing to give me an Amulet of Arkay, should you find one?
I hope Arkay grants my wife some comfort.

TESS214: a temple where the dead are prepared for burial
