check out a trail of blood leading away from the murder scene
talk with Helgird
investigate the brutal murders of women
quest.description:
Another girl killed. The victim is Susanna, from Candlehearth Hall. Served me a drink just a few nights ago... but I can't say I knew her.
She was killed the same way as the other two girls. Looks like she was stabbed, and then cut apart. It's like an animal got to her, but these are the wounds of a blade.
You could help us with the investigation. We're stretched thin as it is with the war. Nobody has the time to spend on this. Not pleasant, but it's the truth.
Here are some starting points for you. I noticed a trail of blood leading away from here. Helgird's taken Susanna's body into the Hall of the Dead to prepare for burial. She's a little crazy, but if she knows anything, it's dead bodies.

plots: Sean wants knowledge

quest.title: Disco Sheep
quest.objective: name one of Sean's sheep "jeb_", and observe what happens
tasks: get a name tag
name one of Sean's sheep "jeb_", and observe what happens
quest.description:
Good day to you, traveler! I just love the colorful sheep you brought me: they are so pretty.
There's an interesting thing I heard from a fellow shepherd: if you name a sheep "jeb_", something bizarre is supposed to happen. I'm happy at the moment, but knowing what happens to any sheep named "jeb_" would make me even happier. I something good happens, I shall name all of them so. If something bad happens, I will warn all shepherds about this particular name.
You have to find a name tag. Those are scattered in dangerous places; monster-filled dungeons, abandoned mineshafts, and even the ominous woodland mansions. Feel free to name one of my sheep "jeb_", and please make note of what happens. Do this, and I promise to give you a mountain of wool in all possible colors.

Buc-becaw! HELLLLP-becaw! I am "no ordinary talking chicken," and I am in need of your *cluck* help. I am Melicamp of Beregost, a *cluck* mage adept in the mystical arts.
A... misread... incantation seems to be *cluck* the source of my troubling form. 'Tis been over a month since I *cluck* uttered a polymorph spell, and I simply cannot return to my normal *cluck* form!
There is a tower directly to the west of *cluck* Beregost, about which can be found the mage Thalantyr. I am his apprentice, and I am certain he will *cluck* aid me. I'll just nestle in your pack until we get there.

Old legends tell about a mighty skeletal creature known only as the "Wither." It is said that it can bomb out everything in its surroundings. If you killed the Wither, I'd give you a rare Nether Star as a reward.
I'll draw you the summoning pattern of the Wither. You need to gather up certain items from the hellish Nether: three wither skeleton skulls, and four blocks of soul sand. Use these items to summon the Wither.

I'm not selling cheap mead. I'm selling good mead for cheap... Black-Briar Mead. I sell cases of it for half of what the inns and taverns pay through the Black-Briar Meadery.
If anyone saw me leave Riften, they'd get suspicious. I need someone to take this small keg of Black-Briar Mead to Wilhelm at the Vilemyr Inn in Ivarstead. Drop it off and he'll trade you something for the delivery. Keep it as payment for the legwork.
Oh, and if you bump into Indaryn from the meadery, keep your mouth shut. He'd rat us out in a second.

TESO63: the Bloated Float's bouncer and helmsman

quest.description:
About time someone showed up. Thank you for freeing me. I'm Graman gro-Marad, the Bloated Float's bouncer and helmsman.
I've been locked in that storage room for hours. I don't know exactly what's going on, but not long ago, a gang of thieves calling themselves The Blackwater Brigands stormed the ship. They took myself and Ormil, the Bloated Float's owner, hostage and put the ship to sea. I have no idea what they're after. If you can get me safely to the top deck, I can steer the Float home. But I'm not budging until the coast is clear. I'm used to dealing with drunken louts, not a gang of well-armed thieves.
Good luck... you'll need it.

help Shadr clear his debt with Sapphire

I owe a great deal of money to someone and I think they cheated me. I don't know what to do.
I was able to work out a deal with the stables in Whiterun to sell me some of their tack and harnesses. I borrowed some gold from Sapphire to pay for the shipment, but it got robbed before it even arrived. Now Sapphire wants her money back, and if I don't pay her, I think she's going to kill me.
Can you help me pay off my debt? You should go talk with Sapphire about it.

I'm always looking to replenish my supply, so if you ever come across five of them, I'd be more than happy to take them off your hands. The last traveler that traded me some said he found them at a place called Ancient's Ascent.
Careful though, rumor has it a dragon makes its home there.

Traveler, do you like fishing? May I ask you to catch 6 tropical fish for me? These sort of fish are common in vast oceans of our world. I yearn to take a look at new kinds of fish. I could even try to breed them.
If you happen to give me 6 exotic fish, I'll be glad to reward you with an enchanted fishing rod of mine. A best kind of tool for a passionate fisher.

TESO310: a fellow member of the Dark Brotherhood, and a Shadowscale
TESO311: a swamp far south of here, on the southern end of Cyrodiil
TESO116: Teinaava's sister, a fellow member of the Dark Brotherhood, and a Shadowscale
TESO312: an Argonian Shadowscale, Ocheeva and Teinaava's childhood friend, and a royal assassin of Black Marsh who escaped his duties

plots: Teinaava needs help with a personal matter
just as a member of the Dark Brotherhood cannot kill a fellow family member, a Shadowscale is forbidden from slaying another Shadowscale

quest.title: The Renegade Shadowscale
quest.objective: bring back Scar-Tail's heart as proof for Teinaava
tasks: Go to Bogwater.
assassinate Scar-Tail
bring back Scar-Tail's heart as proof for Teinaava
quest.description:
Ah, dear friend, may I steal a moment of your time? I have a rather delicate situation I was hoping you could help me with. This is a personal matter, and will have no bearing on your standing within the Dark Brotherhood. Would you like to hear more?
Now, the details. Far south of here, on the southern end of Cyrodiil, lies a swamp called Bogwater. Hiding in that swamp you will find an Argonian Shadowscale named Scar-Tail. Kill this renegade. and bring me his heart as proof of the deed.
I have some history with Scar-Tail. When Ocheeva and I trained with the Dark Brotherhood as children, we befriended another initiate, a Shadowscale by the name of Scar-Tail. The three of us were inseparable. When our training was completed, we reluctantly parted ways. But now... Now, the unthinkable has happened! Scar-Tail has fled Black Marsh and refuses to fulfill his duties as royal assassin! This is an act of treason! This treachery must be punished! Just as a member of the Dark Brotherhood cannot kill a fellow family member, a Shadowscale is forbidden from slaying another Shadowscale. That is why you must go to Bogwater and eliminate that treacherous snake!
Please kill Scar-Tail, so Ocheeva and I can put this matter behind us.

BG2210: from the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart
BG2212: a charismatic man who used to be one of the highest-ranking officers in the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart

plots: Sir Ryan Trawl has heard of the player
Anarg was implicated in smuggling slaves: he was expelled from the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart
Anarg took some young knights of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart with him
if the player considers the Fallen Paladins a threat, they are free to do what they consider necessary

quest.title: Investigate the Fallen Paladins
quest.objective: investigate the Fallen Paladins
tasks: Go to Bridge District.
join the Fallen Paladins
investigate the Fallen Paladins
quest.description:
Greetings, traveler. I am Sir Ryan Trawl. I have heard of you. I would like to offer you the opportunity to help the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart.
The task of being a paladin is not easy. Many break under the demands of our path and leave to pursue avenues of life more appropriate to their talents. Sometimes they bend instead of break, twisting their paladinhood to serve their own purpose. These are hard to detect, but when found, they are quickly cast out.
Recently, one of our highest-ranking officers was implicated in smuggling slaves. His name is Anarg, and though he was once a friend, he was expelled from the Order. We thought that the end of it, but Anarg took others when he left. He is a charismatic man, and some of the younger knights were swayed by his words. We could tolerate their loss, but they masquerade as paladins, abusing our good name. They extort, smuggle slaves, and spit on all that we honor. The Fallen Paladins, as they're known, would recognize any of our Order, and some also fear conflict with former friends, so we need outside help in this matter.
The Fallen Paladins always need warriors to aid their illegal activities. We want you to ally with them, especially Anarg. He's the key to them all. If you consider these men a threat, then do what you think is necessary. Gloves of Healing would be a suitable reward for the task, I think.
Anarg has kept their activities localized in the Bridge District. I suggest you search there. May Torm be with you.

TESO79: a legendary male knight of old

plots: knights who wished to quest for the holy relics of Pelinal Whitestrake would walk the Pilgrim's Way: the player should pray to each of the gods in turn, and ask their favor upon the player's quest

quest.objective: show that you are a worthy knight to seek out the holy relics of Pelinal Whitestrake

complete the Pilgrimage of the Nine Divines
show that you are a worthy knight to seek out the holy relics of Pelinal Whitestrake
quest.description:
Oh my. To what do I owe this honor? I am but a humble prophet. What business do you have with me?
You would quest for the holy panoply of Pelinal Whitestrake? The legendary Relics that have been sought by mighty warriors throughout the ages? Are you a worthy knight?
The gods grant insight to those they deem worthy. Why and how they act is not predictable. What I can tell you is that traditionally, knights who wished to quest for the Relics would walk the Pilgrim's Way.
Travel to the Wayshrines of the Nine Divines. Pray to each of the gods in turn, and ask their favor upon your quest.

plots: the player is presenting an ancient Falmer tome to Urag gro-Shub and asking if Urag gro-Shub is interested in buying it

Well, well. I haven't seen one of these beauties in a long time. A rare find in the original Falmer language. You're damn right I'm interested. Question is, are you selling?
Well, considering no one else in Skyrim would buy something they couldn't possibly read, I'd say you don't have much of a choice. Tell you what, you bring me books like this, and I'll pay a thousand gold each. I'll even throw in a translated edition I have for free.
If you're holding out for more gold, it's never going to happen.

It would be very sweet of you to get more information about my daughter. Anything you can find out from Captain Aldis would be welcome news.

The lout sold it to a fence by the name of Roger not too long ago, I do think. He lives in the sewers below th' city, although I knows not exactly where. He might still have it.
Please find me family gong!

BG1289: one of the dukes of Baldur's Gate, and Skie's father

quest.description:
I'm Eldoth, a traveling bard. Pleased to make your acquaintance. You look like the type to be on the outlook for ways to improve the quality of your life.
Well, I have a proposal that could help you in that endeavor. You see, there's a girl, my lover in fact, who desires to escape her father and live on her own. Her father is Entar Silvershield, one of the dukes of Baldur's Gate. This, of course, makes her desires more difficult than that of the average city girl.
However, with your assistance, we could help her escape the tyrannical clutches of Entar. Here's the punchline: Since Entar's going to be hunting us anyway, we can blackmail him for hoards of cash and not worry about our captive escaping. After all, we're doing it all for the sake of Skie.
Now, we needn't go about this right away. In fact, I'll help you with whatever you're doing until you decide to head up to Baldur's Gate. Just think of it as one favor deserving another.

TESS179: the lawful female ruler of Riften

We're aware of a Skooma dealer's presence in the warehouse within this city. Unfortunately, we're certain this Skooma dealer, Sarthis, has informants within the city guard. Every time we've made a move to arrest him, he's escaped.
However, if you'd take care of this discreetly, you might be able to surprise him without warning. Here, this is the key to the warehouse. See if you can drop in on this dealer of poison and convince him to close down his operation permanently.

TESO396: the lady of light, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: the player has summoned Meridia by the detritus of the profane

quest.description:
By the detritus of the profane, I am brought forth. And by your offering, you have made the profane your interest, mortal.
The undead are foul, unnatural things. Some of my rivals take pleasure in these abominations. Not Meridia. I wish these creatures destroyed. Hidden behind a door, deep in Howling Cave, are necromancers. They rob graves for the materials to raise their undead armies.
Find these necromancers. Destroy them and their abominations. Do this, and earn the gratitude of Meridia. You shall have the Ring of Khajiiti and go with my blessing.

plots: the gatekeeper won't let Farthing go and get her doll

quest.title: Farthing's Dolly
quest.objective: return Farthing's doll to her
tasks: Go to .
find Farthing's doll
return Farthing's doll to her
quest.description:
My name's Farthing. I'm only five. In a few years my papa will let me hunt. Are you allowed to hunt?
I've lost my dolly out in the woods. The gatekeeper won't let me go and get it. Can you get it for me?

BG198: Landrin's house in Beregost, west of the Jovial Juggler Inn
BG1118: Landrin's house in Beregost, west of the Jovial Juggler Inn
Landrin's house in Beregost, west of the Jovial Juggler Inn

plots: Landrin gives the player antidote potions against poison

quest.title: Landrin's Possessions
quest.objective: deal with the spider infestation in Landrin's cellar
tasks: kill spiders, and fetch Landrin's husband's boots and Landrin's bottle of wine
deal with the spider infestation in Landrin's cellar
quest.description:
Hey, I'm Landrin.
I've got an infestation of poisonous spiders in my cellar in Beregost. You'll know the house when you see it: just to the west of the Jovial Juggler Inn.
Here, take these potions with you. They're antidotes against the poison.
Keep whatever you don't use and I'll give you an extra 120 gold pieces if you bring back my husband's old boots that he keeps down there. If you bring back one of their bodies and my ol' bottle of wine as well, I might toss in a little something extra too.

TESO401: an Orc woman who claims to be a knight

plots: the player does not know Marius Caro

quest.title: Mazoga the Orc
quest.objective: report to Marius Caro the reason Mazoga the Orc is in Leyawiin
tasks: find out why Mazoga the Orc is in Leyawiin
report to Marius Caro the reason Mazoga the Orc is in Leyawiin
quest.description:
Marius Caro, by grace of the Gods, Count of Leyawiin. You are a stranger to me, but well-met. Perhaps you would like to do a service for Leyawiin?
I need your help. An Orc named Mazoga here claims to be a knight, but will not reveal her business. Find out why she is here, and report to me, and you will earn a reward suitable for those who serve Leyawiin.

plots: Dryad of the Cloud Peaks dies if her ancient oak dies

quest.title: Dryad of the Cloud Peaks
quest.objective: save Dryad of the Cloud Peaks' ancient oak from dying
tasks: stop a pair of people from attacking Dryad of the Cloud Peaks' ancient oak
save Dryad of the Cloud Peaks' ancient oak from dying
quest.description:
Please, kind spirits, a wondrous ancient oak is in peril. It is the tree to which I am bonded! If it dies, I, Dryad of the Cloud Peaks, die.
It is about to be attacked by two who would defile the majesty of nature. They have avoided my charms and must be stopped before irreparable harm is done. Would you heed my plea?
There is a potion that might help you on your journeys.

TESO326: the player's guildleader in the Mages Guild
TESO22: the headquarters of the Mages Guild
TESO138: a male master wizard of the Mages Guild
TESO528: the male leader of the necromancers
TESO554: a relic of the necromancers, a helmet

plots: Irlav Jarol and his group of mages want to use the Bloodworm Helm to fight Mannimarco
Arch-Mage Traven fears that necromancers might target Irlav Jarol

quest.title: The Bloodworm Helm
quest.objective: return the Bloodworm Helm to the Arcane University
tasks: Go to Fort Teleman.
find Irlav Jarol, his group of mages, and the Bloodworm Helm
return the Bloodworm Helm to the Arcane University
quest.description:
A group of mages led by Irlav Jarol took the Bloodworm Helm, and have retreated to Fort Teleman, in an effort to study it further.
They hope to learn enough from it to find some sort of way to fight Mannimarco. I tried to dissuade them, but it was no use.
I would like the helm to be returned, so that it may be kept safe here in the Arcane University. I fear Irlav has made himself a target for the Necromancers.

BG133: a dangerous tower owned by Durlag
BG1277: Therella's son who wants to be a hero

plots: Dalton went on an adventure to Durlag's Tower
Dalton and his fellow adventurers bought a ward token from Galken
Dalton did not return from Durlag's Tower

quest.title: Therella's Missing Son
quest.objective: find out what happened to Dalton
tasks: Go to Durlag's Tower.
find Dalton
find out what happened to Dalton
quest.description:
Greetings, adventurer. I have, or perhaps I should say had, a son named Dalton. He fell in with a crew of adventurers from Waterdeep. Dalton was always obsessed with the idea of being a hero.
Alas, he has neither the brains nor the ability. Such is a mother's lot in life, however, to watch her children perform acts of idiocy despite her warnings or concerns.
He and his thick-skulled cohorts took it upon themselves to plumb the depths of Durlag's Tower. They bought a ward token from that shyster, Galken, and made ready to leave. Though I begged and cried, Dalton still insisted on going. The band never returned. I fear that they were destroyed by the mad dwarf's machinations. That is the tale, sad but true.
Please find my son if he still lives.

plots: Romeo wants comfort
the player is a famous hero

quest.title: A Rose, My Darling
quest.objective: bring a rose to Romeo
tasks: find a rose
bring a rose to Romeo
quest.description:
Great timing, Hero. I'm suffering... my poor heart is writhing in love.
Help me find a rose for my loved one, so that my heart may yet calm down. All I need is but a single rose. They can be found in various temperate forests.
Please, help a fellow in love. I have 27 pumpkin pies I can give you.

plots: xvarts and kobolds swarmed the Nashkel mines
xvarts and kobolds have started attacking livestock more and more often

quest.title: Xvart Raids
quest.objective: save Hulrik's cows
tasks: kill the xvarts that are attacking the cows
save Hulrik's cows
quest.description:
I'm Hulrik! You have to help me!
Them xvarts are after my cows again! Ever since them xvarts an' their kobold kin swarmed the mines at Nashkel, they've been makin' attacks like that more and more often.

TESS327: a devout female worshiper of Dibella
TESS513: the goddess of love and passion
TESS855: the three men Haelga slept with
TESS856: Mark of Dibella, Marks of Dibella

plots: when Haelga sleeps with a man, Haelga gives the man a Mark of Dibella

quest.title: Caught Red Handed
quest.objective: help Svana Far-Shield embarrass Haelga
tasks: gather 3 Marks of Dibella from Bolli, Hofgrir and Indaryn, and confront Haelga with the Marks of Dibella
help Svana Far-Shield embarrass Haelga
quest.description:
I hate Haelga! It's everything about her. She's disgusting. I think she takes her worship of Dibella a bit too seriously.
Do you know she's slept with three different men in the last month alone? What kind of a woman would do such a thing? Just for once, I'd like to see her squirm... to rub her nose in it.
Actually, there is a way to do this, but I don't think I could get away with doing it. She'd kill me if she found out. You see, I happen to know after she makes love, she gives her partner a token of her affection called a Mark of Dibella. If you confront her with three of the Marks of Dibella, she'd be so embarrassed... well, I don't know what she'd do!
Oh, this is going to be great! You need to get the Marks of Dibella from Bolli, Hofgrir and Indaryn. Not sure how you're going to do that, but try your best. Then just confront Haelga with them and the rest works itself out.

plots: Tazok has been going to the Cloakwood regularly
there are important documents in the chest here

quest.title: A Hidden Base in the Cloakwood
quest.objective: investigate Tazok and his group of bandits
tasks: Go to Cloakwood.
go to Cloakwood
investigate Tazok and his group of bandits
quest.description:
This whole thing is dirty to the core, that's what I know! These aren't your ordinary bandits here. Tazok's been making regular visits to the Cloakwood, so that's where I'd start if I were you. There are some documents in that chest that might be worth taking a look at, too.
Now go step on some toes, all right? And you can tell them Ender Sai sent you.

plots: the player is hurting their prisoner

quest.title: No More Pain
quest.objective: find your prisoner's treasure for yourself
tasks: get your prisoner's hidden things from a hollowed-out rock
find your prisoner's treasure for yourself
quest.description:
I'll tell you anything. Anything! Just please stop... hurting me... I just... can't take the pain. Not a second longer.
I'll give you money. Treasure. I have some things hidden away. Take them all. They're yours. Just please... stop. Just north of Windhelm. There's a hollowed-out rock. I have some things hidden in there. Take them! They're yours.
I've told you everything I can. I don't know what else you could want...

TESS168: the player's admirer, and a member of the Dark Brotherhood
TESS235: a young boy who wanted Grelod the Kind dead
TESS236: a cruel, old female orphanage headmistress, killed by the player

plots: Astrid woke the player up from their sleep
Aventus Aretino was looking for the Dark Brotherhood: Grelod the Kind was a Dark Brotherhood contract, and the player must pay for killing her

quest.title: With Friends Like These...
quest.objective: kill one of the kidnapped people for the Dark brotherhood
tasks: turn around, and select the person who shall not leave the room alive
kill one of the kidnapped people for the Dark brotherhood
quest.description:
Sleep well? Who I am really isn't as important as what I am. And what I am is an admirer. Of sorts.
You see, that little Aretino boy was looking for the Dark Brotherhood. For me, and my associates. Grelod the Kind was, by all rights, a Dark Brotherhood contract. A kill... that you stole. A kill you must repay.
If you turn around, you'll notice my guests. I've "collected" them from... well, that's not really important. The here and now. That's what matters. You see, there's a contract out on one of them, and that person can't leave this room alive. But... which one? Go on, see if you can figure it out.
Make your choice. Make your kill. I just want to observe... and admire.

BG292: a tomb over in the lower crypts of the Graveyard District
a tomb over in the lower crypts of the Graveyard District
BG293: a tomb over in the lower crypts of the Graveyard District

plots: Korgan Bloodaxe and his fellows were on a mission to obtain the Book of Kaza for a book collector
Korgan Bloodaxe and his fellows had a heated argument: only Korgan Bloodaxe remained alive afterwards

quest.title: Help Korgan Recover the Book of Kaza
quest.objective: bring the the Book of Kaza to the book collector
tasks: find the Book of Kaza with Korgan Bloodaxe
bring the the Book of Kaza to the book collector
quest.description:
I'm scouring for a band of desperate adventurers to aid me in a gallant task. Come and hear Korgan Bloodaxe's tale!
A fortnight past, me fellows and I were in the midst of obtaining an ancient text fer our patron when a skirmish visited our midst. Vile words, alas, became a lake of bloodshed. So it goes the sacred grimoire ne'er made it to our benefactor's hand. And now he awaits its arrival with a zeal reserved for a grog-blossom in an alekeg. The scuttlebutt is the pay is handsome and worthy of note — sacks of loot and odd magics. The volume sits not far from 'ere, and the bibliomaniac, he paces the floor in the meantime. 'Tis called the Book of Kaza.
The Book of Kaza is in some hobnail's tomb over in the lower crypts of the Graveyard District. It's nae abandoned, but rumors and half-truths only scare the young and infirm. Keeps the curious away, me guess.
Well... it'll take far more than a few shambling bags of skin and stitches to deter Korgan Bloodaxe from a king's ransom! A foolhardy jaunt into a hive of undead? How could ye resist?

TESO253: an evoker and alchemist, and a member of the Mages Guild
TESO22: an university for mages in the Imperial City
TESO254: the female head of the Alchemy Headquarters
TESO256: magical crystals called Tears, frozen tears of Garridan Stalrous

plots: Julienne Fanis can tell the player more about Garridan's Tears

quest.title: Tears of the Savior
quest.objective: find as many Garridan's Tears for S'Drassa as possible
tasks: Go to Arcane University.
talk to Julienne Fanis
find as many Garridan's Tears for S'Drassa as possible
quest.description:
S'Drassa of the Mages Guild. Evoker and Alchemist. Could you assist me in acquiring something for my crystal collection?
I'm searching for some specific crystals known as Garridan's Tears. I want you to bring me as many of Garridan's Tears as you can find. If you do, I will pay you a fair bounty in gold for each one. I confess I have a weakness for crystals of a magical nature, and I must add these to my collection. This is a personal errand, you must understand. Just between you and I. The Mages Guild has nothing to do with it.
The Tears are not just a namesake. They're literally the frozen tears of a knight named Garridan Stalrous who lived many years ago. I'm not certain what happened to the knight, or why the tears were frozen, but I do know someone you could ask. Seek out Julienne Fanis at the Arcane University in the Imperial City. She oversees the Alchemy Headquarters there. If anyone can help you get more information on about these crystals, she can.

BG1238: Merchants' League Counting House, northeast section of Baldur's Gate, northeast from Elfsong Tavern
Merchants' League Counting House, northeast section of Baldur's Gate, northeast from Elfsong Tavern
BG1240: Merchants' League Counting House, northeast section of Baldur's Gate, northeast from Elfsong Tavern

plots: The Merchants' League found Balduran's shipwreck on Balduran's Island
Mendas of Waterdeep wants to get Balduran's logbook before the merchants destroy it while they search for treasure
The Merchants' League keeps the sea charts locked up
Mendas of Waterdeep will give the player some gold to obtain the sea charts

quest.title: The Reclusive Scholar
quest.objective: travel to Balduran's Island to find Balduran's logbook for Mendas of Waterdeep
tasks: obtain the sea charts from the sea captain
travel to Balduran's Island to find Balduran's logbook for Mendas of Waterdeep
quest.description:
I am Mendas of Waterdeep, quester of small truth in this land. I am in need of favor from you. Can you help a gentle fellow in search for knowledge?
The Merchants' League sailors found Balduran's shipwreck on a small island. I wish to recover the ship's logbook. I will solve mystery of Balduran's final voyage. Merchants' League will destroy my artifacts to get treasure. This must not happen! If you help me, I get things precious to me, you get treasure, merchant men get nothing. You will help, yes?
These men that find island, they keep the sea charts locked up. In Baldur's Gate, there is building in northeast section of city called Merchants' League Counting House. To find it, just go northeast from Elfsong Tavern. The sea charts, they are in there. Most likely, captain of ship will have them. I don't know such things as chart retrieval, but you are hero, and it is no problem for heroes.
There might be small danger, so I give you some gold for the charts.

plots: the player is not a believer of Helm

quest.title: A Mission From Oisig
quest.objective: discuss your mission with Oisig
tasks: follow Oisig
discuss your mission with Oisig
quest.description:
Greetings. I am Oisig, cleric of Helm.
I would speak with you. I would hire you as a mercenary in the service of Helm. I would prefer a person of faith, but you will be adequate.
Follow me to the temple of Helm. I will discuss what is required of you there. Do not take too long; Helm requires you now.

TESO146: a legendary thief, and the player's guildmaster at the Thieves Guild
TESO224: an extensive, well-guarded monastery, in the far northeast of Cyrodiil, beyond Cheydinhal
TESO225: a large crystal with special properties

plots: retired, blind Moth priests go to die in the Temple of the Ancestor Moths
the Gray Fox will mark the location of the Temple of the Ancestor Moths on the player's map
the player must not kill innocents: however, there is no bloodprice for slaying the stone's guardians

quest.title: Turning a Blind Eye
quest.objective: return to the Gray Fox with Savilla's Stone
tasks: Go to Temple of the Ancestor Moths.
steal Savilla's Stone
return to the Gray Fox with Savilla's Stone
quest.description:
I have need of your special gifts. There is an item, hidden away in a remote monastery. I need you to go get it for me.
The monastery is extensive and well guarded, so you should make sure to be well prepared. Should you succeed, I will pay you well for your services.
The monastery is called the Temple of the Ancestor Moths. It is where retired, blind Moth priests go to wait out the rest of their days. I will mark the location on your map. Look for it in the far northeast of Cyrodiil, beyond Cheydinhal.
I need you to acquire Savilla's Stone. It is a large crystal with special properties that I need to gain... advantage. Remember, do not shed innocent blood. However, there is no bloodprice for slaying the stone's guardians, human or inhuman. When I receive word that Savilla's Stone is missing, I will be here waiting for you.

TESS663: the goddess of destruction, Molag Bal's rival

plots: the player tried to take the mace on Molag Bal's shrine: Molag Bal imprisoned the player with sharp spikes

quest.title: Dominion and Humiliation
quest.objective: help Molag Bal take revenge upon a priest of Boethiah who desecrated Molag Bal's shrine
tasks: save the priest of Boethiah from imprisonment
help Molag Bal take revenge upon a priest of Boethiah who desecrated Molag Bal's shrine
quest.description:
Fool! Did you think Molag Bal, the Lord of Domination, would so easily reward you? What do you see from that little cage? Speak.
You definitely see the spikes of your cage. Sharp, aren't they? This was the last thing many saw before they were sacrificed in my name. But even a god has his enemies, and my rival Boethiah had her priest desecrate it. So long since it's tasted blood. Until you came.
I want submission. I want the priest who did this to bend his knee and give me his soul. He comes by to perform Boethiah's insulting rites at my altar, but he's been missing. Captured and bound. Left to rot.
You'll get the freedom your kind enjoys so much. Save the priest. Let him perform his rite one more time. And when he does, we will be waiting for him.
Then you will be finally rewarded. The Mace of Molag Bal! I give you its true power, mortal. When your enemies lie broken and bloody before you, know that I will be watching.

TESS711: an investigator from the College of Winterhold, giving quest via "Midden Incident Report"
TESS712: a sewer system underneath the College of Winterhold
TESS713: the library in the College of Winterhold
TESS715: a large, segmented sculpture of a gauntlet, with the Daedric sigil 'O' emblazoned upon the palm

plots: Anonymous found the missing students of the College of Winterhold dead in the Midden: they were attempting a summoning ritual well beyond their capabilities
the Deadric Relic in the Midden is related to the students' death: Anonymous pried 4 rings from the Deadric Relic

quest.title: Forgotten Names
quest.objective: complete a summoning ritual in the Midden
tasks: Go to Arcanaeum.
find the 4 rings needed in the ritual
complete a summoning ritual in the Midden
quest.description:
Midden Incident Report
by Anonymous

The missing students were found in the Midden this morning. Dead, as expected. None of us bothered keeping a detect life charm for the search at this point.
The bodies were found together, each suffering the same deformities; peeled and bubbling skin on the arms and face. Conjurer's burn, as it's commonly referred to around the College. There's little doubt they were attempting a summoning ritual well beyond their capabilities.
The relic nearby put any doubt in this theory to rest. I admit that I've never seen one like it - a large, segmented sculpture of a gauntlet, the Daedric sigil 'O' emblazoned upon the palm. Attempts to move it were in vain. I must show it to the Archmage during his upcoming visit. Perhaps he will know more.
While we couldn't move the relic, I was able to pry four "rings" from it. I'm sure there's a connection between them and the ritual the students were attempting.
I'll store these in the Arcanaeum until we can consult with a conjuration master to learn more.

BG283: Tiris and Jenia's home, north of the Alibakkar estate
Tiris and Jenia's home, north of the Alibakkar estate

plots: Tiris is too frightened to leave Tiris and Jenia's home

quest.title: Helping Tiris
quest.objective: figure out why Tiris is frightened
tasks: speak with Tiris
figure out why Tiris is frightened
quest.description:
My name is Jenia, and I come to you on behalf of my son, Tiris. He is very frightened. Too frightened to even leave our home!
I beg of you to come and speak to him! To see what has frightened him so and perhaps help him!
Tiris is at our home, the one just north of the Alibakkar estate. Please come as soon as you are able to! I so despair seeing him like this! I know I am poor and have nothing to offer, but I beg you to help my son!

plots: Tammy wants comfort
the player can tame a horse by trying to mount it until it stops throwing the player off its back

quest.title: Moving to Places
quest.objective: bring a horse to Tammy
tasks: Go to .
tame a horse
bring a horse to Tammy
quest.description:
*sigh* I dream of leaving this tiny village every day. If only I had a horse... then I could go anywhere I want. Wherever my wanderlust takes me to.
Traveler, you must have covered a lot of land, learned many new skills. Please help me: tame a horse, and bring it to me. Horses are commonly found grazing plains, and their warmer cousins savannas. You can tame a horse by trying to mount it until it stops throwing you off its back. I'll pay a whole block of emeralds for it. Then I too, could take on the life on road.

plots: Olivia wants reputation
Olivia gives the player seeds that can be used to tame a parrot

quest.title: A Talkative Pet
quest.objective: bring a tamed parrot to Olivia
tasks: Go to .
tame a parrot
bring a tamed parrot to Olivia
quest.description:
My mommy and daddy say that I can't go outside the village. I don't! But I really wanna have a parrot. The other kids would certainly like me better if I had a cool pet like a parrot!
You a big enough to travel to places on your own without your parents. Traveler, please tame a parrot and bring it to me. I even have some seeds for you: tame the parrot with them. Parrots live in jungles.
I will give you this diamond I once found on the ground. Even a kid like me knows that those are valuable.

TESO432: a male Orc who leads the Black Bow Bandits

plots: Mazoga might have had contacts with outlaws in her shadowy past

quest.title: Knights of the White Stallion
quest.objective: kill Black Brugo with Mazoga
tasks: ask Mazoga about locating Black Brugo
kill Black Brugo with Mazoga
quest.description:
You and Mazoga are to find and kill the leader of the Black Bow Bandits, the Orc named Brugo.
In her shadowy past, your friend Mazoga might have had contacts with outlaws. Ask her about locating Brugo and his Black Bow Bandits.
I have created a chivalric Order of the White Stallion. If you succeed, I will bestow on both you and Mazoga the titles of Knights-Errant of the White Stallion for your service to Leyawiin.

plots: Ragefast imprisoned Ragefast's nymph in Ragefast's house

quest.title: A Nymph for Ramazith
quest.objective: free Ragefast's nymph and bring her to Ramazith
tasks: enter Ragefast's house
free Ragefast's nymph and bring her to Ramazith
quest.description:
Greetings to you and yours, my friend. I'm Ramazith.
Might I have your ear a moment? My proposition is thus: I would have you enter into the home of a colleague of mine and effect the release of a creature he has imprisoned there. Ragefast be his name, and he has in his possession one of the most beautiful and useful creatures in all of Faerûn. It's a nymph he captured some time ago, and I know not what laughable plans he has for her, but I am sure she be more... productive in my care.
I not so rich as to be able to offer huge gold, but as competent wizard I do have the odd magical item of worth. Perhaps an enchanted item will serve your needs, no?

plots: the player is a noble
Chanelle was an orphan who was took in by the de'Arnise family: the player is Chanelle's guardian as the ruler of the keep
no one can marry Chanelle without the player's permission

quest.title: The Maid & Her Suitors
quest.objective: decide who gets to marry Chanelle
tasks: go see Chanelle and her two suitors
decide who gets to marry Chanelle
quest.description:
Greetings, Your Grace. It is I, the majordomo of your castle. We have a small problem here at the keep, one that I doubt that you would be aware of at all.
I am unsure if you have met Chanelle... She has been a maid here most of her life. She was an orphan, and the de'Arnise family took her in as a servant when she was young. As the ruler of the keep, you are technically her guardian. Ordinarily, that would not be a problem, but there are two men who desire her hand in marriage. It is... up to you, my liege, to give her away and decide which of the men has your blessing for the marriage.
I shall bring them in to see you, my liege. If you do not resolve this issue, then... no one shall be permitted to marry Chanelle. And I am sure that is not what she wants.

TL252: a town a couple of days travel away from here

plots: the Vanquisher told the Imperial Railmaster that the player is coming to him

quest.title: Onward to Zeryphesh!
quest.objective: travel to Zeryphesh on the Imperial Railmaster's Embercraft
tasks: tell the Imperial Railmaster when your ready to go
travel to Zeryphesh on the Imperial Railmaster's Embercraft
quest.description: You're the one the Vanquisher lady told me about, then? Alright... whenever you're ready to get rollin', we'll get your gear aboard our Embercraft, and we'll set out to Zeryphesh. Shouldn't take us more than a couple of days to get there!

BG2101: a betrayed man, and the player's friend
BG2131: an inn in the Promenade District of Athkatla
BG2132: a foreign noble, and a good man

plots: Keldorn's wife has been seeing Sir William of Thorpe
Sir William of Thorpe has challenged Keldorn's honor

quest.title: Adulterer's lot
quest.objective: bestow some justice on Sir William of Thorpe
tasks: Go to Mithrest.
go find Sir William of Thorpe with Keldorn
bestow some justice on Sir William of Thorpe
quest.description:
My wife has been seeing another man. Sir William of Thorpe... He's a foreign noble establishing trade here in Athkatla. He was a good man — at least I always thought so until... until now.
My friend, let us bestow some justice. Sir William has challenged my honor. There must be a reprisal.
We must make haste to the Mithrest in the Promenade District. I cannot live like this for long.

TESO409: the player's guildmaster in the Fighters Guild

plots: the player has stolen something from their fellow Fighters Guild members: this is the player's first offense

quest.title: Expelled from the Fighters Guild
quest.objective: bring 20 bear pelts to Vilena Donton
tasks: collect 20 bear pelts
bring 20 bear pelts to Vilena Donton
quest.description:
You would steal from your brothers? If you had a need for something, why would you not just ask?
I will give you a chance, though. As it is only your first offense, do not return until you have collected 20 bear pelts.
Use this time to reflect on your actions.

plots: Maria wants comfort
the player is a friend of Maria

quest.title: Staying Warm...
quest.objective: craft 2 campfires, and give them to Maria
tasks: collect 3 sticks, a piece of coal, and 3 wood logs
craft 2 campfires, and give them to Maria
quest.description:
Dear friend, this village is freezing cold, isn't it? This cold is turning my fingers blue, at least.
You are a highly skilled individual. May I ask you to craft a campfire or two? First, you have to collect some materials: 3 sticks, a piece of coal, and 3 wood logs.
After crafting the campfires, please give them to me. I even have something for you: 32 Blue Ice. It's slippery, blue-colored ice. I'm sure it'll prove useful to you, my friend.

TESS6: a province with many words of power
TESS227: a mortal blessed with the blood and soul of a dragon, masters of the Thu'um

plots: the player is the Dragonborn

quest.title: The Words of Power
quest.objective: find a lost word of power
tasks: Go to Skyrim.
get to the location marked on your map
find a lost word of power
quest.description:
You have learned so much already, Dragonborn. Growing your gift too quickly would be dangerous.
But there are many Words of Power in Skyrim, carved in the Dragon tongue. Even from here, we can feel the Thu'um resonate from them. Finding these lost Words would be a sufficient test, to temper your abilities with experience.
We have felt the whisper of a Word. Give me your map, and I will show you where its echo can be found.

TESS135: a former scout of the Imperial Legion

plots: Noster Eagle-Eye tracked down all the places in the wilds that were causing people trouble: he lost his helmet in one of the old caves

quest.title: Noster's Lost Helmet
quest.objective: retrieve Noster Eagle-Eye's helmet for him
tasks: find Noster Eagle-Eye's helmet
retrieve Noster Eagle-Eye's helmet for him
quest.description:
I'm Noster Eagle-Eye. I was the finest scout in the Imperial Legion, once. Tracked down all the places in the wilds that were causing people trouble.
Lost my helmet in one of the old caves. My pretty, pretty helmet. Life just got worse after that. Kept losing things. So many things....
Oh, could you find that helmet for me? I sure would love to have it again. Could show you some of my old scouting tricks.

plots: Henantier and Kud-Ei were study-mates at the Arcane University
Henantier gets into trouble because of his careless experiments: Kud-Ei fears that Henantier has done this again
Henantier is trapped and there is no way Kud-Ei can free him

quest.title: Through A Nightmare, Darkly
quest.objective: help Kud-Ei save her friend Henantier
tasks: follow Kud-Ei to Henantier
help Kud-Ei save her friend Henantier
quest.description:
Kud-Ei. I don't suppose you could help me locate my friend Henantier could you? If you find him, I'll be glad to offer you a sizable reward.
I miss Henantier so. We were study-mates at the Arcane University and we've come to grow fond of each other over the years. He's always getting himself into jams with the careless ways he performs his experiments, and well, I'm afraid he's done it again.
I'm going to level with you, as you seem like you wish to help. Henantier isn't missing. On the contrary, I know exactly where he is. The problem is he's trapped and there's no way I can free him.
Follow me. We aren't going far, so no need to prepare for a long journey. In fact, Henantier's still in town. More I can't say aloud without risk of others hearing.

TESS7: an Ancestor Glade in Skyrim, in the pine forest
an Ancestor Glade in Skyrim, in the pine forest
TESS8: an Elder Scroll which foreshadows the defiance of the gods with the blood of mortals
TESS9: mysterious scrolls which are fragments of creation from outside time and space
an Ancestor Glade in Skyrim, in the pine forest

plots: the ritual of the Ancestor Moth: the player must remove the bark from a canticle tree with a draw knife to attract Ancestor Moths to them

quest.title: Unseen Visions
quest.objective: read "Blood"
tasks: perform the ritual of the Ancestor Moth to gain the second sight needed to decipher the Elder Scrolls
read "Blood"
quest.description:
Scattered across Tamriel are secluded locations known only as Ancestor Glades. There's one in Skyrim, in the Pine Forest.
Performing the Ritual of the Ancestor Moth within the glade should provide the answers you seek. It involves carefully removing the bark from a Canticle Tree which will in turn attract Ancestor Moths to you.
In keeping with tradition, you must use a specific tool in the Ancestor Glade, an implement known as a Draw Knife. Every Moth Priest is taught this ritual, but few ever get the chance to perform it... you should consider yourself fortunate if it works for you.
Once enough of the moths are following, they'll provide you with the second sight needed to decipher the Elder Scrolls. From what I saw in the vision, the Elder Scroll which foreshadows the defiance of the gods with the blood of mortals is the key to the prophecy.

TESS295: a mortal with the soul of a dragon

plots: the player is meeting Paarthurnax for the first time: the player is the Dovahkiin

quest.title: The Throat of the World
quest.objective: receive a lesson from Paarthurnax
tasks: hear Paarthurnax's shout, and match it with your own
receive a lesson from Paarthurnax
quest.description:
Greetings, traveler. I am Paarthurnax. Who are you? What brings you to my mountain? Forgive me. I gave in to the temptation to prolong our speech. I know you are Dovahkiin.
You have come here to learn from me. Patience. There are formalities that must be observed, at the first meeting of two of the dragons. By long tradition, the elder speaks first. Hear my shout! Feel it in your bones.
Match it, if you are Dovahkiin!

TESS155: a fellow thief, and Vald's ex-lover
TESS204: a male thug who only understands gold
TESS209: a powerful woman with criminal connections

plots: the player asked Vex information about Vald

quest.title: Vald's Debt
quest.objective: ask Vald to betray Mercer Frey

ask Vald to betray Mercer Frey
quest.description:
Vald? That pig? Oh, I have info on him. More than you care to know. Vald does not have a good side. The only thing he understands is gold. A man after my own heart.
You can try to buy him off, but he'll ask for a whole lot. I mean, you are asking him to betray Mercer Frey. Your best bet would be to erase his debt with Maven Black-Briar. If you talk to her, she might be able to give you the details.
Of course, you could just run him through and take what you need off of his corpse... I could care less.

plots: Luke wants comfort
the player is a friend of Luke

quest.title: Sweet Dreams
quest.objective: give a green bed to Luke
tasks: obtain a green bed
give a green bed to Luke
quest.description:
I hate working the forge all day long. People should learn to make their tools themselves! Arrgh!
I'm sorry friend. I'm just feeling quite cranky at the moment. My bed is all lumpy and uncomfortable. If only I had a better bed. That would surely improve my mood!
Could you, perhaps, obtain a bed for me? I'd prefer a green bed. Help your friend get rest at night. I'd be even willing to part from 32 emeralds for a good bed.

plots: Lily wants knowledge
the player is an enemy of Lily
the player can get to the Nether with a portal made out of obsidian: take a look at ruined portals scattered around the world

quest.title: Intentional Game Design
quest.objective: try to sleep in a bed in the Nether, and report back to Lily
tasks: Go to Nether.
go to the Nether
try to sleep in a bed in the Nether, and report back to Lily
quest.description:
Why are you talking to me? Can't you just steer clear of me?
If you really want to do something interesting, though, I've got something fun for you. Go to the Nether. You know, the lethal hellish dimension? You can get there with a portal made out of obsidian. Take a look at the various ruined portals dotting the landscape. Try to sleep in a bed there, and report back to me. I'm very interested in hearing the results of this little experiment.
If the things I've heard about the Nether are true that should teach you a lesson... and I'll even give you a shiny diamond.

plots: Mironda is not good with names

quest.title: A Beer for Mironda
quest.objective: bring a cask of Halfling's Help to Mironda
tasks: Go to Trademeet.
get the cask from Old Vyatri
bring a cask of Halfling's Help to Mironda
quest.description:
Name's Mironda. Pleased to see yer face and make its acquaintance. I'm no good with names; if ye can remember mine, ye've already beaten me. I forgot yers by the end of the first syllable.
Maybe it's the wild mage in me comin' out, but I can't stand not tastin' something new once in a while. Most dwarves will drink the same mountain swill from crib to dust-crib, but I'm always hankering for the latest brew. Old Vyatri in Trademeet was just getting a shipment from Luiren I'd dearly love to sample. If ye happen to run by his place in yer travels, get a cask of it for me and I'll pay ye well!
Can't wait to taste it. Halfling's Help, it's called — I hope it works on dwarves, too

TESS794: a farm owned by Hillevi Cruel-Sea's family

tasks: find Wuunferth
deliver a bottle of Nightshade extract to Wuunferth
quest.description:
Everything you see is grown at my family's own Hollyfrost Farm. Fresh and filling.
I also do a little herb growing. The court wizard, Wuunferth, pays us to plant a little Nightshade. Who knows what he uses it for? A poison like that?
Hey, could you deliver this bottle of Nightshade extract to Wuunferth?

TESS705: a retired sailor, giving quest via "Habd's Journal"
TESS706: an old lighthouse on an icy coast

TESS709: a man, Ramati and Habd's son

plots: Habd and Ramati sailed for years from Hammerfell to Solstheim and back: Habd and Ramati bought Frostflow Lighthouse to settle down with Mani and Sudi
things went missing from the cellar and strange noises came from there as well

Habd went away from Frostflow Lighthouse to buy some traps: after returning home, he found out that Ramati was killed by a bug-like creature; Habd killed the creature and went into the cellar to save his family, locking the door behind him

quest.title: A Tragedy at Frostflow
quest.objective: uncover the tragic events inside Frostflow Lighthouse
tasks: Go to Frostflow Lighthouse.
investigate the cellar
uncover the tragic events inside Frostflow Lighthouse
quest.description:
Habd's Journal
by Habd

After years of sailing from Hammerfell to Solstheim and back, Ramati and I have finally saved enough money to buy that old light house we spotted on the coast and we are moving in next month.
These northerners really know how to live. It may be cold, but you can't beat the tranquility of the watching icebergs to live out your silver years. Ramati loves the place too, despite the occasional leaky ceiling. Mani and Sudi, unfortunately, seem miserable here; I know the kids are old enough to strike out on their own, but I hope they'll grow to love the peace and quiet here as I have.
Mani and Sudi continue to bicker and harass each other and they seem to have started in on their mother as well. Ramati keeps finding things missing from the cellar. Sudi said she heard a noise down there but Mani just thinks their mother is going mad from isolation. The very thought of it is ridiculous, she's always wanted to retire here!
Sudi keeps saying that she hears scratching coming from the cellar at night. I think she's just trying to get her mother's goat, but I'd better head into town to get a few traps just in case it's rats. Should only take a couple days. I just hope those two go easy on Ramati while I'm gone.
Oh gods. Oh gods why? I returned home to find my beautiful Ramati killed and this thing, this horrible bug-like creature ransacking our home. I managed to kill the damned thing, I think it might be a demon! I've never seen anything like it! Oh gods poor Ramati. It must have come out of the cellar. I'm going down there and locking the door behind me to make sure they don't escape. I don't know if I'll make it out, but I have to save my family!

BG2103: high priest of the One God
BG2104: in this area, atop a holy altar
in this area, atop a holy altar
BG2106: an artifact, a part of a rod
in this area, atop a holy altar

plots: Gaal will gives the player a key to the inner chambers

quest.title: Serve the One God

quest.description:
I am Gaal, high priest of the One God.
There is... something that you could do that the great one cannot, despite his vast power.
The Unseeing Eye knows of a valuable item in this area.
The item is a rod... or part of a rod, rather, that you will find atop a holy altar. I cannot tell you more than that. You must let your faith guide you.
If you were to venture below, you could prove your worth by retrieving this artifact for him. Do this, and I will allow you into our ranks and the One's divine presence.
I have a key I can give you... This will allow you entrance to the inner chambers through a door a short distance back the way you came, at the sewer passages.

TESO126: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild

As I said, rats. I'm sure she can explain it to you better than I. She lives here in Anvil. Go and talk to her.
Go take care of the rats. Then talk to me. Good luck!

plots: Roe went on a business trip to Amn

tell Mirianne whether you found information about Roe or not
quest.description:
My husband had to make a sudden business trip to Amn and I'm so worried for him.
"Mirianne," he always said, "Mirianne, who knows the road better than old Roe?" But the highways just aren't as safe as they once were and there hasn't been a messenger from Amn here in months.
Could you keep your eyes open along the southern roads and let me know if you find anything?

TESO488: a frustrated woman, and the owner of the Serpent's Wake
TESO490: a haunted ship right beside the player in Anvil

plots: Varulae sent the crew of Serpent's Wake to the Summerset Isle to retrieve Varulae's crystal ball: someone murdered the crew when they came back to Anvil

quest.title: The Ghost Ship of Anvil
quest.objective: return the crystal ball to Varulae
tasks: Go to Serpent's Wake.
get Varulae's crystal ball from a chest in the Serpent's Wake's hold
return the crystal ball to Varulae
quest.description:
This is a travesty. A complete and utter travesty. The crystal ball is just sitting there in the hold, but I'll be damned if I'm going back onboard. And nobody will help me. Nobody! Not with those spirits roaming the decks. I don't suppose you'll help me? No, of course you won't...
Wait... Did you actually say you'd help me? I've been going out of my mind ever since my crew was murdered! This is my ship, you see. The Serpent's Wake. I hired the crew to sail to Summerset Isle to retrieve a family heirloom, my mother's crystal ball. They made the journey, and arrived back all right, but then... Someone murdered them! All of them! Now their spirits are haunting the ship!
The crystal ball is in a chest in the ship's hold, but I can't get to it. I made it as far as the captain's cabin, but the spirits nearly killed me! Get the crystal ball and return it to me here, and I'll make it worth your trouble. Here, you'll need this key. Thank you so much!
There will be a reward waiting for you! It's the captain's enchanted cutlass. I managed to grab it when I was in his cabin, before his spirit chased me out!

TESS425: an Argonian man who wants to marry Keerava

plots: in Black Marsh, tradition dictates Argonians present a potential mate a unique wedding ring to represent their future bond: Talen-Jei already has a gold band for Keerava's wedding ring

help Talen-Jei complete Keerava's wedding ring

I met Keerava when I wandered into Riften a few years ago. Been smitten with her ever since. In fact, I'm thinking of asking her to marry me.
In Black Marsh, tradition dictates we present a potential mate a unique wedding ring to represent our future bond. I already have the gold band, but all I need are three flawless amethysts to complete the setting.

TESO159: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild

find out what is wrong with Rellian, Vantus Prelius, and Dubok gro-Shagk
find out why several of your fellow members of the Fighters Guild are causing trouble in Leyawiin
quest.description:
Back for more work, are you? Good. Some of our boys are causing trouble in Leyawiin. Looks bad for the guild.
Some of your brothers have been getting rowdy at the local tavern. I've got no problem with cutting loose, but I don't like it when we all look bad. You're looking for Rellian, Vantus Prelius, and Dubok gro-Shagk. I haven't had any trouble with them before, so find out what's going on.
I'll be waiting.

plots: Lou wants comfort
the player is a known villain

quest.title: A Distraction for Idle Hands
quest.objective: give a music disc to Lou

give a music disc to Lou

Gee! You okay? *looks at you with a blank expression* You look a dark human-thing.

Get 6 blocks of emerald in return.

TESO545: Erline's husband, who was killed by Raynil Dralas

plots: Raynil Dralas killed Bradon in Bradon and Erline's home: the Bruma city watch found the body of a dead beggar in Bradon and Erline's's home afterwards
Raynil Dralas convinced Carius that Bradon was a vampire
no one has seen Bradon out in the daylight: Erline explains that Bradon works at night and sleeps on days
Erline has seen Raynil Dralas before

quest.title: A Brotherhood Betrayed
quest.objective: clear Bradon's name
tasks: find Raynil Dralas, and make him tell you the truth about Bradon's supposed vampirism
clear Bradon's name
quest.description:
I can't believe this is happening. Please... please. I need your help. My husband was no vampire! It's ridiculous! No one will listen to me! Forgive me. I loved my husband dearly, and to lose him this way makes no sense. Anything you can do to help would be wonderful. This is all happening so fast.
I came home only just a few hours ago. I found the door open, and my Bradon dead. Standing over him was a Dunmer. I screamed and ran out into the street. Some city watch were nearby and heard me I suppose, as they arrived quickly. I heard the Dunmer identify himself as Raynil Dralas. He said he was a vampire hunter and that Bradon was his mark. The guards seemed to know about Raynil, and after a search of the house, the body of some beggar was found stashed in our basement. The guards sent for Carius, who is an investigator for crimes here in Bruma. In minutes, Raynil convinced Carius that Bradon was a vampire.
Why would he stash a body in his own house? That's ridiculous! And another thing. The guards are making a big deal out of no one seeing Bradon out in the daylight. Well of course that's the case! He works at night, and has to sleep during the day. Why does that make him a vampire? It's all that Raynil character. I don't trust him. The thing that bothers me the most is that I swear I've seen him before. Of course he says he's never been here. Look, there isn't much more to say. Please... help me clear my husband's name.
Just find Raynil Dralas, and make him tell you the truth. I swear, he's a liar!

TESS55: a member of the Thieves Guild
TESS325: a woman who has not paid her debts to the Thieves Guild
TESS326: a man who has not paid her debts to the Thieves Guild
TESS327: a woman who has not paid her debts to the Thieves Guild

plots: the player and Brynjolf did a little thievery at the market

quest.title: Taking Care of Business

tasks: collect some debts from Keerava, Bersi Honey-Hand, and Haelga without killing them
send a message that the Thieves Guild is not to be ignored
quest.description:
Well, well... Color me impressed kid. I wasn't certain I'd ever see you again!
So... now that I've whetted your appetite with our little scheme at the market, how about handling a few deadbeats for me? They are Keerava, Bersi Honey-Hand and Haelga.
They owe our organization some serious coin and they've decided not to pay. I want you to explain to them the error of their ways. Do this right, and I can promise you a permanent place in our organization.
Honestly, the debt is secondary here. What's more important is that you get the message across that we aren't to be ignored. A word of warning though... I don't want any of them killed. Bad for business.

plots: Thorley Aethelred built a fence around his sheep: it did not help with his bear problem

quest.title: Bear Season
quest.objective: bring the fangs of the 6 West Weald Bears as proof to Thorley Aethelred
tasks: kill 6 West Weald Bears to protect Thorley Aethelred's flock of sheep
bring the fangs of the 6 West Weald Bears as proof to Thorley Aethelred
quest.description:
It seems I'm having a bear problem and I just don't know what to do.
I've had attacks on my small flock of sheep lately. I was hoping that building a fence would solve the problem, but it hasn't helped at all. Then, one day when I was just about to step outside, I saw the culprits. A group of West Weald Bears was dragging away a sheep carcass. There's no way I can fight those ferocious beasts off on my own.
If you could thin the population a bit, they would probably leave the area. Kill six of the things, bring me their fangs as proof, and I'll reward you well.
Please, you're my only hope.

TESS348: an injured woman, and a good daughter

deliver a satchel of letters to Verner
make a delivery for Sylgja to her parents
quest.description:
Would you happen to be headed towards Darkwater Crossing?
My parents live there. I usually make the journey to bring them gifts and to just say hello, but I haven't been well lately.
I've written some letters and placed them in a satchel. Perhaps you wouldn't mind delivering it to them on my behalf? I would insist on rewarding you for your time.
Here, take my satchel and give it to my father, Verner. He'll likely have something for you to bring back.

TESS203: the player's guildleader in the Thieves Guild

squeeze Gulum-Ei for information

Gulum-Ei is our inside man at the East Empire Company in Solitude. I'm betting he acted as a go-between for the sale of Goldenglow Estate and that he can finger our buyer.
Get out there, shake him down and see what you come up with. Talk to Brynjolf before you leave if you have any questions.

TESS513: the goddess of love and compassion

plots: Senna wakes the player up: the player does not remember anything about coming to the Temple of Dibella, blathering about marriage or a goat, and throwing trash all over the Temple of Dibella

quest.title: A Night to Remember
quest.objective: find Sam as you recover from a bad hangover

find Sam as you recover from a bad hangover
quest.description:
Wake up! That's right, it's time to wake up, you drunken blasphemer!
Of course! You don't remember getting here. I'm guessing you also don't remember coming in here and blathering incoherently about marriage or a goat. Which means you don't remember losing your temper and throwing trash all over the temple.
You want to know where your friend Sam has gone? Dibella teaches love and compassion, but that doesn't mean we're just going to tell you what you want to know and let you walk away from this. Pick up your mess, then apologize, and if we think you're sincere we'll consider lending you aid.

plots: Captain Wayfinder's mother ran the Sea Squall as strictly as she ran the house

quest.title: Salty Sea-Dogs

tasks: find the Fine-Cut Void Salts
bring Fine-Cut Void Salts back to Captain Wayfinder
quest.description:
I am a sea captain by inheritance, as my men are fond of saying. Can't blame them, my mother ran the Sea Squall as strictly as she ran the house.
I've been trying to find new areas of business, trying to win the sailors' respect, but I keep having problems. Take the last trade we did. Some Fine-Cut Void Salts from the College of Winterhold. Plenty of coin if you know who to sell it to.
What happened to the Salts? Sailors are what happened to them. They got drunk and ended up losing the merchandise in some cave. If you're not afraid of little exploring, I'll pay good gold to get those Salts.

MC54: a mysterious, hard to reach dimension
MC55: strange fruits that might teleport the player a short distance when eaten

find 6 Chorus Fruits
bring 6 Chorus Fruits to Kevin
quest.description:
Traveler! Did you know that our dimension is one among many. There exists a dimension called "The End". It is a mysterious place, and supposedly hard to reach.
I yearn to know more about that dimension. I have heard vague rumors about fruits native to the End that might teleport you a tiny distance when digested. They are called Chorus Fruits.
If you get your hands on six Chorus Fruits, I promise to reward you well with 12 diamonds. Please help a man sate his ever-growing curiosity.

TESO144: the player's superior in the Thieves Guild
TESO147: male captain of the city watch

plots: the player is the newest member of the Thieves Guild

quest.title: Untaxing the Poor

steal back the taxes of the poor Waterfront citizens
quest.description:
Ah! Our newest member. I'm glad you stopped by. I have a... situation that you might be able to help with.
The Gray Fox has asked me to take care of a problem, and I'm putting you on it. Hieronymus Lex actually collected taxes from everyone living here on the Waterfront! Your job is to recover those taxes.
The people of the waterfront are very poor. Traditionally the city has not collected taxes from them, even though by law they could. The money the city would collect would barely cover the cost of collecting. The Gray Fox has always guaranteed protection to the poor of the waterfront. He doesn't want to let this injustice stand. It's a matter of principle.
Find out where Hieronymus Lex is keeping the taxes and bring them to me. I'll also need the tax records of what each citizen paid so we can return it.

Then I might forgive you. And I may even give you a small reward on top of that: 32 melons that I grew myself.

mushroom fields, and dimly lit places

My momma is allergic to mushrooms. I can't ever get delicious mushroom stew at home.

BG2202: the main character of the play

quest.title: Who's the Big Star?

do not upset the member of the city council who is among the audience of the play
quest.description:
Ooooh... my patron... We have a real problem. A very large problem. A gigantic problem!
One of... one of the council members is here... or, at least, I believe he is one! On opening night! This... this could make or break the playhouse! And Zaren... Zaren is ill! Deathly ill! He cannot even move from his bed! I see only one chance... it's too late for anything else... You must play Velden. You are a bard, naturally gifted... you observed our rehearsals.
Please, my patron, I'm begging you! This could be the biggest chance for all of us! And... and we mustn't upset the council member! PLEASE, you must do it!

TESO77: one of Sir Casimir's fellow knights at the Order
TESO166: the god of mercy, and one of the Nine

plots: Sir Casimir followed Sir Berich into a war after the Order fractured
the war changed Sir Casimir: he no longer had sympathy for the weak, or pity for the suffering
after the war, Sir Casimir tried to serve the Nine at the Chapel of Stendarr in Chorrol
Sir Casimir was cursed after killing a beggar at the Chapel of Stendarr: he was weak, constantly weary, and lacked the energy to do almost anything
the Gauntlets of the Crusader slipped from Sir Casimir's hands after killing the beggar: they are still in the Chapel of Stendarr, too heavy to move

quest.title: Stendarr's Mercy
quest.objective: retrieve the Gauntlets of the Crusader for yourself
tasks: Go to Chorrol.
talk to the priests of Stendarr
retrieve the Gauntlets of the Crusader for yourself
quest.description:
I, Sir Casimir, know where you may find the Gauntlets of the Crusader, for I was the one who lost them when I was still alive. Though many know where they are, they are still lost. I believe there is something you must do in order to retrieve them.
When the Order fractured, I followed Sir Berich into war, taking the Gauntlets with me. When it was over, I returned to this land. I attempted to return to the service of the Nine, but the war had changed me. I no longer had sympathy for the weak, or pity for the suffering. In the brief time I was there, I did more to hurt the Chapel of Stendarr than help it. It was there that I was cursed.
A beggar who came to the Chapel each day for help tried my patience one too many times. I lost my temper, and struck him. My blow landed harder than I had intended, and he fell to the floor, dead. Killed in the very Chapel of the God of Mercy. I left the Chapel at once, of course, but the damage was done. I was weak, constantly weary, and lacked the energy to do almost anything.
As proof of the deed, when I struck the poor man the Gauntlets slipped right off my hands and fell to the floor. Heavy as stone, they would not move. None could lift them. I suspect they lie there still, in Chorrol's Chapel. You must prove to Stendarr you are worthy to lift the Gauntlets once more. Seek out the priests of Stendarr in Chorrol. Perhaps they can help you.

TESS417: the second councilor of Raven Rock, and a loyal underling of Councilor Morvayn
TESS419: the nobleman who rules over Raven Rock, a member of House Redoran

plots: the player has helped Raven Rock before
the Ulen Family has placed a deathmark on Councilor Morvayn's head

quest.title: Served Cold
quest.objective: search Raven Rock and root out traitors who want to assassinate Councilor Morvayn
tasks: Go to Retching Netch Cornerclub.
talk to Geldis Sadri and check out any leads he provides you
search Raven Rock and root out traitors who want to assassinate Councilor Morvayn
quest.description:
After everything you've already done for Raven Rock, I hate to ask for more but I can't risk Councilor Morvayn being killed.
The Ulen Family of House Hlaalu, a rival Great House, has placed a deathmark on the Councilor's head. I need you to start out by being my eyes and ears... search Raven Rock and see if you can root out these traitors.
The best place to start would be Geldis Sadri over at the Retching Netch Cornerclub. If he provides you any leads, check them out before bringing them to my attention. I can't afford to make any mistakes.

TL28: a grateful man who injured his leg

plots: the player told Finnas that the player came here to rescue him, Snowbell and Sunbeam

quest.title: The Not-So-Lost Husband
quest.objective: tell Bellethe that Finnas is okay
tasks: take Snowbell and Sunbeam to Bellethe
tell Bellethe that Finnas is okay
quest.description:
You ... you came to rescue us?  Thank the guardians!
I've managed to keep Snowbell and Sunbeam safe up here, but I injured my leg. I can't make my way out of this cave while carrying them. If you'll take them to Bellethe, I'll follow you out at my own pace. Tell Bellethe that I'm okay. My thanks to you for your help!

plots: Avrusa Sarethi is keeping a a tight rein on Aduri

quest.title: Smooth Jazbay
quest.objective: collect 20 Jazbay Grapes for  Avrusa Sarethi so that she can cultivate her supply of Nirnroot
tasks: find 20 Jazbay Grapes
collect 20 Jazbay Grapes for  Avrusa Sarethi so that she can cultivate her supply of Nirnroot
quest.description:
Sigh. I've got my hands full here. Between the farm chores, cultivating my supply of Nirnroot and keeping a tight rein on my sister Aduri, there's little time for rest.
Could you help me? One of the ingredients I need to cultivate Nirnroot are Jazbay Grapes... the acidic content of the juice is perfect for the soil. I need twenty of them for my current crop.
I'll give you something for your efforts... finding all of them might not be easy... or cheap.

BG2197: the lead female role in "The Sorcerer's Bane"
BG2198: a grand epic about the pride of a great sorcerer and the love that is his downfall

plots: the player is Higgold's patron
Higgold has gathered together a play and a troupe of actors like he promised: the play is "The Sorcerer's Bane"
Higgold shall introduce the player both actresses and the rest of the actors

quest.title: Who to Star
quest.objective: choose who will play Karenina
tasks: choose between two female actresses who are desperate for the part of Karenina
choose who will play Karenina
quest.description:
It is good to see you again, my patron. I have managed to gather together a play as well as a troupe of actors, as I promised.
They are a fine lot. I have worked with some, and they should serve well. As for the play, I have come across a translated copy of, uh, "The Sorcerer's Bane." You will like it, my patron. A grand epic about the pride of a great sorcerer and the love that is his downfall. Seldom performed, but well attended when it is.
The only problem I am having is deciding who will play Karenina, the lead female role. There are two actresses in the troupe who are desperate for the part. I know them both well and cannot decide, so I shall leave the choice to you. Here... I shall introduce you to both of them, as well as the rest of the actors.

BG1236: a showy adventurer and tour guide
BG133: a dangerous tower filled with traps

plots: Ike Cascadion Vendar is leading a tour to Durlag's Tower
the tour to Durlag's Tower costs 60 gold

quest.title: A Tour of Durlag's Tower
quest.objective: take a tour to Durlag's Tower
tasks: buy a tour to Durlag's Tower from Ike Cascadion Vendar
take a tour to Durlag's Tower
quest.description:
Step right up folks and HEAR the tale of dread placed before thee. Join with me as I, adventurer extraordinaire Ike Cascadion Vendar, lead yet another group of brave souls through the very SEAT of danger in the realms. To Durlag's Tower we shall go, and witness the perils that have taken the lives of hundreds of courageous men and women.
SEE the horror of the treacherous traps! FEEL the presence of the long languishing dead! MARVEL at the wondrous wealth buried below! NOT for the weak of spirit as I will NOT be held accountable for any heart failure during OR after our expedition! Step up, step up! One at a TIME!
A special package deal of 60 gold for you, not that you would need a discount.

TESS550: a cave that is said to be haunted because of Potema the Wolf Queen's necromantic rituals some 500 years ago

plots: Falk Firebeard thinks that checking out the Wolfskull Cave is not worth his time with the war going on

quest.title: The Man Who Cried Wolf
quest.objective: investigate the reports of strange happenings near Wolfskull Cave
tasks: Go to Wolfskull Cave.
clear out the Wolfskull Cave
investigate the reports of strange happenings near Wolfskull Cave
quest.description:
There have been reports of weird happenings near Wolfskull Cave. Travelers disappearing, odd lights. I suspect wild animals or perhaps bandits.
The cave has a bad history. Long ago, Potema the Wolf Queen used it for necromantic rituals. That's where it got the name. That was over 500 years ago. Nothing much down there now - but everyone's always convinced the cave is haunted.
I don't think it's worth our time with the war going on, but if you want to clear out the cave, I'll make sure you're repaid for your work.

TESS71: the player's commanding officer in the Imperial Legion
TESS848: the Jarl's corrupt female steward who has secret arrangements with the Thieves Guild

plots: the Jarl's men will arrest the player if they find the player in Anuriel's private quarters

find evidence about Anuriel's corrupt activities in her private quarters, and use it to blackmail her
use Anuriel to gain intelligence on the Stormcloaks
quest.description:
You're going to Riften. My spies report the Jarl's Steward, Anuriel, has arrangements with the Thieves Guild that would be rather embarrassing if made public.
I need you to find evidence of her corrupt activities, and use it to gain a measure of her "cooperation."
This will require stealth and discretion. The Jarl's guards won't take kindly to anyone rummaging through the steward's private quarters.

TESS196: a male member of the Companions

plots: the player told Kodlak Whitemane that they want to join the Companions

quest.title: Take Up Arms
quest.objective: prove that you are worthy of joining the Companions
tasks: go with Vilkas out to the yard, and let him see what you can do
prove that you are worthy of joining the Companions
quest.description:
You would like to join the Companions? Would you now? Here, let me have a look at you. Hm. Yes, perhaps. A certain strength of spirit.
How are you in a battle, child? Don't feel like you need to show off for our sake. Vilkas, here, will be the one testing your mettle.
Let Vilkas take you out to the yard and see what you can do.

TESS583: a haunted barrow on the east side of Ivarstead

plots: Wyndelius went into Shroud Hearth Barrow two years ago: Wilhelm warned him not to go in there
Wyndelius was never seen again

quest.title: Lifting the Shroud
quest.objective: investigate Shroud Hearth Barrow
tasks: Go to Shroud Hearth Barrow.
go to the barrow
investigate Shroud Hearth Barrow
quest.description:
If I were you, I'd keep away from the barrow on the east side of town...
There ain't much more to tell... it's haunted and you should stay away. Look, I've seen one of the spirits with my very own eyes. When it glared at me, I swear it burned right through my soul.
Fortunately, the spirits seem to be sticking to the barrow. I think they're guarding it. Certainly isn't helping my business any; who'd want to rent a room anywhere near a haunted barrow?
If you think there's anything you can do, be my guest. About a year or two ago, some fella named Wyndelius came through; said he was some kind of a treasure hunter. I warned him not to go in there, just like I warned you. The very next night we heard screams from the barrow, and that was it. We never saw him again.

TESS41: the Lord of the player and Garan Marethi's vampire clan
TESS936: a chalice that is able to increase the potency of the player's vampiric powers

plots: the player told Garan Marethi that Harkon wants the Bloodstone Chalice without addressing Harkon properly as Lord Harkon
