help J'zargo test his new spells
quest.description:
Can you... can you possibly help J'zargo? You must be very skilled with magic, yes? J'zargo is working hard, but cannot do it alone.
J'zargo has worked hard on learning new spells, trying new things. This will make J'zargo stand out as a mage. But J'zargo works so hard, there is no time to test these new spells.
If you help with the testing, this will make learning easier. J'zargo will give you scrolls, you will use them and report the results. This is a good plan, no? Let's see... this one, I think. J'zargo has designed it to be an excellent flame cloak, with a twist. It is especially potent against the undead, and should burn them to a crisp in no time. J'zargo gives you plenty of these scrolls, so you try them and return when you can say whether they work.

plots: the player told Regulus Terentius that they are looking to buy a house in Bravil
Nilawen sells furnishings

quest.title: Buying a house in Bravil
quest.objective: purchase the house in Bravil
tasks: pay 4,000 gold to Regulus Terentius
purchase the house in Bravil
quest.description:
Regulus Terentius, Count of Bravil. So you're looking for a house to buy here in Bravil? Really?
It just so happens there is a modest shack overlooking the canal. It's not much to look at, but the smell will soon make you forget how ugly it is. Pay me 4,000 gold, and it's all yours.
I'll have my steward register the deed of ownership. It's squalid little shack, I'm sorry to say. Oh, and the place is fairly bare. If I were you, I'd head on over to Nilawen at The Fair Deal and get some furnishings. Or you could always eat off the floor... doesn't matter to me.

MC89: [Enemy] green monsters that sneak up on people and try to blow them up along with them
MC90: a special bow crafted by Jack

plots: Jack wants knowledge

quest.title: Bowing Down Creepers
quest.objective: test out the Awesome Bow, and report back to Jack
tasks: kill 15 Creepers with the Awesome Bow
test out the Awesome Bow, and report back to Jack
quest.description:
I'm a fletcher. Bows and arrows are my domain.
In fact, I've just crafted a special Bow I've dubbed the "Awesome Bow". I just need someone to test it out.
You could be just the right person for the job. Go, and kill 15 Creepers with the Awesome Bow. I friggin' hate those green suicide bombing monsters! I'll have 32 emeralds for you, as a tester's fee.

TESO262: a male gate guard who has seen the spies
TESO263: a male captain of the guard

plots: the gate guards have reported seeing strangers on the road for the past several nights: Jauffre cannot leave Cloud Ruler undefended while his men search the whole mountainside
Jauffre has asked the Countess of Bruma to have the guard keep an eye out for strangers

quest.title: Spies
quest.objective: track down the spies, kill them and find out what they know
tasks: Go to Bruma.
talk to Steffan
talk to Captain Burd
track down the spies, kill them and find out what they know
quest.description:
I hope you can help. The gate guards have reported seeing strangers on the road for the past several nights.
I cannot leave Cloud Ruler undefended while my men search the whole mountainside, but these spies must be eliminated. Talk to Steffan. He can tell you where he has seen them. Captain Burd in Bruma may also be able to help. I've asked the authorities of Bruma to have the guard keep an eye out for strangers.
Track down the spies and kill them. Find out what they know, and what they're planning, if possible.

TESS491: a Breton man, and a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

plots: Esmond Tyne stole Glover Mallory's bonemold formula
Esmond Tyne talked about trying to fence goods to the Rieklings at Castle Karstaag

quest.title: Paid in Full
quest.objective: recover the bonemold formula for Glover Mallory
tasks: Go to Castle Karstaag.
find the bonemold formula
recover the bonemold formula for Glover Mallory
quest.description:
Eager to make some coin, eh? That's the spirit. I'll tell you what. The Guild's got a problem out here that I've been trying to deal with for years, but haven't been able to handle.
A fellow Breton who went by the name Esmond Tyne showed up on my doorstep about a fortnight ago. He stole something from me: my own formula for improved bonemold. Took me years to perfect.
Before he ran off, he was talking some nonsense about trying to fence goods to the Rieklings at Castle Karstaag. I told him he was crazy to even think about talking to those vicious little buggers, but he wouldn't listen. I'd bet a fat purse of coin that he's either dead or hiding out up there.

TESO46: a store in the Market District

plots: the player told Vinicia Melissaeia that they want to buy a house in the Imperial City
Sergius Verus can sell the player some furnishings for the house

quest.title: Shack for Sale
quest.objective: purchase the house in the Imperial City
tasks: give Vinicia Melissaeia 2,000 septims
purchase the house in the Imperial City
quest.description:
Vinicia Melissaeia, Office of Imperial Commerce. You desire a house in the Imperial City?
Why? I mean... of course. All I have available right now is a hovel on the Waterfront. It's yours for mere 2,000 septims. You may give those septims to me.
You'll find the house in the Waterfront District. It's not much to look at. You may want to spruce it up a bit with some furnishings. I'd suggest talking to Sergius Verus at Three Brothers Trade Goods in the Market District.

TESS95: the player's superior in the Companions
TESS15: a fellow member of the Companions, a man

plots: Farkas will answer the player's questions about the Companions

quest.title: Proving Honor
quest.objective: complete your trial of claiming a fragment of Wuuthrad
tasks: Go to Dustman's Cairn.
claim another fragment of Wuuthrad with Farkas
complete your trial of claiming a fragment of Wuuthrad
quest.description:
We have something special for you this time.
Last week a scholar came to us. He said he knew where we could find another fragment of Wuuthrad. He seemed a fool to me, but if he's right, the honor of the Companions demands that we seek it out in Dustman's Cairn.
This is a simple errand, but the time is right for it to be your Trial. Carry yourself with honor, and you'll become a true Companion. Farkas will be your Shield-Sibling on this venture, whelp. He'll answer any questions you have.
Try not to disappoint. Or to get Farkas killed.

plots: half-ogres wounded Bjornin

quest.title: Half-ogres Near Beregost
quest.objective: kill the half-ogres who battled Bjornin
tasks: Go to .
find half-ogres
kill the half-ogres who battled Bjornin
quest.description:
I'm still healing from my latest encounters. They did quite a number on me, those half-ogres. There's a band of them fortifying themselves in the mountains south-southwest of here...
If you could give them a taste of justice by testing your steel against them, that would do me, Bjornin, proud.
In an effort to encourage such deeds of righteousness, allow me to present to you this shield as a reward upon your return...

plots: the player is a ranger
Delon has been looking for the player again
Imnesvale is in danger again: Umar has threatened to kill everyone if they don't leave
the Minister will tell the player everything

quest.title: Umar the Witch
quest.objective: deal with Umar
tasks: Go to Imnesvale.
talk to the Minister
deal with Umar
quest.description:
Hey! It's me, Delon. I... I've found you again, my noble ranger! It's... it's so hard to find you sometimes! The... the village is in danger again! The Minister has asked for you!
It's Umar! The witch! She's come back, and she's threatened to kill everyone if they don't go an' leave right now! The... the Minister says he will tell you everything!

plots: Urag gro-Shub gives the player a note that tells the player the location of the book

quest.title: Fetch Me That Book!
quest.objective: find a book for Urag gro-Shub
tasks: read the note
find a book for Urag gro-Shub
quest.description:
If you're feeling adventurous, I'm always looking for someone to procure valuable books from some more... dangerous locations.
Here, I scribbled down the last place I'd heard about. Check it out, but be careful.

TESS830: the wisewoman of the orc clan
TESS832: the male chief of the orc clan, who was a strong and proud warrior

plots: Yamarz became weak: the giants sense Yamarz's weakness, and intrude on the orc clan's territory
Atub must petition Malacath for relief: the ritual must be done at the walled orc camp

quest.title: The Cursed Tribe
quest.objective: Help lift the curse placed on Yamarz
tasks: bring Troll Fat and a Daedra Heart to Atub
Help lift the curse placed on Yamarz
quest.description:
Please, our tribe suffers and we need help.
Our Chief, Yamarz, was once a strong and proud warrior. Now he is stricken, cursed. He is weak, and so our tribe is weak. The giants sense this, and intrude on our territory. Now they assault our very home.
Yamarz refuses help, but I sense that you may be just what we need. He has demanded we stay inside the walls. We cannot leave. I must petition Malacath for relief. This curse must be lifted. But I cannot travel to Malacath's shrine. The ritual must be done here, and I do not have the materials I need.
I beg of you, can you bring me Troll Fat and a Daedra Heart? I have no wish to depend on a stranger, but I have no choice.

TESO67: a polite former Knight of the Thorn from Cyrodiil
TESO73: a small, round gold medallion, with an inscription "To Pyke, from Farwil" on the back

plots: Pyke made his way to the Shivering Isles as soon as he heard the gates to the Shivering Isles open
Pyke will mark the Fetid Grove on the player's map

quest.title: To Help A Hero
quest.objective: bring Pyke's gold medallion back to him
tasks: Go to Fetid Grove.
retrieve Pyke's gold medallion from Grummites
bring Pyke's gold medallion back to him
quest.description:
It's good to meet you. The name's Pyke, and I welcome you to my humble home. Please, make yourself comfortable.
Since you're here, I was wondering... do you think you could assist me? I'm having a bit of a crisis.
I was a Knight of the Thorn from Cyrodiil. As soon as I heard the gates to the Shivering Isles opened, I knew a threat was lurking inside. I made my way here and began exploring this strange place. As I was passing Fetid Grove, I was waylaid. Some dastardly Grummites stole my most prized possession... my medallion that signified my membership in the Knights. It's a small, round, gold medallion. On the back is the inscription "To Pyke, from Farwil".
Could you bring back my medallion from the Grummites at Fetid Grove? I will mark Fetid Grove on your map. You could have Thorn Shield as a reward. Good luck to you, friend!

TESS28: the player's leader in the Dawnguard
TESS33: a Jarl holding his court in Windhelm

plots: Brunwulf Free-Winter's guards are unaware of the threat, and will treat violence against the visiting advisor as a crime

quest.title: A Jarl's Justice
quest.objective: kill a vampire masquerading as a visiting advisor in Brunwulf Free-Winter's court
tasks: Go to Windhelm.
convince Brunwulf Free-Winter that the visiting advisor is a threat to him
kill a vampire masquerading as a visiting advisor in Brunwulf Free-Winter's court
quest.description:
Jarl Brunwulf Free-Winter is in danger. A vampire plays as a visiting "advisor" to the court of Windhelm. Destroy it before it's able to complete its foul business.
But be warned. The Jarl's guards are unaware of the threat, and will treat violence against this "advisor" as a crime. Convince the Jarl of the threat and he'll let you destroy the creature. If not, then do your best not to get caught.
Quickly now! The longer you delay, the more danger the Jarl is in.

TESS40: Serana's family's home, on an island to the west of Solitude

plots: the player asked Serana why she was sealed inside a tomb
Serana and her father don't get along

quest.title: Homecoming
quest.objective: help Serana back to Castle Volkihar
tasks: find a boat that takes you and Serana to Castle Volkihar
help Serana back to Castle Volkihar
quest.description:
That's... complicated. And I'm not totally sure if I can trust you. But if you want to know the whole story, help me get back to my family's home.
My family used to live on an island to the west of Solitude. Not the most welcoming place, but depending on whose around, I'll be safe there. My father and I don't really get along. Ugh, saying it out loud makes it sound so... common. "Little girl who doesn't get along with her father." Read that story a hundred times.
Hopefully we can find a boat to take us to my family's home.

TESO378: the lady of decay, one of the Daedric Princes
TESO380: the god of the cycle of birth and death

plots: the player has approached Namira's shrine
Forgotten have lived in peace for many years worshiping Namira from the dark, basking in their misery and filth: priests of Arkay seek to bring light to the Forgotten's darkness

quest.title: Namira Versus the Priests of Arkay
quest.objective: assist Forgotten in eliminating some priests of Arkay
tasks: Go to Anga.
cast a spell Namira gives you upon the priests of Arkay, and let Forgotten kill the priests
assist Forgotten in eliminating some priests of Arkay
quest.description:
You dare approach Namira's shrine, Child of the Light? You, who walk this plane basking in the light of the warm, cruel sun?
Prove to me that you deserve my favor. In Anga, my Forgotten have lived in peace for many years. They worship me from the dark, basking in their misery and filth. Now, though, some would seek to bring light to their darkness.
Priests of Arkay have intruded upon their squalor. I want you to help my Forgotten kill these priests of the Light. Cast this spell upon the priests. Allow my beloved Forgotten to kill the interlopers. When this is done, I shall reward you for your efforts.
You shall have my ring. Let it bring pain to others who would wish it upon you.

TESO238: the player's superior in the Thieves Guild
TESO394: a poor district in the Imperial City
TESO395: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild, a woman
TESO147: the male captain of the Imperial Watch
TESO146: a legendary thief and defender of the poor, and the guildleader of the Thieves Guild

plots: Hieronymus Lex and the Imperial Watch have invaded the Imperial City Waterfront: Hieronymus Lex has vowed not to leave until the Gray Fox is in custody

quest.title: Misdirection
quest.objective: help the Thieves Guild get the Imperial City Waterfront back to normal
tasks: Go to Imperial City.
find Methredhel, who is co-ordinating the Thieves Guild's response
help the Thieves Guild get the Imperial City Waterfront back to normal
quest.description:
I have a small problem that you may be able to help with. The guild will even pay a reward.
That buffoon, Hieronymus Lex, has invaded the Imperial City Waterfront. Imperial Watch guards from all over the city prowl the streets. Hieronymus Lex has vowed not to leave until the Gray Fox is in custody. The Fox is safe, but the Thieves Guild cannot do business like this. The poor of the Waterfront are kindred to the Gray Fox, and will not betray him. However, cubs soon get hungry. Soon someone will break. Many guild members could be jailed.
Find Methredhel in the Imperial City. She is co-ordinating the guild's response. Shadow hide the hunter.

plots: Big Head will give the player his charm so that the player can speak with Bolwing

quest.title: The Fork of Horripilation
quest.objective: find the Fork of Horripilation for Big Head
tasks: talk to Bolwing to hear his secret
find the Fork of Horripilation for Big Head
quest.description:
Sing for Big Head.
The Fork for Big Head. Oh, where has Master put the Fork? It sings alone. Far from home. Sad, sad Fork. Sad, sad Big Head.
The Fork! The precious, precious fork! Hear how it sings to Big Head! Beautiful, perfect Fork of Horripilation! But it is gone. Gone, gone, gone. No more singing. No more ringing. Taken from Big Head, never returned. That is when Big Head came here. Master brought me! Whispered shouts into my ear! Songs of Madgods! Songs of bad gods! Softly, Master. Softly.
It went away. But it will come back! It always comes back! It is close. Big Head can hear it! The Fork of Horripilation! Hear it singing! Songs of home! It comes again. It brings presents! It is not present. Soon it will be! You will find it! Bring the Fork! Hear the music. Music of toads. Music of roads! Sing to yourself, so all can hear!
Talk to the beggar! Talk to Bolwing! He knows secrets, but no one can hear them. No one but Big Head. Take Big Head's charm! Listen to Bolwing! His tongue is tied, but his mind is unraveled! He'll tell you the secret. Who has the Fork?

plots: Quintus Navale has thought about repairing the White Phial
Nurelion was obsessed with the White Phial: his obsession consumed him

quest.title: Repairing the Phial
quest.objective: acquire the materials necessary to repair the White Phial
tasks: Go to Throat of the World.
get unmelting snow
get mammoth tusk powder
get a briar heart
acquire the materials necessary to repair the White Phial
quest.description:
I have some thoughts about repairing the White Phial. There are three crucial elements. Some may be easier to find than others.
On the top of the Throat of the World is a patch of unmelting snow. No heat can touch it. Then we need the tusk of a mammoth, ground to a fine powder as only the giants know how. The final step is tricky. It requires the briar heart from a Forsworn of the Reach.
If you can bring me these materials, the Phial can again be made whole. You can keep the White Phial after I have repaired it. I fear keeping the Phial would just remind me of Nurelion's obsession, and how it consumed him.

TESO494: a camp on the shore of Niben Bay
TESO495: a harmless, sad ghost of a sailor

plots: the player asked Gilgondorin about the Watchman
Gilgondorin pinpoints where the Watchman appears on the player's map

quest.title: The Forlorn Watchman
quest.objective: lay the Watchman to rest
tasks: Go to Bawnwatch Camp.
go see the Watchman at 8 o'clock at night
lay the Watchman to rest
quest.description:
So you want to learn more about the ghostly Watchman?
The Watchman looks like he may have been a sailor. No one knows where he came from, or why he looks so sad. I don't like talking about the dead like they're some kind of tourist attraction, but that spirit has been making his ghostly journey for years now. We've learned to just accept that he's there.
Every night, sure as clockwork, he appears at Bawnwatch Camp at 8 on the shore of Niben Bay. He's never harmed anyone, but most people give him a wide berth. You seem curious enough, so I'll be glad to pinpoint where he appears on your map.

TESO159: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild
TESO230: the son of the guildleader of the Fighters Guild

plots: Modryn Oreyn sent Viranus Donton and some other Fighters Guild members on a troll killing mission to Forsaken Mine: Modryn Oreyn felt that they were up to the task

quest.title: Trolls of Forsaken Mine
quest.objective: find out what happened at Forsaken Mine and report back to Modryn Oreyn
tasks: Go to Forsaken Mine.
find Viranus Donton and other Fighters Guild members who went missing
find out what happened at Forsaken Mine and report back to Modryn Oreyn
quest.description:
I have got another job for you. It's a sensitive one. I need you to find Viranus Donton.
I sent him on a mission to Forsaken Mine. He and some others were supposed to clear the place of trolls. Haven't heard back from them in days. I want you to go check it out. I don't need to tell you how sensitive a matter this is.
We'd been contracted to clear the place of trolls. It was a tough job, but I felt the men I sent were up to it. I want to know what happened.
Get moving, and report back to me as soon as possible.

TESO116: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood
TESO117: a large manor house in Skingrad

plots: the guests falsely believe that they cannot leave Summitmist Manor before finding a chest containing gold and the key to Summitmist Manor
the door to Summitmist Manor will be locked behind the player until the other guests are dead: the doorman will explain the rest

quest.title: Whodunit?
quest.objective: assassinate the other five guests at the party
tasks: Go to Summitmist Manor.
talk to the doorman
assassinate the other five guests at the party
quest.description:
Do you like parties? Because you've been invited to one. Of course you'll be killing all the other guests. Each guest, at some point in the past, wronged their mysterious host. Now he's hired us to exact his revenge. Are you ready to attend?
You need to go to the city of Skingrad, to the large house known as Summitmist Manor. There you will meet up with five very unlucky guests. In order to receive your bonus, you must kill each guest secretly, one by one. If anyone sees you committing murder, the bonus is forfeit. The guests believe there is a chest of gold hidden in the house, and have agreed to be locked inside until one of them finds it. In fact, the guests believe the key to the manor is inside the chest, and only by satisfying their greed will they be allowed to leave. Poor fools. There is, of course, no chest of gold. The guests will find no key. After you arrive, the doors will be locked behind you, as everyone expects. When all the guests lie dead, you will be free to leave.
Now go, see the doorman at Summitmist Manor. He will explain the rest. Have fun.

plots: the player walked on Zordral while he tried to kill Bentha
Zordral believes that Bentha is evil
Zordral thinks that the player is a threat to him and tries to kill the player too

quest.title: Zordral's Witchhunt
quest.objective: save yourself and Bentha from Zordral's wrath
tasks: kill Zordral
save yourself and Bentha from Zordral's wrath
quest.description:
You there, stay back! If any of you come any closer, I'll kill her. I'm serious. Don't make me do it. All I have to do is say the last word of my spell and she'll die.
She's a witch. She'll use her magics to poison the children of this town. She'll butcher the livestock and she'll seduce the young men, make them her puppets. She must be killed!
Are you mocking me?! No one mocks the great Zordral. You will pay for your insolence!

plots: the player brought a power source to Professor Stoker: it is completely drained

quest.title: The Sundered Battlefield
quest.objective: recharge the power source, and return to Professor Stoker to install the power source in the automaton
tasks: Go to Rivenskull Pass.
Go to Sundered Battlefield.
reach the the Sundered Battlefield
find the Emberworks on the far side of the Sundered Battlefield
recharge the power source, and return to Professor Stoker to install the power source in the automaton
quest.description:
Oh, no... I was afraid of this! The Power Source is completely drained! This is going to be more difficult than I'd anticipated. This is only a minor setback. We knew about these Power Sources from our explorations of the Emberworks, on the far side of the Sundered Battlefield. We found machines there that the ancient dwarves once used to craft them. If you can reach the Emberworks, it should be child's play to recharge it.
You'll have to make your way through Rivenskull Pass to reach the battlefield. Once you've charged the Power Source, come back here, and we'll install it in the Automaton.

BG2265: a wizard merchant with magical wares, and a newcomer in this town

plots: Lazarus Librarus' does not have anything for the player to purchase
Lazarus Librarus' spellbook was stolen: he cannot fashion scrolls without his spellbook
Lazarus Librarus suspected Hectan, but he was at the local pub from dusk until dawn the night of the theft

quest.title: Lazarus' Missing Spellbook
quest.objective: return Lazarus Librarus' spellbook to him
tasks: Go to Tankard Tree.
talk to Hectan
return Lazarus Librarus' spellbook to him
quest.description:
Lazarus Librarus at your service. I would normally invite you to look at my magical wares, but alas, my shelves are completely bare. I have not even a single parchment left for you to purchase.
My spellbook has been stolen! Without it, I cannot fashion the powerful scrolls which normally fill my shop. Please, mighty traveler... I beg of you to help a humble wizard! At first, I suspected Hectan... he is well known about town for his sticky fingers. But after questioning many witnesses, it is clear that Hectan was at the local pub from dusk until dawn the night of the theft. I still suspect that no-good thief Hectan was involved — I can clearly see the guilt in his face! But there is no proof. Without my spellbook, I am virtually powerless to pursue this myself, and as a newcomer to this town, I have no one to turn to for help.
I regret that there is little else I can tell you. Hectan can usually be found in the Tankard Tree if you wish to question him.
I urge you godspeed.

TESO135: the player's superior at the Mages Guild
TESO136: one of the Ayleid ruin sites on the eastern side of the province

plots: there are no Necromancers involved in this task

quest.title: Vahtacen's Secret
quest.objective: help with Irlav Jarol's research project at Vahtacen
tasks: Go to Arch Mage's Tower.
talk to Irlav Jarol
help with Irlav Jarol's research project at Vahtacen
quest.description:
I, Raminus Polus, have a new task for you, and I assure you there are no Necromancers involved.
There's a research project going on at Vahtacen, one of the Ayleid ruin sites on the eastern side of the province. Irlav Jarol is in charge of the project, and is apparently in need of some help.
I thought you might need a break, after the things you've been exposed to lately. You can find Irlav here in the Arch Mage's Tower.

TESS250: the secluded home of the Greybeards
hight up the slopes of the Throat of the World
TESS251: hight up the slopes of the Throat of the World
hight up the slopes of the Throat of the World

plots: the player killed a dragon for Balgruuf the Greater and absorbed some kind of power from it
the Greybeards think that the player is a Dragonborn: a Dragonborn is said to be uniquely gifted in the voice - the ability to focus the player's vital essence into a Thu'um, or shout

quest.title: The Way of the Voice
quest.objective: answer the summons of the Greybeards
tasks: reach High Hrothgar
answer the summons of the Greybeards
quest.description:
So when the dragon died, you absorbed some kind of power from it. So it's true. The Greybeards really were summoning you. They are masters of the Way of the Voice. They live in seclusion high on the slopes of the Throat of the World.
Whatever happened when you killed that dragon, it revealed something in you, and the Greybeards heard it. If they think you're Dragonborn, who are we to argue?
The Dragonborn is said to be uniquely gifted in the Voice - the ability to focus your vital essence into a Thu'um, or Shout. If you really are Dragonborn, they can teach you how to use your gift.
You'd better get up to High Hrothgar immediately. There's no refusing the summons of the Greybeards. It's a tremendous honor.

TESS529: a Skaal man in a bad mood
TESS530: a Skaal man, the only blacksmith in the Skaal village

plots: Baldor Iron-Shaper is the keeper of an ancient tradition, the forging of Stalhrim
Deor Woodcutter saw two elves in the far distance, dragging something behind them in the woods on the day Baldor Iron-Shaper disappeared: the elves went south and west

quest.title: A New Source of Stalhrim
quest.objective: find Baldor Iron-Shaper
tasks: search for any sign of Baldor
find Baldor Iron-Shaper
quest.description:
I am in no mood to talk, outsider. One of the Skaal has gone missing. It is Baldor Iron-Shaper. As our only smith, Baldor is very important to the village.
Baldor is the keeper of an ancient tradition, the forging of Stalhrim. It is an art we Skaal hold sacred. If someone wanted to make such weapons, they would have to get that knowledge from Baldor.
I did see something in the woods on the day he disappeared. I saw two elves in the far distance, dragging something behind them. Hunters often visit our lands, so I thought little of it.
The elves went south and west. If your road takes you that way, perhaps you could search for any sign of Baldor. The Skaal would be grateful.

plots: Arkion and Nemphre used to be lovers
Arkion wants Nemphre's Onyx Ring
Nemphre wants Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet

quest.title: Arkion and Nemphre
quest.objective: steal Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet and Nemphre's Onyx Ring, and bring them to Ordulinian
tasks: find Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet and Nemphre's Onyx Ring
steal Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet and Nemphre's Onyx Ring, and bring them to Ordulinian
quest.description:
Ah, fair adventurers, I'm Ordulinian.
The roads of this fair city are lined with fools, are they not? Two of the greatest are Arkion and Nemphre, necromancers grown bitter over lost love. Alas, but they use petty trinkets as their excuse for enmity. Nemphre covets Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet and Arkion dreams of her Onyx Ring. Steal those trinkets and bring them to me and perhaps those two fools can at last find peace.
For your troubles I will give you a Cloak of Non-Detection. It may be of some use to you in the future.

plots: the corrupt watchman took Ruslan's last septim
Luronk and Ruslan were shopping at Jensine's when the corrupt watchman accused them of stealing: the corrupt watchman fined Luronk and Ruslan even though Jensine said that they were innocent
the corrupt watchman has shaken down most of the shopkeepers in the Market District

quest.title: Imperial Corruption
quest.objective: do something about the corrupt watchman
tasks: Go to Market District.
ask around about the corrupt watchman
do something about the corrupt watchman
quest.description:
Hey stranger, can you spare a few coins? I've just been shaken down by that bastard watchman and he took my last septim. I don't know his name, but I'd recognize him if I saw him again.
Luronk and I were shopping at Jensine's when he accused us of stealing. Even Jensine said we were innocent, but he didn't care. We had to pay his "fine" or go to jail.
He's shaken down most of the shopkeepers in the Market District. They're all too afraid of him to do anything. Jensine wouldn't even talk about it.
Someone ought to do something about him.

TESO135: the player's superior in the Mages Guild

plots: the player is an Associate of the Mages Guild
the player has been found guilty of theft: the player's Mages Guild privileges have been suspended

quest.title: Mages Guild Suspension
quest.objective: collect alchemy samples to regain your Mages Guild membership
tasks: deliver 20 Dragon's Tongue and 20 Redwort to Raminus Polus
collect alchemy samples to regain your Mages Guild membership
quest.description:
It is unfortunate that we should meet under these circumstances, Associate. You have been found guilty of theft. As such, your guild privileges have been suspended. If you wish to be reinstated, you must perform a service for the guild. Are you willing to do so?
Make no mistake: this task is simple, but has a purpose. In selflessly serving the guild, at risk to yourself, while putting your own feelings aside, you prove your devotion to the cause. You will help replenish alchemical supplies for the guild.
Deliver 20 Dragon's Tongue flowers, and 20 Redwort flowers to me. Surprised? Annoyed? It is not unexpected. Nevertheless, that is your path to re-acceptance in the guild.

TESS62: the player's commanding officer in the Stormcloaks
TESS433: the man who leads the Stormcloaks, and who has declared himself the High King
TESS625: a crown made from the bones and teeth of ancient dragons that symbolizes the power and might of a High King

plots: the High King always wore the Jagged Crown: the Jagged Crown is said to contain a portion of the power of every king who has worn it

quest.title: The Jagged Crown
quest.objective: find the Jagged Crown for Ulfric
tasks: meet Galmar Stone-Fist and your fellow Stormcloaks
find the Jagged Crown for Ulfric
quest.description:
I've found the final resting place of the Jagged Crown. Can you believe it? Well, I'm almost certain.
The High King always wore the Jagged Crown. It was the symbol of his might and power. The crown is made from the bones and teeth of ancient dragons, and it is said to contain a portion of the power of every king who has worn it. True or not, who would dare deny Ulfric's claim, when the legendary Jagged Crown sits upon his brow?
We're headed to Korvanjund. But, if old King Borgas is indeed buried there, we're bound to run into trouble of some kind. Your fellow Stormcloaks are already assembling outside the tomb. I'll meet you there as soon as I'm finished up here.

plots: Dao genies came to Trademeet
Dao genies are hunting Ihtafeer
Dao genies won't allow trade to occur in Trademeet until Ihtafeer's head is delivered to them

quest.title: Dealing with the Trademeet Genies
quest.objective: investigate the issue with the Dao genies
tasks: talk with Guildmistress Busya about what needs to be done
investigate the issue with the Dao genies
quest.description:
My name is Lord Logan Coprith, and I am the High Merchant of Trademeet.
A group of Dao genies from Calimshan arrived to Trademeet a while ago. They and their gold were welcome enough at first... But in only weeks, they have taken all business and put a stop to it. They are hunting a rakshasa named Ihtafeer and insist that she is present in the town.
The genies will allow no trade to occur until Ihtafeer is found and her head given to them. Why... why they have chosen this particular tactic, I am unsure.
Without proper trade, however, the merchants are penniless. Soon, the food resources will dry up as well, so something must be done... and done soon.
Perhaps you might be able to look into this genie issue for us? Guildmistress Busya in the next room can tell you more about what needs to be done.

TESO20: a worried mother, and a trader
TESO289: an isolated village, south of Chorrol
TESO292: Dar-Ma's beloved female horse, whom Dar-Ma would never abandon

plots: Dar-Ma was supposed to make a delivery to Etira Moslin, because Seed-Neeus was not feeling well
Dar-Ma went with Blossom

quest.title: A Shadow Over Hackdirt
quest.objective: find Dar-Ma
tasks: Go to Hackdirt.
find clues about Dar-Ma's whereabouts from Etira Moslin
find Dar-Ma
quest.description:
I'm Seed-Neeus. I don't mean to impose, but I'm hoping you can help me. My daughter, Dar-Ma is missing and I don't know what to do.
Dar-Ma never came back from Hackdirt. I'm dreadfully worried something may have happened to her. Can you help?
Dar-Ma was supposed to make a delivery to Etira Moslin in Hackdirt, so I would start there. Hackdirt is a rather isolated village, south of Chorrol. We do some business with the trader there. Small volume, but she pays well. Normally I make the deliveries, but I wasn't feeling well so Dar-Ma insisted on going this time. In case it may be useful, she was with Blossom -- her horse, I mean. Dar-Ma loves that animal, and would never willingly abandon her.
If you find my daughter, you have my friendship and gratitude to the end of my days!

plots: Fralia Gray-Mane was told that Thorald was killed in the war against the Empire, but she knows that Thorald is alive: the Battle-Borns know that too

quest.title: Missing In Action
quest.objective: find Thorald
tasks: talk to Fralia Gray-Mane privately about the Battle-Borns and their lies
find Thorald
quest.description:
All I can think about is my son, my Thorald... they say that he was killed, but I know better. I know my son is alive! Those Battle-Borns... they're in with the Imperials. They know it too, and yet they lie to my very face!
It's not wise to discuss how I know about their lies here. Please, if you truly wish to help, meet me at my home. I'll tell you the whole story.

TESO139: the lady of nightmares, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: Arkved stole the Orb from the the dreams of Vaermina's followers: in the Orb, Arkved has found more than he bargained for

quest.title: Vaermina's Orb of Nightmares
quest.objective: retrieve the Orb
tasks: find the Orb
retrieve the Orb
quest.description:
We meet again, mortal, for we have met before, whether you know it or not.
When you mutter in your sleep, you speak to me. When you waken wet with sweat, you've just left my house. I dwell in your dreams; I savor your nightmares. Now, you will serve me.
The wizard Arkved has the Orb of Vaermina... snatched from the dreams of my followers and dragged into the waking world. Travel to his tower and retrieve my Orb. Take care, though, mortal. In the Orb, Arkved has found more than he bargained for.
After proving yourself, mortal, you shall bear my token, the Skull of Corruption.

TESO359: an ancient Ayleid settlement known by a different name today

plots: the player has obtained artifacts for Umbacano before
Umbacano gives the player a sketch depicting the High Fane: the High Fane dates from the Late Ayleid Period, following the fall of White Gold Tower
the drawing on the bottom of the page Umbacano gave the player depicts a carved panel from the central chamber of the High Fane
Umbacano gives the player the key to the inner chamber of the High Fane

quest.title: Nothing You Can Possess
quest.objective: retrieve a decorative carving from the High Fane for Umbacano
tasks: locate the ruins of the High Fane
retrieve a decorative carving from the High Fane for Umbacano
quest.description:
You have proven yourself more than a simple grave robber. I believe you can handle a more complicated assignment. Are you interested?
Here, take a look at this sketch. The ancient texts refer to this site only as the "High Fane." Do you know it? Your first task is to locate the ruins of the High Fane. I believe it must now be known by a different name.
The High Fane dates from the Late Ayleid Period, following the fall of White Gold Tower, a very troubled time for that ancient people. A time I find most fascinating. The drawing on the bottom of the page I gave you depicts a carved panel from the central chamber of the High Fane. I believe this carving will shed new light on Ayleid history, if I am able to examine it closely. I would like you to retrieve it for me.
You will need this as well. It is the key to the inner chamber of the High Fane. I part with it reluctantly, so guard it well. It is what began my search for the High Fane, many years ago.

TESO277: an annoyed man, drinking his sorrows away

plots: Reynald Jemane has never been to Cheydinhal

quest.title: Separated at Birth
quest.objective: investigate the rumors about another Reynald Jemane in Cheydinhal
tasks: Go to Cheydinhal.
find the person whose impersonating Reynald Jemane and tell him to stop
investigate the rumors about another Reynald Jemane in Cheydinhal
quest.description:
If I've told you once, I've told you a thousand times. I've NEVER been to Cheydinhal! I... oh, hang on. You're someone else. Apologies, my good friend, I mistook you for someone else. Always being asked about it, I am. 'Didn't I see you in Cheydinhal?', they say. Well I'm sick of it. Sick and tired, tired and sick. And perhaps a little drunk. But never mind. You look like the honest sort, so I've a job for you.
You're going to travel to Cheydinhal, and find out what sort of impostor is trying to besmirch my good name. And you're going to tell him... *hic*... You're going to tell him I am quite capable of besmirching my good name on my own. He should cease and desist immediately. There's fifty gold pieces in it for you, friend...

TESO126: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild
TESO160: a fellow new recruit in the Fighters Guild

plots: the player has caught thieves for Azzan before
the player has met Maglir

quest.title: Den of Thieves
quest.objective: get rid of the gang of thieves that has thieved around Anvil
tasks: track down the gang of thieves with Maglir
get rid of the gang of thieves that has thieved around Anvil
quest.description:
Greetings! Looking for some more work, are you?
Good to see you're working hard. I've got some more thieves for you to deal with in Anvil. There have been a number of thefts in the area, and witnesses believe the thieves are holed up nearby. Check around, and see what you can learn. I'm not sure the numbers you'll be dealing with, so I'm sending you with another new recruit. Maglir. I believe you two have already met.
Get moving. You need to get rid of those thieves.

plots: keep away from the keep and the city guards: they won't accept the missives

quest.title: Spread the Love
quest.objective: distribute all religious missives to the citizens of Riften
tasks: Go to Riften.
speak to the citizens
distribute all religious missives to the citizens of Riften
quest.description:
Riften is drowning in a sea of sin and wickedness and it's my personal mission to let everyone know that the warmth of Mara can see them through.
All I need is a messenger to bring Her words to these poor souls by distributing these missives. Lady Mara would be so pleased, if you could distribute the missives! Let me give you the missives. Here you are. Now make sure you give out every single one, we can't afford to let even one lost soul stray from Her warmth.
Almost anyone in Riften is in dire need of those missives. Speak to them, child. You will know who will listen and who will sin. A word of advice, keep away from the Keep and the city guards. They follow their own path and have already forsaken Her.
Allow me to give you Mara's gift as a reward... a true blessing to aid you in times of need. Despair not, her warmth will protect you always!

TESO238: the player's superior in the Thieves Guild
TESO146: the guildmaster of the Thieves Guild
TESO147: a guard who has made things difficult for the Thieves Guild
TESO240: a noblewoman ruling over Anvil, an Umbranox

plots: the Gray Fox has asked that the player does this personally, as this is a delicate matter
Lady Umbranox is looking for a new guard captain: the Legion Commander of the Imperial Watch sent her a list of guard captain candidates
Dairihill lied to Lady Umbranox, telling her that the list has yet to arrive
the Gray Fox has extended his protection to the Umbranox family and Lady Umbranox in particular: Hieronymus Lex's unwavering loyalty and resolve make him the perfect protector for Lady Umbranox

quest.title: Taking Care of Lex
quest.objective: get Hieronymus Lex reassigned as the captain of the guard in Anvil
tasks: Go to Anvil.
Go to Imperial City Prison.
steal the list of guard captain candidates from Dairihill's desk
find a forger to make a forgery of the candidate list
sneak into the Legion Commander's office and seal the forged letter with his seal
deliver the letter to Lady Umbranox in person
get Hieronymus Lex reassigned as the captain of the guard in Anvil
quest.description:
S'Krivva gives you greeting. Hieronymus Lex must be eliminated once and for all. The Gray Fox has asked that you do this personally. It is a most delicate matter.
Lady Umbranox of Anvil, is hunting for a new captain of her guard. The Legion Commander of the Imperial Watch sent her a list of candidates. The Gray Fox wants this list replaced with one that highly recommends Hieronymus Lex. From Anvil he can do little harm to the guild. The letter carrying the list is currently in steward Dairihill's desk. She has lied to Lady Umbranox, telling her that the letter has yet to arrive.
For reasons unknown to this one, the Gray Fox has extended his protection to the Umbranox family and Lady Umbranox in particular. While Lex is a problem for the guild, his unwavering loyalty and resolve make him the perfect protector for Lady Umbranox.
You will have to track down a forger on your own. I don't know of any in Bravil. With the forged letter in hand, sneak into the Legion Commander's office in the Imperial City Prison and seal it with his seal. Dairihill cannot be trusted. You must deliver the letter to Lady Umbranox in person.
Remember, this is a mission of stealth, not blood. Your payment will be higher than normal to cover the expense of the forgery.

plots: Firebead Elvenhair left his identify scroll to Tethtoril

quest.title: Firebead's Scroll
quest.objective: bring Firebead Elvenhair's identify scroll to him
tasks: get Firebead Elvenhair's identify scroll from Tethtoril
bring Firebead Elvenhair's identify scroll to him
quest.description:
I, Firebead Elvenhair, have a small errand for you.
I left an identify scroll with Tethtoril, in the inner grounds. He should be done examining it by now, so if you could fetch it for me, I'd be grateful. I have a great use for those types of scrolls.
Allow me to cast a little spell on you as a reward. It will protect you from any evil you might meet tonight.

TESO56: the prince of madness, one of the Daedric Princes
TESO181: the lord of monsters, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: Sheogorath's citizens need a new ruler when he is gone: the player has to replace a current Duke or Duchess of Madness
Malacath's realm is a nasty place

quest.title: Ritual of Accession
quest.objective: become a ruler in the Court of Madness
tasks: Go to Sacellum Arden-Sul.
speak to Arctus and Dervenin
become a ruler in the Court of Madness
quest.description:
Once I am gone, things usually get bad quickly.
You'll need the respect of My citizens. They'll need a leader, someone to look up to when I'm gone. They're the backbone of any great land. Except where the backbone is an actual backbone. Ever been to Malacath's realm...? Nasty stuff. But, back to the business at hand.
You'll need to control one of the Courts of Madness. Replace a current Duke. Or Duchess. Whichever. That will command respect! The people will rally around you. You'll have their love, their admiration, their complaints! Whatever. As long as it keeps them on Our side.
Speak to Arctus and Dervenin, the High Priests at the Sacellum Arden-Sul. They can explain what needs to be done.

TESS88: a pompous master wizard of Telvanni

plots: the player is the hero of Skyrim

quest.title: Reluctant Steward
quest.objective: tell Varona that Neloth wants apple cabbage stew with some canis root tea
tasks: find Varona
tell Varona that Neloth wants apple cabbage stew with some canis root tea
quest.description:
Where is that ash sucking steward of mine? Varona! Have you seen Varona? I'm hungry.
Find her. Tell her I want apple cabbage stew, with some canis root tea. After all, I don't make my own tea. I am a master wizard of the house Telvanni. Other people make tea for me.
You are not my servant? Obviously not, or you would have a cup of tea in your hands. I supposed you want to be asked nicely. Very well.
Please, oh hero of Skyrim. Please find Varona. I shall be ever so grateful.

TESS750: a hunter, and a worried brother
TESS751: Wulf Wild-Blood's brother, a wild man and a fearsome warrior

plots: Torkild may have become a werebear: a bear-like cursed creature

quest.title: Filial Bonds
quest.objective: find Torkild
tasks: see if Torkild is with the werebears of the glacier
find Torkild
quest.description:
In days past, my brother Torkild and I would share the hunt, but that was... long ago.
Torkild had a wild gleam in his eye, more than most. In my darkest times, I fear he fell in among the werebears of the glacier.
Werebears are twisted, cursed beasts. True bears are noble and great creatures of the wild. I've heard tell of men who, by curse or by heart's desire, become transformed into one of those vile things. It is a pitiable fate. And one that I fear has fallen to my brother.
If you happen to cross his path, be wary. He was a fierce warrior as a man. If he fell prey to his more bestial side, he could be deadly.

TL2176: a door that leads to the Clockwork Core

plots: the Alchemist came through the Imperial Camp an hour ago: he went through the Great Door and sealed it behind him
the Great Door leads to the Clockwork Core

quest.title: Some Assembly Required
quest.objective: open the Great Door
tasks: Go to Scrapworks.
find a power source for the dwarven automaton
open the Great Door
quest.description:
I wish you had gotten here sooner! The Alchemist came through here about an hour ago. He laid waste to the camp and then went through the Great Door, there - sealed it shut behind him.
We believe that door leads to the Clockwork Core. We've been unable to open it ourselves, but we know how in theory. See that dwarven automaton? It's designed to open the door, but it's missing its Power Source. There should be one in the Scrapworks, but it was too dangerous for us to enter. Perhaps you will have more luck.

TESS278: a scholar fascinated by the Dwemer
TESS902: Dwemer machines that were used to purify gems

plots: the Dwemer's greatest achievement has also been their greatest mystery: their instant, unexplainable disappearance
Arniel Gane tries to find out what happened to the Dwemer though experimentation
the player brought Arniel Gane Dwemer parts and a soul gem before

quest.title: Thorough Cleaning
quest.objective: purify a soul gem
tasks: place the soul gem in 3 Dwarven Convectors and heat them for 3 seconds with Arniel Gane's spell
purify a soul gem
quest.description:
The Dwemer, they were uhh, masters of magic in a way we can't even begin to conceive of. Their greatest achievement, however, has also been their greatest, shall we say... mystery.
This mystery is their disappearance, of course! Instant, unexplainable. The stories have fascinated me... Ever since I was young, I wanted to know what really happened. After years and years of work, I'm closing in on a way to investigate what happened through experimentation.
Only now... Well, it's simply a disaster. Without boring you with the, ahh, details, I am attempting to re-create the circumstances of the event. I used the soul gem you brought me for this. The soul gem by itself isn't enough, you see. It needs to be altered, purified. The Dwemer had machines for this sort of thing. I attempted to build my own, based on designs and using parts you helped to provide. My very own Dwemer machine. It worked, but not fully. And the uhh... The device was destroyed in the process.
The designs for my Convector were based on real Dwemer machines, so there may still be some in existence. I'd go looking myself, but uhh... Yes, there are calculations to double- and triple-check. Many calculations. Perhaps you could seek out these Convectors in Skyrim ruins? I can even teach you the spell to heat them.
Just place the soul gem inside, and heat the Convector. At least three seconds. You'll almost certainly need to find multiple Convectors. I suspect it may be due to the nature of the soul gem versus the crystals this was intended for. Destroys the equipment in the process.
But, ahh... It's effective. Three times, and the crystal should be ready for the next step. Isn't this exciting?

TESO326: the player's guild leader in the Mages Guild
TESO443: a Necromancer lair in ancient ruins, south of the Imperial City, south of the White Rose River, nearly halfway to the border of Elsweyr
TESO444: a male mage who infiltrated the Necromancers
TESO445: a male mage, the player's superior in the Mages Guild

plots: the player is meeting Arch-Mage Traven face-to-face for the first time
Raminus has told Arch-Mage Traven good things about the player: the player has advanced quickly, and shows great promise

the Council of Mages has been aware of the increased Necromancer activity in Cyrodiil for some time: Mucianus Allias was sent to infiltrate the ranks of the necromancers, but he stopped sending reports to the Council of Mages
the Council of Mages distrusts Mucianus Allias, unlike Arch-Mage Traven

quest.title: Liberation or Apprehension?
quest.objective: locate Mucianus Allias, and return him safely to the Arcane University
tasks: Go to Nenyond Twyll.
find Mucianus Allias before the battlemages of the Mages Guild apprehend him
locate Mucianus Allias, and return him safely to the Arcane University
quest.description:
Greetings. It is high time that we met face to face, don't you think? Raminus has told me good things about you. You have advanced quickly, and show great promise. I now intend to put your talents to a more direct test.
I have a difficult task that you can, perhaps, assist with. Let me explain what is at stake. The Council of Mages has been aware of the increased Necromancer activity in Cyrodiil for some time. It had been our position to sit back and watch what unfolded, but that time has clearly passed. We cannot tolerate these attacks on the guild. Most of our information on Necromancers has come from an informant inside the cult itself, a guild member who offered to infiltrate their ranks.
Though the information he has provided is limited, it has given us a sense of their scope and power. The Council was initially reluctant to believe the information was reliable, but with recent events, they have little choice but to trust it. I fear that our informant is in danger, and that is why I have called you here.
The informant is a mage called Mucianus Allias. He is not a Council member, but has long served the guild here at the Arcane University. Aware in the growing interest in the guild after the band of Necromancy was put into place, he offered to help the Council track the cult's actions. With my blessing, he infiltrated the group, and has fed us information for quite some time, until recently. I have not heard from him, and I fear for his safety.
The lack of reports from Mucianus has disturbed the Council, and they are now concerned about the legitimacy of his information. A group of Battlemages were dispatched to Mucianus's last know location, with the intent on bringing him in for questioning. I argued against it, but eventually agreed to maintain order in the Council. I regret that decision, and that is why I wish to send you there. I fear the Battlemages may mistreat Mucianus, if they do not mistake him for one of the many Necromancers no doubt present in the ruins.
I wish for you to find Mucianus, and ensure his safe return to the Arcane University. I do not want anything to go wrong. Please, hurry. The Battlemages will arrive there soon, if they have not already, and time is of the essence. If for any reason they are unsuccessful, Mucianus' life will be forfeit. You must make sure he is safe. Go now, and bring word to me as soon as he has been escorted to safety. Mucianus last reported being sent to the ruins of Nenyond Twyll, south of the Imperial City. That is where the Battlemages went. South of the White Rose River, nearly halfway to the border of Elsweyr. I'm afraid I know nothing more about the location, or what you may expect to find once you arrive.

TESO21: a rude mage from the mages' guild

plots: the player is an Associate of the mages' guild
another Associate tossed the Ring of Burden down the locked well behind the guild hall

quest.title: Falcar's Recommendation
quest.objective: retrieve the Ring of Burden for Falcar
tasks: get the key to the locked well from Deetsan
retrieve the Ring of Burden for Falcar
quest.description:
What is it, Associate? Don't tell me you're here for a recommendation from me.
There was a particular Ring of Burden I was testing some time ago. Another stupid Associate somehow got his hands on it, and managed to misplace it. If I didn't know better, I'd say he purposely tossed it down the well behind the guild hall. Why he would do such a thing is beyond me.
You will retrieve this ring for me. Should you manage to do so, I shall consider sending a recommendation to the Arcane University.
The well is locked, so you'll need the key. Deetsan should have a copy of it. Now get moving.

TL2105: a statue that speaks in riddles
TL2191: a foul dungeon filled with Ezrohir

plots: the Ezrohir captured the Guardian of Mana again: they stripped away her magic and enslaved her

quest.title: Artifice of Evil
quest.objective: save the Guardian of Mana, and Zeryphesh
tasks: Go to Vaults Forsaken.
find the Guardian of Mana
save the Guardian of Mana, and Zeryphesh
quest.description:
The Ezrohir prepare today for war
Their legions number in the score.
Their Alchemy and Artifice suffice
To capture Mana... not once but twice.
Imprisoned in the Vaults Forsaken:
Subdued, enslaved, her magic taken.
Forced to lead their troops in battle
From Guardian... to so much chattel.
The Ezrohir have Mana enslaved
But there's still hope; she might yet be saved.
The enemy lie in this foul creche.
Save the Guardian... save Zeryphesh.

BG217: in Athkatla, southeast section of the Government District

plots: Dawnbringer Sain is supposed to acquire art for the temple of Lathander

quest.title: Gain the services of Sir Sarles for the Temple of Lathander
quest.objective: convince Sir Sarles to sculpt a statue for the temple of Lathander
tasks: Go to Jysstev estate.
find Sir Sarles
convince Sir Sarles to sculpt a statue for the temple of Lathander
quest.description:
Greetings, I am known as Dawnbringer Sain, a priest of Lathander.
I am charged with the acquisition of art for the temple. The beauty of the dawn must be captured in every nook and cranny of Lathander's home.
Athkatla is blessed with the presence of perhaps the greatest sculptor of our age. The artist is known as Sir Sarles, and he is making an all too brief visit. We would be foolish not to seize upon the opportunity to have him work for us.
I would ask you to convince Sir Sarles that it would be best for him to work for us. Go to him now.
Sir Sarles is staying at the Jysstev estate. It is in the southeast section of the Government District.
Remember, you speak for Lathander in this matter.

TESO326: the player's guildmaster in the Mages Guild
TESO460: a nobleman who rules over Skingrad

plots: Count Hassildor of Skingrad contacted the Council of Mages: he has important information
Count Hassildor has asked for the player, specifically

quest.title: Information at a Price
quest.objective: receive vital information from Count Hassildor
tasks: Go to Skingrad.
visit Count Hassildor
receive vital information from Count Hassildor
quest.description:
There is an urgent matter which requires your personal attention. This task falls to you, and only you.
Count Hassildor of Skingrad has contacted the Council. He claims to have information that is vital to us. He has requested that you personally travel to Skingrad to obtain this information. I cannot stress how important it is that our relationship with Hassildor be preserved. I expect you to visit him immediately.
I am unsure as to why he has requested that you, of all people, should be the one to visit him. I have no wish to put you in harm's way.
Please, travel there as soon as possible. The Count is waiting for you.

TESS659: a member of the Vigil of Stendarr
TESS661: a house in Markarth that might have been used for Daedra worship

plots: no one has seen anyone enter or leave the Abandoned House

quest.title: The House of Horrors
quest.objective: investigate the Abandoned House with Tyranus
tasks: Go to Abandoned House.
follow Tyranus inside the Abandoned House
investigate the Abandoned House with Tyranus
quest.description:
Excuse me, but do you know anything about this house? Seen anyone enter or leave? Seems no one in this city has.
I'm with the Vigil of Stendarr. We believe this house might have been used for Daedra worship. Evil rites and so forth. I was actually just about to head on inside. Be good to have someone watch my back.
Follow me, and keep your eyes open. Daedra are powerful creatures and tricksters. Never know what you'll find.

TESO118: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood
TESO119: Waterfront District of the Imperial City
TESO120: Waterfront District of the Imperial City
Waterfront District of the Imperial City
TESO121: Waterfront District of the Imperial City

plots: this is the player's first assignment
the pirates have been moving cargo: the player may be able to smuggle themselves onboard the Marie Elena in one of the packing crates
the player's fellow assassins provide insight about any current contract

quest.title: A Watery Grave
quest.objective: assassinate Gaston Tussaud
tasks: board the Marie Elena
assassinate Gaston Tussaud
quest.description:
Warmest greetings to you. I am Vicente Valtieri. I'm eager to see how you fare on your first assignment.
Go to the Waterfront District of the Imperial City. There you will find a ship named the Marie Elena. Board the ship and find its captain, Gaston Tussaud. He'll be in his cabin. Eliminate Tussaud in any manner you see fit. As a pirate, Gaston Tussaud has certainly spilled his share of blood. Someone wants revenge, and they've hired us to extract it.
The pirates have been moving a lot of cargo onboard lately. You may be able to smuggle yourself onboard in one of the packing crates. Oh, and one more thing. Get into the habit of asking your fellow assassins about any current contract. Their insight may prove invaluable.

TESO1: a male Speaker of the Black Hand, who betrayed the Dark Brotherhood for some reason
TESO448: an immortal female spirit who is revered and worshiped by the Dark Brotherhood

plots: the player is a Silencer of the Dark Brotherhood
as the player can see, the Black Hand have dealt with Lucien Lachance
Lucien Lachance tricked the player to kill the Black Hand off: the player killed the Listener and the Listener's successor
Arquen promotes the player to Speaker from Silencer: the player becomes a member of the Black Hand
there are only five members of the Black Hand, including the player

quest.title: Honor Thy Mother
quest.objective: perform an ancient ritual to wake the Night Mother from her slumber, and seek her guidance
tasks: Go to Bravil.
ask about the Night Mother from Arquen between 12.00 PM and 3:00 AM
go to the Night Mother's home with Arquen
perform an ancient ritual to wake the Night Mother from her slumber, and seek her guidance
quest.description:
Silencer! At last you've arrived! Fear not, for the crisis that has threatened the Dark Brotherhood has finally come to an end. I am Arquen, Speaker for the Black Hand.
As you can see, we have dealt with the betrayer, Lucien Lachance! No longer will you serve as his puppet! It seems Lachance wanted revenge against the Dark Brotherhood for some reason, and used you to do his dirty work. But now, we can begin anew!
I bestow upon you the title of Speaker. You will take Lucien Lachance's place on the Black Hand! Welcome! As you know, the Black Hand is now in a state of disarray. Lachance ordered you to kill us off! We five, including you, are now all that remain. Even worse, you killed the Listener! The Black Hand without a Listener is like a hand with no thumb. Even the Listener's successor is dead!
So, we have no choice but to invoke an ancient ritual. We must wake the Night Mother from her slumber, and seek her guidance! Between the hours of midnight and 3:00 AM, ask me about the Night Mother, and we will away to our Lady's home in Bravil. Only then will the ritual begin.
May the Night Mother hold you in her cold embrace.

plots: Miles the Moron wants comfort

quest.objective: bring a wolf to Miles the Moron

tame a wolf
bring a wolf to Miles the Moron
quest.description:
Me happy. See a friend. Hello friend!
Me would like me own wolfie. Could help me do things... Wolfies like Wide Woodland. A biggy forest. Tame a wolfie. Bring it to me. Me give you pumpkins. A load of pumpkins.

BG1166: an elven mage who was a guide to Balduran

plots: Dradeel converted to the Church of Selûne recently
there are werewolves everywhere
Dradeel might find a way out of this island if his spellbook was returned to him

quest.title: Returning Dradeel's Spellbook
quest.objective: destroy the lycanthropes' lair, and bring Dradeel's spellbook back to its owner
tasks: find the lycanthropes' lair and Dradeel's spellbook within it
destroy the lycanthropes' lair, and bring Dradeel's spellbook back to its owner
quest.description:
I am Dradeel, mage and recent convert to the Church of Selûne.
I was the guide for Balduran's brave adventures to the ends of the world and beyond. The wolf-men are everywhere. The lycanthropes' lair is in Balduran's ship. My spellbook lies within. With it, I am a powerful mage. Without it, I am the pauper that stands before you. With my spellbook retrieved, I may be able to discover a way off of the island.
If you go to destroy the lycanthropes' lair, I would ask that you find my book.

TESO328: the player's superior in the Mages Guild

find J'skar, and make him re-appear
quest.description:
A recommendation, from me? Well, of course. Raminus would naturally want my opinion, wouldn't he?
This is a situation we can both benefit from, Associate. You do me a small favor, and I'll happily send along a glowing recommendation.
J'skar's disappeared. I mean he's really disappeared. No one here has seen him in days. Volanaro thinks maybe a spell backfired. If someone from the Council were to stop by, and find him gone, it'd look bad for me. I can't have that. Talk to the mages here, and see what you can find out.
If you can make J'skar re-appear, you'll have your recommendation.

TESO559: the hideout of the player's enemy
TESO561: an adjective referring to the Daedra

plots: Martin has deciphered one of the four items needed for the ritual needed to open a portal to Camoran's Paradise with the Mysterium Xarxes: the blood of a Daedra Lord
"Modern Heretics" is the best introduction to Daedric cults: the library here has a copy
the Mysterium Xarxes ritual will consume the physical form of the Daedric artifact

quest.title: Blood of the Daedra
quest.objective: acquire a Daedric artifact for Martin
tasks: locate one of the Daedric cults
acquire a Daedric artifact for Martin
quest.description:
I've deciphered part of the ritual needed to open a portal to Camoran's Paradise.
The Mysterium Xarxes mentions four items needed for the ritual, but so far I have only deciphered one of them: the 'blood of a Daedra Lord'. In fact, Daedric artifacts are known to be formed from the essence of a Daedric Lord, from whence they derive their great power. Not an easy thing to come by, obviously, but we will need a Daedric artifact.
The only way to obtain a Daedric artifact is through the cults devoted to each of the Daedric Lords. The book "Modern Heretics" is the best introduction to Daedric cults. The library here has a copy if you need it.
Bring the artifact to me when you have acquired one. Remember, the Mysterium Xarxes ritual will consume the physical form of the artifact in order to release its Daedric power.

plots: Larina stole Pantea's flute and sold it to a necromancer

quest.title: Pantea's Flute
quest.objective: recover Pantea's flute for her
tasks: Go to Hob's Fall Cave.
find the flute
recover Pantea's flute for her
quest.description:
That damn fool! I should wring Larina's neck! That fool student of mine stole my flute and sold it to some necromancer in Hob's Fall Cave.
Apparently Larina told him some story about the flute being able to make the dead dance. It's just a flute. A really old and valuable flute, but just a flute. I just got a ransom note for it. That flute has been handed down for seventeen generations!
Well don't just stand there. Go get my flute! I don't have any money to give you. but I can show you a few tricks I learned playing for wizards.

plots: this is the player's last trial

quest.title: The Horn of Jurgen Windcaller
quest.objective: retrieve the horn of Jurgen Windcaller

find the horn of Jurgen Windcaller in his tomb
retrieve the horn of Jurgen Windcaller
quest.description:
You are now ready for your last trial. Retrieve the Horn of Jurgen Windcaller, our founder, from his tomb in the ancient fane of Ustengrav.
Remain true to the Way of the Voice, and you will return. Then it is time for us to recognize you formally as Dragonborn.

TESS409: a dark ritual to obtain the services of the Dark Brotherhood

plots: the player, a member of the Dark Brotherhood, came to see Amaund Motierre after he had performed the Black Sacrament
Amaund Motierre wants to arrange several assassination contracts with the Dark Brotherhood, leading to the assassination of the emperor
Amaund Motierre gives the player two items: a sealed letter that will explain everything that needs to be done, and a valuable amulet - the player can use it to pay for any and all expenses

quest.title: The Silence Has Been Broken
quest.objective: accept Amaund Motierre's assassination contract
tasks: take the sealed letter and the valuable amulet to your superior in the Dark Brotherhood
accept Amaund Motierre's assassination contract
quest.description:
By the almighty Divines. You've come. You've actually come. This dreadful Black Sacrament thing... it worked.
Well, I won't waste your time. I would like to arrange a contract. Several, actually. I daresay, the work I'm offering has more significance than anything your organization has experienced in, well, centuries.
As I said, I want you to kill several people. You'll find the targets, as well as their manners of elimination, quite varied. I'm sure someone of your disposition will probably even find it enjoyable. But you should know that these killings are but a means to an end. For they pave the way to the most important target. The real reason I'm speaking with a cutthroat in the bowels of this detestable crypt. For I seek the assassination of... ...the Emperor.
What I ask is no small thing, of course. But you represent the Dark Brotherhood. This is... what you do? No? You must understand. So much has led to this day. So much planning, and maneuvering. Now, it's as if the very stars have finally aligned. But I digress. Here, take these two items. They need to be delivered to your, um... superior. The sealed letter will explain everything that needs to be done. The amulet is quite valuable - you can use it to pay for any and all expenses.

MC31: deserts, taiga forests, and frozen regions
MC32: deserts, taiga forests, and frozen regions
deserts, taiga forests, and frozen regions

plots: Wilson wants comfort
the player is an enemy of Wilson

quest.title: It's Your Lucky Day
quest.objective: bring a rabbit's foot to Wilson
tasks: hunt down a rabbit
bring a rabbit's foot to Wilson
quest.description:
Oh. It's you. As if I wouldn't have enough to worry about...
Or perhaps even a devil like you has a heart. Would you help me sweep my worries away by bringing me a rabbit's foot? I'd like to feel luckier. Hunt down a rabbit. They are found in deserts, taiga forests, and frozen regions. Rabbits are quite quick on their feet, so they might keep you busy for a while.
Do this for me, and I'll give you a Potion of Leaping. That should help you jump out of my sight faster.

MC2: ore veins deep in the ground
MC11: ore veins deep in the ground
ore veins deep in the ground

plots: Nila wants comfort
the player is an enemy of Nila

quest.title: Gold. GOLD. GOLD!
quest.objective: bring gold ore to Nila

find some gold ore
bring gold ore to Nila
quest.description:
What are YOU doing here! If it was up to me, I'd never let you in the village.
Perhaps you'd like to mend our relations? Bring me some gold ore, the more the better. You can never have enough of it; it's so beautiful. My gold. I wish to have it all to myself. Too bad it's mainly found in the ore veins deep in the ground.
I guess you could have these melon seeds as a reward. I have no use for them; melons have nothing on gold.

TESO126: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild

plots: the player has worked for Azzan before

quest.title: The Unfortunate Shopkeeper

talk to Norbert Lelles
stop the break-ins to Quality Merchandise
quest.description:
Looking for more work, eh? Good. I have got a contract for you. I'd like you to go talk to Norbert Lelles, here in Anvil.
He runs Quality Merchandise here in Anvil. He's been having problems with break-ins, though, and he's hired us to put a stop to it. Sounds like he wants your help stopping the theft at his store.
Take care of Lelles. He needs the help.

plots: Benirus Manor belonged to Velwyn's grandfather: Velwyn is selling Benirus Manor because he has pressing matters elsewhere
the player gets the key to the front door and the deed of ownership after buying Benirus Manor

quest.title: Where Spirits Have Lease
quest.objective: purchase Benirus Manor
tasks: give 5,000 gold to Velwyn
purchase Benirus Manor
quest.description:
I'm Velwyn. You wouldn't happen to be in the market for a home would you? If you are, I just happen to be selling a manor located right here in Anvil.
I'm selling my grandfather's house, Benirus Manor. If you're interested, I could let you have it for a modest sum, 5,000 gold. I have to sell it soon, as I have pressing matters elsewhere. You're welcome to take a look at it. It is located across the street from the Chapel.
Once you buy, you get the key to the front door and the deed of ownership. That's the deal.

TESS23: a fellow vampire, who speaks elegantly

plots: the player is married: it presents difficulties for vampires
vampirism is the greatest gift that vampires can bestow to their loved ones

quest.title: The Gift
quest.objective: turn your wife into a vampire
tasks: use vampiric seduction on your wife, embrace her and bite her neck
turn your wife into a vampire
quest.description:
It's come to my inescapable attention that you, my dear friend, are married. Marriage is a fine institution, however, one that does present certain difficulties for such as like ourselves.
May I strongly suggest that you make a visit to this spouse of yours and "invite" her to the family by offering her the Gift of Vampirism. Put her mind to rest, allay her fear through vampiric seduction and when she is in a pliant condition, embrace her and bite her on the neck.
It is the greatest token we can bestow upon those we love and wish to see protected.

TESS617: a small waterlogged shipwreck northeast of Dawnstar
TESS618: a male Argonian layabout, and a shipwreck scavenger

plots: Argonians are unpredictable opponents, especially near water
