locate Deekus
assassinate Deekus
quest.description:
There's an assassination contract for you. You are to kill Deekus.
He is an Argonian layabout, likes to scavenge shipwrecks. My guess is he'll run if threatened. Or swim, if given the chance.
Personally, I've always found Argonians to be incredibly unpredictable opponents. Especially near water. Unfortunately, Deekus is at Hela's Folly, a small waterlogged shipwreck northeast of Dawnstar. Making him stay out of water will be difficult.

TESS294: a dragon, and the player's ally
TESS31: a mythological scroll that can bend time itself

plots: the player has the Elder Scroll

quest.title: Alduin's Bane
quest.objective: defeat Alduin
tasks: Go to Time-Wound.
take the Elder Scroll to the Time-Wound
defeat Alduin
quest.description:
You have it. The Scroll - the Elder Scroll. Time bends... touch. Time shudders at its touch. There is no question. You are doom-driven. Blessings of Akatosh. The very bones of the earth are at your disposal.
Go then. Fulfill your destiny. Take the Scroll to the Time-Wound. Do not delay. Alduin will be coming. He cannot miss the signs. You must defeat him.

BG2269: Marlowe's home, a simple, safe dwelling atop the east cliff
BG2270: Marlowe's home, a simple, safe dwelling atop the east cliff
Marlowe's home, a simple, safe dwelling atop the east cliff

plots: Marlowe assumes that the player is one of the strangers that all the locals have been talking about, an adventurer from the north
Marlowe and his daughter shall surely perish without the player's help

quest.title: Marlowe's Plea for Help
quest.objective: find out what Marlowe needs help with
tasks: talk to Marlowe
find out what Marlowe needs help with
quest.description:
Excuse me, I... I do not mean to be rude... but you *are* one of the strangers that all the locals have been talking about, aren't you? An adventurer from the north? Yes, yes, of course you are. Anyone can see that you are an extraordinary person. Please forgive me.
I would not bother you, stranger, but I am in terrible peril! I need your aid! I beg you for a boon or I and my daughter both shall surely perish! I... cannot speak more of this here. Please come to my home on top of the cliff, I beg you! We can speak freely there!
My home is atop the east cliff, adventurer. It is a simple dwelling but... safe, for the moment. My name is Marlowe... please meet me there and I shall explain everything, I swear.

TESS601: Safia's ship, in the Solitude docks
TESS602: a ruthless female pirate captain who is deadly with a blade

plots: this is Nazir's final, most challenging assassination contract
Safia's crew is loyal and bloodthirsty

quest.title: Painting the Seas Red
quest.objective: assassinate Safia
tasks: Go to Red Wave.
find Safia
assassinate Safia
quest.description:
I have an assassination contract for you: Safia, a pirate captain. She can be found aboard her ship, the Red Wave. It's currently docked at the Solitude docks.
Safia is a ruthless she-devil, by all accounts. Deadly with a blade. And let's not forget her crew - loyal and bloodthirsty, the lot of them.
This is my final contract, and certainly the most challenging. Be careful with this one, my friend. If you are capable of pulling through this, you've not only earned your payment, but my respect as well. And believe me, friend - that does not come easily.

plots: Mario wants knowledge

quest.title: Hermit Knowledge
quest.objective: ask Lone Wolf about the meaning of life, and return to Mario
tasks: Go to Lily Forest.
find Lone Wolf
ask Lone Wolf about the meaning of life, and return to Mario
quest.description:
There is a strange woman living alone out in the Lily Forest. Some say that she knows the meaning of life!
Could you find her in that flower forest, and ask her about it? I really want to hear what could possibly be the meaning of life.
When you return, I'll have a little something for you. A compass. May it point you toward your destinations in life!

BG2159: of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart
BG2165: a noblewoman, one of the Morningales
BG2166: Tyrianna's godparent, an upstanding man serving the god of duty, comes from Baldur's Gate

plots: the Morningales have been murdered: Tyrianna survived her family

quest.title: Tyrianna's Family
quest.objective: escort Tyrianna to the building beside the temple in the docks and wait for Hurgis Baltezan to arrive
tasks: protect Tyrianna
escort Tyrianna to the building beside the temple in the docks and wait for Hurgis Baltezan to arrive
quest.description:
I have a vital mission for you that must take precedence over all else.
We have received word of a great atrocity, one that must not be completed. There has been... murder is too weak a word. An entire family has been decimated. The Morningales have been a model of decency in this city, and their work in opposing the slave trade has earned them renown across the land. It also earned them many enemies. This past tenday has seen the family murdered in their homes, almost to the last. It would seem they were made examples of.
The time for justice will come, but what is important now is that someone survived, praise Helm. Tyrianna — she hid in a cellar while all others were executed. She must be protected until escorted from the city. Her survival will be a symbol to persevere in the fight against slavery, despite the ferocity of the enemy. You will go to a safe house we have set up, and you will make sure she remains secure. It is as secret as we could make it, though nothing is ever absolute.
In the morning, her godparent will arrive. He is from Baldur's Gate and will accept no other guards besides his own. You will see that she reaches his care. Go to the building beside the temple in the docks and await him. She should be safe in his care. Hurgis Baltezan is his name, and a more upright citizen you will not find. He earned the title "Hand of Torm" in his service to the god of duty.
The Order shall reward you with a suit of powerful armor for your good works.

TESS754: a worthless and tainted mine in Raven Rock
TESS755: the great-grandfather of Crescius Caerellius, who worked for the East Empire Company

plots: the East Empire Company swept something big under the rug two centuries ago: it killed Gratian Caerellius and ruined the Raven Rock Mine
Crescius Caerellius and his wife found Gratian Caerellius' things in their home: an unsent letter to the East Empire Company, and a key to the locked off section of the Raven Rock Mine

quest.title: The Final Descent
quest.objective: find out what happened to Gratian Caerellius
tasks: find and unlock the locked off section of the mine
find out what happened to Gratian Caerellius
quest.description:
Who in the blazes are you?! Can't you see I'm busy? Or, perhaps you could help me. Hmph, maybe. Been difficult trusting people lately, they think I'm crazy.
Mark my words, these mines hold a secret that could put Raven Rock back on the map. A secret the East Empire Company swept under the rug two centuries ago. It killed my great-grandfather, Gratian Caerellius, and left Raven Rock with a worthless and tainted mine.
East Empire Company called it "a terrible accident", claiming that he was lost in a rockfall, but I know better. My wife and I were cleaning out our home, and we came across some of my great-grandfather's things locked in an old chest. I found an unsent letter he'd written to the East Empire Company, and a key.
The letter describes a discovery that was made in the mine by some of the diggers. They wanted Gratian to take a closer look. The East Empire Company must have felt it was of great value, as they locked that section of the mine off from everyone else. I assume the key unlocks that section of the mine. I haven't been able to find the entrance.
I'm telling you... there's something big down there, something that the East Empire Company wanted to hide from everyone.

BG2233: a well-spoken woman, and an enemy to the Shadow Thieves
BG2239: the basement of the Shadow Thief guild house
the basement of the Shadow Thief guild house
BG2240: the male leader of the Shadow Thieves

plots: the player has worked for Bodhi before
Aran Linvail is in the basement of the Shadow Thief guild house: the player needs a key to the basement
Tizzak is missing, and the Shadow Thieves may have him: he may know how to access Aran Linvail's sanctum

quest.title: To Kill a Guild
quest.objective: kill Aran Linvail
tasks: find a way to access Aran Linvail's sanctum
kill Aran Linvail
quest.description:
Again, I require your talents. Now to the task at hand.
It is time to take down the leadership of the Shadow Thieves and throw them into a more permanent disarray from which they may not recover. You must invade their lair one last time. You must kill Aran Linvail, the Shadowmaster. Do this for me, and our arrangement will be fulfilled.
Aran is in the basement of the Shadow Thief guild house, so you need a key. The lock is likely unpickable. What good is a lock in a thieves' guild if any thief can pick it?
One more thing: Tizzak, an employee of mine, is missing, and the Thieves may have him. Find him, and he may tell you how to access Aran's sanctum. Go now!

MC19: a man who wants to redecorate his home

plots: Mike wants comfort
the player can craft banners from sticks and wool

quest.title: Flying Colors
quest.objective: bring 10 red banners to Mike
tasks: obtain 10 red banners
bring 10 red banners to Mike
quest.description:
I'd like to redecorate my home. Stranger, could you do a man a favor? Obtain ten red banners and bring them to me. I have heard that you can craft banners from sticks and wool.
I'll have 32 apples for you.

MC52: a crafting ingredient that powers up contraptions

plots: Harry wants comfort
the player is an infamous person
the player can craft a piston with 3 wooden planks, 4 cobblestone, an iron ingot, and Redstone Dust

quest.title: Brain Over Brawl
quest.objective: give 10 pistons to Harry
tasks: craft 10 pistons
give 10 pistons to Harry
quest.description:
You are the person who's been causing trouble in these parts, aren't you?
Why don't we put your energy to a better use? I'm a mason, which means that I have to move large quantities of stone from one place to another. I'd like to automate that process with pistons. That would save me from backache.
The problem is I don't have the materials for making pistons, or the know-how to craft them. This is where you enter the picture. Craft 10 pistons, and then bring them to me. I know that you need 3 wooden planks, 4 cobblestone, an iron ingot, and Redstone Dust for crafting a piston.
Some quarts pillars broke while we were transporting them. You could have the remaining 32 Nether Quartz from them.

TESS455: a bard of the Bards College, and a former soldier
TESS457: the most famous battle drummer of the second age, a man

plots: Rjorn entered Halldir's Cairn in secret, and presumably died there

quest.title: Rjorn's Drum
quest.objective: retrieve the Rjorn' drum for  Giraud Gemane
tasks: Go to Halldir's Cairn.
find the drum
retrieve the Rjorn' drum for  Giraud Gemane
quest.description:
They found it! They actually found Rjorn's drum!
You don't know who Rjorn is? You're joking, right? Rjorn? Only the most famous battle drummer of the second age. Well, famous among bards at least. That drum has been in half a dozen famous battles. It's a priceless artifact.
Nobody knows where he died, and therefore where his drum might be. Halldir was the missing link. Rjorn was always looking for new stories to tell. It seems he was writing a lay about Halldir when he vanished. Rjorn entered Halldir's Cairn in secret, and presumably died there.
Now all I need to do is find someone to get it. Wait. You. You could do it. I need you to get me that drum. The college treasury is a bit thin right now. But I can show you some tricks I learned from my days with the army.

TESS437: the owner of the Sanuarach Mine in Karthwasten

plots: the Silver-Bloods are trying to get hold of Sanuarach Mine
sellswords showed up after Forsworn attacked Sanuarach Mine: sellswords won't let anyone work until Ainethach sells it off

quest.title: Sanuarach Mine
quest.objective: help Ainethach keep Sanuarach Mine
tasks: convince sellswords to leave
help Ainethach keep Sanuarach Mine
quest.description:
The Silver-Bloods are trying to muscle in on my land. Forsworn attack the mines, and suddenly all these sellswords show up in Karthwasten to 'help.' They won't let anyone work until I sell it off.
You can try to convince them to leave, but I'd keep your sword-arm ready if things get ugly.

BG223: the evil god of thunder and destruction

plots: Stormherald Nallabir lost this past tenday's theological debate to a a representative of the Lathanderian temple in the Government District
the temple of Talos hired Travin to steal a Dawn Ring from the Lathanderian temple

quest.title: Another Mission for the Temple of Talos
quest.objective: get the Dawn Ring from Travin and bring it to Talon Yarryl
tasks: find Travin
get the Dawn Ring from Travin and bring it to Talon Yarryl
quest.description:
It's Talon Yarryl, priest of Talos.
I have a chore for you that may prove interesting.
This is not a matter of negotiation or exploration. No, now you are to face true enemies of Talos.
Slanderous words have been said. Things did not go well for Stormherald Nallabir at this past tenday's theological debate in the Government District. The growing arrogance of the Lathanderian church is distasteful. Talos should be feared; their irreverence is insulting.
We have hired a thief, and he has stolen a Dawn Ring from the Lathanderian temple.
Find Travin in the slums at night, collect the ring, and return it here.
Remember that the honor of Talos rests upon your shoulders.

TL2182: an arrogant person guarding the door
TL2183: a great spectral dragon who stole the Crown from Robot Eye

plots: the player told Robot Eye that the player wants to go through the door

quest.title: Enter the Door
quest.objective: recover the Crown from Thiss, and bring it to Robot Eye
tasks: Go to Forgotten Halls.
find Thiss
recover the Crown from Thiss, and bring it to Robot Eye
quest.description:
You want through THIS door? Ha! Well, it's not as simple as that. Everything has a price - you must know that by now.
If you can solve a problem for us, we will solve a problem for you by letting you through the door. Thiss, the great Spectral Dragon, has kept something of ours for many long years. We would like it back - and you will get it for us, oh yes.
There is a Crown, a... family heirloom that he stole from us. He will not give it up easily, of course. But this door is im-PENETRABLE - so you've got a much better chance with Thiss than you do waiting around here.
You can find Thiss in the Forgotten Halls... good luck! You're going to need it.

MC162: a hidden camp on a mountain
a hidden camp on a mountain
MC163: a hidden camp on a mountain
MC164: a hidden camp on a mountain

plots: Finn wants reputation

quest.title: Exclusively Here!
quest.objective: bring "An Interview With the Enderman" to Finn
tasks: convince A.R. sign an exclusivity deal with Villager
bring "An Interview With the Enderman" to Finn
quest.description:
No one cares about libraries any more! Everyone just buys their books, even though they could read them for free!
There's only one thing I can do to make my library more popular: exclusive books. I'd like to secure an exclusivity deal with A.R., a very famous novelist. She has just finished her new book, "An Interview with the Enderman", while staying at a hidden camp on a mountain.
Could you please get to A.R.'s camp and convince her to sign the exclusivity deal? Bring back a copy of "An Interview with the Enderman" too. I'd like to read it myself. You can have 32 name tags as a reward, keeping things named and ordered is always useful.

plots: the Thalmor are also looking for Esbern

quest.title: A Cornered Rat
quest.objective: locate Esbern, and ask where he was on the 30th of Frostfall
tasks: Go to Riften.
talk to Brynjolf about finding Esbern
locate Esbern, and ask where he was on the 30th of Frostfall
quest.description:
We've got to find Esbern in Riften before the Thalmor do. He'll know how to stop the dragons if anybody does. You'd better get to Riften. Talk to Brynjolf. He's... well-connected. A good starting point at least.
Oh, and when you find Esbern... if you think I'm paranoid... you may have some trouble getting him to trust you. Just ask him where he was on the 30th of Frostfall. He'll know what it means.

BG235: the player's tutor in the player's duties to Helm

plots: the player is one of Helm's chosen: a cleric of Helm

quest.title: Work as a Cleric for the Temple of Helm
quest.objective: hear questions from believers of Helm
tasks: reassure believers of Helm that duty is above all
hear questions from believers of Helm
quest.description:
Greetings, I'm Acolyte Byron.
I will be your tutor in your duties here as one of Helm's chosen.
You have many things you are responsible for.
As a favored of Helm, you will hear questions from those that seek guidance in their duty. They merely needed to be reassured that duty is above all, and that reverence for such duty is the way to happiness.
You will steer them on the true path to Helm's grace.
You have the wisdom that has secured your position within the church.
You will dispense it to those that are needy.
This is a sacred trust that you are given. Do not disappoint.

TESO125: a mace, and Maeva the Buxom's family heirloom

plots: Bjalfi the Contemptible snatched Rockshatter, and took off to join a local marauder gang at Fort Strand

quest.title: When the Vow Breaks
quest.objective: recover the Rockshatter for Maeva the Buxom
tasks: Go to Fort Strand.
find Bjalfi the Contemptible
recover the Rockshatter for Maeva the Buxom
quest.description:
Perhaps you can help me. I'm Maeva the Buxom. My husband's name is Bjalfi the Contemptible. My father said I was a fool to marry him, but I didn't listen. At our wedding, my father gave us a family heirloom as a gift; Rockshatter, a mace that's been in my family for many generations.
Bjalfi snatched Rockshatter from our mantle and took off to "find his fortune" with the local Marauder gang at Fort Strand. I want that mace back. Please, I don't think he's ever coming back, and I'd hate to lose such a precious heirloom to a gang of thugs.

plots: Felicia wants comfort
the player can craft a candle by combining a honeycomb with string

quest.title: Atmospheric Lighting
quest.objective: give some candles to Felicia
tasks: obtain some candles
give some candles to Felicia
quest.description:
Monsters hide in the dark. I'm way too important to die to some mindless, monstrous rabble! Ergo, I need to light up my house thoroughly.
You sure look like a servant. Hear your mistress' command, then. Go, and fetch some candles for me. If you didn't know, you can make candles by combining a honey comb with string.
Get a move on. If your services please me, I may give you some Lapis Lazuli. Perhaps you can enchant something with it?

plots: the player asked Helvius Cecia to give them Hand to Hand training
Helvius Cecia will not throw a single punch during the sparring match
the rules of the sparring match: 1) the player must not reach for a weapon, 2) Helvius Cecia will tell the player to stop if they hurt him or if the match goes on for too long

quest.title: Hand to Hand Training
quest.objective: prove Helvius Cecia that you deserve his training
tasks: have a sparring match with Helvius Cecia
prove Helvius Cecia that you deserve his training
quest.description:
Hand to Hand training, eh? The real question is, can you fight?
You know, throw a good punch? Can you? I'd like to find out if I'm going to spend time working with you. So are you up for a sparring match?
I'll make it easy on you. I won't throw a single punch. I just want to see what you've got, anyway. So, is it a deal?
If I see you reach for a weapon, I'm calling it off. And if you can actually hurt me, I'll tell you to stop. If this goes on for too long, and I get bored, I'll stop you.
Now show me what you've got!

TESS106: a mortal man who ascended to godhood
TESS416: the nobleman who rules over Markarth

plots: the player asked Ondolemar what he is doing in Markarth
Ondolemar knows that Ogmund the Skald worships Talos in his home: the Jarl of Markarth refuses to arrest Ogmund the Skald

quest.title: Search and Seizure
quest.objective: find evidence of Ogmund the Skald's Talos worship for Ondolemar
tasks: break into Ogmund the Skald's home
find evidence of Ogmund the Skald's Talos worship for Ondolemar
quest.description:
I was sent here to lead the Thalmor's interests in this corner of the world. It's my mission to root out all Talos worship in this city.
You're awfully inquisitive, aren't you? I like that. Perhaps you'd care to solve a little problem I'm having? Ogmund the Skald. He's old, respected, and I know for a fact that he worships Talos in his home. But the Jarl has been hesitant to call for his arrest. I want you to break in to his home and find evidence.

plots: wants knowledge

quest.title: Of Horses and Donkeys
quest.objective: test out whether horses can breed with donkeys
tasks: tame a horse
tame a donkey
breed the tamed horse with the tamed donkey
test out whether horses can breed with donkeys
quest.description:
My daddy said that horses and donkeys can make babies together. I want to see what their babies look like!
You are a grown-up! You ought to know how to tame and breed animals. Please show me a baby donkey-horse! I have seen both donkeys and horses eating grass an plains and savannas. Try to tame one of both and make them breed!
Show me a baby horse-donkey, and I'll give you some golden apples. They're incredibly tasty... and so shiny!

TL252: a large city inhabited by the Zeraphi
TL2148: the military leader of the Zeraphi, captured by the Ezrohir

plots: the Ezrohir are preparing to assault Zeryphesh

quest.title: A High-Value Target
quest.objective: prevent the Ezrohir from interrogating Commander Muzaffar
tasks: Go to Ossean Wastes.
rescue Commander Muzaffar from the Ezrohir, before they take him to Riftkeep
prevent the Ezrohir from interrogating Commander Muzaffar
quest.description:
Greetings, my friend! Welcome to Zeryphesh! I am Malik Vosh. I speak for the Zeraphi.
As you know, the Ezrohir are preparing to assault our city. Our military leader, Commander Muzaffar, has apparently been captured by the Ezrohir, out in the Ossean Wastes. They'll have sent for soldiers to take their prisoners back to their stronghold. Once they get him to Riftkeep, they'll identify him quickly enough, and then they'll interrogate him until they know everything about our defenses.
I believe you're going out to the Ossean Wastes, the vast desert. Please, rescue Muzaffar. We need him.

BG2213: a distressed man who knows the player
BG2215: the player's sister, and Danno's crush

plots: Danno bought a love potion from Wallace at the market square: Danno gave Pala the love potion
Pala drank the love potion and collapsed

quest.title: Save Pala
quest.objective: save Pala from poisoning
tasks: Go to Trademeet.
meet Danno in Trademeet
save Pala from poisoning
quest.description:
Oh, Mazzy! Thank the gods that I've found you! I've hurt Pala!
You have to save her! I didn't mean to do it. I bought a love potion from Wallace the peddler at the market square. I just wanted her to love me. She only had a sip of it, and she collapsed.
She is with your mother, Mazzy. How was I to know it was poison? Oh, please hurry! I will meet you in Trademeet.

TESS169: a famous master chef, whose true identity is not known
TESS168: the female guildmaster of the Dark Brotherhood

plots: Astrid told the player about killing the Gourmet and taking his identity
the player should hide the Gourmet's body if they can

quest.title: Recipe for Death
quest.objective: assassinate the Gourmet, a famous master chef, and get his Writ of Passage to assume his identity
tasks: question Anton Virane to learn the true identity of the Gourmet, and kill Anton Virane
assassinate the Gourmet, a famous master chef, and get his Writ of Passage to assume his identity
quest.description:
Let's get down to business. Astrid told you about the Gourmet, I hope? That you need to kill him and take on his identity?
But first you'll need to learn who he is. Assuming, of course, that the Gourmet actually is a "he." Could be a woman for all we know. In my, um, investigations, I came upon this. It's a copy of the Gourmet's cookbook. Ah, but not just any copy. It's signed you see! Seems to be a message from the Gourmet to one Anton Virane. I've tracked Virane to the keep in Markarth. It would seem he's the cook.
You are to obtain that information from Virane - who the Gourmet really is, and where he can be found. Oh, and when you're done with Virane, kill him. Loose ends and all that.
As I was saying... You'll need to kill the Gourmet, of course. But what's more, you'll need to get his Writ of Passage, so you can take his place. Oh, and if you can, hide his body. The longer it takes for anyone else to determine his real identity, the better.
Now off with you!

plots: people around here have not been able to sleep for a week

quest.title: Zombie Infestation
quest.objective: return to Wenric after killing all zombies
tasks: kill 20 zombies
return to Wenric after killing all zombies
quest.description:
I be Wenric, a farmer by profession.
There's been something killing peoples in and 'round the farms here. Zombies or something. I can understands if you can't stomach the task but, just between you an' me real personal-likes, I don't know who else is gonna do it... All of us haves been goin' for a week now without sleep.
We've counted twenty zombies or so, so keep track as you kill 'em, if that's what you plans on doing.
Once you got 'em all, come back here and I'll gives you the 150 gold pieces that some of us have pooled together.

BG2159: of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart

plots: the player is a knight of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart
this is the player's final task

quest.title: The Dragon Slayer
quest.objective: retrieve the Holy Avenger from Firkraag
tasks: Go to Windspear Hills.
slay Firkraag in his lair
retrieve the Holy Avenger from Firkraag
quest.description:
Greetings. It is William Reirrac of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart and I believe it is time for you to perform one final task, if you are willing.
There is an item, a holy artifact, that lies within the hands of a great evil. Firkraag, the great red dragon, looms over the Windspear Hills. His reign must end, and from his lair you must retrieve the most holy of blades, the Holy Avenger. This tool of good has been in his possession for too long. Knight, I call upon you to slay the dragon and make a statement for right and justice.
The blade will be rescued, but so shall the lands that he rules. This is a great risk, but it must be dealt with sometime. Go, and may the forces of good be your salvation.
Accomplish this, and I can think of no one more worthy of wielding the Holy Avenger. In your hands, such a blade will strike deep to evil's heart.

TESS37: a book written by Katria's male apprentice, contains Katria's research on the Aetherium Forge

plots: the player read "The Aetherium Wars"

quest.title: Lost to the Ages
quest.objective: search for the Aetherium Forge with Katria
tasks: Go to .
find Katria's journal, which contains her notes about the Aetherium Forge
search for the Aetherium Forge with Katria
quest.description:
The name's Katria. I am - was - an adventurer. Raided ruins like this for nigh on twenty years. I was on the trail of something big. It led me here, and... I didn't make it.
Oh. You read the book, didn't you? "The Aetherium Wars"? It was my theory, you know. My research. My life's work. All of it, lost! Stolen by my own damn apprentice! That's how I ended up here. I can't rest. Not until I find the Aetherium Forge, until I can prove that it was my discovery. Mine, not his!
Hmm... well, you can pick up where I left off. My notes should still be in my journal, if you can read it. We still have to find the Forge itself. I had a lead on that, too.

plots: Zara wants knowledge
the player is a known villain

quest.title: A Witch of the Wild
quest.objective: help Zara determine whether the rumors about a witch in Darkwater Bog are true
tasks: Go to Darkwater Bog.
search Darkwater Bog for a witch
help Zara determine whether the rumors about a witch in Darkwater Bog are true
quest.description:
Oh great. It's the evil-doer. Our village faces enough hardship even without the likes of you!
On the contrary... Perhaps evil plus evil equals good. There are rumors about a witch in living in a nearby swamp. Many villagers, myself included, worry about the presence of a witch. Would you like to search Darkwater Bog for that witch, and confirm whether the rumors are true?
Even a villain can't resist the price I'm willing to pay for that knowledge: 16 diamonds.

plots: the player and Ralof are making their escape together: the player is a Nord

quest.title: Unbound
quest.objective: escape Imperial custody with Ralof
tasks: jump through the roof of the inn on the other side and keep running
escape Imperial custody with Ralof
quest.description:
Hey, Nord. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance!
See the inn on the other side? Jump through the roof and keep going! Go! I'll follow when I can!

plots: Daniel wants reputation
Daniel gives the player a box of building materials

quest.title: Jewel of the Desert
quest.objective: build an inn in Desert Refuge
tasks: gather up materials for building an inn
build an inn in Desert Refuge
quest.description:
Hail traveler! I'd guide you toward a soft bed, but as it happens, our village doesn't have an inn.
We really could use an inn: travelers heading in and out of the desert pass by Desert Refuge often. An inn would make our village even more famous! Could you build an inn here? You just need some building materials; I'll give you a box of materials to start with.
We will give you ten stacks of sand as a reward, to help you craft many useful things.

plots: the player recently assumed the ownership of the sphere-like building: by all rights, the Cowled Wizards should have the sphere
the Cowled Wizards let the player operate as a wizard in the sphere if the player agrees to do tasks for them

quest.title: Claiming the Sphere
quest.objective: accept Teos' special deal
tasks: do tasks for the Cowled Wizards
accept Teos' special deal
quest.description:
I am Teos, a Cowled Wizard, and I have been assigned to offer you... a special deal.
You just recently took this sphere, and by all rights we should have it, but my superiors said to offer an alternative. It would seem we have need of you.
That said, they would like to offer an exchange. You may operate in this awkwardly placed sphere if you agree to certain duties for the Cowled Wizards.
It is simple: You may have this place and act freely as a wizard. In exchange, you do the odd task for us, acting when we can't because of political or other reasons.

TESS312: the player's guildleader in the Companions, and a Nord who wants to end up in Sovngarde
TESS110: the storied afterlife of heroic Nords
TESS877: Hircine's realm, a place where the player can hunt forever
TESS289: the god of the werewolves, claims dead werewolves in the Hunting Grounds

plots: the Companions are nearly five thousand years old: the Companions became werewolves a few hundred years ago when the Glenmoril witches promised to grant the Companions great power in exchange for hunting their lord Hircine
the Companions were deceived: lycanthropy affects not just the Companions' bodies, but the Companions' spirits as well

quest.title: Blood's Honor
quest.objective: claim the head of a Glenmoril Witch so that Kodlak Whitemane can cure the Companions' lycanthropy
tasks: seek out the Glenmoril witches, kill them, and collect their heads
claim the head of a Glenmoril Witch so that Kodlak Whitemane can cure the Companions' lycanthropy
quest.description:
Have you heard the story of how we came to be werewolves?
The Companions are nearly five thousand years old. This matter of beastblood has only troubled us for a few hundred. One of my predecessors was a good, but short-sighted man. He made a bargain with the witches of Glenmoril Coven. If the Companions would hunt in the name of their lord, Hircine, we would be granted great power.
The Companions of old became werewolves. They did not believe the change would be permanent. The witches offered payment, like anyone else. But we had been deceived. The disease, you see, affects not just our bodies. It seeps into the spirit. Upon death, werewolves are claimed by Hircine for his Hunting Grounds. For some, this is a paradise. They want nothing more than to chase prey with their master for eternity. And that is their choice. But I am still a true Nord. And I wish for Sovngarde as my spirit home.
I've spent my twilight years trying to find a cure myself. And now I've found the answer. The witches' magic ensnared us, and only their magic can release us. They won't give it willingly, but we can extract their foul powers by force. I want you to seek them out. Go to their coven in the wilderness. Strike them down as a true warrior of the wild. And bring me their heads. The seat of their abilities. From there, we may begin to undo centuries of impurity.

TESS482: a merchant who used to sell East Empire Pendants
TESS107: an island with old East Empire Company mines
TESS483: popular amulets that were made exclusively for the East Empire Company, a popular collectible

plots: the player asked Fethis Alor whether he sells special mining gear: he does not

quest.title: Pain in the Necklace
quest.objective: bring East Empire Pendants to Fethis Alor
tasks: Go to Solstheim.
find East Empire Pendants
bring East Empire Pendants to Fethis Alor
quest.description:
Mining gear? No. However, I used to sell East Empire Pendants until I ran out of them. Popular little item.
It's an amulet that was made exclusively for the East Empire Company. They gave them to their workers as an incentive at one point... a kind of reward for extra effort. They're no longer being made, so they've become collectible. I'd love to get my hands on a few of them.
They could be anywhere on the island. The mines might be a good place to start. If you find any while you're exploring Solstheim, bring them here and I'll pay you for them.

TESO431: a young woman, whose heart is old and wise

plots: Dagail hears voices without her amulet

quest.title: Voices Without Bodies
quest.objective: help Dagail to find her amulet
tasks: seek Agata
help Dagail to find her amulet
quest.description:
You seek wisdom from me, child? Ah, no. You seek words of recommendation. Words are... difficult. They come and go. The voices, though. So loud they are, they drown out the words. Without my amulet, my stone to lock the voices away, the words will never come and stay. Would you lift your hands to help another, to help me find the words?
Seek Agata, child. She will see the path, and set you on it. She may be young, but her heart is old and wise. It guides her well through these troubled times.
I must rest.

TESO188: a sickly woman, and the proprietor
TESO191: a liquid cure that bubbles up from around an old statue

plots: Sickly Bernice thinks these may be her last days in the Shivering Isles
on the lowest level of the Knotty Bramble, there is a pool containing Aquanostrum: Sickly Bernice gives the player a special flask to collect the Aquanostrum

quest.title: A Liquid Solution
quest.objective: bring Aquanostrum to Sickly Bernice
tasks: Go to Knotty Bramble.
find Aquanostrum to cure Sickly Bernice's illness
bring Aquanostrum to Sickly Bernice
quest.description:
Oh... hello. Sickly Bernice, proprietor. Don't get too close now. You might catch what I have.
Well... it seems I am dying. Yes, these may be my last days in the Shivering Isles. That is, unless someone like yourself could help me find the cure. But no one has taken me up on my offer, even with the promise of a reward. Ah well, it's been a good life I suppose....
There's only one place in all the Isles to get the cure for what I have... Knotty Bramble. I'll mark it on your map. There, on the lowest level of the place, is a pool containing the cure: Aquanostrum. Legend has it that it bubbles up from around an old statue. Bring me back the remedy, and I will reward you well with a Circlet of Verdure. Here, take this special flask to collect the Aquanostrum.

TL2213: a military officer working for the Professor

plots: the Professor sent the player after the power source in the Scrapworks: the Officer and his troop are on the same mission
the Officer sent his troop to the Abandoned Sawmill: he has not heard from them

quest.title: The Cave-In
quest.objective: clear the way to the Scrapworks
tasks: Go to Abandoned Sawmill.
find dynamite
clear the way to the Scrapworks
quest.description:
So, the Professor sent you after the Power Source? We were on the same mission, but the only way to the Scrapworks is through that pile of rock.
I know the Abandoned Sawmill used to have plenty of explosives from when the place was still in operation - a little bit of dynamite would probably get the job done here.
I sent my troop after it, but haven't heard a thing. If you can head up there and get that dynamite, we could all pass through and get the Professor what he needs.

TESS54: a male scholar, and a member of the Blades

plots: the Thalmor hunted the Blades down, but the Blades have a headquarters of a sort now: it's time to rebuild the Blades
being a Blade is a lifelong commitment

quest.title: Rebuilding the Blades
quest.objective: recruit new members for the Blades
tasks: find anyone who would make a good Blades recruit and bring them to Delphine
recruit new members for the Blades
quest.description:
The Thalmor hunted us down. It wasn't exactly great for recruitment. But we have a headquarters of a sort now. We'll rebuild the Blades.
If you find anyone you think would make a good recruit, I can certainly take a look at them. Remember, though, being a Blade is a lifelong commitment. Their loyalty has to be with us once they're in.
After you have recruited enough new Blades, ask Esbern about the dragon lairs he's been studying. We'll have the recruits do some dragon hunting with you.

TESS593: the noblewoman who rules over Morthal
TESS595: a man who lusts after Alva

plots: Hroggar's wife and daughter died in the fire: Hroggar blames his wife for starting the fire because she spilled bear fat in the fireplace
rumors say that Hroggar started the fire himself so that he could get together with Alva

quest.title: Laid to Rest
quest.objective: investigate Hroggar's house fire
tasks: Go to .
find clues among the ashes
investigate Hroggar's house fire
quest.description:
I want you to look into Hroggar's house fire. He lost his wife and daughter in the blaze. My people believe the house to be cursed now. Who am I to gainsay them?
How the fire started? Hroggar blames his wife for spilling bear fat in the fire. Many folk think he set the fire himself. Lust can make a man do the unthinkable. The ashes were still warm when he pledged himself to to a woman named Alva.
I can't arrest Hroggar on rumor and gossip. But you, a stranger, might find the truth for us. Sift through the ashes at Hroggar's house that others are too fearful to touch. See what they tell you.
Should you prove him guilty or innocent, I will reward you.

TESO56: the Prince of Madness and the Lord of the Never-There, one of the Daedric Princes
TESO85: a creature that guards the Gates of Madness

plots: the Shivering Isles lie through the door behind Haskill
Sheogorath seeks a mortal to act as his Champion
the Gatekeeper dislikes strangers to the Shivering Isles

quest.title: Through the Fringe of Madness
quest.objective: become Sheogorath's champion
tasks: get past the Gates of Madness
become Sheogorath's champion
quest.description:
I am Haskill, Chamberlain to the Lord Sheogorath.
You approach the Shivering Isles. Through the door behind me lies the realm of Sheogorath, Prince of Madness, Lord of the Never-There.
My Lord seeks a mortal to act as His Champion. Perhaps the Lord Sheogorath will find a use for you. You'll want to pass through the Gates of Madness. Oh, and mind the Gatekeeper. He dislikes strangers to the Realm.

BG2159: a member of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart
BG2161: a tavern in the Umar Hills, in the village of Imnesvale

plots: the player is a knight of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart
Metrich wants some squatters removed from his lands: the squatters used violence against Metrich's men

quest.title: Dealing with the Baron
quest.objective: restore order to the lands of Metrich by solving a land dispute
tasks: Go to a neutral meeting place.
speak with Metrich
restore order to the lands of Metrich by solving a land dispute
quest.description:
Knight, we have been commissioned by a local barony. Such service to political figures is good for the Order, and you will serve quite well in the task.
It is necessary for us to be accessible in local concerns lest we seem above the people. In this case, a baron has petitioned us to solve a land dispute. Baron Metrich wishes some squatters removed and has cited violence against his men as reason for it. Go to his lands, restore order, and bring favor to us.
The baron waits in a neutral meeting place. He is in a tavern in the Umar Hills, in the village of Imnesvale. Go now.

TESO1: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood, giving quest via "Dead Drop Orders #1"
TESO373: an ancient necromancer, who is in the process of turning himself into a lich
TESO517: the player's first dead drop note, on Hero Hill

plots: "Dead Drop Orders #1" is addressed to the player: the player is a Silencer of the Dark Brotherhood

quest.title: Affairs of a Wizard
quest.objective: assassinate Celedaen
tasks: Go to Leafrot Cave.
search for Celedaen's written records that may contain evidence of some kind of weakness of his
assassinate Celedaen
quest.description:
Dead Drop Orders #1
by Lucien Lachance

Silencer,
You are now reading your first dead drop note, here on Hero Hill, which proves to me you were well-appointed to the tasks that lie ahead.
Journey now to Leafrot Cave. There you will encounter an ancient necromancer who is attempting to escape death by transforming himself into a lich. This necromancer, Celedaen, has not yet completed his metamorphosis, but is still immensely powerful, possibly too powerful to destroy if confronted directly. Search Leafrot Cave. Necromancers are wizards after all, and wizards are prolific by nature. Celedaen surely has written records, and these records may contain evidence of some kind of weakness. Perhaps there is some other way to destroy Celedaen besides a direct confrontation. But destroy him you must!
When the necromancer lies dead, journey to the city of Chorrol for your next dead drop. At the foot of the Great Oak, hidden in the bushes, is an old sack. Inside you will find your reward for killing the necromancer, as well as information regarding your next contract.
Serve me well, Silencer, and there's no telling just how far you might advance.

TESO477: a cave just north of Malene's inn

plots: Malene has seen undead of all types walking in the dark woods near the entrance to Moss Rock Cavern

quest.title: The Gravefinder's Repose
quest.objective: help Malene deal with Raelynn the Gravefinder
tasks: Go to Moss Rock Cavern.
kill Raelynn the Gravefinder
help Malene deal with Raelynn the Gravefinder
quest.description:
Thank goodness someone that can help is here! I don't know how to make this request any simpler, but to put it bluntly, Raelynn the Gravefinder must die.
A few months ago, that witch of a Necromancer decided to inhabit Moss Rock Cavern just north of my inn. I don't know what she does in there; frankly, I don't want to know. However, I do know that after she arrived, the woods at night became unsafe.
I've seen undead of all types walking in the dark woods near the cave entrance. Now, this area's getting a bad reputation and my business has waned. Every day, it seems the number of undead increase.
If someone can get into the cave and kill Raelynn, maybe we can stem the tide. Her death pays a handsome bounty. I hope you'll take advantage of the opportunity. Raelynn will finally get what's coming to her.

TESS890: Azura's shrine, up the steps to the altar
TESS891: Azura's shrine, up the steps to the altar
Azura's shrine, up the steps to the altar
TESS117: a fortress, endangered by water, yet untouched by it
TESS892: the queen of the night sky, a goddess
Azura's shrine, up the steps to the altar

plots: Azura has given Aranea Ienith the gift of foresight

quest.title: The Black Star
quest.objective: become the champion of Azura
tasks: Go to Winterhold.
ask around about an elven mage who can turn the brightest star as black as night
become the champion of Azura
quest.description:
Azura has seen your coming, traveler. It was not curiosity, but fate, that has led you here.
Azura has given me the gift of foresight. I had a vision of you walking up the steps to this altar long before you were born. You have been chosen to be her champion. I know it is unexpected, but do not worry. It will all unfold as she has predicted.
You must go to a fortress, endangered by water, yet untouched by it. Inside, you will find an elven mage who can turn the brightest star as black as night. It is cryptic, I know, but Azura's signs are never wrong. I believe the fortress may refer to Winterhold. Ask if they know this elven enchanter.

TESS77: a professor at the College of Winterhold
TESS930: the leader of the College of Winterhold
TESS416: the nobleman who rules over Markarth
TESS81: a powerful artifact that was held at the College of Winterhold
TESS82: a powerful staff that can contain energy from the Eye of Magnus

plots: the player is the Arch-Mage
the player should have the Staff of Magnus

quest.title: Aftershock
quest.objective: take care of a magical disturbance
tasks: Go to Markarth.
contain the power from the Eye of Magnus with the Staff of Magnus
take care of a magical disturbance
quest.description:
There is something you should be aware of, Arch-Mage. We've been contacted by the Jarl of Markarth. It would seem there's some sort of disturbance.
From what few details we were given, it sounds quite familiar. I suspect that the power released by the Eye of Magnus was not fully contained, and has coalesced in this part of Skyrim. I do hope you still have the Staff of Magnus someplace. I suspect you're going to need it to contain the power.
I'm sure the Jarl will be quite pleased to. I think it only fitting that the Arch-Mage personally receive a large portion of the reward.

BG2173: Mairyn's sacred lands to the north of this place where the temple of the sun god once stood
BG2174: Mairyn's sacred lands to the north of this place where the temple of the sun god once stood
Mairyn's sacred lands to the north of this place where the temple of the sun god once stood

plots: the player is a ranger
the humans have come recently, digging and tearing down the trees: Mairyn begged the humans to stop but they refused

quest.title: Humans Destroying Forest
quest.objective: stop the humans from further desecrating Mairyn's forest
tasks: seek out the nature of the humans' quest
stop the humans from further desecrating Mairyn's forest
quest.description:
Good ranger! My name is Mairyn... I am a spirit of this forest, and I am in desperate need of your aid!
There are... other humans... in my sacred lands to the north of this place where the temple of the sun god once stood. They have come recently, digging and tearing down the trees... I have begged them to stop, good ranger... I have pleaded with them that they are destroying not only me, but many of the other forest spirits as well. The humans have refused.
I implore you... go to the forest in the north and do whatever you can to stop these humans from further desecrating my forest! You must go to them, and seek out the nature of their quest, if you wish. Whatever you do, however, you must stop them.
I... I have nothing to offer you, ranger, other than my gratitude. May Mielikki shine on you, good ranger.

TESO55: a male beggar, and a humanoid cat

plots: Bhisha the Khajiit follows Ushnar gro-Shadborgob everywhere

quest.title: Ushnar's Terror
quest.objective: stop Bhisha the Khajiit from tailing Ushnar gro-Shadborgob
tasks: make Bhisha the Khajiit go away for good
stop Bhisha the Khajiit from tailing Ushnar gro-Shadborgob
quest.description:
That cat beggar Bhisha the Khajiit is following me! He's going to eat me, I just know it. Don't look! He's standing right over there.
You haven't seen that filthy cat beggar have you? He's still around. I've seen him skulking like the filthy cat he is.
Isn't he scary? I wish someone would just make him disappear. I would do just about anything for you if you make him go away. Permanently. For good. Never to be seen again.
You need a dog. I happen to have one of my old ones still lying around. I'll send it to you after you get rid of the filthy cat man.

TESO144: a member of the Thieves Guild, and the Doyen of the Gray Fox
TESO146: the legendary guildleader of the Thieves Guild

plots: Armand Christophe is addressing the player, Methredhel, and Amusei
members of the Thieves Guild are followers of the Gray Fox: the one who wins the contest is allowed to join the Thieves Guild
the beggars will help the player locate Amantius Allectus's diary, for a price
Armand Christophe can sell the player lockpicks

quest.title: May the Best Thief Win
quest.objective: win the contest against Methredhel and Amusei
tasks: Go to Imperial City.
steal Amantius Allectus's diary without killing him, Methredhel, or Amusei
win the contest against Methredhel and Amusei
quest.description:
Everyone is here, let's begin.
Each of you is seeking membership in the Thieves Guild. The Thieves Guild is not a myth. We are followers of the Gray Fox, and I am his Doyen.
Merely by finding me, you have passed the first test. It's unusual for us to have three potential recruits at the same time. Rather than the normal test of skill, I'm going to make this a contest. Methredhel, you know the rules. However, for Amusei and the newcomer, let me state them clearly.
Whoever brings me the diary of Amantius Allectus, without killing him, will be invited into the guild. It's somewhere in the Imperial City. The beggars will help you locate it, for a price. I can sell you lockpicks if you need them.
One more thing. You cannot kill each other during this trial. We may be thieves, but we're not murderers.

TESS15: a fellow member of the Companions

plots: Farkas knows where the player might find the dragon

quest.title: Dragon Seekers
quest.objective: kill a dragon with Farkas
tasks: lead Farkas to the dragon
kill a dragon with Farkas
quest.description:
Travelers have been coming to Whiterun. They tell stories about dragons. I've heard of them, but didn't think they were real.
Rumors also claim that you have defeated dragons before. You are a very brave person worthy of being a Companion. But I already knew that.
Let's go kill a dragon together. That's one way to find out if they're real. I even know where we might find one. Lead on!

TESO150: a merchant, and the chairperson for the Society of Concerned Merchants

plots: trouble began when Thoronir opened his store selling all kinds of merchandise undercutting the competition: Thoronir refuses to join the Society of Concerned Merchants or discuss the matter

quest.title: Unfriendly Competition
quest.objective: find proof about Thoronir's wrongdoing
tasks: investigate Thoronir's store to find out where he gets his inventory
find proof about Thoronir's wrongdoing
quest.description:
I think you may be just the kind of person we're looking for. Perhaps you can assist us with a problem we're having here in the Market District.
I'm the chairperson for the Society of Concerned Merchants. We formed this group a while back to keep a nice fair economic balance in town. Not every store is a member, but we're slowly trying to convince them to join. Everything was fine until Thoronir opened his shop nearby.
Selling all sorts of merchandise, Thoronir undercuts prices like you wouldn't believe. He doesn't always sell what we sell, but it is still a problem. People who buy tend to want to spend their money there. That leaves none for us. It's getting so bad, a few of us may have to close up shop. He outright refuses to join the Society or even discuss the matter. We are convinced he is up to no good.
What we need is for you to case his establishment, and figure out where he gets his inventory. Find some proof of his wrongdoing, and let us know. We cannot do it ourselves, as he recognizes all of us. The job pays a fair bounty in gold when he is brought to justice.

TESS604: a dangerous, rogue male Dark Elf mage who studies dwarwen artifacts

plots: the player has done assassination contracts for Nazir before

quest.title: Deadly Research
quest.objective: assassinate Maluril
tasks: Go to Mzinchaleft.
find Maluril
assassinate Maluril
quest.description:
I have another assassination contract for you: Maluril. He's dangerous. Very dangerous. A rogue Dark Elf mage doing research into dwarven artifacts should be both respected... and feared. Just not by you.
Maluril is doing his research in Mzinchaleft. A Dwarven ruin... what an exotic place for a kill. I hope the elf doesn't give you too much trouble. I once got set on fire by a sorcerer. Nasty business, that. But I digress.

TESS168: the player's dying leader in the Dark Brotherhood
TESS813: the man who leads the Penitus Oculatus

plots: Astrid betrayed the player by giving the player to the Penitus Oculatus: the Penitus Oculatus destroyed the Dark Brotherhood
Astrid opposed the old ways that guided the Dark Brotherhood for centuries unlike the player and the Night Mother

quest.title: Death Incarnate
quest.objective: fulfill Astrid's contract
tasks: kill Astrid
fulfill Astrid's contract
quest.description:
Alive.... You're alive... Thank Sithis...
Ssshhh.... Please. There is much... I have to say. And... not much time... I'm sorry. So very sorry. The Penitus Oculatus... Maro... He said that by giving you to them, he would leave the Dark Brotherhood alone. Forever. By Sithis, I was such a fool. All of this... it's all my fault. You are the best of us, and I nearly killed you... as I've killed everyone else...
I'm saying you were right. The Night Mother was right. The old ways... they guided the Dark Brotherhood for centuries. I was a fool to oppose them. And to prove my... sincerity, I have prayed for a contract. You lead this Family now. I give you the Blade of Woe, so that you can see it through.
You must kill... Me.

TESS208: one of the finest breeding horses in the realm
TESS209: Sibbi Black-Briar's mother, and a dangerous, powerful woman

plots: Sibbi Black-Briar agreed to sell Frost to Louis Letrush
Maven Black-Briar threw Sibbi Black-Briar in Riften Jail before he delivered Frost to Louis Letrush: Sibbi Black-Briar thinks that this exempts him from selling Frost to Louis Letrush

quest.title: Promises to Keep
quest.objective: help Louis Letrush get Frost and his lineage papers from Sibbi Black-Briar
tasks: Go to Riften Jail.
talk to Sibbi Black-Briar about Frost and the lineage papers
help Louis Letrush get Frost and his lineage papers from Sibbi Black-Briar
quest.description:
I'm Louis Letrush. Looking for work? I need someone to deliver a message to Sibbi Black-Briar.
I recently approached Sibbi Black-Briar about buying Frost, one of the finest breeding horses in the realm. He agreed to sell. I paid Sibbi half the cost of Frost up front, but before he could deliver, Maven had him locked up. Sibbi believes this exempts him from our deal. It does not.
Head to the Riften Jail and talk to Sibbi. Get him to tell you where Frost and his Lineage Papers are and bring them to me outside Riften. You'll be well paid for your time.

TESO350: an elderly vampire hunter, and the leader of the Order of the Virtuous Blood
the sanctuary of the Order of the Virtuous Blood in the Imperial City
TESO351: the sanctuary of the Order of the Virtuous Blood in the Imperial City
the sanctuary of the Order of the Virtuous Blood in the Imperial City
Roland Jenseric's house in the Temple District of the Imperial City
TESO352: Roland Jenseric's house in the Temple District of the Imperial City
Roland Jenseric's house in the Temple District of the Imperial City
TESO353: Roland Jenseric's house in the Temple District of the Imperial City

plots: the player is a famous hero: the player has not met Seridur before
Seridur and his fellow vampire hunters are only 3 old men lacking the strength to defeat vampires in battle
Roland killed his girlfriend in the back garden of his house by sucking her blood out of her neck
the player should return to the sanctuary of the Order of the Virtuous Blood if they have questions: the Order of the Virtuous Blood meet at night

quest.title: Order of the Virtuous Blood
quest.objective: kill Roland Jenseric
tasks: Go to .
search for clues about Roland Jenseric's whereabouts
kill Roland Jenseric
quest.description:
It's an honor to finally meet you. When I heard you were in town, I just had to send for your help. Your reputation precedes you. Oh, allow me to introduce myself. I am Seridur.
Welcome. You're now in the sanctuary of the Order of the Virtuous Blood. Few outside our circle have ever set foot in our hallowed hall. We are, for lack of a better word, defenders. We guard this city from an infestation that plagues it. We are vampire hunters. I'm sure you are familiar with those despicable beings. Feeding on the innocent as if they were cattle. Well, this group was formed to combat them. Alas, we are but 3 old men, not able to match the fighting prowess of the vampire. We lack the strength to defeat them in battle.
Our goal is to root out the vampires that live in our fair city. So far, we've been unsuccessful finding one until now. It's come to the Order's attention that Temple District resident Roland Jenseric is a vampire, and has already claimed one victim. That's where you come in. We want you to slay this vampire and cleanse the city of his filth before he can feed or kill again.
A few nights ago, I was roaming the city as I often do, looking for any signs of a vampire. As I headed past Roland's house I heard a cry. I rushed into the back garden to find Roland struggling with a woman he'd been courting. I tried to intervene, but he was too strong. He threw his lover to the ground and turned his attention on me. Luckily, I managed to run back into the street and escape his grasp. I hid for a while and then returned to the garden. Roland was gone and the woman was dead. She had two puncture marks on the nape of her neck. That's when I realized he was a vampire. The Order needs you to track him and destroy him.
I would start by searching his home. He hasn't been there for days, so it should be safe. Return to us here if you have questions. We meet at night.

TL29: a researcher, giving quest via "Blair's Notes"
TL215: notes on the discovery of the Thing

plots: the Thing got in Bennings, but then Fuchs disappeared

quest.title: The Thing
quest.objective: destroy the Thing before it infects the whole world
tasks: find the Thing
destroy the Thing before it infects the whole world
quest.description:
"Blair's Notes"
by Blair

It was in the ice. Who knows how long? But it wasn't dead. And now it's hiding, here somewhere... in one of us. We found it in Bennings, but then Fuchs disappeared. It's still here, and it's looking for a way out. If it gets out into the world, it can infect everyone, everywhere. Three years, at most. Gods forgive us for what we've set loose upon the world.

TESS12: a school for mages in Skyrim
TESS31: a scroll that can show the player the past

plots: the player asked Esbern what they need to learn Dragonrend

quest.title: Elder Knowledge
quest.objective: recover an Elder Scroll to learn Dragonrend
tasks: Go to College of Winterhold.
talk to the mages about finding an Elder Scroll
recover an Elder Scroll to learn Dragonrend
quest.description:
Ah, you need an Elder Scroll. There's a pretty puzzle. Not the kind of thing you'll find in your local bookshop. Let me think...
Perhaps the College of Winterhold. What learning there is in Skyrim is gathered there. One of the mages there may be able to put you on the trail of this Elder Scroll.
This Elder Scroll might be able to show you the past in some way, and let you learn the Dragonrend shout.

TESO185: the Duchess of Dementia, an incredibly paranoid woman

plots: the player was sent by the Madgod
the player will be Syl's Grand Inquisitor

quest.title: The Lady of Paranoia
quest.objective: find the people who conspire against Syl
tasks: talk to Herdir for help
find the people who conspire against Syl
quest.description:
Why do you approach Syl, the Duchess of Dementia? Do you seek death?
You're the one the Madgod sent, aren't you? Then you're safe for now. Speak to no one unless I instruct you to. None of them can be trusted. Do you hear me? None! Surrounded by traitors and spies, I am. Always, always. They watch and wait, eager to slip a knife into my spine when I'm not looking.
Could be all of them. Every last one. None can be trusted. But they'll never take me down. Never! I'll see them all rotting in shallow graves before I let my guard down! You... you will help me. Yes, yes. You will be most useful.
You're going to find out who knows. You're going to learn who keeps secrets, who conspires against me. You will be my Grand Inquisitor. Expose the conspirators, and they will be punished, I assure you. Find out who keeps secrets, and what they are. Speak with Herdir. He will help you. Do you understand what is required of you? If no one is found, you will be held responsible.

plots: the player has asked training from Alix Lencolia: the player is not well known

quest.title: Blade Training
quest.objective: become known as a hero or a villain
tasks: increase your fame or infamy
become known as a hero or a villain
quest.description:
Training? From me? I'm sorry, friend, but I have no idea who you are. Never heard of you. I'm afraid I don't offer training to just anyone. If you were famous, perhaps... or infamous, I suppose... that might count for something. But, alas, you're not.
Until I hear your name spoken by others, don't expect any training from me. When you're known as a hero or a villain, I might change my mind.

TESO135: the player's superior in the Mages Guild
the grove, to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave

the grove, to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave

tasks: speak to Zahrasha or Eletta, and choose wisely
complete your induction into the Mages Guild by creating your own staff
quest.description:
Before you can begin work for the guild, you'll need to do something for yourself. Every mage carries a staff. It is crafted and enchanted by the guild, and is a symbol of status. You need such a staff.
The wood used for staves comes from a grove to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave. Several mages tend to the grove, and should be able to assist you. Speak with either Zahrasha or Eletta when you arrive.
And choose wisely.

plots: the Synod seemed convinced the Staff of Magnus was somewhere in Skyrim: the Synod will not be cooperative

find the members of the Synod
learn the location of the Staff of Magnus
quest.description:
The Synod seemed convinced the Staff of Magnus was somewhere in Skyrim. They inquired about the ruins of Mzulft, but that's all I remember.
It sounded like they were heading there, though they were rather secretive about why. I suppose if you're intent on looking for the staff, there's a chance they might be in Mzulft yet. Just don't expect them to be cooperative.

plots: the player is Higgold's patron
the Turmish fanatics are not permitting the play: the dress rehearsal is supposed to be tomorrow

quest.objective: do something about the Turmish fanatics

do something about the Turmish fanatics
quest.description:
Ah! Patron! This is unbelievable! There are... a group of Turmish fanatics in the playhouse! They have taken it over!
They charged in and scared the cast to death yelling nonsense about not permitting the play! They said they would sooner burn the playhouse than allow the show! And the dress rehearsal is supposed to be tomorrow! Gah! Patron, you've got to do something! Stop them, please!

plots: the player asked Andragil to train the player in blocking

quest.title: Block Training
quest.objective: demonstrate your blocking skills to Andragil
tasks: block Andragil's attacks with your shield
demonstrate your blocking skills to Andragil
quest.description:
You want training, from me? Well, perhaps I can accommodate you. If you're worth the time and effort, that is. I think a little test is in order.
Thinking you know how to use a shield is one thing. Actually using one is quite another. So here's what we're going to do. We're going to find out whether or not you can hold up in combat. You put up your shield, and I hit you. If you're still standing when I'm done, you've earned the right to learn what I have to teach.
Shall we find out what you really know? Now, put up your guard, and let's begin. I'm losing interest in this.

the player is a friend of Baker

bring a cake to Baker
quest.description:
My friend, as you might know, I'm not a man to say no to the sweeter temptations in life.
I'd be overjoyed, if you baked me a delicious cake and brought it to me.
I'm not leaving you hanging either: I have 3 golden apples for you.

plots: wants equipment
glistering melon slices are used to brew healing potions

find Cleo
bring glistering melon slices to Cleo
quest.description:
I am a farmer here in Seaside Settlement. Sometimes, I get a bountiful harvest of melons. I process most of the melons into glistering melon slices for clerics and their important healing potions.
I actually just finished preparing some glistering melon slices. Could you please take them to the cleric in the village of Humming Hills? I'm sure she'll pay you for them.

TESO135: the player's underling in the Mages Guild

At your convenience, consult her at the Lustratorium.

TESO519: County Hall, in the Cheydinhal castle

County Hall, in the Cheydinhal castle
