speak to Garrus Darelliun, the second-in-command of the guard, about Ulrich Leland
do something about Ulrich Leland
quest.description:
You seem far too nice to be one of Ulrich Leland's men. What can I do for you?
Don't even get me started about Ulrich. That madman won't be satisfied until everyone in town is dead broke...or in jail! What in Oblivion is Ulrich doing with all that money anyway? I'm sure he's lining his pockets with the gold of the good citizens of Cheydinhal.
There's only one man who seems to care: Garrus Darelliun, the second-in-command of the guard. I hear he isn't happy with Ulrich. I don't know what you can do for us in this situation. I mean, Ulrich Leland is the Captain after all.
Perhaps you could speak to Garrus. You can find him roaming the County Hall of the castle most of the time.

BG128: to the south of the Friendly Arm Inn
BG130: to the south of the Friendly Arm Inn
to the south of the Friendly Arm Inn

plots: Unshey had to bargain her new Girdle of Piercing for her life

quest.title: A Rogue Ogre
quest.objective: bring the Girdle of Piercing to Unshey
tasks: kill the ogre holding the Girdle of Piercing
bring the Girdle of Piercing to Unshey
quest.description:
Hey, I'm Unshey, an aspiring writer.
Have you heard? There's a rogue ogre with a belt fetish to the south of the Friendly Arm Inn. I had to bargain my new girdle of piercing for my life out there. Wasn't even interested in an autographed copy of my book. Hey, if you can get that belt back to me, I'd be mighty grateful.
You'll get 95 gold pieces for your trouble, and a new history book I've just completed.

plots: the player asked Farengar Secret-Fire whether he is the only wizard in Whiterun: Farengar Secret-Fire is the only wizard, but Whiterun is also home to a priest, a priestess, and alchemist, and others

quest.title: Salt for Arcadia
quest.objective: deliver some frost salts for Farengar Secret-Fire
tasks: give the frost salts to Arcadia, the local alchemist
deliver some frost salts for Farengar Secret-Fire
quest.description:
I believe I am, yes. Technically speaking, of course. The city is also home to a priest, a priestess, an alchemist, and I'm sure others who practice. Ah, that reminds me. Speaking of alchemists, I have some frost salts for Arcadia. She asked me to obtain them for one of her potions.
Would you be so kind as to deliver the frost salts for me? I'm sure Arcadia will provide some form of recompense…

plots: Carl wants knowledge
the player is a friend of Carl

quest.title: Assistant Cartographer
quest.objective: give the map of Spruced Hills to Carl
tasks: Go to Spruced Hills.
make a map of Spruced Hills
give the map of Spruced Hills to Carl
quest.description:
I raise my face from my maps for a moment, and there you are! Just as I need the help of a trusted friend.
There are many, many regions in this world: mapping them all out is a tremendous task. I ask you to map out one of them: Spruced Hills. It is a taiga hills region, which means that there might be some rather steep hills covered in spruces and snow.
After making a map of Spruced Hills, come back here and give the map to me. I shall give you a spyglass, a fine tool for an aspiring cartographer.
Travel safely! Being mindful of your surroundings is an important skill for everyone, not just us cartographers.

TESO28: Ursanne's missing husband who developed a gambling addiction

plots: Aleron Loche wasted Ursanne and his hard earned money on bets: Aleron Loche wanted to move him and Ursanne to the Imperial City
Aleron Loche borrowed money from Kurdan gro-Dragol: Aleron Loche owes Kurdan gro-Dragol 500 gold
Aleron Loche did not return home after meeting Kurdan gro-Dragol at the Lonely Suitor Lodge yesterday

quest.title: Caught in the Hunt
quest.objective: find Aleron Loche
tasks: Go to Lonely Suitor Lodge.
speak with Kurdan gro-Dragol
find Aleron Loche
quest.description:
I'm Ursanne. I'm sorry to impose upon you like this, but I'm in need of assistance, and I don't know what to do. My husband, Aleron, is missing.
It all started when Aleron became foolish, and started gambling. He'd visit the arena every week and spend our hard earned money on bets. I told him to stop, but he didn't listen. He was certain he could win us a fortune and move us somewhere nicer, like the Imperial City. It didn't take long for Aleron to begin losing. He resorted to borrowing money from a usurer to cover his losses and place new bets. As you can imagine, it didn't pay off. He ended up owing around 500 gold. We could never have that kind of money to pay back the usurer.
Yesterday, the usurer, Kurdan gro-Dragol, sent for my husband to meet him at the Lonely Suitor Lodge. He hasn't returned since. I fear for his life. Kurdan isn't known for his patience. Please, I'm not wealthy, but I'd give anything to see Aleron again. Please, find Aleron.
Farewell, and be careful, Kurdan is not to be trusted.

TESO300: a wine enthusiast, and a master alchemist

plots: the player asked Sinderion to train them

quest.title: Alchemy Training
quest.objective: bring a bottle of each of the best wines from Skingrad to Sinderion
tasks: find a bottle of Tamika's, and Surilie Brothers vintages of year 399
bring a bottle of each of the best wines from Skingrad to Sinderion
quest.description:
Training? Oh, I'm afraid that's not my area of expertise. I'm very focused on wines right now, you see.
Wonderful thing, wine. It's all about the balance. The flavor, the bouquet, the consistency... just wonderful. I'm sorry, what? Training... right. I'll make you a deal: you fetch me a bottle of each of the best wines from Skingrad, and I'll think about it.
Both vineyards, Tamika's and Surilie Brothers. Vintage 399. Oh, what a good year that was...

TESO56: the prince of madness, one of the Daedric Princes
TESO164: the prince of order, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: Sheogorath does not know how much time he has left: Sheogorath wants the Gatekeeper to guard the Gates and be ready for Jyggalag's forces
the player should tell Relmyna that they are working for Sheogorath: Relmyna would do anything for Sheogorath

quest.title: Rebuilding the Gatekeeper
quest.objective: rebuild the Gatekeeper
tasks: Go to Xaselm.
talk to Relmyna
rebuild the Gatekeeper
quest.description:
Things are getting a bit thin. Get that Gatekeeper in place, and do it quickly. I'm not sure how much time I have left.
It's essential. Simply essential! If only it were essentially simple... but it's not. I want him there guarding those Gates. If any of Jyggalag's forces show up, he should be ready for them.
It wouldn't do to just let them in if more show up. And more always show up. Still and all, I think things are going well, considering! Go talk to Relmyna in Xaselm. Tell her you're working for me. She'd do anything for me, that little minx.

plots: the player asked mercantile training from Palonirya

quest.title: Mercantile Training
quest.objective: prove to Palonirya that you have enough capital to receive her expertise
tasks: collect 10,000 Septims
prove to Palonirya that you have enough capital to receive her expertise
quest.description:
Training? Well, my dear, good business sense is just something that comes naturally to me. You've got to have the know-how, or else I can't teach you anything at all.
Do you have what it takes? Do you even know what it takes? Gold, that's what! Septims, and lots of them! Show me that you've got the starting capital, at least ten thousand in liquid assets.
Afterwards, I'll help you learn how to put it to good use.

plots: the player asked Farengar Secret-Fire to teach them how to enchant weapons and armor
learning an enchantment from an item destroys the item
Farengar Secret-Fire can sell the player everything they need

quest.title: The Joy of Enchanting
quest.objective: use an Arcane Enchanter and a filled soul gem to enchant something
tasks: take an enchanted weapon or piece of armor and use an Arcane Enchanter to learn its enchantment
use an Arcane Enchanter and a filled soul gem to enchant something
quest.description:
Ah, a student of the craft. You'll need to start by learning an enchantment.
Take an enchanted weapon or piece of armor, then use the Arcane Enchanter to learn its secrets. The item is destroyed in the process, so be wary. Once you know an enchantment, you'll need a filled soul gem, and something to enchant. You'll use the Arcane Enchanter for that, too.
Of course I have everything you need for sale, if you have the coin.

plots: Jaheira kept the player waiting as there were things she had to take care of
Jaheira was asked to bring the player to the Harper Hold

quest.title: Summoned to the Harper Hold
quest.objective: see the Harpers with Jaheira
tasks: go with Jaheira
see the Harpers with Jaheira
quest.description:
Hail there! I said I would return, and I have. Sorry to have kept you waiting, but there were things I had to take care of. Now that we have met once again, there is something I must ask of you.
We must go to the Harper Hold in Athkatla. I have been asked to bring you, and we must go soon. They will allow us to pass the wards of the door, but I must be with you.

plots: Delon does not have any money
Delon was sent to find someone who could help his home village Imnesvale: terrible beasts have been seen out in the hills
Umar herself might have returned
Minister Lloyd can tell everything else

quest.title: Investigate the Deaths in the Umar Hills
quest.objective: investigate the monster sightings at Imnesvale
tasks: Go to Imnesvale.
talk to Minister Lloyd
investigate the monster sightings at Imnesvale
quest.description:
My name's Delon. I was sent to f-find someone, but things have been gone all wrong! *sniffle* I've had all my money stolen, and I'm lost, and everyone's so mean. *sniff*
I was sent to find someone who could h-help my village, Imnesvale. Terrible things are happening there, and nobody knows what to do! Everyone says they seen strange b-beasts out in the hills. Everyone's so frightened! There's even t-t-talk that Umar herself has returned!
When you get to Imnesvale, talk to Minister Lloyd! He can tell you everything else!

BG2181: a man who hates Garren Windspear

plots: Garren Windspear left his home in the player's care
Jierdan Firkraag and his hooligans kidnapped Garren Windspear's daughter from Garren Windspear's home
the player will travel unmolested, because Garren Windspear pleaded the player's virtue at the Radiant Heart

quest.title: Rescue Garren's Child from Firkraag
quest.objective: rescue Garren Windspear's daughter, and avenge the slain knights of the Radiant Heart
tasks: Go to .
find Jierdan Firkraag
rescue Garren Windspear's daughter, and avenge the slain knights of the Radiant Heart
quest.description:
My daughter is gone! I left my home in your care! I... I... no, no, I know it was not you... I know who my enemies are. Damn that Jierdan Firkraag! What is his grief with me?! I don't know where you will find him. His hooligans prevent searching. I don't know... Perhaps the ruins in the northeast? I don't know...
Please rescue my child, no matter the risk. You will travel unmolested, for my pleas of your virtue were heard at the Radiant Heart. They demand justice for the slain knights, so that is your task now. Do this, and your honor shall be restored.

TESO159: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild
TESO408: a fellow member of the Fighters Guild, a missing man
TESO230: a fellow member of the Fighters Guild, Vilena Donton's son
TESO409: the female guildmaster of the Fighters Guild, protective of Viranus Donton
TESO410: a fellow member of the Fighters Guild, Viranus Donton's older brother, Vilena Donton's eldest son

plots: Vitellus Donton was killed in action recently: the player may have seen the other wounded around

quest.title: The Master's Son
quest.objective: bolster Viranus Donton's confidence by find Galtus Previa in Nonwyll Cavern with Viranus Donton
tasks: Go to Donton house.
take Viranus Donton on a mission with you
bolster Viranus Donton's confidence by find Galtus Previa in Nonwyll Cavern with Viranus Donton
quest.description:
I've got another job for you, slightly off the record. You'll be going on a mission with Viranus Donton. Yes -- the guildmaster's son.
You're to accompany him, and make sure he succeeds. He needs some time in the field, to get his confidence up, or he'll never become a good warrior. Vilena coddles the boy too much. Doesn't want him in the line of fire. Suppose it's no surprise after Vitellus.
Vitellus was Vilena Donton's eldest son. Good man. We lost him on a botched mission recently. You've probably seen the other wounded around. If you're smart, you'll steer clear of the subject around the guildmaster. Perhaps you and I will have time to discuss it more later.
Viranus' mother's been holding him back, protecting him. You'll go to Nonwyll Cavern with him. Galtus Previa was lost there, and you're to find him. And not a word of this to the guildmaster! Go find him. He'll be in the Donton house, most likely. And bring him back in one piece!

TL238: a villainous man holding Ordrak's Heart
TL242: a powerful relic infused with the energy stolen from the Guardians
TL2107: a device that upholds the barriers between the worlds

plots: the Clockwork Core can be restored with Ordrak's Heart

quest.title: Into the Dark
quest.objective: defeat the Alchemist and seize Ordrak's Heart before he destroys the Clockwork Core
tasks: overtake the Alchemist before he reaches the Clockwork Core
defeat the Alchemist and seize Ordrak's Heart before he destroys the Clockwork Core
quest.description:
You must overtake the Alchemist before he reaches the Clockwork Core. With the power of Ordrak's Heart, he could destroy the barrier between the worlds, which would mean the end of everything.
You must defeat the Alchemist and seize the Heart. He intends to use it for destruction, but, infused with the energy stolen from the Guardians, it now has the power to restore the Clockwork Core, and repair the damage to the barrier.

TESS338: fire salts, strange minerals that burns as hot as lava
fire salts, strange minerals that burns as hot as lava

plots: Balimund's forge consumes fire salts

quest.title: Stoking the Flames
quest.objective: bring 10 fire salts to restore Balimund's forge
tasks: find 10 fire salts
bring 10 fire salts to restore Balimund's forge
quest.description:
Come to see Balimund perform miracles with steel, eh? Smithing's been in my blood for generations.
I owe my success to my forefathers and their recipe for flame. The secret is my forge. It consumes fire salts, a strange mineral that burns as hot as lava.
Sadly, this forge is dying and I've used the last of my fire salts. If I can't feed it soon, it may grow cold. Ten pinches of fire salts should give me all I need to bring this forge back to life.
Could you get the fire salts for me? I know that they are hard to come by, but they would save my business and warm an old smith's heart.

BG1182: the art collector's estate, west of the fairgrounds, in the center of Baldur's Gate
the art collector's estate, west of the fairgrounds, in the center of Baldur's Gate
BG1183: the art collector's estate, west of the fairgrounds, in the center of Baldur's Gate
BG1184: the helmet of a legendary hero
the art collector's estate, west of the fairgrounds, in the center of Baldur's Gate

plots: mercenaries were petrified while trying to break into the home of Ramazith: Ramazith sold the mercenaries to an art collector
Degrodel gives the player six scrolls of stone to flesh to unpetrify the mercenaries
one of the mercenaries has the Helm of Balduran

quest.title: Searching for Balduran's Helmet
quest.objective: bring the Helm of Balduran to Degrodel
tasks: unpetrify the mercenaries
bring the Helm of Balduran to Degrodel
quest.description:
First of all, my name is Degrodel. I have been on the lookout for skilled adventurers. My task is very simple.
Some years ago, an evil band of mercenaries were all petrified while trying to break into the home of Ramazith. For those of you with a limited vocabulary, petrified means "turned to stone." Anyhow, one of those adventurers had in his possession an item of power: the Helm of Balduran. Ramazith didn't know this at the time and so, after turning them all to stone, he simply sold their bodies to an art collector living in the heart of Baldur's Gate.
What I would like you to do is find these statues, turn them back to flesh, and take the item. I will give you these six scrolls of stone to flesh. Use them on the statues when you find them.
The estate can be found just west of the fairgrounds in the center of town. Good luck, and don't entertain any thoughts about betraying me. It could be very hazardous to your health.
You will be paid 5,000 gold for this service. This is a kingly sum, so I won't barter with you about the amount.

TESS778: an orphaned dark elf who was raised by Argonians in the Black Marsh
TESS126: the land of the dark elves

plots: when Brand-Shei was found by his Argonian father, Brand-Shei was wrapped in a blanket bearing the symbol of House Telvanni

quest.title: Distant Memories
quest.objective: help Brand-Shei uncover his past
tasks: find clues about Brand-Shei's past
help Brand-Shei uncover his past
quest.description:
I may be dark elf by birth, but I was raised Argonian. Through reasons I'm still trying to discover, I ended up orphaned then taken in by a kindly Argonian family in Black Marsh. I hope one day to find out what happened to me... how I ended up like that.
I know when I was found by my Argonian father, I was wrapped in a blanket bearing the symbol of House Telvanni. It was one of the great houses in Morrowind long ago. Whether that means I was one of them or not, I'm uncertain.
If you come across anything in your travels that might provide me with the answers I'm looking for, I'd be grateful.

TESS367: the sly, lazy steward of the Jarl of Winterhold
TESS12: a college for mages in Winterhold
TESS370: the nobleman who rules over Winterhold

plots: the Jarl of Winterhold thinks that Malur Seloth has some connection with the College of Winterhold: he goes easy on Malur Seloth

quest.title: Keeping Up the Appearances
quest.objective: give Nelacar's mage's staff to Malur Seloth
tasks: Go to Frozen Hearth.
steal Nelacar's mage's staff from his room
give Nelacar's mage's staff to Malur Seloth
quest.description:
I do nothing around here. And I hope to keep it that way. The Jarl is convinced I have some connection with the College, so he goes easy on me.
Maybe you'd like to help me keep up appearances? Old Nelacar has a mage's staff in his room in the Frozen Hearth. It'd be good to have that staff in case the Jarl starts wondering if I actually have a real connection to the College.
Pinch that staff for me. I'll be waiting for it. Once I have it, I'll show you a few tricks I've learned about buttering up royalty.

BG2142: a member of the church of Lathander
BG2143: a shy, sad, young girl, and Dawnlord Arenthis' charge

plots: Risa does not talk much since the death of her parents

quest.title: Locate a Caretaker for Risa
quest.objective: do something to help Risa
tasks: find a guardian for Risa
do something to help Risa
quest.description:
I am Dawnlord Arenthis of the church of Lathander... excuse my young charge. Risa doesn't talk much since the recent death of her parents.
There is very little that can be done for her as well... other than to put her into an orphanage, I suppose. She is so shy and sad, though, I am sure it will do her no good.
If only there were someone who would care for her. Might you know of someone who would make a suitable guardian?

plots: the player has volunteered to close the Oblivion Gate: Savlian Matius sent men in the Oblivion Gate to see if they could find a way to shut it

quest.title: Breaking the Siege of Kvatch
quest.objective: help defeat the Daedra invaders, and end the siege of Kvatch
tasks: close the Oblivion Gate
help defeat the Daedra invaders, and end the siege of Kvatch
quest.description:
You want to help? You're kidding, right? Hmm... if you're serious, maybe I can put you to use. It'll likely mean your death, though.
I don't know how to close this Gate, but it must be possible, because the enemy closed the ones they opened during the initial attack. You can see the marks on the ground where they were, with the Great Gate right in the middle. I sent men into the Gate, to see if they could find a way to shut it. They haven't come back. If you can get in there, find out what happened to them. If they're alive, help them finish the job. If not, see what you can do on your own.
The best I can say is, good luck. If you make it back alive, we'll be waiting for you. It's a brave thing you're doing.

TESO56: the prince of madness, one of the Daedric Princes
TESO212: a maze dungeon in Shivering Isles
TESO60: a detail-oriented man, and a snappy dresser
TESO214: small book, tells the player how to activate Xedilian
small book, tells the player how to activate Xedilian

plots: Sheogorath gives the player the Attenuator of Judgement and a small book: the player can get more information from Haskill

quest.title: A Better Mousetrap
quest.objective: activate Xedilian to make unwanted guests to stay away from Sheogorath's realm
tasks: Go to Xedilian.
use the Attenuator of Judgement and the small book to activate Xedilian
activate Xedilian to make unwanted guests to stay away from Sheogorath's realm
quest.description:
I'm Sheogorath, the Daedric Prince of Madness. I've been waiting for you, or someone like you, or someone other than you, for some time.
Now? You run an errand for me. An important one. Of course, anything I tell you to do is important. My Realm, my rules. You're going to Xedilian, one of my favorite spots in the Shivering Isles. It's a little place I use to take care of unwanted visitors. And some are more unwanted than others.
There are those that have other ways into my Realm, and they're on the move. We don't want them here. Trust me. So, you're going to get Xedilian up and running. Here's a little book to tell you how, and the Attenuator of Judgement. You'll need that, too. Of course, you can always get more details from Haskill. He's a detail-oriented type of person. A big help. And a snappy dresser.
Now, get going. Before I change my mind. Or my mind changes me.

BG2195: enthusiastic director of theatricals, musicals, and other entertainments, from Calimport

plots: the player and Higgold are in front of the player's playhouse
Higgold will look for actors and a play to put in production for a week: six weeks after that the playhouse will start producing coin
Higgold will send the player a message when he's ready to go

quest.title: Running the Playhouse
quest.objective: provide the investment to stage the play, and make important decisions about the play
tasks: wait for a message from Higgold
provide the investment to stage the play, and make important decisions about the play
quest.description:
Greetings, greetings, greetings! I am Higgold, director of fine theatricals, musicals, and other entertainments. Most recently from Calimport, where I needn't return quickly due to the sensitivity of one particular huzzah...
..but we needn't get into that. Now, let's see... yes, mm-hm... yes, this looks like a fine playhouse. I know a few actors that aren't working, but it'll take some time to find them, as well as a worthy play to put into production. A week for that, I think. About six weeks after that for rehearsing and then this playhouse of yours should start making decent coin, so long as all goes well.
Your part, my good friend, is to provide the investment to stage the play as well as make important decisions. You'll also reap the majority of the profits. I'll start looking for actors and a play right away. It shouldn't take more than half a week, and I'll send word as soon as I'm ready to go.

plots: Roggvir died: Svari's mother took his death hard

quest.title: Return to Grace
quest.objective: convince Svari's mother to go to temple
tasks: talk to Svari's mother
convince Svari's mother to go to temple
quest.description:
Mum doesn't say much since Uncle Roggvir died. She doesn't even go to temple anymore. I wish she would. At least that way she'd have people to talk to.
Maybe you could convince her. You should go do it right now.

TL246: a male Estherian infected with the plague

plots: this plague targets beings of an inherently magical nature, not humans

quest.title: Trail of the Grand Regent
quest.objective: go to the Watchweald Temple
tasks: take Crows' Pass to the Frosted Hills to catch up to the Grand Regent before he enters the Watchweald Temple
go to the Watchweald Temple
quest.description:
This plague seems to specifically target beings of an inherently magical nature, such as the Estherians. So far it's not affecting humans, so I've sent for a transport to bring us some medical supplies, and I'll be coordinating the medical relief here.
Meanwhile, you need to get out to the Watchweald Temple. Take Crows' Pass to the Frosted Hills. Try to catch up to the Grand Regent before he enters the temple.

TESS99: a brewer from Thirsk Mead Hall
TESS102: a special brew made at Thirsk Mead Hall

plots: the player asked Elmus if they could help him

quest.title: Mead for Elmus
quest.objective: retrieve one bottle of Ashfire Mead for Elmus
tasks: Go to Thirsk Mead Hall.
grab a bottle of Ashfire Mead
retrieve one bottle of Ashfire Mead for Elmus
quest.description:
Actually, now that I think of it, I have been missing the Ashfire Mead. It's a special brew that we make at Thirsk.
If you could... somehow... get up there and grab a bottle, I'd be a long way towards forgetting how miserable it is down here.

BG2276: a man leading a guild of thieves
BG2279: a tavern in the Bridge District
BG2280: a male member of Aran Linvail's guild
BG2281: a male member of Aran Linvail's guild

plots: Jaylos and Caehan are planning leave Aran Linvail's guild to join the rival guild: they are supposed to meet their contact on the second floor of the Five Flagons

quest.title: Switching Sides
quest.objective: find the lair of the rival guild
tasks: Go to Five Flagons.
pose as the rival guild's new recruit to the rival guild's recruiter
find the lair of the rival guild
quest.description:
Two of our men, Jaylos and Caehan by name, are planning to leave our little community and join with our enemies. Greener grass and all of that, I suppose.
They are to meet their contact on the second floor of the Five Flagons tavern in the Bridge District. Go there and pose as one of our enemy's new recruits. I want to know where our enemy's lair is. We have yet to find it.
This recruiter could arrive at any time so I suggest that you go to the Five Flagons now. They may prove unreasonable, so prepare yourself for hostility.
Return when you have the information we need.

plots: the aspiring wizard wants to join the College of Winterhold

quest.title: Magic Student
quest.objective: help an aspiring wizard learn warding spells
tasks: raise your own warding spell and allow the aspiring wizard to cast a spell at it
help an aspiring wizard learn warding spells
quest.description:
I've finally found you! I want to join the College of Winterhold. But I need help with my wards. Can you teach me?
So, first, you raise your ward and I'll throw a little spell at it. That way I can see the 'right' way to do things.

TESO1: the Speaker for the Black Hand, and the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood, giving quest via "Orders"
TESO334: Lucien Lachance's private refuge, a ruined fort located in the forest northeast of the Cheydinhal Sanctuary
TESO333: one of the guildhalls of the Dark Brotherhood
TESO116: the leader of the Cheydinhal Sanctuary

plots: "Orders" is addressed toward the player: the player is an Eliminator
the player should not share the contents of this message with anyone at the Cheydinhal Sanctuary, including Ocheeva, and make no mention of their journey to Fort Farragut
Fort Farragut is guarded by rotting sentinels who will attack any interlopers on sight

quest.title: A Prelude to the End
quest.objective: put a stop to the unseen powers that are unraveling the very fabric of the Dark Brotherhood
tasks: discuss your special assignment with Lucien Lachance
put a stop to the unseen powers that are unraveling the very fabric of the Dark Brotherhood
quest.description:
Orders
by Lucien Lachance

Eliminator,
You have served the Dark Brotherhood well in the short time you have been with us. Indeed, the rate of your advancement has been rather remarkable. Now the Black Hand itself is in need of your abilities.
You must proceed with all haste to my private refuge in the ruins of Fort Farragut, located in the forest northeast of the Cheydinhal Sanctuary. When you arrive, we will discuss the nature of your special assignment.
I cannot stress to you enough the importance of your swift arrival at Fort Farragut. There are unseen powers working to unravel the very fabric of the Dark Brotherhood. The Black Hand is counting on you to prevent this disaster.
Do not share the contents of this message with anyone at the Cheydinhal Sanctuary, including Ocheeva, and make no mention of your journey to Fort Farragut! Also, be warned -- my refuge within Fort Farragut is guarded by denizens who will attack any interloper on sight. Get through these rotting sentinels and you will surely have earned the right to visit my private sanctum.
Lucien Lachance

TESS894: a man who saw a dragon flying down from the south
TESS895: a village that was destroyed by a dragon

plots: the player told Alvor that there was a dragon in Helgen

quest.title: Before the Storm
quest.objective: inform Balgruuf about the dragon in Helgen
tasks: Go to Whiterun.
find Balgruuf
inform Balgruuf about the dragon in Helgen
quest.description:
What? A dragon? In Helgen? That explains what I saw earlier... a dragon flying down from the south... I was hoping I was wrong about what I thought it was... Didn't want to believe my own eyes, is all.
The Jarl needs to know if there's a dragon on the loose. Riverwood is defenseless... We need to get word to Jarl Balgruuf in Whiterun to send whatever soldiers he can. If you'll do that for me, I'll be in your debt.

BG2145: the peaceful leader of ogres, who used to be a leader in the army of Sythillis

plots: Madulf and his fellow ogres want to be left alone
Madulf wants peace with humans

quest.title: Madulf Wants to Make a Deal with the Village
quest.objective: tell the villagers of Imnesvale that Madulf can protect them from orcs in mountains
tasks: Go to Imnesvale.
go to Imnesvale
tell the villagers of Imnesvale that Madulf can protect them from orcs in mountains
quest.description:
Me Madulf... lead fellows from great army of Sythillis in the south. No want to kill races no more. Lead fellows in desertion. We just wants be left alone.
Always Madulf and fellows be chased and hated 'cause me an ogre! We just wants to be left alone. We come here one moon ago, tries to settle for a while, yes?
We needs you bring word to human village... humans run when Madulf goes, so me needs youse to do it for me. Youse bring word, yes?
Madulf no want death... Madulf no want fight. Just want peace. You tell villagers, maybe, that Madulf and fellows will protect village... protect from orcs in mountains, yes?
We have shield to give you... is magic, from Sythillis's army... we no use. Maybe you like.

TESO146: the player's guildmaster in the Thieves Guild
TESO584: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild
TESO225: a stone that reveals secrets to its fielder

plots: Savilla's Stone has revealed that the Gray Fox needs something special for his plans: the Arrow of Extrication
the player may kill Fathis Aren, but not in the castle of Bravil

quest.title: Arrow of Extrication
quest.objective: steal the Arrow of Extrication from Fathis Aren, and bring it to the Gray Fox
tasks: Go to Bravil.
talk to the beggars about locating the Arrow of Extrication
steal the Arrow of Extrication from Fathis Aren, and bring it to the Gray Fox
quest.description:
My work with Savilla's Stone has revealed that I need something special for my plans. It's a small item in the possession of a powerful court wizard. Will you do this for me? I will pay you well.
Bring me the Arrow of Extrication. It has a key shaped head. Bravil's court wizard, Fathis Aren, recently acquired this unique item. You may kill Fathis if necessary, but not in the castle. My spy network will tell me when you have it. Return here with the arrow when you do.
The beggars in Bravil will surely know where Aren keeps the Arrow. Now we should get out of Malintus' house before we wear out our welcome.

BG1222: the dead son of Tremain Belde'ar

plots: Casson was killed for trespassing the Water Queen's House
Tremain Belde'ar wants to resurrect Casson

quest.title: Tremain's Son
quest.objective: bring Casson's body to Tremain Belde'ar
tasks: Go to Water Queen's House.
retrieve Casson's body
bring Casson's body to Tremain Belde'ar
quest.description:
Greetings to you. I am Lord Priest Tremain Belde'ar, a humble servant of Our Smiling Lady Tymora.
My request of you is an odd and very dangerous one. I will not hold you to it if you deem it too extreme. I would have you enter the Water Queen's House and retrieve my son's, Casson's, body. Casson sought to indulge his restless nature by sneaking about the place, and a high price was paid.
You must bring Casson's body to me, that I may restore his life to him.

plots: Arnold wants reputation
the player is a famous hero

quest.title: Number One Armorer
quest.objective: bring 32 blocks of iron to Arnold
tasks: obtain iron ore
smelt iron ore into iron ingots
craft iron ingots into blocks of iron
bring 32 blocks of iron to Arnold
quest.description:
I want to become famous. Just not quite like you, hero. I seek to become the best armorer in the world. To do that, I need a lot of practice in hammering down pieces of armor.
Would you please bring me 32 blocks of iron? Those should help me become a better armorer in no time! First, you have to get iron ore from the many iron veins in the ground. Next, you'll want to smelt the ore into iron ingots in a furnace somewhere. Lastly, you ought to craft those iron ingots into blocks of iron on a crafting table.
Do all that, and I promise to outfit you in better armor than what you are wearing now!

TESO452: the leader of one of the guild halls of Mages Guild

plots: the player asked a recommendation from Carahil: the player is new to the Mages Guild
the Council of Mages has entrusted Carahil to take care of an issue of merchant killings along the Gold Road
a rogue mage is suspected of the merchant killings: the only link between the victims is the Brina Cross Inn
battlemages have been sent to the Brina Cross Inn
the player can learn Restoration while facing a life and death situation

quest.title: Blood Money
quest.objective: investigate a number of merchants' deaths along the Gold Road
tasks: Go to Brina Cross Inn.
speak with Arielle Jurard about further instructions
investigate a number of merchants' deaths along the Gold Road
quest.description:
So you are here for your recommendation? Unlike some frivolous tasks you may be given at other guild halls, this is a serious matter, and has consequences. Are you prepared?
Allow me to explain the task. The Council of Mages has entrusted me with resolving a situation along the Gold Road. Several traveling merchants have been found dead along the Gold Road recently, with even more missing. The Council has asked that I put a stop to it. You are going to help me do so.
As you are new to the guild, you are less likely to be recognized as a member. This may give you an advantage in getting to the root of the problem. We believe the killings are the actions of a rogue mage. Battlemages have been sent to the Brina Cross Inn, the only common link between the victims.
You are to travel north to the Brina Cross Inn, and speak with Arielle Jurard. She will give you further instructions.
This is a harsh, dangerous task for you, I realize. Your unfamiliar face makes you most useful, however. And, what better way to learn the many uses of Restoration? Practical application is often the best educator. Even in life and death situations.

TESS670: a worker at the Riften Fishery, and a Skooma addict
TESS350: the man who owns the Riften Fishery

plots: Bolli will fire Wujeeta if she shows up for work under the influence of Skooma

quest.title: Helping Hand
quest.objective: help Wujeeta cure her Skooma addiction
tasks: give Wujeeta a healing potion
help Wujeeta cure her Skooma addiction
quest.description:
My job at the Riften Fishery is in danger. The owner, Bolli, said that if I show up for work in this condition one more time, then I'm out.
I don't mean to do this to myself, but I can't help it. I tried some Skooma a year ago, and ever since then, I can't stop! If you could give me a healing potion, I could cleanse this poison from my body and get back to my life.

plots: wants serenity

quest.title: Scouring Up Housing
quest.objective: build a new house in Woodridge
tasks: gather up materials for building a house
build a new house in Woodridge
quest.description:
Our village, Woodridge, is stagnating hard! We need more housing so that our village can grow larger.
Traveler, do you know anything about building houses? Perhaps you could build a brand new house in our village? You have to gather some house building materials first, though.
I have a fine reward for you! A stack of golden carrots. A fine meal after doing some construction work, ain't it?

TESO273: a farmhouse built by Albert Jemane, in the middle of nowhere
TESO275: the dead father of the Jemane brothers, and a former professional thief employed by Fathis Ules' organization

plots: the player has recently escorted the two Jemane brothers back to Weatherleah
Albert Jemane was supposed to obtain a valuable item for Fathis Ules, but he kept it for himself
Albert Jemane fled from Chorrol with his family to wilderness, and was never heard from again: only his small son Reynald was found
Albert Jemane kept the item in Weatherleah, but Weatherleah was ransacked by ogres: they took the item

quest.title: Sins of the Father
quest.objective: recover an item stolen by Albert Jemane from ogres
tasks: Go to Redguard Valley.
find the item in a troll lair
recover an item stolen by Albert Jemane from ogres
quest.description:
Fathis Ules. I may have a bit of a proposition for you involving the Jemane family you so recently assisted.
It was kind of you to escort the Jemanes back to Weatherleah. However, their father, the original owner of Weatherleah left them an even greater legacy.
My tale actually begins with the father, Albert Jemane. He was once in my employ, or should I say the employ of my organization. He was very good at obtaining things from people who did not want to part with. A professional thief, to put it bluntly. He was assigned to obtain a very valuable item for me. He succeeded, but decided to keep this item for himself. An unfortunate decision.
Albert Jemane fled from Chorrol with his family, and was never heard from again. Only his small son Reynald was found, wandering alone in the wilderness. Naturally, my associates and I believed he had perished. The wilderness is, after all, a dangerous place. No place to take your family. Then, these many years later, voila! The brother reappears. It seems the rest of the family did not die in the wilderness after all.
What is the point of my tale? Albert Jemane builds Weatherleah way out in the middle of nowhere. He was a thief, not a farmer. The only reason to establish such a place would be to stay out of the Chorrol Guard's sight. I believe that the item Albert stole, which rightly belongs to me, was hidden at Weatherleah. Unfortunately, the notorious Redguard Valley Ogres ransacked the place and probably took all of the loot back with them.
If you were to obtain this item, somehow, and bring it to me, I would pay you very well for it.

TESO1: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood, giving quest via "Dead Drop Orders #7"
TESO449: a male Wood Elf Archer, loves a married woman
TESO451: an ancient statue in Bravil, a symbol of good luck and prosperity

plots: the player killed Havilstein Hoar-Blood for Lucien Lachance
Ungolim spends his days securely locked inside his house

quest.title: A Kiss Before Dying
quest.objective: assassinate Ungolim
tasks: Go to Bravil.
eliminate Ungolim when he visits the Lucky Old Lady at night between 6:00 PM and 1:00 AM
assassinate Ungolim
quest.description:
Dead Drop Orders #7
by Lucien Lachance

My compliments on another job well done! Havilstein Hoar-Blood was more swine than man, and deserved to die quivering like an animal! You must not stop! You must kill again!
Your next target is a Wood Elf named Ungolim, who resides in the city of Bravil. Bravil is also home to an ancient statue known as the Lucky Old Lady. It is seen as a symbol of good luck and prosperity, and the fools of Bravil often speak to the statue and wish for good tidings. Every night, poor lovestruck Ungolim visits the statue and pleads desperately for the heart of a young maiden. This maiden is married, and her husband has learned of Ungolim's affection for his bride. He fears the competition, it would seem, and has commissioned the Dark Brotherhood to help in the matter.
You must go to Bravil, locate Ungolim, and kill him. The Wood Elf owns a house in the city, but he spends his days securely locked inside. I recommend you lie in wait at the Lucky Old Lady statue, and then eliminate Ungolim when he arrives for his nightly visit. He's generally there between the hours of 6:00 PM and 1:00 AM.
By all accounts, Ungolim is a deadly archer and a fearless opponent. I also have reason to believe he is expecting trouble, so if Ungolim senses danger, he may attack you on sight. Be vigilant, and bring the Wood Elf down! You must not fail!
When Ungolim's body lies broken at the foot of his dear statue, you must journey to the city of Anvil. Your dead drop is in a barrel located behind the statue in the pond. As is standard, your reward and next contract will be waiting.

plots: Bob wants reputation

quest.title: Coming Soon!
quest.objective: promote the services of Bob in nearby villages
tasks: Go to Seaside Settlement.
Go to Desert Refuge.
Go to Stoneburg.
talk to the villagers
hand out promotional items to villagers
hand out coupons to villagers
promote the services of Bob in nearby villages
quest.description:
Hail! It's rare to see another traveler out in the wilderness. I'm a wandering merchant by trade: I travel from village to village to sell my merchandise.
You wouldn't mind helping me out a bit in exchange for an enchanted book? I'd like you to promote my services in nearby villages: Seaside Settlement, Desert Refuge, and Stoneburg.
I am already fairly well-known in the coastal Seaside Settlement, so you just gotta tell the villagers there that I am coming there soon. For the villagers of Desert Refuge out in the desert, I have some promotional items that I want you to hand out. Lastly, I want you to give some coupons to the villagers of the mountainous Stoneburg.
Good luck in your promotional mission!

BG2150: the home of Nalia de'Arnise, a castle under siege

plots: if the attackers have breached the inner courtyard of the de'Arnise Keep, they will be hard to rout
Nalia de'Arnise's father would not leave the de'Arnise Keep

quest.title: The de'Arnise Keep Has Been Invaded
quest.objective: defeat the attackers at the de'Arnise Keep
tasks: Go to de'Arnise Keep.
find Daleson
defeat the attackers at the de'Arnise Keep
quest.description:
I, Nalia de'Arnise, need a strong hand to help me. My land is under siege, and none of this rabble will aid me! And after all I've done for their kind, too! Please, can you assist me?
There is no time! I only hope that the attackers have not made it inside. If they have... if they have breached the inner courtyard, they will be hard to rout.
I will tell you what secrets I can. Perhaps you will be able to sneak in and attack from a more vulnerable spot. I hope Father is all right. He... would not leave.
Please, hurry to the de'Arnise Keep and find Daleson.

TESO95: west of the Imperial City, on the edge of the Great Forest

plots: Sir Juncan died while seeking out the Boots of the Crusader

quest.title: Nature's Fury
quest.objective: retrieve the Boots of the Crusader for yourself
tasks: Go to Shrine of Kynareth.
talk to the priests of Kynareth
retrieve the Boots of the Crusader for yourself
quest.description:
My name was Sir Juncan.
I wish to see you succeed where I failed. I was on the path to the Boots of the Crusader, but died before I reached them.
I cannot tell you exactly how to find the Boots, for that will be up to Kynareth. I can tell you to seek out her Priests, though. West of the Imperial City, on the edge of the Great Forest, is a shrine. You will find them there, and they will tell you what you need to know.

TESS691: Lucan Valerius's shop in the town
TESS692: Lucan Valerius's shop in the town
Lucan Valerius's shop in the town

plots: the golden dragon claw was stolen from Lucan Valerius' shop

quest.title: The Golden Claw
quest.objective: retrieve a golden dragon claw for Lucan Valerius
tasks: Go to Bleak Falls Barrow.
find the golden dragon claw
retrieve a golden dragon claw for Lucan Valerius
quest.description:
We did have a bit of a... break-in. But we still have plenty to sell. Robbers were only after one thing. An ornament, solid gold. In the shape of a dragon's claw.
I've got some coin coming in from my last shipment. It's yours if you bring my claw back. If you're going after those thieves, you should head to Bleak Falls Barrow, northeast of town.

MC190: storied cities at the end of time and space
MC191: chests whose contents are stored separately for all people

plots: Loki wants reputation
the player can craft Ender Chests somehow

quest.title: A Box of Tricks
quest.objective: give an Ender Chest to Loki
tasks: Go to End Cities.
obtain an Ender Chest
give an Ender Chest to Loki
quest.description:
I'm planning all sorts of new pranks that would make me a famous man here in the village. There's one integral item that I haven't been able to obtain: an Ender Chest. You know, the chests whose contents are stored separately for everyone?
I heard you can find Ender Chests in End Cities at the end of time and space. It should also be possible to craft them somehow. Can you obtain an Ender Chest? I would pay you well for one: you could have some powered rails that I used in one of my pranks.

TESO1: a fellow assassin, giving quest via "Dead Drop Orders #2"
TESO375: Matthias Draconis, Andreas Draconis, Sibylla Draconis, Caelia Draconis
the rest of the Draconis, the children of Perennia Draconis

plots: "Dead Drop Orders #2" is addressed toward the player: the player is a Silencer
the player killed Celedaen in the player's previous assignment

quest.title: Next of Kin
quest.objective: assassinate all five members of the Draconis
tasks: Go to Applewatch.
get the locations of other Draconis from Perennia Draconis, and assassinate her
assassinate all five members of the Draconis
quest.description:
Dead Drop Orders #2
by Lucien Lachance

The Necromancer Celedaen is dead, and you are not. That is quite an accomplishment. But your work as a Silencer has just begun.
Your next assignment requires you to eliminate not just one target, but five. An entire family, in fact. The unlucky kin are Perennia Draconis, Matthias Draconis, Andreas Draconis, Sibylla Draconis and Caelia Draconis. The locations of most of the family members are unknown, so you should begin your search with the family matron, Perennia, who resides at the farm called Applewatch.
You must discern the locations of all the Draconis family members and then systematically eliminate them. I suggest you first speak with the mother and find out if she has any valuable information on the whereabouts of her children, before ending her life.
When every member of the Draconis family lies dead, journey to the city of Skingrad. In the castle courtyard you will find a well containing your reward for the Draconis contract, as well any further assignment I might have.

plots: ankheg armor is comparable to full plate with half the weight
there is an iron shortage

quest.title: An Offer from Taerom
quest.objective: sell your ankheg shells
tasks: give your ankheg shells to Taerom Fuiruim
sell your ankheg shells
quest.description:
Hello there, I'm Taerom Fuiruim, a blacksmith of some renown.
An interesting piece o' material you got there. Ankheg, if I'm not mistaken. Been a while since I seen the like, but if I remember correctly, it makes a fine set of armor. If properly treated it's comparable to full plate with half the weight!
If you're willing to part with your shells I'll give you 500 gold for the lot of them. No more can I offer with business as slow as it is.
Iron shortage hurting us all.

plots: Dana wants knowledge
Dana gives the player a bucket

quest.title: Bringing Out the Flavor
quest.objective: bring a lava bucket, blaze rod, and a block of coal to Dana
tasks: Go to Nether.
obtain a lava bucket
obtain a blaze rod
obtain a block of coal
bring a lava bucket, blaze rod, and a block of coal to Dana
quest.description:
My job is to sell meat of all sorts: both cooked and raw. I take pride in my craftsmanship: I always try to find new, improved ways to cook meat.
I have a hypothesis: the fuel used in my oven affects the taste of the meat that's cooked in it. I'd like to test out different materials to feed the flames of my oven: a bucket of lava, a blaze rod, and a block of coal, for starters.
Would you help a butcher better her craft? Bring the items I mentioned to me, and I'll cook you a year's worth of steak.
Lava can be found in pools deep under the ground. I'll give you a bucket for scooping out the lava. Blaze rods a trickier to obtain; you have to brave the hellscape that is the Nether. Coal, on the contrary, is quite easy to get. Just look out for ore veins seated in stone.

plots: there are five empty chests
a famous person will appear in front of each empty chest: each famous person will give the player a gift that belongs to another famous person and will give a hint about the gift's owner
the player must place each gift to the correct chest behind each famous person

quest.title: Game of the Imps
quest.objective: play the imps' game
tasks: place the gifts, and talk to the imps
play the imps' game
quest.description:
We are two imps, little demonic people. We want to play a game.
Okay, big peoples... this is how our game will go! There is five chests here with nothings in them! In front of each empty chest, a famous big people will appear! Famous big people! Oh, yes, powerful famous big people! Each famous big people will give you a gift that belongs to another famous big people... and they will hints to you what gifts belong to them! If you thinks you knows which famous big people a gift belongs to, you puts it in the empty chest behind them, yes? Very simple!
Once you places all five, you comes and asks us! If you wrong, we laugh at you! If you right, we open the sixth chest! The sixth chest has all of the drow's treasure! All of it!

TESS10: a courtyard in Castle Volkihar with Valerica's garden, a peaceful place that Serana's father could not stand
TESS40: a castle, and the home of Serana's family
TESS932: a courtyard in Castle Volkihar with Valerica's garden, a peaceful place that Serana's father could not stand
a courtyard in Castle Volkihar with Valerica's garden, a peaceful place that Serana's father could not stand
TESS933: a courtyard in Castle Volkihar with Valerica's garden, a peaceful place that Serana's father could not stand
TESS934: a courtyard in Castle Volkihar with Valerica's garden, a peaceful place that Serana's father could not stand

plots: Dexion said the player and Serana needed two other Elder Scrolls
Valerica told Serana that she'd go somewhere safe, somewhere that Serana's father would never search

quest.title: Chasing Echoes
quest.objective: get information about an Elder Scroll from Valerica
tasks: search for clues about Valerica's whereabouts with Serana
get information about an Elder Scroll from Valerica
quest.description:
That Moth Priest, Dexion. He said we needed two other Elder Scrolls. I think I know where we can start looking. We need to find my mother, Valerica. She'll definitely know where one of the Scrolls is, and if we're lucky, she actually has it herself.
The last time I saw her, she said that she'd go somewhere safe... somewhere that my father would never search. Other than that, she wouldn't tell me anything. But the way she said it... "someplace he would never search." It was cryptic, yet she called attention to it.
Wait... There's a courtyard in Castle Volkihar. I used to help her tend a garden there. All of the ingredients for our potions came from there. She used to say that my father couldn't stand the place. Too... peaceful. I don't think we'll actually trip over her there. But it's worth a look.

TESS377: a mine connected to an old Nordic crypt

plots: Perth warns the player to stay out of Soljund's Sinkhole

quest.title: Soljund's Sinkhole
quest.objective: make Soljund's Sinkhole safe again
tasks: Go to Soljund's Sinkhole.
clear out draugr
make Soljund's Sinkhole safe again
quest.description:
Whoa, there. I don't know where you're going, but stay out of that mine. It isn't safe.
We tunneled into an old Nordic crypt. The whole place is crawling with draugr. We're not mining up any ore with those undead around, so I wouldn't go down there if I were you.
You want to clear out the draugr? You're joking, right? Those bone-walkers will tear you limb from limb. But if you want to get yourself killed, go ahead.
I hear talk about a regiment coming to clear the crypt out. We'll see if that happens.

MC97: "The Nether: Compiled Accounts of the Hellish Plane"
a book about the hellish dimension the player is familiar with

plots: John wants knowledge
the player is a famous hero

quest.title: A Mine of Knowledge
quest.objective: recover "The Nether: Compiled Accounts of the Hellish Plane" for John
tasks: find "The Nether: Compiled Accounts of the Hellish Plane"
recover "The Nether: Compiled Accounts of the Hellish Plane" for John
quest.description:
To have more tomes in my library... Now that would be incredibly lovely...
Oh hero, I was just dreaming about having more precious, amazing books. Actually, you could recover a book for me. It is called "The Nether: Compiled Accounts of the Hellish Plane", and it tells about the hellish dimension your familiar with. You can find it in a nearby mineshaft.
I'm willing to part from an enchanted book, should you succeed in recovering "The Nether: Compiled Accounts of the Hellish Plane".

TESO72: Count Indarys' son, and a brash young man

plots: Farwil entered the Oblivion Gate with six other Knights of Thorn: Count Indarys posted guards around the Oblivion Gate
Farwil formed the Knights of the Thorn two years ago

quest.title: The Wayward Knight
quest.objective: save Farwil from Oblivion, and close the Oblivion Gate
tasks: enter the Oblivion Gate
save Farwil from Oblivion, and close the Oblivion Gate
quest.description:
About two days ago, Count Indarys's son, Farwil, entered the Oblivion Gate with six other men. We haven't heard from them since then. The Count fears the worst, and has posted guards here so we can watch and see if anyone comes back out. So far, nothing.
At this point, Count Indarys is offering a reward for the recovery of his son from inside the gate... or confirmed news of his demise. If you find him or the rest of the Knights of the Thorn, get them out of there. I'm sure that the Count would also be pleased if the gate was closed.
The Knights of the Thorn are a bunch of rabble who fancy themselves true knights. Farwil formed the group around two years ago. They make grand boasts, and talk a good talk, but that's all they are. The real work goes to us, the City Guard. I hate to speak ill of them, as something horrible may have happened, but their own bravado got them into this mess.

TESO367: aquamarine colored crystals native to Ayleid ruins

plots: Lithnilian is the first to discover Welkynd Stones growing in a natural cave

quest.title: No Stone Unturned
quest.objective: help Lithnilian recover his research notes
tasks: Go to Bramblepoint Cave.
find Lithnilian's research notes
help Lithnilian recover his research notes
quest.description:
Ten years of research down the drain!
I've been studying the Welkynd Stones. Yes, the aquamarine colored crystals usually native to Ayleid ruins. It seems I'm the first to discover them growing in a natural cave. That's about all I can say about it.
I don't suppose I could convince you to help me recover my research notes? I was doing some research in Bramblepoint Cave, and suddenly I was attacked. I grabbed everything I could and ran, but I fear I dropped my notes. Those notes are very important to me and represent ten years of my life. If you could recover them, I'd be sure to reward you appropriately with some potent potions.

plots: the Dwemer discovered the Black Book that is connected with Miraak
Neloth found the Dwemer's "reading room" in Nchardak: Neloth was not able to open the protective case where the Black Book is sealed

quest.title: The Path of Knowledge
quest.objective: find the Black Book
tasks: Go to Nchardak.
go to Nchardak with Neloth
find the Black Book
quest.description:
I know where to find the Black Book connected with Miraak. I haven't been able to get it, though. But maybe together we can unlock the secrets the Dwemer left behind.
Forbidden knowledge was somewhat a specialty of the ancient Dwemer. It seems they discovered this book and took it to study. I have found their "reading room" in the ruins of Nchardak. The book is there, but it's sealed in a protective case which I wasn't able to open.
But perhaps the two of us together will be able to get the book. To Nchardak, then. Follow me.

TESS668: an ex-student of the College of Winterhold

plots: Orthorn stole books from Urag gro-Shub and left to join the summoners at Fellglow Keep

quest.title: Hitting the Books
quest.objective: find the books needed to identify the artifact you found
tasks: Go to Fellglow Keep.
talk to Orthorn
find the books needed to identify the artifact you found
quest.description:
I know what you want. Word travels fast around here. Discovered some big mystery, huh? Well you don't even need to ask. No, I don't have anything for you. Not anymore, anyway.
Orthorn stole a number of books when he ran off to Fellglow Keep to join those Summoners. Some kind of peace offering. I think one of those volumes may have had some relevant information. If you want them, you'll have to talk to Orthorn.

BG189: behind a painting at the Three Old Kegs
BG191: behind a painting at the Three Old Kegs
BG192: behind a painting at the Three Old Kegs
behind a painting at the Three Old Kegs
BG194: behind a painting at the Three Old Kegs

plots: Ghorak was cursed with an illness for killing his brother
Agnasia knows how to cure Ghorak

quest.title: Ghorak the Diseased
quest.objective: take Kereph's skull to Agnasia
tasks: find Kereph's skull
take Kereph's skull to Agnasia
quest.description:
For your own health and that of your children, come no closer.
I, Ghorak, was cursed with this fell disease as punishment for my wickedness... No, your potions and magics are of little use. The only way to cure this sickness is to right the wrongs of the past. Behind a painting at the Three Old Kegs, you will find the skull of my brother, Kereph. Take it to Agnasia in The Lady's Hall. She will know what to do with it.

plots: Brynjolf will cause a distraction

quest.title: A Chance Arrangement
quest.objective: put Brand-Shei out of the business permanently
tasks: tell Brynjolf when you are ready, steal Madesi's silver ring from a strongbox under his stand, and place Madesi's silver ring in Brand-Shei's pocket without him noticing
put Brand-Shei out of the business permanently
quest.description:
I've got a bit of an errand to perform, but I need an extra pair of hands. And in my line of work, extra hands are well-paid.
It's simple... I'm going to cause a distraction and you're going to steal Madesi's silver ring from a strongbox under his stand. Once you have it, I want you to place it in Brand-Shei's pocket without him noticing.
There's someone that wants to see Brand-Shei put out of business permanently. That's all you need to know. Now, you tell me when you're ready and we'll get started.

TL241: the player's ally who was enchanted by Ezrek Khan
TL282: a male djinni, and Fazeer Shah's old rival

plots: the player successfully completed their previous tasks to Fazeer Shah: this is the player's final task
