quest.title: The Djinni's Final Task
quest.objective: free the Guardian by humiliating Ezrek Khan
tasks: steal Ezrek Khan's Lamp of Marvels
free the Guardian by humiliating Ezrek Khan
quest.description:
Well, well. You are much more determined... and capable... than I had suspected! Excellent...
Now, to your final task. If you truly wish to free the Guardian, you must humiliate my old rival, Ezrek Khan, by stealing his precious Lamp of Marvels.
Be warned: Ezrek Khan draws his power from the same source as the Netherim. His realm borders closely on theirs; they will almost certainly stand against you, should you challenge the djinni.

plots: Laerta and Louise are twin sisters

quest.title: Laerta and Louise
quest.objective: get rid of a bogeyman that scares Laerta and Louise every night
tasks: find the bogeyman
get rid of a bogeyman that scares Laerta and Louise every night
quest.description:
Hi! I'm Laerta. That's my twin sister, Louise.
Mom and Dad don't believe us, but there's a bogeyman that comes and looks in our window every night. We're real glad we're twins because, if there were only one of us, then there'd be no one to hold on to when we get scared. Scare away the bogeyman, would you?
Mom says to give this scroll as a reward. I think it's supposed to protect you from any other bogeypeople you find.

plots: Bertha wants comfort
the player is a friend of Bertha

quest.title: Colorful Carpets
quest.objective: give 6 different-colored carpets to Bertha
tasks: obtain 6 different-colored carpets
give 6 different-colored carpets to Bertha
quest.description:
The warmest greetings to you, friend!
I hope that you don't mind, but I'm feeling a bit bored right now. I could make myself a game of sorts, if I had six different-colored carpets.
You surely wouldn't leave a friend dying in boredom? Please obtain six different-colored carpets, and bring them to me. As a token of our friendship, I'm giving you a pretty painting in return.

MC3: a nearby river rich in salmon

plots: Thomas wants comfort

quest.title: Catch of the Day
quest.objective: help Thomas gather fish for his village
tasks: Go to Salmon Steps.
catch 16 fish
help Thomas gather fish for his village
quest.description:
Traveler, I'm worried about my fellow villagers here in the village. I don't think that they eat enough nutritious, tasty fish.
Could you help me gather more? I simply can't catch enough fish for everyone, even if I'm a pro fisherman.
There is a river, Salmon Steps, bountiful in salmon near here. You could try your luck there, and catch 16 fish for me. I could pay you 32 shiny, green emeralds for the fish.

TESO326: the player's guildleader in the Mages Guild
TESO22: a school of mages in the Imperial City
TESO369: a female mage, eager to explore the powers of the Necromancer's Amulet
TESO370: the male leader of the Necromancers
TESO371: a dangerous amulet, one of the relics of Necromancers

plots: Caranya removed the Necromancer's Amulet from the Arcane University
Caranya is not safe from the minions of the King of Worms

quest.title: The Necromancer's Amulet
quest.objective: return the Necromancer's Amulet to the Arcane University
tasks: Go to Fort Ontus.
get the Necromancer's Amulet from Caranya
return the Necromancer's Amulet to the Arcane University
quest.description:
Caranya insisted on removing the Necromancer's Amulet from the Arcane University. She said it posed a threat to the safety of the Imperial City.
While I do not doubt that Caranya was right, I question whether her motives were genuine. She seemed all too eager to explore its power. I fear she is not safe from the minions of the King of Worms.
Caranya is at Fort Ontus; please, go there and return with the Amulet. Help her to see that she should not use the weapons of the enemy, especially out of fear.

BG1286: [Enemy] a dragon-like creature with a barbed tail

plots: the player met Coran in this wood
the mayor of Beregost hired Coran to hunt down a dragon with a barbed tail: Coran knows that dragons do not have barbed tails

quest.title: Coran the Wyvern Hunter
quest.objective: bring the wyvern's head to the mayor of Beregost
tasks: find the wyvern's nest with Coran and kill the wyvern
bring the wyvern's head to the mayor of Beregost
quest.description:
It's refreshing to find other people in this wood. I am Coran, thief and archer!
I've been alone in the wilderness for far too long. I wouldn't mind returning to the big city, but I have yet to collect my bounty. I'd share the reward with the lot of you if you would help hasten the hunt.
The deal is this: I've been hired out by the mayor of Beregost to hunt down a great winged dragon that's been plaguing the caravan routes. He's offered 2,000 gold for its head. Now before you get cold feet, let me allay your fears. The only descriptions of the beast have always mentioned its deadly barbed tail. From what I know about dragons they don't have barbs on their tails — that's something unique to wyverns. So all we have to do is find this wyvern's nest and kill it. Our only worries are if it has friends over for dinner!
We shouldn't tarry any longer; let's collect the head of this soon-to-be-sorry wyvern.

TESS459: an employee of the East Empire Company
East Empire Company's rundown offices in Windhelm
TESS460: East Empire Company's rundown offices in Windhelm
East Empire Company's rundown offices in Windhelm
TESS463: a female dark elf, and the meticulous overseer of the Shatter-Shields' shipping operation

plots: pirates have been raiding all along the coast, from Hammerfell to Vvardenfell: the East Empire Company's security forces are limited, and all the mercenaries are tied up in the war

quest.title: Rise in the East
quest.objective: help Orthus Endario prove that the Shatter-Shields are in league with pirates
tasks: Go to Windhelm.
steal Suvaris Atheron's logbook and bring it to Orthus Endario
help Orthus Endario prove that the Shatter-Shields are in league with pirates
quest.description:
Sad, isn't it? We can't afford to keep the place running since these attacks started. Pirates, you see. Raiding all along the coast, from Hammerfell to Vvardenfell.
Our own security forces are limited, and all the mercenaries are tied up in this ridiculous war. We don't even know their base of operations, and attacking single ships won't really solve the problem.
Only the Shatter-Shields appear safe. They are a very powerful family here in Windhelm. They run a private shipping operation, and would love to have the docks to themselves. Wouldn't surprise me if they were in league with the pirates, somehow.
Not yet, no. But perhaps an intrepid person such as yourself could help with that. They have a dark elf who oversees their operations. Suvaris Atheron. She's meticulous to a fault, and keeps a logbook with every transaction she makes.
If you get me the logbook, I'll have proof of Shatter-Shield's treachery.

TL2132: Skara's nesting place north of here, out in the Salt Barrens
TL2109: a man, and Jasha's missing friend

plots: Hareph left with a crew to determine why the Skara have become aggressive

quest.title: The Missing Man
quest.objective: find out what happened to Hareph
tasks: Go to Swarm Stacks.
find Hareph
find out what happened to Hareph
quest.description:
If you're heading out into the Salt Barrens, could you find out what happened to my companion Hareph?
He left with a crew to determine why the Skara have become so aggressive lately, but no one has come back.
If you travel North to the Swarm Stacks, you should be able to find him - or at least what happened to him.

TESO135: the player's superior in the Mages Guild
TESO385: the Mages Guild's female specialist on magicka arcana
TESO386: the guildleader of the Mages Guild

plots: Tar-Meena is reading about Necromancy, only stopping to sleep, at the Arch-Mage's request

quest.title: Necromancer's Moon
quest.objective: find information on Black Soul Gems, especially about their powers and creation
tasks: Go to Mystic Archives.
speak to Tar-Meena about Black Soul Gems
find information on Black Soul Gems, especially about their powers and creation
quest.description:
I'd like you to speak with Tar-Meena at the Mystic Archives. She is our specialist on magicka arcana, and has been helping gather information.
I believe we have been asking her the wrong questions, taxing her too much with vague attempts to make sense of all that we know. Speak with her specifically about these Black Soul Gems. If she knows anything about their powers or creation.
Her expertise in arcane knowledge and lore could be invaluable to us, if we can make proper use of it. She can likely be found in the Archives now, poring through materials on Necromancy. She stops only to sleep, at the Arch-Mage's request.

TESO56: the prince of madness, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: the player summoned Sheogorath
Sheogorath wants to make Border Watch an interesting place
the people of Border Watch are superstitious

quest.title: Entertaining Sheogorath
quest.objective: find a way to make the first two parts of the K'Sharra come true
tasks: Go to Border Watch.
ask about the K'Sharra from the shaman
find a way to make the first two parts of the K'Sharra come true
quest.description:
Another mortal dares to summon me, Sheogorath, and already I am bored. But enough about me. Let's talk about you.
I could turn you into a goat. Or a puddle. Or a bad idea. I could make you eat your own fingers. Or fall in love with a cloud. Perhaps I could make you into something useful. Let's find out.
There's a little settlement called Border Watch. It's a nice, peaceful place... and dull, dull, dull. You're going to make their lives interesting. They're a superstitious bunch. Everything is an omen or a portent. Let's make one come true. Find their shaman and ask about the K'Sharra prophecy. You are to find a way to make the first two parts of the prophecy come true. I'll take care of the rest, because it's the most fun. Now, run along.

MC196: wings that let the player fly

plots: Alex wants reputation
the player has an Elytra

quest.title: Elytra Air Show
quest.objective: complete Alex's Elytra obstacle course
tasks: talk to Alex when you are ready
complete Alex's Elytra obstacle course
quest.description:
You've got a nice pair of wings on you. Would you care to try my Elytra obstacle course? Villagers might enjoy to see you fly. Perhaps they'd even want to try my course after seeing you go through it. Just talk to me when you are ready.
Good performances are awarded with cool prizes!

TESS407: a man who has contracted the Dark Brotherhood to kill Titus Mede II
TESS683: Titus Mede II's ship, moored offshore in the Solitude inlet

plots: the player is a member of the Dark Brotherhood
Titus Mede II will be surrounded by elite bodyguards, but they might be more lax than usual because everyone assumes that the Dark Brotherhood has been destroyed

quest.title: Hail Sithis!
quest.objective: assassinate Titus Mede II
tasks: Go to Katariah.
get onboard
assassinate Titus Mede II
quest.description:
The Emperor is still in Skyrim, but not for long. He's onboard his ship, the Katariah, moored offshore in the Solitude inlet. But you must hurry!
If you can get onboard that ship. Kill Titus Mede II, as contracted... I will reveal the location of the dead drop that holds your payment.
This is the true Emperor, not some half-penny lookalike. He'll be surrounded by elite bodyguards, I'm sure. You'll have your work cut out for you. Still... everyone assumes the Dark Brotherhood has been completely destroyed. They may be a bit more lax than usual.

plots: Mr. Colquetle's son and his wife traveled away and went missing

quest.title: Colquetle's Family
quest.objective: find out what happened to Mr. Colquetle's son and his wife
tasks: find Mr. Colquetle's son and his wife
find out what happened to Mr. Colquetle's son and his wife
quest.description:
What cruel whim of the fates controls this torment of me?!
I, Mr. Colquetle, have heard nothing from my son and his wife for nigh unto a week now, and all else pales in importance until I do. I should have known better than to allow his travel in these dangerous times.

TESO301: a part of the Great Forest northeast of here
TESO303: a multi-purpose potion for dungeon explorers

plots: the player has brought Sinderion a sample of Nirnroot for examination
the Elixir of Exploration requires Nirnroot
the formula for the Elixir of Exploration describes many magnitudes of the brew: Sinderion wrote a short missive about it for the Imperial Alchemy Symposium

quest.title: Seeking Your Roots
quest.objective: collect more Nirnroot
tasks: Go to Shadeleaf Copse.
collect 10 samples of Nirnroot for Sinderion
collect more Nirnroot
quest.description:
So, you've brought something for me to examine?
Yes, this is a genuine Nirnroot sample. Very nice quality in fact. Hmmm... that gives me an idea. Since you already know what they look like, do you feel up to a bit of a collecting expedition?
A few years ago, an adventurer not unlike yourself sold me a musty old tome containing alchemical formulas. Most of them were worthless. But one of the moldy pages contained the recipe for a potion known as an Elixir of Exploration, a sort of "ultimate dungeon delver's" brew. The formula looked sound, except it required an extremely rare ingredient. Yes, you guessed it, the Nirnroot. I put the book aside, because frankly, I had so many other delicate experiments going on that I just didn't have the time to go plant hunting. Now that you're here, that changes things.
The Elixir of Exploration is a multi-purpose potion that was obviously created with the dungeon explorer in mind. The formula describes many magnitudes of the brew. If you're interested, I wrote a short missive about it for the Imperial Alchemy Symposium. You bring me 10 samples of Nirnroot, and I'll make the Elixir of Exploration available to you at a huge discount as well as give you one for free.
The best place for you to start would be Shadeleaf Copse, which is a part of the Great Forest northeast of here. Good luck, and hurry back with more of the Nirnroot!

plots: Ranarr-Jo thinks that Cindanwe can control minds

quest.title: Everything In Its Place
quest.objective: liberate Ranarr-Jo and others from mind control
tasks: gain Kishashi's trust
liberate Ranarr-Jo and others from mind control
quest.description:
I'm Ranarr-Jo.
Perhaps you could help us? But why should I trust you? You might be, you know... one of Them.
Our situation is desperate, she controls our minds... but wait, I've said too much.
Talk to my Kishashi. If she will trust you, I will trust you.

plots: the player purchased the Servants Quarters for Rosethorn Hall

quest.title: Helping Hands
quest.objective: hire a housekeeper for Rosethorn Hall
tasks: pay Eyja 150 gold to hire her as your housekeeper
hire a housekeeper for Rosethorn Hall
quest.description:
Hello, I heard you purchased the Servants Quarters for Rosethorn Hall, and I was wondering if you had anyone in mind to fill that position?
For 150 gold and a roof over my head, I'm yours. Well, to help around the house I mean.

TESS207: a pompous, womanizing nobleman, one of the Black-Briars
TESS556: a buxom young woman with long flowing black hair and beautiful singing voice, Sibbi Black-Briar's former fiancée

plots: Svidi found out that Sibbi Black-Briar had an affair and told Wulfur about it
Wulfur attacked Sibbi Black-Briar: Sibbi Black-Briar killed Wulfur and was arrested for Wulfur's murder
Sibbi Black-Briar has to stay in jail for 8 months

quest.title: The Lover's Requital
quest.objective: help Sibbi Black-Briar in his plans to kill Svidi
tasks: find Svidi
help Sibbi Black-Briar in his plans to kill Svidi
quest.description:
Look, we all have our flaws; mine is that women can't get enough of me. So I had this little affair going on while I was betrothed to a beautiful girl named Svidi. Well, she finds out and she tells her brother, Wulfur. Then her brother attacks me with a knife... I mean, I had to defend myself!
So I got arrested for his murder. And now I have to stare at these bars for eight months. Can you believe it? I was about to let that wench Svidi marry into the richest family in Riften, and this is how she repays me. I'd do anything to have that whore's head on a platter. All I need to know is where she is.
Find her and I promise you'll be well compensated. Svidi was a young woman... buxom, with long flowing black hair. She used to sing the most lovely songs to me when we were courting. I've never heard a voice so beautiful.
All that talent will go to waste when I'm finished with her.

TESO479: a settler, and a family man

plots: Barthel Gernand and his family ran into goblin war parties northwest of here while starting to build a new settlement

quest.title: Goblin Trouble
quest.objective: stop a goblin war so that Barthel Gernand and his family can finish building their new settlement
tasks: talk to Mirisa about the goblins
stop a goblin war so that Barthel Gernand and his family can finish building their new settlement
quest.description:
A word of advice! Watch for goblins if you're heading north. We ran into goblin war parties northwest of here, while starting to build a new settlement.
My family and I are still trying to figure out what to do. We spent everything we had to buy the land and supplies, so we can hardly go back.
Say, do you think you could help us? We need to get the goblins off our land so we can start building our new settlement. You should talk to Mirisa about the goblins. She's our guide and knows what needs to be done.
Take care, friend. Don't get yourself killed on our account.

TESS588: the ancient goddess of humankind and beasts, who teaches us to respect the beasts
TESS589: an ancient tradition, and a test to prove yourself to Kyne

plots: Froki thinks that the Divines are impostor gods
Froki gives the player the symbol of the wolf, the crab and the skeever: this will compel the guardian to appear when the player reaches the guardian's lair

quest.title: Kyne's Sacred Trials
quest.objective: participate in Kyne's Sacred Trials by hunting the guardian beasts blessed by Kyne
tasks: defeat the guardian wolf, crab and skeever and return to Froki
participate in Kyne's Sacred Trials by hunting the guardian beasts blessed by Kyne
quest.description:
The Divines are stolen idols! Impostor gods, sold by silver tongues. No thank you. Froki will not forget Kyne, or her Sacred Trials.
Kyne's Sacred Trials is an old tradition, a test to prove your worth in the eyes of Kyne. Show that you're a hunter and no simple butcher. Kyne teaches us to respect the beasts and blesses the hunter who will face their champions. True hunters are those who survive the Trials.
Do you think you're strong enough for Kyne's blessing? I would be glad to pass this tradition down. You must defeat guardian beasts, blessed by Kyne. I'll anoint you with the symbol of the wolf, the crab and the skeever. This will compel the guardian to appear when you reach his lair.
Return when you've defeated the guardian wolf, crab and skeever.

TESS168: the leader of the Dark Brotherhood
TESS291: the male officer in charge of Titus Mede II's security
TESS293: a powerful poison that kills immediately after one bite

plots: the player killed the Gourmet for Astrid: the player is the Listener of the Dark Brotherhood
Astrid gives the player Jarrin Root
after assassination, escape through the upper door, and across the bridge: Astrid has "arranged" for it to be unguarded

quest.title: To Kill an Empire
quest.objective: assassinate Titus Mede II while disguised as the Gourmet
tasks: Go to Castle Dour.
present the Gourmet's writ of passage to Commander Maro to gain unrestricted access to the kitchens, and poison Titus Mede II's meal with Jarrin Root
assassinate Titus Mede II while disguised as the Gourmet
quest.description:
So it's done. You've killed the Gourmet. And now Titus Mede II is as good as dead.
I've decided you will have the honor of killing the Emperor. Go now to Castle Dour in Solitude. Present the Gourmet's Writ of Passage to the officer in charge, Commander Maro.
You'll gain unrestricted access to the kitchens, and then the Emperor. You're posing as a chef, so you'll be able to poison his meal rather easily. Here, take this - it's called jarrin root. All it takes is one taste, and the effects are quite immediate. The Emperor will be serving Sithis before he even knows he's dead. Once Mede has been killed, escape through the upper door, and across the bridge. I've "arranged" for it to be unguarded once the alarm is sounded.
Now go, my friend. Go, and fulfill your destiny as Listener.

TESS882: the big holy tree of Kynareth that died
TESS883: the ancient parent tree of the Gildergreen
TESS884: a weapon that can cut the Eldergleam

plots: disciples of Kynareth used to travel far to hear the winds of Kynareth in the Gildergreen's branches

quest.title: The Blessings of Nature
quest.objective: restore the Gildergreen with the sap of the Eldergleam
tasks: Go to Orphan Rock.
get Nettlebane
restore the Gildergreen with the sap of the Eldergleam
quest.description:
This is the Gildergreen. It was planted as a seedling in the early years of Whiterun. Disciples of Kynareth could sense something holy in it, and traveled far to hear the winds of the goddess in its branches. Of course, not as many pilgrims these days. A big dead tree isn't very inspiring if you're coming to worship the divine of wind and rains. Kynareth gives life, and we need a living tree to be her symbol.
I've thought about restoring the Gildergreen... Trees like this never really die. They only slumber. I think if we had some of the sap from the parent tree, Eldergleam, we could wake up its child. But even if you could get to the Eldergleam, you couldn't tap it. Not with any normal metal. If you want to help, you'll need something to cut into it first.
Eldergleam is older than metal, from a time before men or elves. To even affect it, you have to tap into the old magic. You'll have to deal with the Hagravens. I've heard about a weapon they've made for sacrificing Kynareth's creations. It's called "Nettlebane." The hags terrify me, or I would have gone after it myself. It's held in a Hagraven nest called Orphan Rock

plots: the player freed Guardian of Mana from her enslavement by beating some sense into her

quest.title: Freedom!
quest.objective: leave Riftkeep with the Guardian of Mana
tasks: enter the portal to Zeryphesh that the Guardian of Mana opens for you
leave Riftkeep with the Guardian of Mana
quest.description:
Stop. Enough. You have freed me from my enslavement and I am myself once more!
We must leave this place. I will open a portal for you, to Zeryphesh.

plots: Malaaq was bound to guard Irenicus' items and the player's weapon
Malaaq was captured from his home, Plane of Air, by Irenicus
Malaaq will be free if he is given his original flask

quest.title: Free the Genie
quest.objective: return Malaaq's flask to him
tasks: find Malaaq's flask
return Malaaq's flask to him
quest.description:
I am djinni Malaaq and I have been bound by a wizard to guard his items, and your item it seems. I can sense your touch upon this weapon.
If you can secure the means of my release, I will give you your weapon.
I was captured in my home, on Plane of Air, by some wizard. He bound me to this flask that I might guard his things. You must find my original flask and bring it back to me. Once it is within my grasp, I can break the enchantment and be freed.

TESS52: the tundra a bit west of Whiterun
TESS323: the tundra a bit west of Whiterun
the tundra a bit west of Whiterun

plots: the player is torturing their prisoner: the prisoner wants to die

quest.title: Kill Me and Be Done with It...
quest.objective: find your prisoner's hidden treasure for yourself
tasks: get your prisoner's treasure from a hollowed-out rock
find your prisoner's hidden treasure for yourself
quest.description:
Please... What is it you want?
Just... just stop. And I'll tell you where I've hidden my treasure. It's... in a hollowed-out rock. In the tundra. A bit west of Whiterun. Now please... please stop.
Oh gods, you've taken everything I have. Just kill me and be done with it...

plots: Scar knows the player
every night people have been disappearing from the streets of the city
possible tracks of a many-legged centipede-like monster have been found

quest.title: Missing Citizens
quest.objective: discover what's been happening with the disappearing citizens, and come see Scar
tasks: Go to .
patrol and find an entrance to the sewers
discover what's been happening with the disappearing citizens, and come see Scar
quest.description:
It is I, Scar, second-in-command of the Flaming Fist. I have another job you might be interested in. You'll be well paid for your services.
The problem is this: Every night people have been disappearing from the streets of the city. My men have been scouring the city trying to find the culprit, but so far to no avail. People have begun to get scared, and very few are willing to leave their homes at night. Something has to be done, and quickly. Would you be willing to take the job? I'd pay you 300 gold in advance with a 1,000 gold bonus if you discover what's been happening with the disappearing citizens.
Your job is really simple. All I want you to do is patrol the east of the city and find an entrance to the sewers. Perhaps you'll get lucky and find out what's been happening. If you do find out what's been happening, come to see me at the Flaming Fist barracks. Our only clue so far has led us to the sewers, so if you want to explore them first, it would probably be a good idea. Also, we've found tracks of some many-legged creature, perhaps a centipede-like monster.

TESO146: the player's guildleader in the Thieves Guild
TESO541: a man , and the last known descendant of Springheel Jak
TESO225: a stone that reveals secrets to its fielder

plots: the Gray Fox has used Savilla's Stone, again, to find out that he needs another special item, the boots of Springheel Jak, to move forward with his plans
the Earl of Imbel is the last known descendant of Springheel Jak

quest.title: Boots of Springheel Jak
quest.objective: find out where Springheel Jak is buried, and retrieve his boots for the Gray Fox
tasks: Go to Imperial City.
search for clues in the Earl of Imbel's house
find out where Springheel Jak is buried, and retrieve his boots for the Gray Fox
quest.description:
Further use of Savilla's Stone has revealed that I need another special item to move forward with my plans. I need the boots of Springheel Jak. He is a famous thief that died some 300 years ago. Legend has it that he was buried with his boots on.
Find out where Springheel Jak is buried and bring me back those boots. Will you do this for me? It pays well.
The Earl of Imbel is the only descendant of Springheel Jak's line that I have been able to locate. His name is Jakben, and he lives somewhere in the Imperial City. There might be a clue in the Earl's house.

TESS271: an ancient tomb buried in ash in the northern ashlands of Solstheim
TESS272: a large city on the mainland

plots: the ash storms fill up Kolbjorn Barrow faster than Ralis Sedarys can dig

quest.title: Unearthed
quest.objective: become Ralis Sedarys' business partner in his search for the Relics of Ahzidal in Kolbjorn Barrow
tasks: Go to .
give 1,000 gold to Ralis Sedarys so that he can hire some diggers from Raven Rock to dig up Kolbjorn Barrow
become Ralis Sedarys' business partner in his search for the Relics of Ahzidal in Kolbjorn Barrow
quest.description:
The name's Ralis. Ralis Sedarys, out of Mournhold.
I've got a financier waiting for me back on the mainland. Sent me here in the interests of obtaining some rare antiquities. The 'Relics of Ahzidal.' But this whole thing became a disaster right quick, let me tell you.
You come out to the northern ashlands, you don't expect things to go easy, you know? But this was something outside my particular expertise. When I first got to Kolbjorn, you couldn't even see it. Buried in the ash, like most other things on this blasted island. Dug out a pile of the stuff taller than me just to find the barrow. Who knows how much to reach the door. Excavating isn't exactly my specialty. Even if it was, the ash storms fill it in faster than you can dig.
Could you become my business partner? We can sort out the details of our little arrangement later, but for now, I'll manage the dig if you can manage the coin.
When you have 1,000 gold for me, I'll head back to Raven Rock and round up some diggers. Once we've got something worth looking at, I'll send word to you.

TESS168: the player's guildleader in the Dark Brotherhood
TESS343: the overseer of the the East Empire Company's business holdings in Solitude, and the first cousin of the Emperor
TESS247: the female spirit who guides the Dark Brotherhood

plots: the Night Mother spoke to the player

Vittoria Vici has Imperial connections, and her husband has ties to the Stormcloaks: their marriage is a step toward reconciliation between the Empire and the Stormcloaks, but a murder at the wedding will stall the peace process and send shockwaves throughout the entire Empire

quest.title: Bound Until Death
quest.objective: lure Titus Mede II to Skyrim so that the Dark Brotherhood can assassinate him
tasks: Go to Temple of the Divines.
assassinate Vittoria Vici at her own wedding
lure Titus Mede II to Skyrim so that the Dark Brotherhood can assassinate him
quest.description:
Splendid. We're ready to begin. Or, more specifically, you're ready to begin. After all, you're the one the Night Mother spoke to.
Now then. I hope you have something nice to wear. Because you're going to a wedding. Well, more like the public reception. It should be a lovely affair. You'll mingle with the guests, eat some cake... stab the bride.
Oh yes. You've got to kill the bride. At her wedding. And they say romance is dead. Your target's name is Vittoria Vici. She oversees the East Empire Company's business holdings in Solitude. The wedding is being held in that city, at the Temple of the Divines. Her death will cause an uproar, which is exactly what we want.
Vittoria Vici is the first cousin to our dear Emperor, Titus Mede II. Vici has obvious Imperial connections. Her husband has ties to the Stormcloaks. Their union is a step toward reconciliation. So if there's a murder at the wedding... Not only will it stall the peace process - it will send shockwaves throughout the entire Empire. The Emperor's hand will be forced. He'll have to travel to Skyrim to deal with the aftermath... and he'll find the Dark Brotherhood waiting.
Vici is likely to address her guests frequently, as is the wedding custom. Kill her when she does that, and I promise you a significant bonus.
Now go. And give the city of Solitude a celebration they're not likely to forget.

TESS478: a repenting mage who has never killed an innocent person
TESS479: a tower filled with witches and Hagravens, and Illia's former home

plots: Illia just killed a female witch in front of the player
Illia and the witch were supposed to find a human sacrifice: the witch attacked Illia because Illia could not do it

quest.title: Repentance
quest.objective: help Illia prevent her mother from transforming into a Hagraven
tasks: Go to Darklight Tower.
follow Illia to the top of the tower
help Illia prevent her mother from transforming into a Hagraven
quest.description:
By the gods! I know this looks bad. Let me explain...
I called Darklight Tower home, now I know that was a mistake. I am, or was part of a coven serving the Hagravens that live there. So was she.
We were supposed to find a sacrifice. Human sacrifice. I told her I couldn't do it and she attacked me. I've done horrible things living here, but never taken an innocent life. I couldn't just find some person for them to kill. We needed a sacrifice for the Initiation. My mother is going to become one of those things, Hagravens. I can't be a part of that. Gods, I can't run away from this.
I'm going up there to stop her. This cycle must end. I don't know what brought you here, but I could use your help, if you're willing. Follow me. We have to fight our way up the Tower. I don't think anyone else here is about to have a change of heart.

plots: Herbert wants knowledge

quest.title: Mushroom Mania
quest.objective: grow a huge mushroom, and report back to Herbert
tasks: find a mushroom
find a way to grow a regular mushroom to a huge mushroom
grow a huge mushroom, and report back to Herbert
quest.description:
Mushrooms are awesome! I love everything about them! Their texture, their taste...
Some travelers claim to have seen some huge, giant mushrooms that stand as tall as trees. I want to see one for real!
Could you help me see a huge mushroom? You are a traveler: you must know how to grow huge mushrooms. Please find a regular mushroom from a place shielded from direct sunlight, and find a way to grow it into a huge mushroom somewhere where I can see it.
Report back to me after growing a huge mushroom, and I'll reward you with a bunch of golden carrots. They are tasty, but I prefer mushrooms. Especially steamy, hot mushroom stew that waters one's mouth.

plots: Gilbert wants knowledge
the player is an infamous person

quest.title: Tools of the Enemy
quest.objective: bring an Illager crossbow to Gilbert
tasks: steal an Illager crossbow
bring an Illager crossbow to Gilbert
quest.description:
You are quite a mischievous person, aren't you? Maybe you'd like to do a small prank for me?
I want to get an Illager crossbow. See what makes it tick. The problem is, Illagers are quite a nasty bunch: they shoot anyone with their crossbows without discrimination.
Lift one of their crossbows from them, bring it to me, and I'll give you a powerful bow of my own making.

BG257: an enemy of Harpers, and a pompous man
BG259: a short, male halfling thief, and Xzar's friend

plots: Montaron was captured by Harpers

quest.title: Find Out What Happened to Montaron
quest.objective: return to Xzar after you have found Montaron
tasks: find Montaron
return to Xzar after you have found Montaron
quest.description:
My friend Montaron has been taken captive by those irksome Harpers. I would have you enter their building and find Monty for me. Short... halfling... thief... even one of your intellectual capacity can't miss him.
Go to their building and return once you have found him.

MC71: a happy man who owns a cat

plots: Bruce wants comfort
the player tamed the cat for Bruce
the player can craft a lead by combining some string with a slimeball

quest.title: A Cat on a Leash
quest.objective: give a lead to Bruce
tasks: obtain a lead
give a lead to Bruce
quest.description:
Hello again! I'd like the thank you again for taming a cat for me. I'm really happy about my cat.
There is a small issue, though. I hate to trouble you further, but could you get me a lead? I just don't want my cat to wander off to dangerous places all alone. Did you know that you can craft a lead by combining some string with a slimeball?
I'll even pay you five emeralds for the lead.

TESO1: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood, giving quest via "Dead Drop Orders #3"
TESO504: a Khajiit nobleman, and a skilled hand to hand fighter

plots: "Dead Drop Orders #3" has been addressed toward the player: the player is a Silencer of the Dark Brotherhood
J'Ghasta turned down the offer to marry a prominent Cyrodiil noble's daughter: the noble hired the Dark Brotherhood to kill J'Ghasta
J'Ghasta is aware someone may be trying to kill him, and has bribed the guards not to interfere if a fight should spill out into the Bruma streets

quest.title: Broken Vows
quest.objective: assassinate J'Ghasta
tasks: find J'Ghasta
assassinate J'Ghasta
quest.description:
Dead Drop Orders #3
by Lucien Lachance

Are you ready to get your hands dirty, Silencer?
Your next target is a Khajiit nobleman by the name of J'Ghasta, who can be found at his home in the city of Bruma. J'Ghasta was recently offered the hand of a prominent Cyrodiil noble's daughter, but turned down the offer when he learned of the girl's rather negligible dowry. The girl's family is outraged, of course, and has hired the Dark Brotherhood to make J'Ghasta pay for his insolence.
Go to J'Ghasta's house in Bruma and end his miserable life. But be warned! The Khajiit is rich and bored, and spends most of his time honing his skills in unarmed combat. Any opponent who can kill with merely his hands is not to be trifled with, so tread carefully. Even worse, J'Ghasta is aware someone may be trying to kill him, and has bribed the guards not to interfere if a fight should spill out into the city streets.
When the target has been eliminated, you will find your next dead drop in a rotten box under the Old Bridge, just south of the Imperial City. The box will contain your reward for killing J'Ghasta, as well as information regarding your next contract.

quest.title: Wisdom of the Ages
quest.objective: get the Shield of the Crusader for yourself
tasks: Go to Fort Bulwark.
find the Shield of the Crusader
get the Shield of the Crusader for yourself
quest.description:
In life, I was known as Sir Henrik.
If you are true to the teachings of Julianos, it may be possible for you to find the Shield of the Crusader.
When the Order crumbled, I set out on my own. After years of searching, I found the Shield and brought it to Fort Bulwark for safe keeping. With the help of a few trusted friends, I began work to keep the Shield safe for all eternity. I never saw my work finished. I died defending the fort from those who would take and misuse the Shield. I never saw our work finished; I trust that the others carried on without me.
The fort lies in the southeast of Cyrodiil, near the Black Marsh border. If all went according to plan, it should be very well guarded now.

retrieve the Cuirass of the Crusader for yourself
quest.description:
By the strength and guidance of the Nine, who comes before us upon this sacred ground seeking the Cuirass of the Divine Crusader?
Step forward, adventurer, and face us, the Knights of the Nine, each in honorable combat. For the vows we failed to revere in life, we shall uphold in death. No unworthy soul shall lay hands upon this sacred artifact without the leave of the Knights of the Nine.

quest.title: Find Proof of Mae'Var's Treachery
quest.objective: find evidence about Mae'Var's planned betrayal
tasks: show the papers to Gorch to gain access to Mae'Var's guild house
find evidence about Mae'Var's planned betrayal
quest.description:
My name is Renal, as I'm sure you've been told. Renal "Bloodscalp"... a little nickname I've earned over time. Rather grisly, but it keeps the fearful in line.
One of my guild houses to the south is run by a rather ambitious fellow named Mae'Var. Good thief, but I never liked him. Now I know why. I've had some hints that he is getting too big for himself. Thinking of taking my place, I suspect, but I've had no real evidence to say that this is so.
I will give you papers saying you were being transferred by the Shadowmaster. You will spy on Mae'Var from the inside and find me the evidence that I need. You'll need to reassure Mae'Var, naturally. He won't know who you are, but I am confident that you are more than capable of this.
Just head to the storefront in the central docks area and speak to the storekeeper, Gorch. Show the papers to him, and he'll let you in the guild house proper.
I think you will find the reward adequate. 10,000 gold is no small fortune, though I think you deserve a little more. From my personal armory, a sword.

plots: Eola assumes that the player is a cannibal
Eola has been eating the dead people of Markarth

quest.title: The Taste of Death
quest.objective: find your place as a follower of Namira
tasks: Go to Reachcliff Cave.
meet Eola and fight your way through the undead with her
find your place as a follower of Namira
quest.description:
You were young when you first tasted human flesh, weren't you? A brother or sister had died? An accident, of course.
Then the hunger set in. Curiosity. What's the harm in just one bite? It's okay, now. You've found a friend who understands you. You can let go of your guilt.
A lot of our kind block out the memory of their first meal. The shame is too much. But you don't need to hide anymore. Namira, the Lady of Decay, accepts you for what you are.
She has a place for us, where we can sate our appetites without judgment. It's inside Reachcliff Cave. But the dead have stirred from their slumber recently, and I was forced here. Meet me there. We will fight our way to Namira's embrace together.
Until then, tell the people of Markarth that their dead won't be disturbed, anymore. We have bigger plans ahead.

plots: the player is the Listener of the Dark Brotherhood
Cicero went berserk because he overheard Astrid complain about the Night Mother and the player being the listener: Cicero wounded Veezara and tried to kill Astrid before fleeing

quest.title: The Cure for Madness
quest.objective: confront Cicero and kill him
tasks: Go to .
Go to .
find Arnbjorn and make sure he is alright
search Cicero's room for clues about where he has gone and let Astrid know about your findings
confront Cicero and kill him
quest.description:
The fool Cicero went absolutely berserk! He wounded Veezara, tried to kill me, and then he fled. I knew that lunatic couldn't be trusted.
Nothing set Cicero off. At least nothing I'm aware of. Well... If I'm being honest, I haven't exactly been discreet lately in expressing my frustration with this whole situation. Obeying the Night Mother. You being the Listener. It's ridiculous. No offense. Cicero may have overheard me talking to one of the others about the Night Mother. It's possible I was... not entirely respectful. But to go this far. To attempt to murder the leader of a Sanctuary. Cicero must pay with his life. There is no other option.
I want you to find that miserable little fool and end his life! But first... find my husband. Make sure he's all right. After the attack, Arnbjorn flew into a rage. When Cicero left... Arnbjorn went after him. They disappeared into the wild. Take my horse, Shadowmere. You'll find him outside, by the pool, when you go find Arnbjorn. Search Cicero's room here. Maybe there's something in there that sheds some light on where he might have gone.
Let me know the minute you find something. I've got to see to Veezara, and calm everyone down.

find the sunken urn
find the hidden stash of Unknown
quest.description:
Faded Note
The last thoughts of one of Crucible's residents

I don't think I'll live much longer. My wine supply is thinning, only one bottle left. Bernice's wine is worthless! I would have lasted longer on bark. I'd go back home to resupply, but Brithaur, that maggot, has stolen my house. It's not just him, though, it's also the others. I can't leave the safety of the roof. They have a plan for me, I see it in their eyes. Caldana, Earil, Cutter, ALL OF THEM!
They don't know I'm up here, watching. Not much longer, though. At least they won't find me or my stash. I've put all my favorite things in an urn, and sunken it in the sewage near the back of Bernice's dive.
I think I'll drink that last bottle to celebrate.

TESO195: a nasty place where people who have committed suicide end up

plots: a wizard split all citizens of Split into two people: one demented and other manic
Horkvir Bear-Arm cannot resolve the issue himself: there are rules and he does not want to end up on the Hill of Suicides

quest.title: The Great Divide
quest.objective: resolve the trouble of doubles
tasks: kill the demented citizens of Split
resolve the trouble of doubles
quest.description:
Yes, I, Horkvir Bear-Arm, can take a moment to talk with you.
I'd get more work done if it weren't for my layabout double living in town. Terrible drain on productivity. Never know who's who. It's been a problem for too long.
A wizard did it. Stupid layabout mage. Had a theory about each of us having a Manic and Demented side. He decided to test the theory. Cast a spell. Split us all in two. Do we get twice the work done? No! Ridiculous. We're not allowed to take care of it either. There are rules. And I don't want to end up on the Hill of Suicides. You, on the other hand....
Get rid of that Demented bunch. Useless, anyway. Don't get a lick of work done around Split. If you get rid of them, I'll make it worth your while.

BG238: the player's tutor in the player's duties to Lathander

plots: the player is a cleric of Lathander, and one of Lathander's favored

quest.title: Guide the Followers of Lathander
quest.objective: lend your wisdom to the believers of Lathander
tasks: give guidance to someone that needs the guidance of Lathander
lend your wisdom to the believers of Lathander
quest.description:
Hello there, I am Lara, and I shall be your tutor.
Not that you need schooling, but you might be unfamiliar with the duties you are to perform.
In exchange for the many benefits you will enjoy as a favored of Lathander, you will have a few tasks to perform while here. They are humble, but very important.
You are to lend your wisdom to the wounded and afflicted, those that are suffering from a misdirection of the heart. Guide them in the light of the Morninglord's glory.
We shall introduce you slowly to the work. I shall send you someone that needs the guidance of Lathander, and then we shall evaluate how you have done.
